comment: First of all this camera is freaking amazing for the price! I searched for literal hours on youtube trying to figure out which affordable action cam to buy and out of frustration it took me about 2 days because each review of a camera, had a cheap action camera with missing features and sub-par reviews!!On day two I came across a youtuber with this specific  camera and was amazed! This camera has everything you need to get some amazing video shots and even comes with a bundle of accessories that would total over 1k probably if you were to try to get the go pro. The best part is that this camera shoots great high quality footage in 1080p and is so easy to carry around.  Its awesome that they include 2 batteries because action cams in general tend to have a short life span and with 2 batteries and my battery pack (see photo) I literally can get 3+ hours of use out of this thing! Its easy charge both overnight, once you use one battery plug the usb battery charger (included) into your travel battery pack and keep filming, you literally can just keep filming even out in the middle of nowhere and not have to worry about camera life.... This thing is AWESOME!!!
Perfecto

This is my first waterproof camera. I bought it for my snorkeling trip in Thailand. The place that we went snorkeling was a bit deep so most of pictures that I took from the surface were not very good. But If you use this camera to take pictures close up it works well. I think it depends on depth and lighting too. Also no leaks and it’s very good  for the price.

I wanted an action camera to document fishing trips and other outdoor activities but didn't know too much about them so I was uneasy about spending ~$300 on a GoPro. After searching hundreds of reviews, I decided on the AKASO EK7000 to test out the functionality and usefulness of an action camera. I was blown away..The picture quality was unreal. I hope the video I uploaded does it justice. I use 1080p 60fps instead of 4K to preserve memory and battery. Be sure get a good quality micro SD card with a high write speed! I use a 64GB UHS class 3 with 60MB/s which is about 6 hours worth of video at this quality. After a day of events, you can transfer the videos onto a computer and then delete the files on the SD card to have a fresh 6 hours again. The included wrist band has a record button that makes it really easy to start recording video mid-action. Also included were several accessories and attachments as well as 2 batteries. I couldn't be happier with my purchase. I just passed the 1 year mark with this camera and haven't even thought about buying another action cam.

I bought the "ACASO EK7000 ULTRA HD 4K" camera, after a friend of mine recommended me not to take my regular video handheld Cannon camera to those extreme conditions of northern Norway in winter because it will be hard to handle doing the activities we had planned over there.I was little skeptical but I bought the camera anyhow. I took also we me also our handheld camera which we used only 1 day in Stockholm and because it was warm winter day. The "EK7000" it was really neat and easy to use with your mobile phone I stuck the the camera in chest with the provided accessory leaving my hands free to handle the dogs and the sledge during our mushing (video attach) experience. I highly recommend getting one in fact I will be getting another one soon.

For the price, I did not expect much. However, the camera does indeed take decent videos. I only use 1080P 60FPS mode and while it does not compare to my video shot on my  400 dollar Canon camcorder, it's not bad.  I wish I had spent $20.00 extra and bought the model with image stabilization, but too late now. One problem I had was that in the auto power off mode, the camera would shut itself off, and I could not get it to turn back on without pulling out the battery and reinserting. I shut the auto battery/power saver off on the menu and this corrected the problem. The camera has a short learning curve. I wanted a discrete small camera to use candidly and also mount on the handlebars of my bike and it works good, as well as a dash cam in my car. However, hanging the camera on my chest and walking around, there is just too much jumping around without image stabilization. The sound is about fair, but for my purposes, it is ok as I am not interviewing anyone. As I said, if I had it to do over again, I would buy the camera model with image stabilization. However, I am happy with the purchase as I could not afford a Go-Pro.  Decent resolution inside a house with just daylight.  For me, battery life is OK, as I have shot 20 minutes continuous video on one of the two batteries that come with it.
This camera is great! I don't do any action sport but I needed a camera for underwater pictures and videos during my vacation. And the result is very good!

I researched and reviewed and went to forums and and and to find a action cam that would suite my needs and I found the perfect match.  I have put this camera through just about everything and it still runs.  I've dove to over 100ft deep (make sure to get a red lens filter) , gone dirt biking across idaho, climbed to tall mountains, gone downhill skiing, snowmobiling, swimming, snorkeling, running, biking, cycling, sledding, cliff jumping, put it on a drone (and crashed drone with it), cave tubing, river rafting, and the list goes on and on.  I am not easy on equipment  so wanted a device to hold up to my demand.  That and if I did something like run it over or drop it out of a plane or who knows what to actually destroy it I wouldn't be out 100s of dollars like with a gopro but a $100 or so.  I actually purchased another one for my wife and kids to use which they are putting through the tests as well.  I have a few sd cards I change out and an ipad to download to the ismart dv app.  Just have to put the camera in wifi mode connect to it on your device open up ismart dv and download pictures and videos.  I usually just edit on my iphone or ipad using the photo program.  Then either send off to family and friends and/or post on facebook or other places.  I ended up buying the large accessory kit for each camera, with extra batteries.  I have used most all the attachments and enjoyed all the possibilities it gives me to video all my adventures with family and friends.  So many positives and few issues.  I think the only issue I really have had is the certain camera I have has not kept an accurate date no matter if I program it or not.  The one I purchased for my wife and kids keeps the date fine.  I am currently working with company on figuring it out and they have been great about responding to me and making sure to work through the situation which I appreciate A LOT.  The only other thing is battery life but that goes for all devices, you never have enough battery life so I just bring along an extra battery as well as a portable charger.  Can't say enough about this awesome little video camera and all that I have put it through only to enjoy it more.  THANK YOU AKASO and I will continue to share with others and buy for others.  I run a computer/technology shop so I do my research and deal with plenty of problematic devices and this is one I don't have to worry about.  Play on!

I bought this cameral for a trip to Key West. Pictures and videos turned out great!! Video is the default for this camera, which caused me many lost pictures and the only reason I didn't give a 5 star rating. Easy to use, Never had any problems with using under water.

I ordered this camera in 2017, expecting to lightly use it for mountain biking, a trip to the Virgin Islands, and for occasional other action sports. Reviews led me to believe this camera was worth the price considering the features it had and its overall quality.After a few uses over 4 months, I was happy with the camera and its functionality. The inclusion of only one battery with the camera itself was disappointing, however the same model battery can be found elsewhere easily enough. It took decent footage,  however sound was poor and the waterproof case for the camera is a poor fit so the camera rattles constantly (remedied by a small piece of rubber band between camera and case).

We recently went snorkeling in Honduras and Belize, and this camera did wonderfully. Video was perfect as were the stills. Went down about 30 feet and the waterproof case held up as advertised. Just like photos on land, shoot away from the sun to avoid too much green tinging under the water. I've also used a GoPro Hero which offers the same features, for more than triple the cost of this...there was no difference in quality. Thank you Akaso for allowing me to shoot such great memories of this trip!

I first ordered this in late February 2019. Unfortunately the microSD card slot was defective and I returned the camera. (The contact was bad and recordings could be corrupted if the camera was bumped, and thinner microSD cards would just not be recognized outright.)The company reached out to me after my initial review and explained that the unit I had received was two years old and had been returned because it was defective but was somehow sent out again as if it were new. They provided a newer model and accessories as way of apology. The difference in the products over the two year timespan shows that the company does pay attention to quality issues.

Great deal for a great little camera! Bought this for taking pictures in / under the water for a trip to the Philippines and didnt feel like spending hundreds. It certainly has some quirks and a learning curve, but it works great and definitely can't beat the price! Photo quality is great, would give 4 stars for some of the quirks but gets a bonus star for the great price!Some notes:

Underwater footage outstanding!! I do a lot of icefishing and this camera is beyond my expectations for quality!!  Quality is just as good  even if you are not using it underwater.  I am 100% satisfied!!!!

I just tested the waterproof casing of this camera and proved to be satisfying, I placed one of my aquarium display inside the bucket half full of water and submerged the camera to take a screenshot of it, I tried to stabilize the camera while I pressed the remote to take the shot.  I have to put some lighting because it is too dark outside.You can't go wrong with this camera, I'll bring this camera to my trip to Legoland and to a cruise in couple of months.

P.O.S.! First, it Wi-Fi’s to your device for use. Why? Why not “Bluetooth “ ! Because now, I can’t watch the video on my iPad because I don’t have Wi-Fi because I’m using it for this thing! If you use Wi-Fi to set it up and start/stop video, it stops recording on its own! So I use the button to start/stop the recording. It stopped and started on its own 4 times. Some videos are a few minutes, some are more! Then I’m scrolling through the options trying figure out why and... guess what the other word for delete is? .....Format!! Yep, I pressed that and it deleted everything!! No prompt, no this will delete any pics or videos you have, nothing. I was so P.O. I threw the camera against the wall smashing it to pieces! There, hows that for a review!

Update 4/9As you can read below I had some issues with my camera. I did not contact support, they contacted me from my review. They have been more than supportive and helpful with my issues and immediately offered a replacement. We had several correspondences between us that were all focused on me being happy. They sent a replacement camera and a return label for the other one. They did ask me to update my review based on that. I am happy to update it as they have done everything possible to make me happy.

Update 27.11.2017 : The customer service were extremely helpful ,Software updates and close follow up but the camera had to be sent to the factory . As i am outside US and shipping it back will cost a lot , they proposed a full refund . This 1st class worldwide behavior and AKASO will certainly will be a well none brand around the world . Thanks !I was able to capture couple of minutes and i have to say the camera videos quality are stunning !

Worked Great for my Hawaii Snorkeling Adventure, Great clear pictures!! Noticed that pictures turned out the Best/clearest when the sun was on my back. Otherwise it still takes good pictures its just that you'll get more of a water color in the picture. Awesome camera, I don't have/used a gopro but, I do have another underwater camera that I've used on previous vacations and this is leaps and bounds better!! This was awesome to take video as well of the Turtle I followed around for awhile and the 4' Moray eel and Barracuda.

This is a very good camera. I was surprised by how small it is which is a huge plus.  The quality of the photos and videos are good but don't expect the same quality you would get from a more expensive camera or those professional cameras. Akaso EK7000 is very easy to use. I'm able to transfer photos and videos either by using the iSmart DV app to sync with my iPhone, by plugging the Micro USB to USB cable to my computer or by manually sticking the memory card in my computer. I purchased a separate selfie stick (it does not come with the regular package) and so far I'm enjoying this camera. The remote control included with the camera is also very helpful. I'm no photo expert so I didn't see a reason to buy something ultra expensive such as a Go Pro. I'm mainly interested in shooting videos while riding my bike and under water pictures when snorkeling and going to water parks.Note that the battery doesn't seem to last long, but the camera comes with 2 batteries and you can use the same portable batteries you use for your phone to recharge Akaso's battery, so if you're on the go, while you use one you can let the other charging in your backpack and just swap them as needed.

Honestly the quality was pretty good, needed a camera for our cruise to Cozumel and it worked out great when we went snorkeling. The upload quality turns out a bit different though. The WiFi worked good when I would have my chest or head harness on, I could just connect to my phone to see everything. Waterproof case worked great camera is still working 🤞🏾 Battery life was good

I wanted to much to write a great review on this product. The company has been awesome. I had written a bad review of this model before, and they contacted me and sent me a new one, which had the same issues, so they sent me an upgraded V50 Pro as long as I removed the bad review,  and I expected to give such a better review, but sadly aside from great customer service, this camera is very poorly made. Both cameras are very very lightweight, and lack sustenance. My biggest issue with the EK7000, was the wifi and remote camera functions. It was awful. If the camera was more than 10 feet from my phone, the Wifi would drop. Also the battery door was super cheap and flimsy and could fall off as it did not seat very well. The pictures were nice quality, but I needed remote access for snorkeling videos. We also found that the waterproof case hinge rusts after only 1 swim (see Picture).  The new version that they sent me has a better looking waterproof case it might last longer, although we did not put it in the water yet. The camera is sturdier, and seemed like it might hold up longer. I tested the video, and ran a video for about 15 minutes, and picked up the camera to stop the video, and it was almost too hot to touch. It was overheating drastically. I believe if I had it running longer, it would have damaged the internal components. The wrist remote looks and feels much sturdier until you try to push the buttons which can only be properly pushed in the direct center, if you push on either side, the buttons come up in the wrong way. Hard to explain, but just cheaply made and secondly it did not function with the camera at all. That's right, it did not work at all. The battery door is attached this time and functions correctly. I loaded the new cell phone app, and tried the remote access, it was very jittery and laggy when recording video  up to about 15 feet away, then fails. Unable to control the camera further away than that. Also saw that when loading the software, the program has terrible reviews.  We took some photos with it on Halloween night, and night work was not good at all, set on auto, it was unable to deal with low light situation (see Picture).  Finally when I tried working with the camera in the waterproof case, the buttons on top caused settings menu's to come up that I had to open the case in order to back out of as I had to use the touchscreen. It was sketchy at best. The customer service from these guys is great, but I'm sorry, I can not recommend this camera or the EK7000
Pros:Inexpensive

A cheap knock off, made cheap plastic with cheap components. I am suspect of the posted specifications, but even if they are technically accurate, there is more to performance than specs on paper.  If you are filming in ideal lighting, and don't want audio, then this will probably work for you, but read on.Marginal video performance:

I wanted a gopro knockoff because I wasn't sure I even would use this type of device.  My first recording looked terrible, looked like I took on a 12 year old flip phone.  I then noticed that there was a bubble under the glass close to the middle of the lens.  Not sure how quality control could have missed this but now I have to try to work with Akaso because I am two days past the amazon return period.If you take a chance on this product test it right away don't be like me and wait a month.

I don't understand why this product has such a high rating score. This cam is a robber.The quality of pictures are similar to the pictures taken with my first mobile have been 17 years ago. The videos are the worst.
This is a great little action camera.I recently took this on a rafting trip, using the included waterproof camera and helmet mount.

Can't even begin to describe how disappointed I am.  Used a 32gb SanDisk SDCard formatted with FAT32. Worked perfect in my drone before. I tried the Asako at home and took a few videos and previewed them to make sure the files were being recorded. Spend the day at the water and recorded a bunch of rides with the kids.I get home and it says the source is corrupt and needs to be repaired on my windows 10 machine. I've never seen that happen with any cards from my drones, dslrs, etc.

We got this camera to take on our trip to Maui. We tried it out beforehand and found the playback to be of poor quality with lines waving through the video. We decided to give it another try and bought it again, Just returned from Hawaii was so disappointed with poor quality of footage of our snorkel experience. Horrible color, terrible video with wavy lines still on playback. Horrible product. Don't waste your time and money for the frustration. You are basically on your own to figure out how to operate it because the instructions are vague.

Came up as Amazon's best seller when I was looking for an action camera. I was very impressed with the packaging quality and the presentation. Got plenty of accesories for multiple functionalities like diving, biking and other activities. It was a great buy indeed!My only complaint is that I have is that it doesn't support EXTERNAL MIC. If the next generation of this camera would have that feature you'll definitely gain more profit. So what I did is I seach on Google and Youtube on how I can connect my Rode mic to it and I found plenty of them online. It's completely doable as you can see on the pictures. I bought a 3.5mm mount here in Amazon as well, had to tap into the Mic terminals positive and negative then drill a hole to lock in the mic port. Requires minimum soldering.

I bought this to film travel videos and reviews. So, many of the included attachments and accessories didn't interest me... I chose this camera because the reviews led me to believe it's competitive with GoPro cameras, but far less expensive.The reviews were right. The video quality is excellent. The lens captures a very wide area, horizontally, which is a plus if you want viewers to see absolutely everything. And, if you're using video editing software, you can always crop out what you don't want viewers to see.

I was so disappointed with this product!!!! I got recommendations from a friend who said this was a great alternative to a gopro if you didn't want to spend hundreds. I received the product and it wouldn't take a 32 GB microSD (even though they advertised that it would) and so I bought a 16 GB microSD (unable to return either SD card now). The thing finally turned on and when I tried taking a video, it just started glitching and lagging (the whole screen would go black for like 15 seconds before it looked like it was recording) and wouldn't actually save anything to the SD card. So, I tried all the ways to troubleshoot until I gave up and realized this was actually a garbage product. The whole thing also felt very light as if it was made with super cheap materials. I was so disappointed because I bought this camera to take with me for my fieldwork for my master's thesis to have long-lasting memories of all the hard work that went into my project. Not only was I unable to do that, I couldn't return any of the SD cards and had to pay for shipping to get the camera back to my house so my roommate could return it (with all the extra things I didn't take due to lack of space) after I had already left to do fieldwork. It was a waste of money and time- and extremely frustrating that it was such a let down. They did refund me after returning this product, but I would absolutely NOT recommend wasting your time/money with this product. Definitely NOT worth it!!!!!!

If you are very savvy with action cams and all the nuances associated with them, then your experience may be different than mine.  Mine was not positive and I returned the item.  #1:  The directions say to scan a QR code on the side of the box to download the Ez Cam application.  No QR code on my box, so I spent way too much time inspecting the box, manual, etc., looking for it, then had to search You Tube videos for answers.  Low and behold, in small print, the box says to down load some other application Smart IVD or something like that.  So there goes 1.5 hours of my time.  Then I download the application and try to connect the camera to my mobile devices.  It takes 2-4 tries before it connects, then it asks for a password.  Again, NOTHING in the directions about this.  Back to You Tube for another 45 minutes until I find a video that  provides the password as 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9,0.  So 2+ hours to do what should have taken 15 minutes.Now to the operation.  I had a tough time turning the camera on in the case.  It would take pressing the button hard 4+ times before it would turn on and in some cases, I had to take it out of the case to turn it on.  The audio with the case on was bad and that is being kind.  Just not a good overall experience.  I would think these companies could hire someone to do a 5-minute You Tube tutorial, but I suspect these cameras are sold under 50 names and all have variables that would make any consistent directions impossible to provide.  After this experience, I purchased a GoPro and had it set up in 15 minutes.  If you have the time to research all the Bermuda Triangle stuff associated with these off brand action cameras, then purchase and save the money.  If your time and sanity are worth more than $100 in savings, then purchase a GoPro.

Let's start off by saying I have plenty of experience with action cameras.This is the worst quality camera I have ever experienced.  I wanted to try it because of the positive reviews, but It's definitely not worth it.

Will need to update this in future but first trike ride video was at night and low light quality is similar to hero 4  that I use. Forgot it was in waterproof case so all sound was muted into a rough vibrating exhaust type tone. Have to remember to remove from case for better audio. Great battery life for my 1.5 test.Update 6/27/19 One hour ride with this camera installed in same position as hero 4 silver and all you hear is weird vibrating plastic sound when recording. Not gonna work for my needs. On bad idea shelf!

I'm a muralist and was looking for a less expensive alternative to the Go Pro for a time lapse I was starting last week.  I gave the AKASO EK7000 a shot based on the good reviews. I really was excited for the AKASO to work out, I am sad to say that I was disappointed. After spending about 30 min trying to figuring out the button combinations to access camera functions (which were a little tricky but I knew that going in based on the reviews read) I found it would start recording for 30- 45 secs before stopping  and then it would start on its own... breaking the videos into short second sections. Frustrating! The battery life was also disappointing which  I had to run a long extension chord just to charge the camera. (also knew that going in based on reviews)I hope to hear back from AKASO

Update: still haven't had a chance to try the replacement camera they sent me. The vendor has emailed me twice asking me to update my review. I explained I just moved and am in the middle of a renovation and it's still in it's original packaging. They we're pretty insistent on me changing it to 5 stars but kind of hard to do without using it. I understand their side, they were nice enough to send me a new one, I honestly just haven't had the time or opportunity. I will raise it to a 4 until I can actually review it again. As you can see it has great reviews for the price so I don't think you can really go wrong, especially if they fixed the buggy firmware. The video quality is great even with the buggy firmware. To be continued....Update: The vendor contacted me last week and offered to send me a new camera. I accepted and the camera arrived last Saturday. I haven't had a chance to try the camera out yet. As soon as I do I will update with my findings. It was nice that they were willing to send me a new camera. Stay tuned.....

I'm pretty excited about this action camera. I'm getting ready to go on a trip this weekend, so I bought this as my very first vlog camera to document my travels. I'm still learning how to use it, but the test videos I've done so far have turned out well and I'm excited to make some videos.My only real big complaint is that it didn't come with ANY sort of SD card, so the camera is as useful out of the box as a brick. Thank goodness I noticed this and had time to order an SD card before my trip. But I can't understand why it was sold without one at all. Why not just include a cheap one so people can at least USE the camera? The one I bought only cost $8. I would gladly spend $8 more on this camera and be able to use it right away without the hassle of having to make another order and wait for delivery.

7/17/19 updated review: 1 Star as I’m very upset that the Akaso wrist mount failed even though the camera was securely and correctly installed (have used it a few times prior and it was fine).  The component on the top disconnected  during a snorkel trip today and now is at the bottom of the ocean floor. Original  review: 4 Stars. This unit is very affordable! After 2 months and multiple uses in the water, and adding an additional buy package of the accessories-- one of which was the wrist mount, so I can snorkel or dive as the head mount is great yet you have no control of when the camera is on or off or anything especially when you are making multiple videos in the ocean. Would have had 5 stars had they made the watch controller waterproof. I would expect that since this was advertised as water use which is why I specifically bought it. Make a case for the watch or new waterproof dive proof watch like the camera has case and 5 stars all the way around. As for longevity battery charge etc that remains to be seen. I will update this as time passes if anything fails.

This thing works very well for me, but may not for others. I bought this to serve as a dash cam in my Jeep, having moved my previous mirror based dash cam to my wife’s vehicle. I go through a T-intersection that has yield signs allowing the traffic coming from the railroad crossing to go through, but has poor visibility due to a hill and foliage, not allowing me to drive defensively very well while oncoming vehicles frequently ignore the yield signs (and have the nerve to get angry at me for not yielding to them). I feel it’s a matter of time before me or someone else gets tagged at this intersection.EDIT: Added a snipping tool screen capture of a moment right before a guy ran this yield sign and came inches from T-boning me. The video would not have shown the impact, but would have proven my case to an insurance company if needed.

Don't shoot the action if it's even remotely in the direction of the sun with this camera. Huge diffraction circles! The sun is high in the sky and about 40 degrees to the upper right. See pictures. Note: I'm trying to figure out if this is a defective camera.and should be returned. Anybody have a clue?. Something doesn't seem right to me.

I bought one of these cameras to mount to the front of my kayak.  It's very good for what it is, which is a cheap alternative to dropping $200 for a Go Pro.  I have only one complaint and one concern.First, the complaint.  My camera came with the "power save" option set to 3 minutes.  Now, I'm not exactly sure what "power save" does (whether it completely shuts it off or just puts the camera to sleep), but what I can tell you is that the wrist mounted remote won't wake it once it goes in to power save.  And with the camera mounted on the bow of my kayak where I can't reach it, I spent 3 hours on that trip thinking I was taking tons of photos and videos only to discover not a single one recorded.  This is partly my fault for not checking all the settings before I headed out, but I believe it's also a design flaw.  Why make a power save mode that the wrist remote can't wake the camera from?

I've been playing with this for 12 hours now and can't wait to take it on vacation! The camera takes great quality photos, and is pretty easy to get used to. I watched some Youtube tutorials and they were extremely helpful. The accessory pack is also great- lots of attachments, so I recommend anyone to search Youtube on the many uses of the attachments as well. There are also more ways to use the camera than I had originally thought. I also bought a high quality selfie stick that extends quite far, so it will be great for taking photos off the side of the boat, and off the side of cliffs while on our trip. The attachments that came with the camera are universal, so I can use the different attachments with the stick as well, including the waterproof case. It will be fun to play with these features while in Sicily and Greece!I almost forgot the wristband feature- it will be perfect for those long shots with the stick. You can put the band with the remote around your wrist, or on the handle of the stick.

First of all, I would like to say I did a ton of research and watched side by side video after video comparing them to the GoPro, read all the reviews and decided this must be a great deal. Boy was I wrong. Mounted it to my mountain bike for a 10 mile ride that took an hour. The battery died at about 35 minutes. The quality of the sound is very poor. I cant watch the video without muting the TV because of the static. The video set on the 2.7K setting was aweful, it had no detail and was very choppy video. Extremely low quality video especially in shadows or low light. If you are moving slow and in bright light the video is pretty good. Probably a decent price for the the quality but doesn't suit my needs at all. I will be saving up and buying a GoPro. I believe Akaso has the ratings they have because they offer free accessories, but only if you give them a 5 star rating. This is nothing more that a camera I don't mind letting my young children play around with now. Do yourself a favor and save up and buy the tried and true original.

I'm not really sure how this item has such good reviews, yes it's cheap but it just isnt worth it...The quality of pictures and videos looks like I took my old flip phone and use that instead. When I put it in to 4k mode it was oddly delayed and didnt seem to want to play back properly.

So far this camera seems to be a great buy! So cheap relative to the GoPro and it comes with so many mounts, two batteries, and some straps. The recording seems to be high quality as far as I can tell and the microphone is nothing special but it can definitely pick up a normal conversation. Looking forward to trying this out on my next trip!Update: brought it on my camping trip and almost every video I took ended up being a corrupted file. I took video over 3 days and only got ONE working video file. Also, the camera says 4K but it is a lie. It might have 4K pixels but the optical sensor is definitely way lower because the resolution looks to be the equivalent of 720p at best. You can see how low quality it is in the picture and that is at supposed 4K resolution!

I bought this for my trip to Hawaii. There are no instructions that come with this, so good luck if you’re not familiar with this kind of stuff. The camera would freeze whenever I tried to use it & not take any pictures/videos or even turn on/off. The pictures it did take were all bright white & blurry. This camera is awful. I just wanted pictures of my trip during my snorkeling excursions & this camera did not do that. It couldn’t even take pictures of my resort. They were do pixelated. Thank goodness for my phone camera because this one suck. Very cheap.

I bought one before thought it would be a good gift. I rated this 5 stars when I bought mine almost a year ago. However Something has changed since then. The packaging is very cheap. I ordered a second one to give as a gift and the plastic the camera is mounted to was broken. The camera just rattled inside it’s little plastic cage. Didnt Want to give it like that so I ordered a new one and planned to take the first order back. Well I got the second and the same thing has happened the camera has been rattling around for who knows how long. Just looks tacky. I haven’t opened eaither since they are a gift but really disappointed.
See Update Below:Original Review

Bought this for video taping my bike rides, but the bike mount snapped in half just by trying to install it. Spent a half hour with other  mounting kits and got it on anyway. later, had major issues trying to connect the wifi and its recommended app for the phone, and as it turns out, it says it has wifi, but it's not what you would think. It doesn't connect to your wifi, you have to connect to its wifi. It's a kind of backwards thinking thing. So you must change your phone wifi from your home or business wifi connection and connect to the camera wifi and then do the download there. Still, this doesn't get things on your computer, so you are better off just using the usb or popping the SD card out.

I have only had this a few days but took it out for a bit of a shakedown. This camera comes with all the mounts you're likely to need, so I attached it to my bike, and went for a little Father's Day bike tour. I'm putting the resulting video here. I did a little post using After Effects, but not much was needed. I'm really pleased. It's not like I'm making videos for NatGeo Channel or the like; it's just for fun, and fun was what I had. I do indeed recommend if you don't want to spend hundreds of dollars on similar cameras.ADDENDUM: 7.10.2020

I’m never quick to give a poor rating on something. I try to be honest without my emotions getting the best of me. With that said, I won’t begin with talking about how much this frustrated me. I will talk about just the facts first.1. When I had this strapped to my head, I had no clue if it’s actually recording. Times I thought it was, it wasn’t. Times I thought it wasn’t recording, it was. So I wore out both batteries on an adventure today, missing all of the important things I actually wanted to record.

I bought this camera based on all the positive reviews, the whole reason I got it was to get video during a skydive I was doing with my 81 year old Grandfather for his first jump. the short videos I took before the jump were saved on the card. I started recording when we were on the plane about to jump, made sure I got video of everything I wanted to. When I hit the ground I found that the video had frozen at 5:51,  I figured at least we got the jump and the freefall, but to my horror when I checked the camera and SD card later the video was not there at all. Don't trust your once in a lifetime videos to this piece of junk. Wish I hadn't believed all the BS reviews.I'll be getting a real GoPro for my next jump.

At first I was pretty skeptical reading certain reviews. But after trying it out a couple of times I am pretty satisfied with this product.Recording in 4K was pretty choppy but after loading it onto my laptop, the videos seemed to run a bit more smoothly. Def. Runs better in 1080.
This camera record well, takes good quality pictures, and good quality sound !!

I stand by my original complaints, but rating has moved from two-star to four-star because of the vendor standing behind the product. My first unit worked for a very short time I think the length was under three minutes. It finally froze. The vendor provided pre-paid UPS label with the RMA online, and shipped a replacement unit prior to me returning it. This took 14 days of a 30 day return policy. I was asked several times to update my review, and I kept adding paragraphs. I felt like fake 5-star reviews where bought for this very cheap camera.I am going to delete those paragraphs now, as it boils down to, as of today, 8/16/18, the camera is great for 64 bucks, vs. 6.71 times that for a new GoPro6 black...I guarantee you, the GoPro isn't worth the up-charge for any reason other than you want almost double everything... if these resolutions work for the intended purpose. this is a great little camera. Almost no reason not to to give it a five-star, except on principle. Nothing is really five-star, or if everything is five-star, five-star means nothing.

I really liked this camera.  It took some getting used to, but we used it for skiing and snowboarding and in my opinion the camera quality was great!  The sound however was lost a bit, maybe being in the case, but it was always scratching, unless we were not moving.  We took it to a creek across the street and got some great under water video of crawfish, minnows and other under water creatures.  Again the sound does not come out the best, but the under water video and pictures were great.  This is about 6 months into owning the camera, the new had our first issue with it not turning on.  I went online and found some information, and was able to get it to reset.  We took it on a trip to do some cliff jumping, and it worked great again.  The camera did not malfunction and we got some great out of, under and in water camera views, sound not that great, but camera quality was awesome.  We did have some fogging issues since the camera runs hot and the weather was drastically different in the water and in the snow, but we pushed through those small issues.  Then the small piece holding the battery in, cracked, so it was a pain to get the battery in and out.  And at about month 9, the camera would no longer turn on and I could not get it to reset.  For the money I paid, I think we got our monies worth, but would have preferred to have it last a bit longer.  I will most likely buy another one for the price and see how it works, since two at regular price is still cheaper than some others for 1.  All in all, I liked the camera.

I never listen to negative reviews if its possible a lemon situation. But my camera also had the battery issue many other complained about. I bought the camera for a trip and its cheap so I wasn't expecting anything above and beyond but I was hoping for better than what it was.Pros

ordered this thinking it would be a good deal 4k for under 100 bucks. but it is actually a semi cheap pos for the price the 4k is not true 4k it is sketchy and misses frames in 4k mode with terrible picture quality and overly saturated and fuzzy colors. the batteries last about 5 minutes recording in 4k and about 10-15 in 1080 it comes with a bunch of worthless accessories and the waterproof case is made of cheap plastic that looks only good enough for something this disposable. not a good buy as well there is no option for an external mike so in the case all you hear is muffled noise. they include a card for a "free gift" of an sd card or 2 more batteries if you leave a positive review. i saw those reviews and thats what decided me guess i was wrong. in short this is a scam to sell a cheap knock off cam to gullible people. do not buy this you can find them on ebay for 20 bucks..

I bought this as an inexpensive camera to take on an upcoming diving trip.  I have not had a chance to test it underwater and will update my review after my trip.  (BTW I bought the VVHOOY underwater camera case for it because it include a red filters that I do not have for my other cameras.  The camera fits nicely in the case, I probably won't know if it is waterproof until it is too late.  )I read the complaints about the manual and yes the print is small and I had to use a magnifying glass to read it.  But I could read it and the instructions were clear. The part that was a little unclear is how to connect to an iPhone using iSmart DV or as other have recommended PNJ iCam.

This camera was far worse than expected. And I really didn't expect that much considering it was a knock-off Go-Pro for $60. But I really don't believe it is worth $60, and I regret spending that much money on a camera that I will never use again. The image quality is that of my first RAZR flip phone from 14 years ago...except I'm pretty certain my flip phone took less grainy pictures. Moisture definitely made its way inside of the case. The camera puts a time stamp on every photo, which is annoying, and then the timestamp is incorrect because it resets EVERY TIME you change the battery. Our images and videos were blurred due to the moisture that made its way in front of the lens. Video quality is NOT 4K, and that is a complete lie. Shame on Amazon for listing this as a #1 recommended product. We opened it and played around with it before our vacation to Hawaii; it wasn't the best, but we felt that based on the Amazon reviews (which I later found out were given in exchange for some additional free products), we would be happy with it on the trip. We were really sad that we trusted vacation memories of our snorkeling adventures to this awful camera. Sadly, my return window closed while we were in Hawaii, so I was unable to return it. I am now stuck with a poor quality camera with technology from 2006 and out $60. :(Edit: Customer Service reached out and refunded me, which was pretty awesome. Adding a star for customer service.

I picked this up for an up and coming trip as my primary camera failed after about 17 years (canon). I realize this isnt expected to perform on still photos as well as an SLR but i figured it would do as well as my cheap phone. It doesnt. Still photos are blurred no matter how they are taken. If you use them for thumbnails they are fine but if you plan to take stills of your trips do NOT use this as you will be very disappointed. The remote works. The "water proof" case is more like water resistant on the low end. Drop it in the tub its not going to protect your camera in my testing. Also the accessories everyone raves about. Almost all of them are useless outside buying more parts. They have a pamphlet that comes with the device you have to register to get the "good stuff". I refuse to do this because it means more spam. It borders on misleading. Anyhow, good low end, cheap and second camera ok for primary "action" video but nothing to write home about.

I bought this camera as a good alternative to the name brand rival that is 5 times the cost, figured what do I have to lose, it’s only $75. I was actually pleasantly suprised that the video quality above and under water is really good. Then I downloaded the software from the app store and was wondering why it has so many bad reviews and barely a 2 star rating. After installing it I attempted to transfer some of my videos from the camera to my phone and the app would crash on any video that is longer then 1 minute in length. Also the downloaded videos remain with in the app and can’t be saved to your stream. In conclusion the iphone app is very poor quality and if you don’t mind removing the SD card to copy the video to your computer then this camera is a good buy, otherwise if you want to use the app on your phone and to transfer the video footage to your phone over wifi I would not recommend this camera or this brand

Whatever you do, DON'T use the suggested app for this camera EK7000. It hardly works. Once you do get it running it constantly shuts down. I downloaded the app called iSmart DV and it seems to be working. I bought this to use for taking hard to reach shots of action figures, and I'm sure I'll be able to get this camera into spots that I need it. But the picture quality doesn't seem like it's 12mp like the box says. But what did I expect for $50. I'll probably use this until I can get a better camera.Just please, save yourself some frustration and download the iSmart DV app. And I hope it works for you.

I'm using this as a helmet camera on my motorcycle. The image quality is decent enough, and it has a good field of view.I was looking for some sort of camera to stick on my helmet. It comes with plenty of adapters and mounting options in the box. They're all decent, but noticeably inferior to GoPro brand adapters. But they're free, so whatever. It comes with two cases, which you have to use if you want to mount it to anything. The sound quality upon playback is extremely quiet, and there's no way that I can find for an external mic to be connected. If there were, I'd rate this 5 stars. The image quality overall is great for a $50 gopro knockoff. No complaints there at all.

I noticed since the V crisis and everyone at home that many well known webcams were sold out. An article suggested "sports cams" as superior webcams. Being a fraction of the cost of both a GoPro and even ordinary low-resolution webcams. I was running late for a Zoom meeting. In less that 5 mins I was online with a superb image. It was clearly the best of over 100 other participants.So, not really a review, but after my initial experience with this particular use, I strongly recommend this product. In time I will try out all the other features and possibly revisit this review. Straight out of the box the default settings are the highest resolution so it's nearly plug and play on a PC running Win10.

You get what you pay for in this case. I actually really like it. It takes really nice photos, and is waterproof (I tested it for an hour playing around in about 5 feet of water in a lake). I have two major complaints though.1.) The app is absolutely horrible. I had to google how to connect it to my internet, which may just be me honestly, but once I got it all set up with the app it only runs for about a couple minutes before it crashes and shuts the app down. You can’t save or delete more than one photo at a time or it crashes the app as well. It makes it kind of a huge pain.

After purchased reading all the good reviews I decided to purchased this one. First one came defective so I returned it and gave it another chance. Second one came, I tested it at my house, it looks Okay. Took it with me to Cancun, well  It didnt exactly ruined my trip but I wasn't satisfied at all.Here's my evaluation:

AKASO EK7000 Camera froze about 1/3rd of the time even after trying 2 different SD cards and re-formatting it. Many reviews stated they had freezing issues as well. After Akaso support asked me to do firmware upgrade, the unit died and it never powered on. Then they asked me to pay to have it shipped to East coast and then additionally pay $22 for replacment unit. Rediculous. Thankfully I'm able to return it via Amazon since it was still within eligible return date. In addition to Amazon free return, I could have had new replacement sent for no cost but chose not to because they have the worst support ever and thus will never buy their product again.

I bought this camera for someone who is not a techie and had no prior vlogging or making action videos.  I did have to help them use the QR code included with the device and download the PDF manual for them.  But afterward, this person was able to quickly get setup within 30 mins, on their own.They said they really liked the simple and lightweight nature of the design and even could simply strap it to the their wrist while walking.  The menu is relatively intuitive, using a combination of the 4 buttons (front, top, up, & down), but for more granular settings, have to figure things out through some simple trial and error.

Maybe I got a bad unit, but it records sound so low as to be practically non-existent.  I had to increase the volume to max on my PC speakers to barely hear any audio (yes, I checked it on multiple PCs).  I also checked it both in and out of the case - still, barely-there audio.  It's a shame because the video is bright, sharp, and vibrant.  Also, comes with a great collection of mounts.  However, the 'clips' were VERY loose in an actual GoPro mount; though they were tight in the included mounts.  I was looking forward to using this on the slopes, but no audio is a no-go - back it goes.  If you want this just for video - this is a great choice.  Oh, it records in .mov format - didn't see that listed anywhere else.

The description states there is a user manual inside. It's actually listed a few times. There isn't a user manual. There a picture book to set it up which doesn't help. There's a web address for the user manual and it when to a page with a pic of a guy using the camera and it says the page no longer exists. Why don't they supply customers with a manual?!! There is a card in there that says I can get free products if I leave a review. I don't want your bribes. I want a product manual.

The short version is;  the camera is almost non functional - constantly freezing up, crashing, requiring battery removal (thus resetting the time and date and all your preferences).The packaging is fantastic and rivals the name brand cameras.  The camera itself is well built, the waterproof case is great and it comes with a ton of accessories.  The interface is surprisingly intuitive for a knock-off and reasonably well thought out. I popped in a brand new 64GB SD card, formatted it, and began shooting beautiful video and great photos.  After probably 30 minutes of run time, the camera began to demonstrate why it's only $75.  During filming, the camera locked up and the display showed a bunch of vertical green lines and was unresponsive to any combination of button presses.  The only way to recover was to take the battery out.  I swapped out the first battery for the fully charged 2nd battery, and within 5 minutes the display showed LOW BATTERY! and shut down.  The battery indicator, however, showed a full battery.  I tried 3 different SD cards, both batteries, and operating indoors with the protective case off.  Same result.  I could snap a few photos, maybe take 30 seconds worth of video, then it would lock up.

OK - so an update to my original review.  One of the things I was most interested to use this for was streaming.  I have an ATEM mini and all cameras connect in via HDMI.  There are two ports on the side of this device: USB and HDMI (both micro) - neither allow me to achieve the function of using this as a webcam/streaming.  There IS some way to use their app on a smartphone, but I want to use the camera like real hardware...not a toy.Frankly, this is quite disappointing and although all my thoughts below still stand (as a stand alone sports camera it's quite good) I have to change my review because frankly this doesn't do what I asked if it did...which is stream live as a webcam.

UPDATE: Months later, a customer rep reached out to me to offer a new Camera. I receive it withing 2 days of providing him my Amazon Purchase ID and mailing address. I have not had a change to used it yet, but I'm update by review. From time to time you are going to get that one bad product, but for me customer service is everything, you can't always fix the problem but making every attempt to do so shows ownership on the part of the Company offering the product.  Customer service earned this company and product an additional starPrevious Review:

Purchased two of these units by mistake, but was glad I did since one had intermittent LCD issues (possible battery connection) and was returned.The picture quality and ease of use is good, but unfortunately it lacks a good instruction manual.  You get a variety of different mounts, but you do have to look at them carefully in order to be able to identify them and make them useful. Due to the nature of Action Camera Mounts, you may have to use several different mounts joined together to make one that will fit your needs. If you have not yet purchased the camera, don't feel that you need to order a set of additional mounts, wait till you get it and see if what you get will work for you.  If you don't have a Selfie-Stick you might consider ordering one and if you plan on using the camera with the included underwater housing, you might consider ordering an underwater holder/floater.

I really liked this camera.  It came with good accessories and all that.  I never actually used it as an action cam.  I never clipped it to my helmet or to my bike handlebars.  I never even used it outside of my living room.(EDIT, support hooked it up with a no-fuss replacement)

I am still in shock how good this camera works. I have been a pro photographer for over 40 years and have been with the mistaken idea that size matters. Well I can say that when it comes to cameras this is not true. I ordered the Akaso Cameras to record biking, hiking, working, and did not want to spend a small fortune on a camera that I strapped to my Bicycling helmet understanding that it may come off and be broken this first few times I went out for lengthy rides. I was absolutely wrong. I was so wrong that I had to write this review to tell the world just how good and easy this camera is to use and view. First the camera comse with a comprehensive kit that will cover anything you may want to mount the camera on. From the Bike to the Helmet to the dog, and well anything. Extra mounting hardware makes this doable for multiple helmets and gear. When I opened that package I could not focus on all of the hardware at one time. It was overwhelming. But easy to figure out. Extra straps, extra mounting screws, and even a mount that allows you to place the camera 90 degrees across the handle bars. It is amazing how much thought went into the design of the hardware and the amount of hardware you get. You need nothing else, literally, after the purchase of the unit. I bought 3 thinking I would have to mix and match to get all the mounting I needed. Of course I was wrong, and wound up giving one to the wife and daughter.Picture quality and the available settings are really a sight to behold. Lot of variance for different conditions, super wide-angle lens, waterproof case with an extra back, and several different selections for shooting movies, stills, burst stills, and time lapse. I have not used the time lapse yet but I have several ideas that I will try soon. Overall, I am very happy to have made this choice, I have a lot to do to experiment with the different settings and types of shooting methods. As of this writing I have mounted to camera to the top of my Bike Helmet and will be using it on several different bicycling locations and will be posting the videos on my sites. I have every bit of confidence that this will be a life altering experience for me and at my age I feel very fortunate to have been able to experience this amazing technology. I was very excited to have been able to make use of the digital Photography in my Business, which made photography an even more interesting medium to create and experiment.

So i got my Akaso EK7000 4k WiFi today. Fully charged the batteries, powered it on everything seemed ok at first. When i went to connect the cam via wifi to my phone app a pop up came up and said recall send it back to seller for a full refund and $100 compensation. Called amazon and the customer service agent was nothing but a bad person. at first he tells me there is mow way to contact the seller and he starts questioning me about my bank and anout my funds which is none of his buisness. he was just out right rude. anyways i hung up on him contacted the seller then set up for a ups return. so when i get a replacement cam and its fully working i will do a retest on it and see how it performs. the amazon customer service guy really killed my mood for the day.

I have noticed that when the device is in the waterproof container that it has some serious problems. For example, the video will cut out or get digital fuzz were everything is green, freezes or video just blacks out. Sound while in the waterproof container is so low you can barely hear it in playback with the speakers turned all the way up. Now if you use it outside the waterproof container it works great.***** Update 4/8/2019 ******
I just received the camera and it works perfectly.  I like the weight of the camera,  the functions and all the mounting accessories.  I can't wait to put it to the test
I keep typing up a long review but I'm just going to bulletpoint it instead.  Here's what you need to know:Pros: Cheap, small, light, easy to use, LOTS of included accessories

**** Update - Customer support offered a refund due to the loss of the camera, however that was not necessary.My camera was found on the roadway by another rider later in the day and a week later it was returned to me UNDAMAGED and in good working order.  I am now using a metal mount for the camera and the waterproof case which seems to be more durable. *******  The camera takes very good snaps and video.  I'm an IT guy, but figuring out the features based on the icons displayed was a bit of a challenge.  I mounted the camera to my road bike handlebar and made a few trial runs to make sure my next big ride would be trouble free.  Today I did the Tour of Napa 100k event.  Some of the route roads were choppy with periodic potholes.  I was on a choppy downhill doing about 35mph and the camera mount snapped off due to vibration, and the camera bounced down the highway.  Needless to say, it was not possible for me to safely stop and go looking for it as it was during a 1500 cyclist event, and at 35 mph downhill it would have taken some hard braking and then backtracking into oncoming vehicle and cyclist traffic.  I had previously zip-tied the camera into the mounting frame because the design just clipped the camera into the front-loading frame, with nothing other than a small plastic pressure clip to hold it in place - quite useless.  Even tho the mounting kit that came with the camera had many ways to attach to helmets, handlebars, bike frames, etc., all of them were made of brittle plastic. Quite a bummer to not only lose the camera, but the 64gb SD card (separate purchase), and more importantly, the record of the ride.  Haven't decided to replace or not.

Just got this delivered 10 minutes ago. Open the box and the first thing I notice is this. I will be returning this unit along with this 1 star review unless the seller tea he's out to me to replace the case.Update* 7/26/2017

I recently bought this camera with a lot of enthusiasm. I am an amateur low budget photographer  (as in I use my phone for my hobby) and was ready for an upgrade. I did not expect much in terms of photo quality since this is an "action camera", meaning, the money is in the video taking abilities.The image quality inspection took place at my two 21 inch IMAC screens, comparing side by side to allow a fair trial.
Stay away camera overheats bad and have to remove battery to actually turn off.11/2018 Update:

well, we all prolly gonna fall for this cam because of its picture quality and lots of good reviews but after getting this cam, they try to give u some free stuffs if u leave a good review which is totally a scam right there as the reviews should be real, not something u wanna buy off.. nways, i turned on the cam, it looked good and allright but then, this freakin screen went into sleep mode which i understand as most of the cams do  it to save the battery but atleast the screen comes back when u push any button but NO, this cam is all black and blank and never wakes up, and gets so hot after like only 5 mins of recording.. since i used my credit card points to buy this, i am going to replace it and give it one more shot. i will leave the next review when i get the replacement.

This seems like a pretty decent camera, though its no GoPro for the price you really can't beat it, so I bought 2 of them to give one to a friend.  I've had it a couple days now and have been using it on my bike rides to test it out, the real test will come next week when I head out to Colorado to do some skiing.First thing is this camera comes with a ton of accessory mounts and a remote control to start and stop video and take photos.  Give yourself a good hour to unpack it and to get use to how to access the menu to set up the camera and charge the batteries.  The one thing Im not really happy about is that it comes with a real vague start up guide and you have to download the user manual online.  I know most manufacturers do this now, but there seems to be about 3 or 4 different manuals for the EK7000 out there, so make sure you fine the correct one.

My K9 partner and I area Search and recovery unit/team. We spend many hours on all sorts of terrain and weather conditions from mild to extreme. As volunteers we have to buy what we can afford and it gets expensive considering the extras you need to keep going until you "find" what you're looking for. A critical part of that equipment is having a solid compact, camera that can handle everything mentioned above.Surprisingly, this thing is a lil beast! and has weathered the storms pretty well. The Camera comes with a healthy compliment of necessities. With 2 batteries, short charging times, and ability to charge via a usb cord, life becomes easy and welcomed.

The overall value seems to be there. That is evaluating the quality, against the price. The fact that it has some decent accessories included is good too, those can cost hundreds themselves.The support app for the camera is decent as well.

I ride mountain bikes. I can't afford the gopro so I tried this little camera out. Mounted perfect to my helmet. Took decent video at 1080P... nothing but wind noise. Solution? Cur a piece of foam and tape it over the mic, leaving room for the sound holes of the microphone. Battery life at 1080P is about 40 minutes, maybe 42. Take an extra battery with you. I was told by a riding buddy that it records 2+ hours in 720P. Gonna try that out on next video.Keep in mind this is not for anything other than hobbyist/weekend warrior type stuff. If you want that kind of quality, don't expect it out of a $50 action camera.

This is my Updated Review of sport camera AKASO EK7000, I have received my replacement from costumer service representative from the company at least I can say they are very helpful in working with you so I choose to give them a second chance the camera so far is working ran both batteries in full charge, The max it will hold is 1hr 30min the picture quality still ok its not a Canon 80d camera so don't expect much there is a little noise in picture quality the video is not true 4K if this is the reason for buying the camera, It does record video with decent video image but not 4K. The camera at its price is great but accident's will happen so if it does happen it wont hurt much if it breaks or if you loose it in the lake, They do have floating hand grip for it to prevent from sinking in lake you just have to buy it. From buying a $300 sports camera I rather pay $60 bucks that will almost do the same as other competitors instead don't you think anyway ending this review with do some research check your wallet !!--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I bought this for our cruise trip which included snorkeling and zipline. I didn't want to risk my cellphone for the video during those activities, and didn't want to pay hundreds of dollars for something I may not use again.The product came with a large box of mounting gears. At first glance it was almost overwhelming, but I was able to find YouTube videos explaining the use of them, and I got them all sorted out and ready for the trip.

I bought this for a recent trip to Hawaii. I thought I would try it for the price. I was highly impressed with almost every aspect. I used it for still and video. I took it snorkeling several times and the video turned out amazing! The only flaw I came across was, 2 days in, the self-timer stopped working. It hasn't worked since, either. It freezes up if I try to take a timed photo, forcing me to have to turn it off. Other than that, it's a great buy!

**Update**I was contacted by their customer support and they sent me out the pro version which has Image stabilization and is 4k. It also has a webcam function that I have been using for board games online ans it's wide lens captures a lot of the board. The image quality is great too. I was really surprised with their support-

I have mixed feelings about this camera.  It has a lot of nice features and came with a lot of accessories.  I think for action video in bright light, it works really well.  In low light or underwater in more than 10 feet of depth, the pictures are poor.  I took it with me diving in about 30 feet of water and the video/pictures are horrible.  I was pleased that the housing didn't leak, so that's a bonus.  In fact, someone else on the trip had a real GoPro Hero and their housing allowed the pressure to push in button so they couldn't change shooting modes.  My housing allowed me to use all the functions.  But look at the underwater picture. They are all useless, even with post processing to add a red filter.  Above water, they were great.  Not sure if mine is defective.

I bought this for my nephew who is 12. I have a gopro hero 7 black and he loves using my gopro he is just rougher than i like on the camera after watching his footage. The day it arrived I set it up for him it recorded and everything worked fast forward to yesterday Memorial day we went out to the springs and when the record button is pushed the camera either locked up or lines ran across the screen and didn't record. I formatted the card in the camera and that is when this started, I put the card in un-formatted the night it arrived it recorded without any issues. Here is what I found I bought him a class 10 U3 64gb Samsung card with 100mb/s write speed the card is good for 4k I checked it against fakes it's a legit Samsung sd card. If you press record and your Akaso Ek7000 freezes or throws lines across the screen back down the resolution what we found worked was 1080p 30 frames anything higher and the camera freaked out. To format the card or change reolution once powered on press the mode button until the wrench is displayed then press the top record button. Once inside settings the mode button exits and the record button is enter the side buttons scroll. with Resolution highlighted press the record button set it to 1080/30 then press mode button to exit out of settings. The app I can't get to work on an iPhone 8+ or a Samsung S8+ i only connected successfully once it froze.I could return the camera but recording in 1080/30 will be fine for a 12yo it takes photos just fine this is a test to see if he will take care of it then I will get him an official GoPro. My nephews love the springs and they film fish, turtles and back flips off the dock with my gopro but now they have their own to use and my GoPro is no longer bounced off the bottom or banging against the rails climbing up the dock. Hopefully this helps someone i couldn't find anything on a freezing or lines across the screen for the Akaso brand.

My hopes were high that this camera would work based on the good reviews -- reason why I purchased this camera.This camera was intended for our vacation in the Philippines for 3 weeks last month. The capabilities of this camera was very disappointing. The screen freezes several times when used after only about 2 minutes of filming. After 2 minutes of filming, a red screen would appear and then the camera freezes. I was very disappointed that I missed capturing all the water activities we did during our vacation.

I was amazed at the quality of the picture and the bundle of accessories that made it usable for different purposes.  I bought it for myself, but also mainly for my two granddaughters (9 and 12) to use to make underwater videos in their pool. They had a great time making videos of each other and also telling stories with the camera in the water. I saw, but don't have, some of their products.  I was quite impressed.  Great quality, easy to learn and use. I also "borrowed" the camera to take some shots of my Border Collie running agility courses. She wore the camera with no complaints and the result is some great "dog's eye" view of agility. It is fun to watch and great for learning how to direct her in the best ways.  The steadiness of the shots is remarkable. This is just overall a fantastic camera for the price.  I haven't used a Go Pro (at 3 times the price of this one), but I can't imagine that I would be 3 times happier with the results.  Sorry I don;t have samples to post, but I will do so and you can see for yourself.
I rarely write reviews but reviews are soo different than reality.Here's the real deal.

This is my first action camera and I am also not a video wiz. It proved to be extremely useful to me and my non-profit - I am tying it to a post and tape horse riding and then, I edit the footage in Camptasia. Battery lasts for 1.5 hrs. Angle is wide enough to cover maybe 140 of the ring safely. Close-ups are simply wonderful. I like that I have 2 buttons to contend with. Audio is a bust but I don't really need it.  I don't use any remote features or live streaming. So, I give it 5 for video for this price, for sturdiness in the case and usefulness (it paid off many times).  Four stars  are for minor stuff - cover latch for battery broke quickly and I am taping over it to keep it more secure. Most of the fastening accessories are not very useful. I'm stuck with just one for now  - a little platform, which I tie to top of a post. Lots of videos made by this little camera can be seen on facebook page of Lifeline Horse Rescue and Rehabilitation (@lifelinesaveshorses). I am not submitting a video here because all of them are more than 2 min long after editing long footage.

I am incredibly impressed with the quality of this camera, especially for the price! I have used it several times-the second time on a kayaking trip in icy water. It fell into the water a few times-and nothing happened! The case was very secure and the camera dry.The image quality is great-I really do not understand how a name-brand GoPro could possibly be 10x as good at 10x the price-this is everything I want in a camera! I watched a fair number of YouTube videos filmed by and filmed about this camera and it was a clear choice for me.  I am considering purchasing a second so I can get two views at once of my adventures-for example one on the front of my kayak and one to take stills or watch the shore.

OK here's my review I've loved the camera for since I purchased it and have taken many beautiful videos however, I just discovered that there's really no way of editing it I'm not sure why that is I expected it to be just as easy to edit it as a go pro but it's not.  So if you wanna just look at the videos that you shoot without editing  them it's a good camera takes great pictures but for me without the ability to edit it's basically worthless. I downloaded about 6 different editing software apps on my phone and none of them will recognize the video file.  It would be nice if the company that makes these cameras addressed this issue.

Finally, a camera with 2 plus hours of recording time.I was totally impressed by the quality of the video this camera takes.  The accessories that come with it allow you to use it almost anywhere.  With the 2 batteries that come with it you'll be able to shoot 2+ hours of video.  Be sure to get yourself a high quality Micro SD card, Class 10 with a high write speed.  The menus on this camera are very easy to follow and get you whatever you want.  The included remote is an added extra which works great.  Download the app and you can control this camera with your phone and see what it sees.  Getting the app connected to the phone was straight forward.  Take your time and download the manual and follow the instructions for what you're trying to do.  There is only one thing I worry about with this camera and that is how long will the battery cover/door last with me inserting and removing batteries.  Other than that you will get your  money's worth if you buy this camera.  I am glad I did.

My husband was so excited about this gift until he reviewed the footage he recorded. It was blurry and not at all High quality picture clarity. It lacked sharpness and definition. It looked awful. Words on pictures and boxes in the video background couldn’t be read. Our cellphone video footage was perfect and much better.  We read all directions and purchased a new high quality as card that supports 4k. Ties didn’t help.  Super disappointed. I am hoping that this is a defective unit and you are safe to buy but I don’t know. It was a Christmas gift and purchased in advance so our return window is closed.

The picture is the same if not BETTER than my friends Hero... Ok... Ive used the Akaso 7000 now long enough to know if you want a really good action camera? Spend the extra and get a GoPro. The Batteries to this Machine are HORRIBLE only lasting maybe 40 minutes at the most! And that's on the lowest 1080 it has... So I carry FOUR batteries when i go out Detecting and 95% of the time Im always using the BlackWeb Charger I purchased only for this reason... The GoPro Hero 4 has a great picture and a nice stabilizer... BUT the biggest of the big are the batteries. ONE single Hero battery will last as long as FOUR Akaso 7000 batteries. So i make lots of cuts in my vids that I have to put together at the end of the day because I try to save each and every second possible! The charger is used as soon as the first two batteries go down. I hook up the BlackWeb to the two DEAD batteries charger and start them up. Lots to carry around with the Akaso when the GoPro beats it by having the one battery inside. Try going kayaking and taking all that along for the Akaso, including the water case it must be in that you cant hear anything from, and compare it to the single battery, waterproof , GoPro. A hand only GoPro or a Akaso and its bag you must take along to use it?
Very Happy!We do a lot of bike riding with skipping the gyms due to Covid19 as we wait for a working vaccine before going back into gym, which was a petri dish of bacteria and diseases before COVID.

This camera is almost a twin of high cost big name camera- but I after using this camera, I think all the money you would spend is only going to the name as this camera does almost everything its high cost brother does.  I've had the camera for a week now, and used it snorkling, kayaking (don't have to be afraid it will get wet), and while exploring in a cave.  photo and video turned out great, even in the poor lighting of the cave.My few gripes (overall the camera is well worth the price, so take these with a grain of salt):
This is a review of Akaso ek7000.Listing claims it is 12 MP, and shoots at 4K.

I purchased this camera mainly due to its compact size and to take videos during our last vacation (Japan 03/2017) and I have to say, based on its price, it did everything I expect it to do. The main selling point was, again its price, but also the wireless remote control (included) to take pictures of videos.The kit comes with all sort of attachments so it can be attached to a helmet, windshield mount, selfie stick, tripod, etc.

If I could give it no stars I would. I brought this for my birthday on the 28th. I was excited to see all the items it had, charged the batteries and when I turned it on the damn thing needed a card to work. No problem, I had one. It wouldn't allow me to take any pictures only video. I couldn't see the screen too good so I went to hook it up on wifi like to see the video through my smart phone like I saw in a YouTube review and it wouldn't connect. The camera says I was connected but the app kept giving me error messages. I tried everything. By then I was already aggravated as all the positive reviews had me thinking I was getting a bang for my buck. I shouldn't have to climb over mountains to get an item to work. I'm returning and will just invest in the hero 8 like I initially wanted.

I was amazed and what you get with this action camera the price is amazing, this is my first action camera,  I did not want to invest in an expensive action camera since I am new to this, this camera is excellent for the beginner, it has ever kind of mount you need and the water proof case is nice two batteries and a charger  it is a turnkey unit ready for action, I was amazed at the picture quality for under 45 USD dollars  I think once I really learn how to use it and get some editing software it will be a great addition to my document my travels, the camera is easy to use the buttons are easy to use the set up menu is pretty strait forward, I am sure at some point I will buy another Akaso with  a few more features but as a starting action camera this is a great choice to get your feet wet.

Update - Good customer service.So, the company contacted me and sen t me a replacement.  The problem appear to be twofold- one, the device doesn’t like cards exceeding 64gb. Also, the default setting makes the device go into standby, which makes it stop recording. That feature can be turned off, by put the menu and navigation are terrible.

I purchased this item when it was on sale, as I have been considering an action camera to experiment with for a while, especially for on the motorcycle. For the price, it is a nice camera to try out and use without feeling too bad about if something happens. I can give it to the kids to take skiing and not stress about them losing it or breaking it on the first day (not that I want them to break it, I just won't stress out about it).The camera reviews are pretty spot on.

This was given to me as a present for my birthday.  I was surprised that it came with 2 batteries and a lot of nice accessories.  I primarily use it to record when I go out bashing with my RC car.
