Was amazed with the quality and crispness of the pictures.  I think it is pretty durable too. I’ve hit it at speed with my RC and it didn’t skip a beat.  I did have it inside the waterproof case it comes with at the time.  Battery life is ok.  But you get two so no complaints.  I never attempted to use the app  that comes with it so I can’t speak to that.  It’s really nice having a remote that comes with it.  Kind of wish it had a light to tell you what button you pushed (did I just stop the recording or did I just push start?).  At $49 per, I think this is a steal and will definitely get another one.  Great buy!

I bought this as a second action cam to use for a different angle. The reviews I saw made it look impressive. My main camera is a Gopro Hero 4 so the video and audio quality just doesn't compare. If you were using 2 or 3 of these you could get by ok but this one just can't begin to keep up. It's kinda like a Volkswagen and a Ferrari having a race.One handy item with it that I didn't think I would use in the remote control. For videos, I just don't see much use but for snapping a picture it does "ok".

I use this camera in its waterproof case on my kayak while fishing. It's mounted with a Scotty mount on an extension pole. The camera was a little challenging to figure out at first, but not too bad. The battery is only good for about one hour, but it does come with a spare battery. I like that you can swap out batteries instead of having a sealed battery requiring recharging with a cord to the camera. I use the remote (put it in a ziplock bag) to activate the record mode while on the water. I have a great video that was shot with this camera of a battle with a huge Crevalle Jack.Recording time was about 35 minutes. The camera worked great, and the video converted nicely to be viewed on my large screen tv. The camera while in the waterproof case is pretty tough too. On a different day I got a little careless and allowed my kayak to roll in the surf along the beach. The Scotty camera mount broke, and the camera went into the surf along with much of my other gear. I recovered the camera and later washed the sand and salt off it. it was just fine. New Scotty mount, and we're off and running again.I can afford a Go Pro, but I just can't see spending that kind of money. This camera works fine for me.

I bought this to use as a dash board camera for my Tacoma. I bought it while I was displaced from Tropical Storm Imelda. When I finally go to move back home I started setting it up. I ran into trouble while trying to access Setup mode. Press the mode button and it cycles through different options. Only thing mine would only cycle once or twice and then stop. I never could get to Setup mode so I am unable to set my camera to the operating options I want. Not good. So, since I took so long to start using the camera I am now past the return window. I liked what I saw when it did what I wanted it to do, but not being able to set it up like I want stinks. So, will be putting this in a box on a shelf and chalk it up to lesson learned. Sigh

This camera would have been great in 2001, but in the modern world, this camera is simply outdated. The image stabilization works about as good as your eyes do when you’ve had 10 shots and 6 mixed drinks and you’re laying down in your bed, staring at the ceiling. Image quality is so-so but the fact that any sort of movement makes the video shaky just renders this camera useless to take video of any good times you want memories of. Literally any newer smartphone camera takes better quality pictures and videos than this. I have an iPhone 8 and it’s twice as good and way more convenient than this.Enough about the poor quality videos this takes, let’s move on to the terrible features and few good qualities this camera has: good ones first.

We bought this camera for our 13 year old son. He has used it on his bike, under the water at the pool, and on vacation while we were sightseeing. It is durable and has great quality pictures and video.  I was surprised by the number of attachments that he could use on a helmet or mask or stick or bike.  You name it and it was included. It even came with an SD card adapter! You can't really hear the recording when you are using playback. However, when we put the memory card into the computer it was much better.  You have to talk loudly if you want it to record the voices, but we have always had ours in the waterproof housing.  He LOVES the wrist band remote. You do have to be pretty close to the camera for it to work.  Overall, we are very impressed and would definitely buy this brand of camera again.

I thought long & hard about GoPro and OSMO, 2 awesome action cameras, But I did not want to spend $300+. I ended up buying the Akaso EK 7000  and boy am I glad I did!  I shot my video while on vacation in Florida, 1 PM on the ocean goofing around with my wife, I attached the action cam to my full face mask and started filming away, when I saw the quality of the images afterwards I was blown away, I guess 12 megapixels will bring you some pretty top-notch quality video!  I want to say that if you want professional grade video, by the go Pro or Osmo, but quite frankly the video on this action cam is pretty damn good and I can’t justify spending $300+ on anything else. I will try to upload  a video with the next couple days. Buy It, you won’t be disappointed !!!PS, the sound quality is OK, but then again it’s OK on the other cams too, you need to buy an external mic if you want high quality sound.
What a total wasteWhat can I say

My wife said she wants evidence of how I was killed on my motorcycle, my fault or theirs, so she gave me permission to buy an action camera. I have it mounted on my helmet and I've used it twice now on my commute and as seen in the pic, condensation has formed INSIDE the "waterproof" case. The only times I've open the case was to change batteries. I was in a dry environment when I did this (my living room) yet somehow moisture has found it's way inside.4K: The 4K setting only runs at 25FPS (frames per second). I'm not even sure it's a true 4k, the video was pixelated and the quality of the 1080p 60FPS setting looks much better. Seems they added the atrocious 25FPS 4k just to be able to advertise that it's a 4k camera. I mean... there is even a giant "4k" right on the front, which a coworker got excited about after seeing, until I told him about the fps rating.

This camera actually takes pretty good footage when its recording... if you stand behind the mounted camera or hold the camera to operate it works nice. the controls are just a little too clunky for a sports action camera in my opinion. I have tried multiple times to self film some bow hunts and if you cant see the camera recording just assume it is not. I should have gotten some really good footage but didn't. If you are able to look at your camera and operate the controls and verify recording then you should probably just use your phone. If you want to mount this behind you to film a hunt or put on your helmet for some type of riding or whatever, you will have no clue what the camera is doing.Also the battery life is VERY short... I guess thats why they send you 2 of them.  I wasn't expecting this to be perfect for the price but I have to admit I'm a little disappointed. May work fine for some activities.

Unfortunately I am disappointed in this. I should have known better then to expect anything for what this cost.  There’s a reason GoPro costs More.  I bought this specifically to go scuba diving on vacation.  I found that it did not record any of the underwater footage, even though the red light was on and there was 5+ hours left of record space.  I then went back and saw that about 1/5 times I thought I was recording it actually wasn’t recording.  I tested this and found that if I record video for more than 30 seconds, it almost never saves it.  And it frequently won’t save any video files at all regardless of length.  Photos are the same. Sometimes it saves them, sometimes it doesn’t.  If you want to make sure you actually get your footage, don’t buy this.  Maybe a good toy for your toddler.  Disappointed that I won’t ever be able to share my experience.

I received this today and found a few minor issues:1. The documentation: it isn't complete in English. The first instructions in the manual are English. The first list of what's in the box is labeled "Was ist in der Box". Also the documentation doesn't explain some of the accessories (like Clip 2 goes with Clip 1).

This camera works great! I've been through quite a few action cameras, and this is one of the best I've owned. I didn't notice the remote when I bought it, but it was a nice surprise. The remote works great to start and stop and isn't intrusive when strapped on your wrist. Video quality is superb. Battery life is on par with every other action camera I've owned.Note: if you're going to use the remote to stop/start and there is more than 30-60 seconds that recording is paused, you probably want to turn off the power saving feature that shuts off the camera if it's not used for a while. If you have power saving on, the camera will shut off if you've paused for too long and unless you can see whether the camera is on or not, won't know that nothing is happening when you push record on the remote.

I'm seriously blown away for 43 dollars I can't believe the performance this camera puts out let alone the tons of accessories that come with the camera bought this camera exclusively for my motorcycle helmet and let me tell you it serves its purpose first, let's start with battery life I went on a 3 hour bike ride the first day I got the camera the battery lasted 2 hours recording in 2.7k before finally dying and that was just 1 battery you get 2 btw next image quality I have no complaints the video was crisp and vibrant next ease of use the camera was pretty simple to figure out without even looking at the manual one of the feature I love about this camera is the ability to sync what the camera is seeing to a smartphone this was paramount for me as I record motorcycle rides and there is no way to see what the camera is actually seeing the wristband included with the camera is also a nice feature you can remotely take picture and videos by the push of a button so there you have it buy you won’t be disappointed

I got this for my husband and our children to record their fishing trips.  The picture quality is okay but the audio is absolutely horrible.  If my husband holds the camera at arm's length to record himself you can hear enough to know that he is speaking but you can't understand anything.  If he wears the camera on his chest you can understand some of what he says but it is very quiet.  It is so quiet that even after enhancing the video's audio in filmora you still have to strain to make out what he says.Update:  The seller took it upon themselves to reach out to me and asked how they could help me to improve my experience.  They worked with me to make the situation better and I was very impressed by that.

Was very sad with purchase. Unable to download to laptop or computer.We purchased for a 2 month trip across country. FL TO CA. Wanted to use as a action camera 📷 🎥 as well as dash cam. Was unable to get the pics on second cam download and 1st wouldn’t stay on. Very disappointed. Ended up using phone and video camera 📹 which didn’t work well on dash.  WANTED JUST TO GET VIDEO CROSS-COUNTRY total of 7000 miles
The following review is from my son, who purchased this camera to mount on his quadcopter.========================

My eight-year-old has been begging for a Go Pro for a while now, so I started looking into more affordable options that would still produce good results and settled on the AKASO EK7000. I can't speak on whether the camera can in fact handle up to 100 feet underwater, but my son has done several long and thorough tests in the bathtub and in the sink and it works flawlessly. Video and picture quality are great, especially for this price point! The sound quality may not be the absolute best, but it's decent and is plenty good enough for what my son uses it for (note: when the case is on, it doesn't pick up sound well at all, though I don't think it was intended to since the case is what makes it waterproof and all). He mainly wanted it for when he does parkour (he's learning) and to mount onto his skateboard. My son was able to navigate through the menus mostly by himself once I showed him how (I had no trouble with the settings/menu at all). He filled up the 32gb card I bought for it in a couple of hours lol and has been using it constantly, so I LOVE that this camera came with two batteries and a dual charger that lets you charge them at the same time. Now he'll always have a battery ready. It also comes with a ton of mounts (except head and chest) and a little wrist remote, which I suspect will come in especially handy once he gets the hang of using it. Overall, I'm very satisfied with this little camera and my son absolutely loves it!

Update!! This company has won a customer! A customer support tech reached out to me and provided amazing support. This company stands by their products! They got me setup again. I will be more careful and I will definitely look to this company first for my next action camera!!-original review-

Cheaply made camera, all the accessories don't offset how plastic and hollow this camera felt. The video quality was acceptable, the audio was poor and the lack of a touchscreen and very dim display had me return this camera. There are a lot of options at this price point and Akaso( a no name brand) should not be charging this much for such a low grade camera. The waterproof case uses a plastic lens on all their cameras which is prone to getting scratches on it.Update:
Just a few tips ....take as close up as you can it doesn't you good far away in the water.

<Update 7/15/19:  The video I uploaded as part of this review looks nothing like the video I took with the camera. I'm not sure what happened to it, but it obviously doesn't give a very good testimonial for the camera. Hoping this is some sort of temporary issue>After my son lost his expensive GoPro last year in Costa Rica, I said it was too risky to buy another one. But my wife and I were going to Belize and knew it would be a mistake not to have some kind of underwater camera for the awesome snorkeling, so I started doing some research. Came across this camera, and given the price and good reviews figured it would be worth giving it a shot.  There were a couple downsides which are noted below, but overall it was a great purchase.

I will start off by saying I‘ve never owned a GoPro. This is my first ever action cam and we actually bought it to get extra camera angles and top-downs for our video work.We love this camera!  All the attachments had me confused at first but I found a use for every single one.  I was pretty happy with what I got for the first two days, but the camera got 10x BETTER and more fun for me and the kids to use once we installed the phone app and could control and view the camera output from our phones. Super cool camera and for the price, it’s hard to complain much IMO.

I ordered this camera after trying to use my phone camera on vacation in a water proof case under water. The phone did not work. So I came home and ordered this camera after doing some research. I have NOT used this camera under water yet. I have tested the camera in the waterproof case in the sink full of water and the case works great. So I cannot advise on how clear the pictures are under water yet.What I can review is the ease of use and the accessories that it came with. I was very impressed. This is the first digital camera I have owned though. I have never owned a Go-Pro. But for the value of this camera, I think the picture is great, the ease of use is great and the accessories that it came with are good. I only really needed the waterproof case. It has a remote that you can put on your wrist and that is really cool and works really well.

Bought this camera for my honeymoon. We traveled cross country visiting 16 different states. The camera works great and takes great pictures. Especially under water. The only thing that you need to make sure of, is when you’re taking pictures, make sure the lenses are wiped clean otherwise you will have blurry pictures. I keep my camera in the water proof case and have had some blurry pics due to dirty lenses. Otherwise great camera for the price!Updated to add the 5th star! The customer service was excellent!! Highly recommend this camera!
Overall, I wouldn't recommend it unless you really need a low cost camera. I wish I had found a used GoPro 2 or 3 years old for similar price and better video quality and better battery life.+++

I purchased this on the basis it was a 4K high res camera however in the “settings” option page it only allows the choice of 720 60fps or 1080 30fps. Not at all as advertised, in fact the very name of the camera 4K HD PRO is just blatantly misleading.Maybe I just got a bad one but will find out as I like the other features and affordability of the camera itself. It comes with a wealth of attachment hardware which is nice.

I took this out for its first use on motorcycle, and am pleasantly surprised how stable the image is. It was mounted to the top of my clutch reservoir. I was expecting blurry or vibration filled clips, but it looked very good.The problem I had was with the clamp mount. When I began to install this mount, the first nut fell free  and hid.  Be aware of this.  This was also the only piece that did not have semi-captive acorn nuts for the thumbscrews. After finding the nut, I tightened the bracket onto the handlebars and left it to fetch the camera. By the time I returned, the mount had snapped at one of the ends, falling loose. It was not excessively tight, just enough to keep the camera case from moving.  I expect that this could have happened while underway, causing loss or damage to the camera.

This is the first of two Akaso camera's I've recently purchased, and while this one is the lower costing camera,it has been a better camera. I've had some issues with my other camera which I purchased mainly because it has image stabilization, while this camera does not.What I find is that if you are using this as a helmet mounted camera, you don't notice the camera not having image stabilization much, if at all. I find the video image comparable to the more expensive EK7000 PRO as long as it's mounted on something like a motorcycle helmet, which is basically an image stabilizer, but when using it on an RC car, it would be nice to have the image stabilization option.

I wanted an affordable small camera to take kayaking and hiking. I didn't want to be nervous to loose it. This camera is good quality for a fair price. The app interface is much better then dealing with the buttons on the camera. They take some getting use to when you are trying to navigate the menus. But the app is super easy. Just for video or pics the buttons are not an issue.The bundle has a big variety of options but I am super happy with the waterproof case. I tend to swim a lot when I kayak so i wanted to be sure it wont get ruined. Plus I seem to always get stuck in the rain.

I bought this for my son to use on a family trip to Yellowstone.  I had previously bought a GoPro Session, which was my only experience with action cameras, but I thought that it would work for a 9-year-old on a somewhat rugged trip.tl;dr:  Given the (tiny) price, it's more than I expected.  If you have serious requirements, buy a serious camera.  If you're looking for a cheap intro to action cameras, give it a try.

I got this camera November of 2017. I have not used it right away since I was not able to get the memory card right away. Then I first used it late December last year to just do a simple recording and photo shoot. The camera was great and by the time I was trying to use the remote control that came with it, I noticed that it is not pairing with the camera. I thought I am just doing something wrong until I made my research. It looks like there is something wrong with either the remote or the camera itself when paired to its remote control. Then I totally got out of luck when the deadline for eligibility to return or replace this item is over. Now I'm stucked with an action camera without a remote control. I cannot find a replacement remote here in Amazon. Please anyone help me find a good working remote control for this camera?I upgraded the review to a 5-star rating not only because of the great product but also to a superb customer service by AKASO. I was not aware that they tried to contact me long time ago since I was not really checking my emails periodically and their email was delivered in my junk mail folder. I am not a pro action camera user but I am very particular gadgets user. I always make sure that the products that are purchasing are within my quality standards and we do not need to pay for an arm and a leg to get what we need to achieve. I do not want to buy a Mercedez Bens if I would only use it for my everyday grocery shopping or driving it to work. My point here is based on the actual photos and videos that I am getting, AKASO EK7000 is perfect. Most of high priced products are just so hyped because of their name brand only. This camera is perfect for me. I will give a full photo and video review once I got a good subject and be able to find sometime roaming during the holidays. To be continued...

I purchased this mainly to film my kids ski and am overall very happy with it.  It is completely waterproof and has a very wide angle view.  The sound is not as loud when in the case but it is still pretty clear as I have video conversations with my kids instructors.  I also used the bike mount and attached the camera to rearview mirror to use as a dash cam when not using for sports.  The cons are the beep is not very loud in the case so when I mount it on my helmet, I can't tell if its recording.  I mount it on my chest now so I can see the  record indicator.  It would been nice for the remote to have an indicator showing the recording has started or stopped.  You can pair with phone through WiFi for status and controls but that is a pain for skiing.  Also, not ideal for being a dash cam because there is no autostart recording on power up.  I have to start it every time I drive.  Also the camera does not charge when in use so the camera will not stay on long after the car is off and power is cut.  The intend purchase is not for dash cam so I did not grade down anything dashcam related.

Needed a camera to record some trail riding with. The value of this 4K action camera is like the quality of its shots: spectacular! I was reluctantly set on buying a GoPro, then I noticed this 4K action camera on Amazon. The reviews were favorable and the amount of accessories included, for the price, was simply too hard to walk away from. So I didn’t, and I’m stoked about it. This 4K action camera hold its own against the masses, for a third of the price. A THIRD OF THE PRICE!! What else needs to be said, except stop wasting your money on GoPro and get an equally quality picture for a better price for a pretty nifty-looking 4K camera.

We use this for Youtube videos and home videos and photos. My 8yr old daughter uses it as her personal video camera for her toys. Comes with so many accessories, many of which you may never need. Camera is very simple, but can be a little awkward to operate since there are not very many buttons. You can (and should) change most of your settings through the APP. Takes decent pictures, but doesn't zoom in and isn't set up for slow-motion type action. Be careful when recording to make sure the button has been pushed and you CONFIRM it is recording (I have lost a few videos thinking it was recording when it wasn't, I know, operator error, but easy to do). If you want a "go pro" for a bargain price, try this. Might also be good for a 2nd "go pro" that you don't mind putting in risky situations.

The value for the price is unbeatable so don't get mad at the shortcomings - you get more than what you paid for even if it's not comparable to the high end.For $50 there are a fair amount of accessories that come with this camera and you should have no issue operating it right out of the box. I slapped a pre-charged battery and an SD card into the camera and was recording in minutes. Perfect for someone dipping their toes into the world of live streaming (such as myself). It comes with two batteries (and charger) so you'll have plenty of juice but be sure to grab a 64G or higher SD card and Micro USB cable at checkout because these are not provided.

Took some quick videos to get use to the features and functions.  This camera is easy to use the clarity was amazing.  I used the remote control wristband to start/stop the video.  Nice feature, I wish it were waterproof, I'd use it more often.The waterproof housing works fine, just need to put a thin coat of wax on the lens to keep the water from spotting. I mounted the case to my mouth piece and when I finish my water shot edits will add to review.

So far, I've been having trouble importing the video on my PC and when I did, the files were all corrupted or unable to play. I haven't checked up any solutions for this, but so far, only one file is able to play. Maybe I'm doing something wrong, but I assume it was just insert the card and record. It says the files are .mov, but quicktime or vlc won't play them. When I try and playback them on the actual device, it says the files are unable to play and get a green/grey bar across the screen.

This is a great beginner action camera to start with. Nothing fancy, but a great value. I shot a few videos and they look pretty good, not awesome, but the balance between quality and price paid is fair. 4 stars just because it didn't come with sd memory card, I had to spend an extra $20 for a 64gig. I would have paid an extra $10 for the camera all together if it had an SD card. They are pretty cheap on Amazon, I'm sure Akaso guys would afford that. All in all, my son is happy!

There’s a lot of little attachments in the box but not really any instruction manual to explain how it works.  There are rechargeable batteries for the camera but the remote doesn’t work at all.  To get to the battery on the remote you have to use a tiny screwdriver on 4 screws to open the back then open it up and have to unscrew the circuit board get the battery out to change it.  I don’t happen to have any of these button batteries either.  So that part of the purchase is useless to me.  It’s not a big deal really to me but to someone else it might be.  My son tested it out on his helmet and it has a pretty good picture.  Not very loud audio though.  That might be something we can adjust in the settings though.
These cameras last about a year. Customer Service is SHABBY.Wifi quit working on my V50 Elite. This is what they sent me.

Last December, I bought the EK7000. After reading the reviews, I thought it was a great choice for the price. For eight months, it worked like a charm. I used it for three different trips. The video quality was excellent; the sound was great. For the price, it couldn't be beat! Plus, they give you a bunch of accessories. Well, randomly, my screen decided to stop working. I had only used it for a total of twelve days over eight months - broken. After following a troubleshooting website, I attempted to fix it. I bought new batteries and a new SD card. It didn't work. Then, randomly, the screen turned-on again, but now, it's not filming. I am disappointed. If it's not one thing, it's another.Update: After posting this review, AKASO messaged me. They sent me a new camera - free of charge. So far, it's been working like a charm. I used it to film Christmas. I'll use it a few more times before I up my rating. But, I will say that their customer service is on-point. If you do have any issues, they're willing to make it right.

EDITED REVIEW - the company reached out to me after my earlier review and sent me a new camera. I have not had issues with the case or mounts rusting at all after several salt water uses so perhaps it was just a fluke with the first one! However, the handlebar mount snapped in two the first time I was out using it, after it hit my soft foam paddleboard.... I just bought a clamp mount instead. The pictures and video from the camera itself are quite nice. Took me trying out several programs before I found one that would edit the videos. I use Open Shot Video Editor. As in my original review, to use the remote the camera must be OUT of the water. So I start the video by remote instead of reaching up my paddle, swing it around and stick it in the water. It makes for a few seconds of awful video so trimming is a necessity! Overall, it does take good videos and I'm happy with the purchase.Original review - I have an old GoPro but I didn't want to leave it attached to my paddle since it's occasionally left alone by the car as I'm loading/unloading down to the beach. I hoped this camera would be what I needed, something to take good pics/videos yet not such a big investment in case of loss. Unfortunately after just three uses the housing and mounts are very rusted! Three uses in three weeks and it looks like I've owned it for years and treated it horribly. The remote doesn't work the moment that the camera is submerged so do not count on that being something you can do. I had hoped to stick my paddle under the water and snap some pictures but can't. To use the video under water with the remote, you need to start the video above water and then submerge the camera.

The camera is absolutely amazing it works perfect. I had an issue ordering a external microphone And gave a bad review on that camera because of the microphone issue. Will the company send me a brand new camera at no cost to me. The customer service is out of this world good. I would’ve been perfectly satisfied if they would’ve sent me a microphone but now they went above and beyond to send me a Updated camera. I was thinking about buying a go pro but hands-down a Akaso customer service is out of this world. I highly recommend buying a V50 pro Or even the EK 7000 Is awesome. I have a YouTube channel and I use both of these cameras. And the awesome thing about if you do have a problem they will send you a replacement camera once you send the other one back. And may I add they will send you the labeling the same the camera back which is awesome. If you’re thinking about buying a budget camera that is a third of the cost of a GoPro butt and save yourself some money. And if you have any problems you just send it back and I’ll send you a new one heck you can’t beat that. God bless Akaso camera company You guys are awesome keep up the good work.

Batteries were LEAKING when I opened this camera.  Also the body of the camera was coming apart at the seams.  Return process was easy though.UPDATE:  AKASO responded to my review and asked if I would give the product another try.  I agreed and I'm extremely pleased that I did.  This camera is very good.  In fact for the price I would say it's a better value and product than an actual GoPro.  I own several of these action cams from different companies and this is definitely my favorite so far.  And the customer service, WOW.  The wifi works great.  It really helps with knowing exactly what your shots are going to look like.  It comes with enough mounts and attachments to really hook to anything.  Waterproof case hasn't failed us yet and it doesn't seem to fog at all. I would love image stabilization but at this price point I really don't expect it.  Thank you AKASO,

The size is prefect for our son who loves to take videos when we are on the go. The waterproof case is also a plus since he loves the pool and amusement parks. Unfortunately we may not be visiting too many of the later yet, but it will get plenty of use at Disney when everything opens. The other thing that I think sets this part is the number of mounts and accessories that it comes with when compared to similar models. It'a also easy to use for our 8 year old who will be the primary user of the camera.We enjoy playing with the Wi-Fi connection and app; that was a lot of fun being able to remotely view, and use the camera/video features. Also allows you to view the photos/video. We're still exploring all the features but have been very pleased so far.

I bought this as a gift for someone who wanted to get into the whole "GoPro" filming thing without wanting to spend all the cash right away on a real one. The camera itself is really good for the price as far as image quality and it works just fine with any of the mounting accessories. My only complaint and why it gets a star taken off is the abysmal battery life even when you drop the FPS or quality down. You are lucky to get 30-40 mins of filming on a battery. It took me a while to figure this out as I kept having the camera turn off during long sessions which caused me to lose footage.Overall I'd recommend this camera to play around with before getting something more expensive because its cheap enough that if you break It you can just replace it, however, look into either more or better batteries to take with you if you are going to be filming more then just 1-2 hours at a time

I bought this on a recommendation from a friend who has one. I was surprised he used an off brand so I really had to look into it. I kept thinking that is ALOT of items included to be so cheap.Everything included helps you start using this right away.  It felt like decent quality and let me say yes it is!  Super easy to use ( I’m not great with tech stuff)  and still only 59.00? Yes!  A lot of great videos out on how to use this.

Edit to update: The customer service is awesome! They contacted me after ready my review. Emailed back and forth a few times and I’m satisfied w/ the outcome.  The picture quality is pretty awesome.I just opened this and I noticed a few things right away. First there are loads of attachments, which is ok but they are each individually bagged. The bags tear easily or already have holes in them, kind of wasteful. Second, the camera out of the waterproof case feels really delicate, some of the attachments don’t work w/ the waterproof case. Third, the cover for the battery is not connected to the camera, it could EASILY get lost. Fourth, you need a tiny screwdriver to open the remote and the initial setup for the remote seems a bit complicated. I’m hopeful that once every thing gets set up it will be easy to use. The camera itself is pretty user friendly so far and the one picture I took of my dog is a quality picture. I’ll edit my review as I get to use it! Fingers crossed👍🏼

This gadget works perfectly. I rode my motorcycle through seven torrential thunderstorms and the camera was perfectly dry and operable. I videoed my ride on the Tail of the Dragon at Deals Gap and the video is clear no vibration. Camera controls are easy to use as is the app that you download for it. At $50 why try the others? Because you like the name? Because all your buddies have them? Well all of the GoPro accessories work with this camera. Let your buddies over pay. This camera is the real deal. Battery life while in use is about two hours, but it can also be connected via usb to charge and record while riding. Records in .mov file which I'm told is good. Transfer to PC was easy. I did it without instructions so you can too. I'm trying to learn how to edit them now, but it doesn't look too hard. HINT: The camera also records sound really well. I didn't think of that when I mounted it next to the engine. (lol)

Pros:This camera is excellent for the price. I connected it to my bike forks.  I expected the video to be bouncing.  While that camera does not officially support true video stabilization, it does record remarkably stable video. The size and weight is perfect for the application. The camera comes with a half dozen mounting options. It comes with a spare rear cover for the water resistant case. It handles a wide range of lighting without issue. Lens flare is not really a problem.  Distortion at the extreme left and right is not significant.

This is my first ‘action sports camera’. I’ve spent my life doing mountain sports, from being a ‘valley rat’ in Yosemite’s Camp 4 in the ‘60s, ski-instructing for the military in Garmisch-Partenkirchen, to being a climbing instructor for CMS in Estes Park, CO. At 68 years, I thought my days enjoying the mountains were over until my daughter got me out skiing again. I want to record my adventures for my grandchildren to inspire them, and my AKASO EK7000 makes that possible. It’s lightweight, rugged, and easy to use. The camera came bundled with (just about) everything I could imagine needing (need a chest harness for those helmetless backcountry hikes/climbs). The only reason I didn’t give the product 5 stars was because both the  ‘Quick Reference Guide’ and ‘User Manual’ are lacking in detail. However, I did manage to find numerous Google resourced that helped immensely.

For action cams you almost never want to use a built-in mic. This thing has no microphone port (1/8" or USB).Second edit (above first edit): I've had this for a few months now. It shuts off mid-recording even when the battery isn't dead. It fails to store files occasionally and so the whole attempt to record is lost. I would not recommend this camera to anyone.

I bought that camera has a third point of view for my configuration using an ATEM Mini (that can support up to 4 cameras).I had to buy a Micro-HDMI to Full HDMI cable as well as a Micro-USB to USB (to charge) the camera. But it is working pretty well. The camera is very cost-effective and has a wide field of view. For the price, the camera comes with an impressive set of accessories and two batteries (that I do not use but found it interesting to have 2).

I absolutely adore this camera and my daughter aka Super Girl” (because she does her own stunts), literally refuses to leave home without it! She takes it to swim classes, bike riding, skate boarding and even when she’s out with her dad on there hunting missions and 4 wheelers. They capture so many cool things and the clarity it unbelievable. You’d actually think we paid the price of the more “popular” action cameras. With 4 kids, we’ve already decided to get the other 3 their very own. I’m glad I didn’t let the sour reviews deter me away from purchasing this! Heck, I’m a YouTuber and I’m even considering buying myself one for some fun ideas I’ve got planned. Purchase it, you will thank me laterDon’t let the negative Nancy’s cheat you, out of a great product for a great price😉

This is my first underwater camera.  I just got certified for SCUBA, and am planning a whitewater rafting trip.  Needless to say, I've spent a small fortune on all of these adventures, and now I'm a little "money conscious" about the peripheral expenditures.So far, so good.

I love this Camera! If you’re on the fence about Buying this or more expensive product, save your money! This is an awesome camera that comes with some great accessories and you can use a 64 GB card with it (I would also recommend the bundling accessories and a case, you can get all four for under $140 to include the Camera). I used it on our most recent vacation and got some gorgeous pictures and videos! I let my son used it on his bike and he loves watching his video. In addition, they have the best customer service I’ve ever experienced. While I was on vacation with no cell service and minimal WiFi the remote wrist band stopped working and part of my waterproof case crack (I was able to still use the case but kept an eye on it). I contacted amazon using the IM customer service feature (awesome feature if you only have WiFi). They provided me with the email for Akaso customer service. I explained in an email what happened and that I was on vacation. The day I arrived home I had an email asking a couple basic questions. I responded and they sent a new waterproof case and wrist band within two days. They followed up to make sure everything was ok and to make sure I was happy with the results! The earned a customer and fan! I have since recommended this Camera to several friends and family who have purchased it and love it as well. Thank you for the awesome customer service and delivering a great product at the right price!

Almost Famous. I'd give it five stars if it worked better. I'd even pay a little more if it worked better. It's just not completely functional without some work around.- Time and Date.  Resets back to firmware date programming when the battery gets changed. Work around for speed is to connect it up via wifi to my phone and open the app.  It syncs the time/date up without getting into the menu.

I bought this camera to record underwater fishing spots and wanted something that was waterproof, not super expensive and I wouldn't be out much money if I lost it. This does the job.  I don't have a Gopro to compare it to, so consider that.Pros:

I bought this camera as a gift for my wife after she borrowed a GP from a friend for SCUBA diving, and loved it.  I figured "for the price, why not?".  Let me say that this camera does everything you would expect, and is so inexpensive, you could buy 4 of the name brand.  My wife uses it every week to film her dance classes and uploads the video for her subscribers, and it has never once failed her.  The picture and sound is every bit as good, and it saves in the same format as everything else (mp4).  We have never tried the software, because we just use more advanced editing programs, but I assume it works fine.  Before you spend hundreds, try this one first, because you will not be disappointed, and for the price it is easy to replace if destroyed.

I was just learning about go pro but didn't want to spend so much money on something im unfamiliar with. I found this one and so happy about my purchase. Its user friendly and easy to use. The quality is clear and so portable. I haven't tried it in water but we used it in the snow. The case is sealed well and no water have gotten inside. The battery last for 2 hours.  The only thing I wish is the ability to play back the video with the sound. After taking the video and you play it back, there's no sound. Even when you take the waterproof case, you can't hear the sound. But when you download the video in the computer, the sound is clear. Im actually impressed that it records the sound well even though its in a tight water proof case.

Was really hoping this was going to be great but...it was not. It's easy to use and the case it comes with is water proof, but the video is horrible quality and no where near the 4k that is advertised. Taking it hiking, repelling and just walking were horrible. Once we got back from our trip and looked at the videos and photos all of them were blurry, videos were shakey and very disappointed that our trip was not captured liked we'd hoped.  The pictures literally look as if they are just screen shots of a poor video.  If it's something important, spring for the Go-Pro.

Update 3/29/20: The camera's biggest problem is that it requires constant resetting and the SD card requires constant reformatting. Manifestation of these issues is a camera with inaccessible menus and loss of recording functionality. The solution is simple: remove the SD card from the camera, turn on the camera and reset it (there is a reset function in one of the camera's menus), then reformat the SD card as exfat on a PC (reformatting as exfat on Linux will not restore camera functionality for me for whatever reason). Reinsert the SD card into the camera and you're good to go (until loss of menu access/recording functionality occurs again, which seems to be relative to the SD card being moved from the camera to a different device). I've learned the hard way, always check camera functionality prior to leaving the house.Other than that, when wearing a chest mount  strap and not using the camera's waterproof case, audio is perfect. Video quality at 1080 is certainly at least adequate in both sunny and cloudy weather. New batteries recording at 1080p 30fps will last about 80 minutes.

The very first time I used this camera, the buckle which connects the mount to the camera (in the waterproof casing) unlatched while surfing. the camera fell into the ocean, never to be seen again. I called amazon and explained that my camera didn't even last an hour but they did not provide a refund. I never even got to view any photos. Huge waste of money. I'm gonna give this a NoPro

I have bought several of these over the last few years. The first ones are awesome!! Sharp.. good color balance.. great bang for the buck..Akaso has started making these much more cheaply as time has gone on. The latest ones are not sharp at all, they also have gotten much worse with color balance - the newest ones have an orange/yellow tint to them. Some of the mounts provided don't even fit the cameras now. I have also noticed that over time, the color balance starts to shift slowly, and this makes edit work a pain!!

I bought this for our Maui trip when we snorkeled. Nothing worse than getting ready to film and the item does not work. It would not accept the 'wifi code' and from there you are left with nothing but a bunch of plastic. Unfortunately the return window closed while on the trip. DO NOT BUY as this is not a reliable item. For me it is $80 down the drain. NOT HAPPY!UPDATE-----------------------------

I just got back from a week in the Caribbean and used this camera for snorkeling, scuba diving and general sightseeing. I admit I didn't use all the options, as I received the camera just a couple days before I left for vacation, but I can't wait to explore what else this little buddy can do!  I found the photos to be of very fine quality, a little pixley underwater for snorkeling, but I am a graphic designer with a trained eye for these things so don't know if the average Joe would notice that. Wouldn't suggest this for scuba diving. This was my first scuba experience and the photos are extremely blue and without color.  I understand that the deeper you go the less color spectrum you will have on camera. Perhaps there is a better camera for photography deeper than 15-20 feet, I don't know. One of my photos (orange coral) was snorkeling and I was about 5 feet below surface. The other photo was at about 15-20 feet scuba diving. The video was snorkeling in Barbados (lots of white sand) on a sunny late afternoon. I was surprised when I downloaded my photos and video that there was a time/date stamp on everything. Perhaps I didn't read the directions well enough, but I hope there is a way to remove that. I also wish that the first option in the cycle of capture options was photo instead of video. Otherwise, I am very pleased with my purchase!

My son and his wife worked at a camera shop for over 20 years and they're very impressed with the quality of this little camera, as I am. I'm 74 years old and I'm in love with this. I was pleasantly surprised that in the box beneath the camera itself, there were a whole lot of accessories included with the camera, too. I didn't realize there would be so I ordered a separate accessory package along with the camera so now I have even more accessories. I needn't have bought the extras so I'm including this info in this review so that other customers  know there's a whole box of great accessories also included with the camera at no extra cost. I'm thrilled with this purchase.  Very well worth the money. I give it five stars across the board.

Update: The customer service team reached out to me to offer a brand new camera after my poor experience. Since I did not request this and they upgraded the camera to a newer and better version, free of charge to me, I'm updating my review to have 5 stars. Call it what you will, but I believe that a review can be based on both the product and customer service of the company. Understand that my previous words should be taken into consideration about this product, but the company went out of their way to make sure I was satisfied with my overall experience. I will see how the new camera holds up compared to the other one and hopefully I won't have a similar issue.The adhesive that attaches the pad to the helmet surface: great. The adhesive that mounts the pad to the plastic mount: Awful. I'm lucky the whole camera system didn't fall off during my commute! This camera is barely worth the $60... I'd spend $40 or so more to get a Yi 2 or something better.

I got this camera primarily for snorkeling after my Pentax/Ricoh failed on a recent trip. I researched many cameras until I stumbled on this one. A huge amount of accessories was included. The Go/Pro style mounts seemed to fit my floating handle and other things just fine. Color balance is good , which was always a problem with my Ricoh. Admittedly I have not used it underwater except in an indoor pool due to travel restrictions with the virus emergency. I did think the pool pics were very clear and good quality. It came with two batteries which will be very handy as well. The price is so good I may buy another just to have a spare in case I lose one  in the ocean.

The quality of the camera is truly amazing for it's price. It records professional video footage. The audio is crap but if audio is not your first priority and video is then this is a great camera. I did pick up a memory card that allows me to have 5 hours of video stored on it at any given time. There is another review that someone put on here that says what memory card is best to get for great quality video and I just got one of those and my camera is working great. Looks kind of cheap and is very light but I love it. I picked up the headset/chestset that is sold separately and a tripod and they all work great with my camera. I love the headset with this camera. Smooth video footage.

Got this EK7000 camera for cable wakeboarding...and it worked better than expected. I've never owned a "GoPro" because of the scary price, so I was all in to test out this camera at a fraction of the price. I know you can pay more for a camera that has a more stable picture..but I can't really complain about the quality of this camera. I thought the picture was going to be choppy at 4K because playback on the camera itself seems choppy..but when I played it on my computer at home, it was great. I'll be buying more as gifts. I'll update over time if I come across any issues. Also very impressed to see how many different adapter and batteries, accessories it came with. I used the remote too! A+++

My 9 year old and I downloaded the instructions and figured it out quickly. The only negatives so far are that the instructions on how to use all the pieces are poor and the fact you can't hear volume when playing back the videos you took on the device stinks. Otherwise the camera has good quality, is pretty simple to use and intuitive with the app. Again wish you could get audio on the actual camera so you don't have to load everything to your phone and then play on another device just to watch playback BUT the camera itself appears to be good quality and it has been really fun having my son explore and make videos all over the place, even in the pool without any problems. I do not have a Go Pro to compare it against though but I still feel this was a good purchase especially for the cost and with all of the supplies provided.Note: I felt they were clear that the SD card was not included but make sure you understand that as well. Also there are a lot of pieces so I'd recommend a case for carrying/storing everything. Final bit of advice would be to purchase a tripod as well as that is not included either (again I knew it wasn't but just found I wanted one after I bought this pack).

The picture quality seems to be good but the camera has few significant limitations:1. The manual says "in waterproof case audio will not be recorded", on my motorcycle it was recorded and was too noisy (wind) even on low speed. It's not possible to hear anything else but noise.

I bought this camera to use mainly while Stand Up Paddleboarding and during any other water activities, and it did not disappoint!  The pictures and video quality is perfect, and that along with the affordable prices makes this camera perfect!  It's a little tricky to figure out how to use it at first (changing mounts, connecting it to your phone, etc), but I figured it out in no time and after "practicing" a couple times, it became no big deal,  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND you download the users manual - it was very handy multiple times while I was learning my camera!  You'll need a QR scanner on your phone, so just fyi!  Make sure you read the directions while connecting your camera to your phone.. again, can be tricky and at first, but once you get it its fine.  Dont let the video quality from the camera fool you - it's choppy and doesn't seem good, and I was SO upset at first, but once you transfer the media to your phone, it's perfect!  I downloaded the recommended Akaso App and also you a video editing app called InShot, and the 2 together work perfectly.  I'm so incredible happy with this camera, and if youre in the market and considering this one, I highly recommend it!(Note, it does get hot quickly so I wouldn't leave it out in the hot sun while not in use.  It comes with 2 batteries, each of which only last about 90 mins, so make sure you have both of them charged and ready to go, and take your charger with you!  I have a portable charger that I used to use for my phone that I carry around with me when Im using my camera.. that way  if both batteries die and we're out somewhere that I don't have access to an outlet, I can just plug them in to that charger!  They reach full charge in no time!)

When I opened the box, which was secured by a single piece of clear tape, the camera was shoved in the bottom with a torn cardboard inner box.  No idea if everything was there, but i needed it for a canoeing trip, so I just went with it.  Camera takes decent pictures and video, but there is a serious flaw.  I did not notice that the camera does not preserve settings if you swap the battery, so all of my media that i took on my trip in 2020 is timestamped January 2018.I was contacted by the manufacturer about this issue, and they promptly shipped me a brand new camera.  I am impressed with the amount of care they have for their customers.  With the instructions included in the NEW camera package they sent, I was able to understand and operate the camera without the 'self-taught' hiccups that I endured with the first shipment that i suspected was not new and may have been a defective return.

My old GoPro Hero 3+ died after a leak in it's waterproof housing and I started hunting for a new underwater camera. Wasn't ready to drop $400 on a new GoPro 7 after reading some mediocre reviews, so looked for a more budget friendly alternative and I found the perfect choice. The picture and video quality is equal to, if not better, than my old GoPro and it comes with a useful accessories pack. I use it for underwater video primarily and I do miss the blinking red light on the back of the GoPro to show that the video is active. There is a light that blinks on top of the AKASO, so it's just a matter of getting used to it. Easy transfer to my Mac via USB and works well with Mac media apps. All in all, I highly recommend this camera for anyone on a budget looking for a GoPro type action camera.

For the price - wow!  I hope this is as good as it seems.  I charged up the batteries, and fired it right up.  I used some of the myriad clamps that come with it to put it different places on my motorcycle.  The connection from the camera to my phone was easy to set-up and makes controlling the camera pretty easy.Somehow I missed the fact that a memory card is not included - so - I've ordered one... and here's the first "gotcha" - the instructions says only to use 32GB cards.  I'm a guy, BIGGER IS BETTER - why can't I put 128GB card in this puppy and record entire trips????  So order a 32GB card when you order the camera.  More to come later.

A button broke after the first use. While using it on our honeymoon, the function to switch from picture mode to video mode hardly worked. Also there were multiple times when the device wouldn’t record or take pictures and it would have to be turned off and turned back on. I felt like I was trying to fix it so much that my wife was getting frustrated since I wasn’t experiencing the honeymoon. By day 3 of the trip we just used our phones with the $6 water proof bag cases. I would suggest those over this device.
This is a great little camera. I compare it to my GoPro 7 Black. I use them on my helmet, riding my dirt bike.Pic quality - same

I bought this for a photography project where I needed to place a camera in a public area without fear of it being stolen. After testing the Akaso EK7000 I won't spend the extra for a Go Pro. This action cam does almost everything I need. The small wrist mounted remote was dead on arrival but a couple of email with customer service and a new one was in the mail. Great costumer service!I wish the camera had a longer battery life though 1 to 1.5 hours is good I shoot a lot of time lapse and can be set up for hours on end. Camera doesn't shoot in RAW but in the higher resolution settings it captures more than enough images for a 30 - 60 second time lapse video. Works well as a dash cam while driving too.

[ORDERING] I started looking for a product that could be used for filming during hikes, bike rides, kayaking, jumps & stunts, and just simple recording. That is where I came across this product.[SHIPPING] Shipping took ONE extra day; however, NOTE that the shipper has no control over that; however, USPS, UPS, or any shipping company are doing their best to get the product to customers. One day is not a big deal at all. This product is much worth the wait anyhow.

It really is hard to beat this action cam.  The picture quality is far better than I expected, the remote on/off/pause is really well done and it mounts to all kinds of surfaces.  I bought one form my nephews for dirt bike riding and they love it.  Takes a time or two to get the angle right so you aren't filming the ground or front tire but once you figure it out, it works great.For me, it is hard to justify spending money on the Go Pro just because technology is changing so quickly and if my nephews crash and wreck the camera, I'm not devastated because I spent several hundred dollars.  I haven't used the camera under water and probably won't.  I would recommend this camera to anyone wanting to try the action cam thing at a reasonable cost for a better than expected quality camera system.

Talk about bang for your buck! This camera is incredible. Lightweight, crisp images (and audio!!), standard memory card / usb interfaces. Attached is a video taken recently of a crayfish grab gone wrong. I love this camera - it has a ton of mounting options, easy access to the battery compartment, and out of the box waterproof (completely) to what I can attest to be at least 20ft. Or 1+ atmosphere. I'm _literally_ writing this review right now because I'm back in my order history looking to purchase another. If you're thinking about getting yourself a weatherproof action cam, I can't possibly recommend this one enough.

For comparison, I've used a go pro and a Sony wide angle action cam. Out of the box, there are issues with the screen- see photos. The images it captures are incredibly grainy especially compared next to quality photos from a Pixel2 cam, go pro, or my Sony.  The battery cover is always randomly popping off which is another huge issue. Lastly, the camera will randomly turn off even though the battery is recently charged and ful- this renders the camera essentially useless because it turns itself off within 60seconds of turning on. My husband said, "what did you expect for the price?" To be honest I did expect a functioning camera. I thought it'd be nice to have something that didn't coat an arm and a leg so I wouldn't worry so much about scuffing it or dropping it- turns out I didn't even get a chance to do any of those things. I've only had the cam for about 10days and I've experienced all these issues in that time! Would definitely NOT buy again.
I had two cheap action cameras, under $50 with more functions and capabilities.I decided to bought this camera, for buyers review.

I Highly recommend this product.I use the AKASO EK7000 every day. I at first purchased it to shoot action scenes around my city, but I realized that it makes for a really nice webcam too!! I work in film production and the quality is pretty good for action scenes but is pretty good for other tasks as well. I stabilize my videos on Davinci Resolve Pro

Bought this action camera for my pre-teen because of all the goodies that came in the box, along with the price. Right out of the box, we were able to strap it to his helmet and he was off on a bike ride.We were able to download the apps to his Fire Tablet, and he is able to share his videos directly from his tablet, no removal of the memory card required.
Ok, first off their customer service is excellent and was no problem when Camara started to have issues to get it replaced.Overall its not bad for the price an quality of this camera.

Camera is a good inexpensive replacement for a Go Pro.....Video is decent, pictures good, for the price, very good quality. Lots of accessories, 2 batteries, although I just got this..so I can’t be sure how long the last. All good, and far less expensive than Go Pro....with very comparable image resolution. Audio...stinks....but I don’t need sound on this.One thing bothers me though, there is a card inside, which offers free accessories, if you post a 5 star review. Right on the card, it asks you do not mention this card, why you ask? Obviously, it’s against Amazon policy...you don’t reward buyers for inflating reviews, and tell the platform you sell on. That’s misleading, isn’t it? So although this is a very good product, for the price, that sort of underhanded method, makes me question their integrity. They really don’t need to do this.....it’s dishonest. I would have given it four stars, but that bugs me. And no, I don’t think it’s better than a Go Pro......

My husband has been a hobby SLR/DSLR photographer for 40 years, so he knows his way around camera equipment, but we were completely new to video equipment and were unsure about sinking a ton of money into something we may not use.  We found the AKASO EK7000, and could not be more thrilled!  We are having so much fun with time lapse, mounting it in the car and driving around town, and placing it on the floor to get close-ups of the cats fighting.  It will also be useful as a body cam in his line of work, as his department does not yet have them, and you can never be too careful these days when people are so litigious.  For the price, that will be an excellent insurance policy, something we hadn't even thought about until we saw the size and portability of it.  Thank you for such a fun and useful product!!

Seeing is believing. Don't belive the other reviews because they are getting paid to give good reviews. The product also came with something that stated if u leave a 5 star reveiw on Amazon you'll receive a bunch of things. The wife and I were very excited to get this and try it out. We tried and sent it back 2 days later because the picture was EXTREMELY grainy looking (especially if dark like indoors) and the picture was very grainy and pixelated if u were outside. Just save your money and get a gopro 7. At least u know your getting something good.

I feel a bit duped after recording my first long video with this. Upon playback of this important footage I realized this camera does not have a microphone and therefore does not record audio. I feel intentionally mislead as the description does not mention this nor did any of the reviews I read. How can this camera have 12k 5 star reviews, but cannot record audio?So far I've recorded 3 hours of beautiful silent film. At least it actually records video, unlike my POS GoPro Hero 3 which died from not being used for 6 months.

Update* this camera is actually pretty nice. Playback of 4K recordings is choppy, but once you download it to your phone through the iSmart DV (on the iPhone in this case) it’s perfectly fine. The AKASO DV app is buggy and that’s what I downloaded at first but then I read the owners manual (which is a QR code just hold your phone camera up to it and it should give you a link to it) and it recommended the iSmart DV app. It’s fun to use in the pool and the waterproof case works perfectly fine. For the money it’s a great little piece of tech! A GoPro is t worth it to me since I’m not using the camera everyday. But if you want a really smooth 4K video, I recommend a camera that records in 4K 60fps instead of this cameras 24 FPS. But for vacations and mountain biking once in a while this camera is perfectly adequate! So far so good.

regular meant-to-be-used as webcams have become so over priced, and I also plan to take it with me on trips, etc to take pictures for my blog.First of all, lets review the packaging. I had read that there were mounts and accessories included but hadn't really paid attention to the amount of stuff that came with. I was pleasantly surprised by the selections of mounts and straps that came with! Everything works really well. However one out of two of the batteries sent doesn't charge or work at all, which is a bummer.

Got this camera for use on my fishing trips as it's easier to mount it than a phone is.  Didn't want to shell out the bucks for a GoPro and was hoping this camera would "good enough".  The reviews are good so I figured I'd give it a shot. Well, not only it is good enough, it's great!  Crystal clear video and it's very easy to save the videos to my computer via the phone app. It's awesome!  Battery life is great, the accessories that came with it made it very easy to mount and I now have hours of first quality video of my trips to share and watch again. The app works perfectly and is so easy. The wrist remote is particularly convenient as I can flip the camera on and off while fighting a big fish.  Perfect fit for what I wanted and an excellent value. Very, very pleased with this little camera.I've never dunked it in the saltwater but I did video in a pond near my house and was down to about 10 feet and not a drop of moisture got in the case so I have no doubts it would be fine. I plan to utilize it again heavily in a month and look forward again to seeing my trips from a "different" view.  Love it.

Purchased this for two reasons: one, since I wanted to have an ‘action cam’ option, and the idea of being able to get one for $45 bucks sounded appealing, especially at 1080p or 4k.  Two, I was hoping to be able to use the HDMI out as an extra live stream possibility for OBS and other applications.On number one – the camera is pretty decent.  It is NOT as good 1080 quality as say a DSLR, or any other pro camera.  I had thought that perhaps the pixilation of the review videos on Amazon were just a byproduct of the upload to Amazon; but there is some measure of grain and pixilation the output.  Tried to increase to 2700 and different frame rates – so far same effect.  This is not to say however, that the picture is bad.  It’s not bad.  But if you’re a professional videographer, do not think that this will be the same as go-pro footage.

I gave this camera to my daughter as a present, This is what she has to say about it:The video quality is very good and smooth. I did find hard figuring out the battery; It was a struggle opening the battery compartment. Another thing about the accessories that are included: I don’t know what they are for, which the manual should explain more clearly. Opening the package was also really hard. But after all this is sorted out, it’s a good quality and amazing camera for when you go to the beach. They just need to make it more practical.

I waited a few months before posting a review to see how it held up... we are 10 months in and I love this thing! It first went along with me on a trip to Hawaii, where I kept it in the waterproof case the whole time. Bc I had this camera, I was able to get video of my friends and I jumping off waterfalls, snorkeling, and playing in the water! I have some pictures I wouldn't otherwise have! Bc it is in a case and you're in the water, of course you're sometimes going to have water spots in the middle of the photos or some occasional odd light refraction in the pic, but overall I got some really good shots. Again I took it with me swimming at Balmorhea State Park and got some fun video of the fishes swimming around. I couldn't upload any of my videos for the review. I just recently moved to Hawaii and my camera has survived the move and being tossed around aggressively. Overall, I have been really impressed with this little guy, especially at how much cheaper it is compared to a GoPro. I've purchased a few additional accessories to go along with it and all the generic GoPro equipment fits.

This camera was amazing!!!! It took the best photos and videos. Even under water I could still record sound. I have been playing one of my videos over and over again because I can hear the waves and water hitting the shore. The sound is so peaceful it helps me sleep. The waterproof case held up well and I ended up leaving my camera in the waterproof case for the whole trip even during my hikes. I had wonderful clear photos to show all my friends and family. The only downside for me was the battery life. I have contemplated buying a couple more batteries so I could take photos and video for longer. Luckily they do include 2 batteries to start, so it was really nice to change them out.Update: The batteries are not an issue at all! I bought a battery bank to charge my phone while on vacation. I brought the battery bank to the beach with me to charge my phone, and instead I would use one battery to film in the water while the other charged. It worked wonderfully! Since purchasing, I have taken this camera on several vacations and adventures. I have snorkeled in Maui, Hiked in San Francisco, and explored the beautiful Rocky Mountains with this camera. I never take it out of the waterproof case (probably because I am lazy) but it the camera takes such clear photos in the case that I don't see a need to take it out. I have suggested this camera to my other family members for their trips. Although a Go Pro has better features you really can't beat this camera for the price.

This is a fantastic little camera!  I bought it on an impulse just to see what it was like, and I couldn't be happier.The price is great and includes a number of accessories (e.g., waterproof housing, mounting brackets, two batteries, and more).  Add on a microSD card (not included), and you have everything you need to get started right away.

If you're flipping between 2 action cameras trying to decide which one to pull the trigger on...pick this one!! You will not find a better action camera at this price point.  Bought for my upcoming vacation, allowed my 2 youngest children to test it out.  Video quality is great. App/WiFi feature makes downloading videos super easy, you will have to try both recommended apps though.  Sound quality through water proof case isn't horrible.  Did notice a tiny bit of fogging in waterproof case which means there is a bit of leakage somewhere.  Overall though for $50 this is a fantastic purchase!! In fact I just ordered 3 more for our family to use on vacation and out doing charters

The battery life on this product is insanely short.  I have adjusted the recording quality and was able to get about an hour out of it but compared to a name-brand version this is terribly inadequate.  They do give you two batteries but I was unable to get past lunch on a day of skiing- AND it is kind of a pain to switch the batteries while you are out doing an activity. For the handful of minutes that it does work- the picture quality is right on par with others that I have seen so no problems there.  Also, the price is FANTASTIC, but . . .you get what you pay for.  Do not leave the house without the spare battery easily accessible and even then don't expect you'll be able to film yourself for more than an hour.**UPDATE**  Months later, a customer rep reached out to me to offer two new spare batteries.  I have to admit that I wasn't able to greatly increase the battery life- BUT, equipped with 4 fully charged battery packs I certainly have enough time to record most of what I need on a given day.  Battery still not great- but customer service and working with the company affords them an additional star!

I have used several of these from mounted on a motorcycle, to scuba diving on shipwrecks, strapped on R/C vehicles and bashed around, to hauled underneath drones. Despite being a fraction of the cost of other brands, these have always worked perfectly for me. They come with a ton of mounts, a waterproof case (and it has worked to 100 feet in frigid New England waters), extra battery, etc.You can pay more for a similar product, then cringe when you lose it in the surf at high tide (true story), or when you slam a drone into a brick building (also a true story). I find these more than capable for anything I've thrown at them.

Purchased this camera for a trip south to the Keys around mid Feb. I was a bit worried about the functionality being that it's on the cheaper end of the action camera world. This thing did wonderful! far surpassed expectations! I used a wrist strap purchased in a cheap kit that did great, and I was able to swim with it. the case didn't leak (I had a spare but didn't use it) and the battery held up well. all in all would buy again and recommend this model. I didn't go with the touch screen because with the case only the buttons work anyway. wonderful action cam!

All in all I'm impressed. A few of my friends have GoPros and I've always wanted to camera that style but couldn't afford it. The ek7000 came up on a flash sale. And I just couldn't resist it. Opening the box I was truly surprised by all of the accessories inside. All the different mounts in wireless remote 2 batteries charging station I thought to myself all this for so little. There's no way this camera can be any good. So I gave it a try. I made a couple of short videos with it and upload it into the computer. Into the side by side comparison with videos from a Hero 5 The video quality was very close. As was the sound but the image stabilization on the ek7000 Was much better. If you're looking for a compact action camera Look, no further. You need to give one of these a try.

This product is by far the most reliable camera I've ever had my hands on.It was only intended for any accidents/incidents that would occur whenever I'm out and about on my motorcycle. It comes with the camera (of course) with extra accessories as well as batteries whenever you're touring. What's really cool is the fob remote that they give you. No need to fiddle around with the camera to see whether or not you're recording. And it comes with the screen as well. Reason why this is brought up because the camera is much more affordable than a standard GoPro. Even the modest GoPro Session is 5 times more than the Akaso.

Just recieved the cam. Its cool i knew it wouldnt be like a go pro but it is ideal for what i want it for like kayaking,out camping and mudding.I put it to the test today as a dash cam i mounted it from my headliner near winshield but back like 10" from it i read plenty of reviews before i bought this cam. It worked great until about 20mins in it overheated i had the ac on and it was cold in the car i was dissapointed.

I have been looking for some kind of action camera to use that is waterproof. This is so I could film videos of me going underwater and to just have something to film fun videos of me and my friends. Of course like most people I first looked at a GoPro but was shocked at how expensive they are. So I looked up action cameras on Amazon and this one of the first things to come up. $60 and 12,000+ with over 4 stars as an average rating?! Sounds amazing! So I bought it and once it delivered to my house I started using it for several months and was amazed by how amazing of a camera I got. So many mounts and accessories came in the box. I am very satisfied with my purchase and I would for sure recommend it to a friend! The iPhone app is slow and could use some improvement though.

**UPDATE: AKASO sent me a EK7000 pro camera to replace this one. It does have the time lapse video feature that I need. I am impressed with the customer service and with the quality and utility of the camera.  I am still not sure if this older model has been updated to be able to shoot time lapse, so I will leave my previous comments up. ** --- Unfortunately, when AKASO says "time lapse" mode, what they actually mean is timer mode, as in push the button and run around and pose in front of the camera which will wait several seconds before taking the photo. THIS IS NOT TIME LAPSE. I am extremely disappointed and would not recommend anyone buying this camera if you want this feature.

I've had this camera for several months now and do not recommend it for several specific reasons:1 - The claimed resolution seems dubious. For example, shooting in 2k with the camera looks about the same as 1080 on my older gopro cameras. This is with the same mount, same environment, and exposure. It simply doesn't look as good.

I purchased this camera for my son to use while we travel.  He's always wanting to take videos and photos on the beach and he's super excited to have access to this.  I haven't put the camera through its paces yet, but I will update this review once we return from our trip with first hand experience.Instructions and information that comes with the camera is pretty sparse.  There is a quick guide included in the packaging and a .pdf file online to download the users manual.  There are several helpful videos online that explain the different attachment uses.  I knocked a star off for having to dig around online to figure out what everything is.

I had very low expectations about this camara. For the price that I bought it it could not record any decent videos. Oooh I was wrong, way wrong. Not only I been using the camara everywhere I take my son to but also I bought another and have verbally recommended this camara to every friend. I have recorded videos at night with low light and the videos come out great. I have not record any extreme video so I would not comment on image stabilization. But for my every day time keeping and library building this is the way to go. I had plans to buy another one just to keep it in different locations but it's soo easy to move around that I don't have the need for a second one.Now I would like to get their higher version to see what is like. I absolutely recommend this camara to anyone who would like to record precious moments at an affordable price.

I was taking a last minute vacation to Curaçao and wanted to capture our snorkeling adventures. I didn’t have the money to spend on a more expensive name brand camera and the reviews for this were promising.I am throughly impressed with this little camera, especially for the price!
