The picture and video quality were great. Battery life was good- we did a mix of videos and a still photos. Each charge was sufficient for our snorkel adventures.  I highly recommend this camera to someone who wants to capture those beach adventures without breaking the bank.

i have had the EK7000 since July 2017 with the  Sports bundle. I  recommend both. The camera has worked well. I have it set for 1080p at 60fps since I do not have a 4K monitor. When using it in my car I can read license plates up to a distance of about 40+ feet and even in a lane over..  Battery life is on the order of 45 minutes of recording. Sound quality is good. The cell phone smart app can be downloaded at google play store but have found that is has  some bugs - Like shutting the camera down after a few minutes. So clearly I don't use it. The included remote control works fine. I mostly use the camera when driving through the canyons or at Willow Springs raceway. I am buying a  second one to get interior and rear view shots.

For the price point, it has great picture and video quality. It works as you'd expect it to, for the most part...Unfortunately, the main features you'd want to work end up not working in specific scenarios.

I followed the reviews and purchased this camera instead of the expensive GoPro. While the sound quality is not as good I was very pleased with the purchase. I used it for a Spartan race twice. Had to work out some issues (with the way I was working it) on the first race but the next one came out great. It was not a perfect a picture as I've seen from GoPros but certainly worth the money when compared. Very happy with the product.

This little camera takes very clear pictures and videos. I put it on our rock crawler and the first couple of times the videos was very clear . But I didn't have it strap down to good. And it moved a little causing a shaking videos. But still very clear videos.  That and trying to drive a rc car that only has fast speed. Then  i strapped it down with zip ties on a slower rc rock crawler never moved. And it was a lot better what great videos . No shaking videos. I also put it on a little tripod on my deck and video a chipmunk up close . I was awesome. I would recommend this awesome little camera. I haven't tried the water yet. I had problems uploading my video to show you.

I am not a big video producer (age 59)...will be go snorkel this year in Mexico and Colorado ski.  Did not need to spend "GoPro" bucks, therefore this AKASO EK7000 was right for me.  Had 11,000 reviews on Amazon at 4+ star rating and they were correct. Only a few uses so far but came with a bunch of accessories (including underwater case) and after doing this review, they will send me more. Easy to use scrolling menu screen.  Basically didn't need lots of options and this gives me all I need...4K or 2K video, single and burst pics and a neat arm band remote to start/stop the video or take single pics.  So far pleased and the price was 1/3 of GoPro Hero.

Let me start by saying, I bought a GoPro for over $400 at BestBuy. I used it one day and returned it because GoPro requires special software in order to view your videos from a computer. I purchased this AKASO based on the great reviews and price point. The quality is excellent and feels just like the GoPro (which was a great surprise). In my opinion, this is better than the GoPro because, not only does it feel, look and record as nice as a GoPro, you don't need special software to view and edit videos on your computer! (GoPro records videos in a special video format that you can't watch unless you have GoPro software installed.) This AKASO records in standard video formats that make it easy to view on normal video playback software that's already on our computers!

I have been using this camera daily for the past month while riding to work. The picture quality is great and the sound quality has been good for what I need. The waterproof case has worked excellently in heavy rain and the camera is high quality enough to catch license plates while riding. The battery only lasts about 90 minutes but with 2 batteries, I switch to a fresh one for the ride home so I don't lose power on the ride. Overall I've been very happy with the camera and if I had the option again would buy it again.Update: Camera still working very well, with great quality picture. The batteries do degrade over time, only getting a little less than an hour of run time with each one. Overall still a good camera and good for the price.

To be honest, I bought this camera because I needed a webcam and webcams are almost impossible to get right now and I did some research and found out that this camera could be used as a webcam and also has all the functionality of an action camera!They shipped super fast and set up was so easy! This camera is 10 times better than the stock webcam on my laptop, so it is doing everything that I intended to use it for.

Well, I kinda like the quality, but still my go pro session still  better quality with 1080 than this camera, despite its making good pics and videos. But with 4k quality sometimes becomes very blurry kinda becomes pixels and goes back to normal. But sounds is terrible and makes me nervous. Very low, and you barely hear unless you stick your memory into computer and volume up all available speakers connected to your computer...

Tried the camera for the very first time today and was impressed with the quality of the video.  Stabilization was very good.  For the cost you could not ask for better.  In fact  the quality of the images and the camera itself is as good, if not better than higher priced action cameras.  The instructions which you go on line to view the manual were pretty straight forward and easy to follow. The camera came with a lot of essential attachments that you do not have to pay extra for. They even provide you with 2 batteries.  I used the bike attachment.  Ended up buying 2 cameras, one for me and one for the wife.

"I used the the recommended head band holder and it detached and sunk in the Florida Keys whilst kayaking. The wrist strap did not fit and was unusable. Would have been ok maybe but only had it for a day before it became fish food."This was my initial review, then I was personally contacted by the company and offered a full refund or a replacement. Many companies would not do this. I was very happy with my experience and enjoyed the camera itself before my incident. This was not a normal situation and I am sure I will have many opportunities in the future to make many new memories with my new replacement camera. Thank Akaso for taking the time and being such an honest company.

So glad I purchased this instead of spending the money on a Go Pro or another more expensive option. As with many people that purchase action cameras I'm sure I used this a few times and it's been sitting in a drawer ever since. It's not that it isn't a great camera I just am not quite as awesome as I thought I am it appears. Ha. Seriously though it's a great camera for a snowboard trip or a trip out of town but not something I use every day. I took it snowboarding and the image stabilization was great. I had to play around with it to find the angle I liked the best but I got some great video I'll be happy to have years later I'm sure. We also took it on a vacation and let our nieces and nephews play around with it in the pool. The case worked perfectly to keep water out and they had a blast taking some absolutely terrible video that made me sick to watch as they have no idea not to just move the camera all over the place with no sense of direction. It was great fun for them and I didn't have to worry about them wrecking my camera that cost hundreds of dollars as I would if I bought a more expensive model. I'm looking forward to taking it on future trips and with me surfing, filming our kids learning to ski, motorcycle riding etc.

Just like some of the other cheap knock offs, this probably has it's place but not in my selection of cameras. Quality is OK. However, it's very annoying that every time you change the battery you have to reset the date and time. Other settings seem to be saved so why not the date and time. I'll stick with the more complete product that can actually do simple things.UPDATE 09/28/2018 to 5 stars from 2: Akaso reached out to me to help solve this issue. They sent a new V50 camera that will now hold it's date/time settings while you change the battery. Kudo's to Akaso for the great customer service (5 stars on customer service) and standing behind their product. That is very much appreciated in today's world where many companies don't stand behind their products and have poor customer service.

We wanted to get action cams so we could see what our school age kids were seeing as they ran youth motorsports races. We weren’t too sure about forking out the cash on a more expensive brand since lost objects are common with young kids.  We settled on this one as a much more wallet friendly alternative. We weren’t expecting a ton out of it but we’re pleasantly surprised. It’s actually a pretty nice little camera. Videos are clear and colors are great, even when running snow/ice races on a sunny day.  We’re fans of the wifi connectivity as we can watch the videos on our phones/tablets immediately without having to wait to get to a computer. It also came with a nice assortment of mounting pieces that have come in handy. Can’t really go wrong with this one and we’d recommend it to anyone looking for something in this price range.

This is my first sports camera.  I didn't wanted to buy something expensive since I already own an iPhone.  But this was nice and reviews were good.I just have it in my hand and first of all:  there are a lot of accessories here!  Everything you could need for is already included.

Very nice & affordable alternative to expensive GoPro Hero camera. $59 vs $399 plus it includes about $200 worth of accessories that you don't get with GoPro. As far as performance it is pretty good. Better battery life than GoPro 90 mins vs 50 mins. 4K video is only 25 frames per second vs GoPro 4k 60fps, but the default 1080 / 60fps on this camera is great enough for most of us. Pro athletes should go with the GoPro for higher frame rate and advanced image stabilization but for the rest of us, this camera is awesome.

I got this for my 9 year old she’s into video and photography. Got it in a flash deal so I saved about $15. I didn’t want to spend too much like a ho pro because she is just a kid and hopefully this won’t get lost or stollen. Thought this may be better than the kids video cams with the quality, screen and large storage. I thought a 64GB SD card was included but it was not(maybe I viewed too many action cams and got it mixed up thinking this came with it all. I’m just getting all the pieces out of the box and familiarizing myself with it so I could help her figure how to use it. It comes with a lot of attachments and extra pieces, love the wireless option too. I wanted something of good quality, storage space and waterproof, I think this may have it all except for having to now purchase a separate SD card. I’m still trying to figure out how to release the action cam from the attached box, I can’t unclip it.I will probably update again once we start using the cam.

I wanted an action camera to use on my motorcycle but like many I was reluctant to invest $300 or more, then worry about it while on the open road.  Rain often accompanies me while traveling so it was important to have a camera with good protection.  It didn't miss a beat in a downpour in Kentucky which lasted for hours.  The AKASO comes with amany accessories right out of the box, including two batteries and a tiny charger.  It is easy to use and the performance is much better than I had expected. After watching the Isle of Man race on TV I'm thinking I need to buy a few more!  My suggestion is to buy a couple of them on your first order.  You won't be disappointed.

I'm not impressed with this camera; "astonished" would be closer to the mark.  Purchased this Akaso EK 7000 based on a recommendation from a friend of my wife's, and I just can't believe what this little camera can do for the money we put into it.  As a caveat, we're not pushing the camera to the limits of human endurance by skydiving, mountain biking, scuba diving or the like.  But it works extremely well for our needs.My wife competes in dog obedience training, and likes to review videos of her dog's performance after trials and matches.  Finding someone willing and capable to record her session in the ring on a cellphone is always difficult.  Most of the other dog handlers are preoccupied with their dogs, and it's not good ring etiquette to approach too close to the show ring to shoot video, since that will be a distraction.  She noticed another handler retrieving a tiny camera from just outside the corner of the ring after her session and asked about it.  Turned out to be this little EK 7000, and that handler was very enthusiastic about what it could do.  When my wife asked for it for Christmas I was skeptical, so I spent a lot of time researching this and several other cameras.  While there were other cameras that were able to do what the Akaso could do, and possibly even more, they were all at least two to three times as expensive.  So I went ahead and gave this to my wife for Christmas.

Very good action camera for what it is worth. My boyfriend has a GoPro that he paid hundreds for and he's constantly on his toes about breaking or losing it. This camera is almost just as good and I don't stress out as much about how much I paid for it. It has a lot of features as far as recording options but I only really use it for 1080p at 60fps. It does time lapses but you have to make sure its set to 'continuous lapse' under settings. I haven't taken the camera underwater just yet but I tested the case with a dry paper towel inside then plunged it in the pool and it worked just fine. The mounts and case are the same as that for GoPro, and this company definitely provides a good amount to start you off with. They even give you an extra battery and charging unit for the battery. Would have been nice to have a full extra housing case, but they do provide another backing. I would have given this review 5 stars but I notice a weird diagonal lag when I record (at 1080p and 60fps). It is most prominent in dark areas when I am moving the camera around and it gets annoying because the picture looks really choppy. All the other reviews and posted videos seem to working just fine though, so maybe it is only mine.

I had to admit that I am blow away by the quality of this camera, both for videos and photos. When I ordered it, I still had doubts, could such a good camera cost so little? Yes, it can! Not only is the camera great, it comes with a plethora of mounting options. It even has a wrist-strap with a remote control! Now the Android app which this comes with (Akaso DC) is rather slow and primitive. Barely gets a passing grade. I read that you can use other (better) apps. I don't know. What I do know is that this camera is a steal and I highly recommend it. Last but not least, if I ever break it, it's only 60 bucks or less to replace. Frankly, I see no point in getting a GoPro after trying this camera.Try it - you will love it!

Where to Start? Worked when we tested it and set it up at home before taking on a trip. Removing battery resets date and time and some settings.  Wow!!Took on a Maldives trip.  Went snorkeling the first time, and it recorded the entire snorkel. Next trip, worked but stopped recording.  Next trip it worked. Than didn’t record second time after stopping.

According to the many positive reviews, I thought that I was making a good purchase for my trip to Riviera Maya. The catch on the waterproof case broke after the first time I used it. Needless to say it was a great disappointment! I was unable to take pictures and videos while snorkeling.  I wished that I had invested more money and got a quality underwater camera!! I returned it and received a refund, but I bought memory cards, battery recharger, waterproof hand grip and head strap for which I paid money and have no use for.

My wife insisted that I get an action camera for a vacation trip. It was going to cost about $50 to rent a GoPro for a week and I could buy this for $60. We were very pleased with the results. We took pictures with it mounted on my helmet biking and white water rafting and even numerous pictures swimming underwater. It worked great. The only reason I didn't give it a 5 start rating is battery life. I got about 47 minutes of video on our whitewater rafting trip in two separate segments. I started a third segment, but the camera did not save the last segment before the battery died. So... A word to the wise. Stop and restart the camera frequently, especially when the battery is getting low, so it will save those video clips.

Returned it because it doesnt work as it says and some reason it is now a gift card balance. Super unsatisfied and no customer service numbers are operating at this time.. little frustrating when I paid with a debit card. No video stability really and the app is terrible that you have to use for the camera. Never let me go above 720 quality.UPDATE: A worker from akaso kindly sent me a replacement and I got to mess around with the controls more. Idk how but this one is a lot more stable and started in 1080hp quality still no 4k... and still not the best app in the universe. But way better quality than what I originally purchased. It's even brighter and has a higher contrast. So maybe the first one was just a return. This one even came in plastic wrap unlike my first camera. So far so good. Also have always loved the underwater capability. Never had any leaks in the case.

I purchased this camera to film my son's travel baseball games.  I chose this particular camera based on reviews (it came highly recommended from some fellow travel baseball moms), the extra battery included, and the low price tag.  I recommend downloading the user manual from the website to familiarize yourself with the different functions of the camera.  This will also assist in setting up the camera.  I chose to download the app to my husband's phone since I run Game Changer on my phone and did not want to interrupt scoring to get the camera set.  I am excited about this purchase and cannot wait to capture some memories.

I was heading out on a week's catamaran cruise with the family and this represented a reasonable alternative to the high-priced action cameras. I was disappointed when initially using the underwater case at home the clip holding the underwater case together broke. I received and completed a questionnaire from the manufacturer indicating that I had a problem and they promised send me a new case. However, my time frame was such that I needed to get a replacement camera from Amazon. That was done quickly and without a problem. The case did come eventually.As advertised, the audio does not record well when the underwater case is in place, and, being on board a boat for the week, it rarely came off so most of my videos are without sound.

I've had this camera a little over a month and it's worked well.  I've used it only for videos so far, both 1080 and 4k.  The batteries last right around an hour, decent, but not great.It's easy to use, the menu is easy to navigate to set the time and date, or video resolution.  I haven't tried the water resistance or image stabilization.

Okay, so this is my first action camera. It came very well packaged and very fast. So cudos on that. I was going to buy a GoPro but I decided since this is strictly for insurance purposes,  I don’t make professional videos or do moto vlogging, I didn’t see the point in spending 200$ plus on a cam.The video quality is pretty good and has multiple options, the better the video the shorter the time you can record and vise versa. I’m still playing around to find that “just right” but after a test today I was impressed.

After losing my Gopro when surfing, I decided to buy a rather cheap one in case I lose another one.This camera is pretty good for its cost. The video quality is okay, but the protecting case isn't 100% waterproof.
For the price it’s great.  I got the $60 dollar one for my 8 year old.Picture quality is not good indoors without bright lights or night time, I assume.

We got this for our 9 year old son because he wanted to start a YouTube channel. Well, he did and he loves it. It’s got all sorts of attachments that come with it which took us some time to figure out, but once we did, we realized you can attach this thing nearly anywhere. And he does. From the bike to film stunts, to the computer to film him playing video games (why this is a thing I still don’t understand:) he uses often. And yes, he’s 9 so you know it’s easy to operate. We also took it in the pool as it comes with a waterproof case. The underwater shots are far superior to what I would’ve suspected. A great little unit at a great price.

Excellent, it's a small camera, the resolution of the videos is great outside, but inside houses, or places with low lighting the video and the photos are of low quality. I'm very proud of de camera.It works with a SanDisk 64GB Ultra.

So, my husband and I do a ton of dirt bike riding and we love having videos of all the riding we do. He has a Go Pro and I decided I needed a camera, too. Not wanting to pay $400 for a new action camera, I found this Akaso after a few minutes of searching. I was a little skeptical because it's so reasonably priced. I just got it today and man am I so pleased!!! As soon as I got home, I got the camera out and started playing with it. To my pleasure, this thing takes really good videos and pictures. Not to mention, my husband is a little jealous that I have a remote for mine! :) We are going camping/riding this weekend and I can't wait to use it! I'm seriously so excited that I found such a great deal!

I was willing to give this camera a chance for the price. Boy was I right for doing that. This little camera already has made recording videos a breeze. I like that it came with a wrist remote to record and a waterproof case.plus other accessories. The user interface once you get use to it was no problem to navigate. My only complaints are that when the camera is in the waterproof case, the camera cant pick all conservation. But that might be for the best at times. LOL And that you cant zoom in and zoom out. If you can I haven't found out. Ill blame that on user error if I can. Other than that I like it. Update 9/22/20. I have been using it for zoom now that im going back to college after 21 years and its look great. or should I say I look great

Great camera, easy to use.  Bought this because I misplaced my GoPro and cannot bring myself to spend that much again.  Glad I did - this camera feels similar to my GoPro, connects easily to my phone and came with a lot of great accessories.  I also found that I can use many of the accessories I previously purchased and didn't lose, which is even better.  I knocked off 1 star because the casing came a bit scratched up, but not a major issue and I probably won't feel as bad when I start scratching it some more.  I definitely miss not needing a case, but again, not a big deal.  I would recommend!

I was going back and forth between a 3 and 5,  the pictures are fantastic,  look really great.  I setup the camera to take pictures of a garage being built on my property every 1 min.  It works with no issues.  It's siting on a container in my house, and i just open the window.  The only issue i have seen, is the LCD looks likes there's a water spot in the center of it.  The longer the camera is on, the larger the spot gets, and it's annoying.  If i get it fixed, i will raising this to a 5 start rating, if not, I will knock it down to 3 star.  It doesn't affect the usability of it.You can adjust the size of the picture from 720-4K,  I have a 64G card in it, and take hundreds of pictures at a time, while plugged in.  Havn't used the battery yet, so can't comment on how well that work.  But it does come with 2 batteries.

Update 02/09/2019: Now that this camera has been in use for a couple months, there are a couple additions to make to the review. First of all, the video quality is excellent. However, a couple of issues have become apparent. The most significant is an occasional failure to save a video clip on the camera card. I don't discover that a file has been corrupted until I load the video files onto the computer. My card has the correct specifications, and the vast majority of the files are saved without issue. Just know that occasionally video clips will be corrupted, so reliability is definitely an issue. Second, the battery door is not affixed to the camera, and the little latch for it is cheaply made. The latch for my battery door is already broken. It is still functional, but definitely frustrating to use. It makes switching batteries in active situations (fishing, hiking, etc) quite challenging. Finally, I've got to repeat that the video quality and image is outstanding, but the audio leaves a lot to be desired.I was looking for a camera that would capture my outdoor adventures. Over the years I have lost and/or broken multiple expensive cameras while hunting, fishing, and snorkeling. This camera has done a wonderful job for me so far - the mounting options are terrific, very easy to use, and the wide angle coverage is impressive. Images are smooth and crystal clear.

Purchased this camera for snorkeling in Costa Rica. I was really wanting a go pro for the top of my full face snorkel mask but then read reviews on this product and am so happy I did. This camera is much cheaper but of very good quality. Some reviews I read stated that the camera was difficult to navigate through all the settings or to set up due to a lack of instructions. It’s true that the quick start guide that comes with the camera doesn’t give you much info, however it includes a QR code which takes you to the full user’s manual. I had no difficulty setting up the camera following the manual and was even able to save the manual to my ebooks app on my phone. The only complaint I have is that I wish the extra case back was waterproof. The fact that it is not is written in the manual but I feel like it should be emphasized because it does look like it would be waterproof since it is made to attach to the back of the clear waterproof case. Overall I’m very happy with this purchase and glad I got it instead of spending much more for a GoPro
Amazing little camera:Akaso Camera Review

What can I say I am impressed, video, picture and sound quality is great even with waterproof case on. Some people say there is no sound with case on, let me tell you it works just fine. Spent the day out kayaking filming and taking pics they came out really good. The remote is awesome simple to use red for pics and grey for video. Camera menu is Lil tricky to get used to but I’ve only had this camera for a little while. I have not tested it under water but I will when I go on my cruise to the Bahamas and in the lake when fishing. You can charge the battery while in camera but you do have to take the case off. Mini SD card up to 64gb. Great amount of accessories, 2 batteries and external charger. Comes well packaged and if you contact the vendor they are quick to reply. Time will be the test for quality.

I bought this product thinking that I'm getting a really good deal on a Go-pro generic, but this really isn't in the same ballpark. The manual is inaccurate so you have to figure some things out yourself. That's not the main problem though. For the price I paid, I'd keep it if that was the only issue. The issue is that the camera doesn't record sound with the waterproof case on! It barely records with the case off! I took the case off and spoke into the microphone from about 12 inches away. When I played it back, I could barely  hear my voice. If you want an action cam, pay for what you want. Video quality is good, but sound is terrible, and non existent with the case. I WAS going to use it going kayaking. Oh well.

I bought this to bring to a music festival. The first day the screen went crazy and the camera would not turn off. I removed the battery and replaced it but the camera never turned on again. Extremely disappointed with this product and I hope I can get a refund.Edit/Update: I purchased this in February and after seeing my review the company contacted me via email to offer a refund. As of December I have received a full refund of the product from the manufacturer even though it was past amazon’s return period.

Keep in mind that most of the positive reviews here are posted simply because the seller bribes positive reviewers with additional accessories. Of course they are already included in the price and to get what you have paid for you are forced to type a review. Basically this is the only reason why I gave the 5 stars originally and reduced it to three.  However the text below that I posted a couple of months ago is correct. The camera is really good for the price.Bought it as a gift to my 8-years old son. It turned out to be much more than a toy. The picture quality is perfect, he keeps dropping the camera, however it is still functional. The number of auxiliary items is really surprising, we never used even 10% of them.

so far the product arrived on time and in great shape. Box had padding to help prevent it from bouncing around while in transit. i love the fact that it has a separate charging station for the battery, the remote control is a really cool feature. Has plenty of attachments to mount pretty much anywhere . i bought this with the intention of using it for review my MTB trips to make better runs, but now ill be bringing it along on my honey moon to capture moments together. Cant wait to use it ill update once i take it down the trail see how she holds up to the abuse.

For the price - this camera is awesome.  This camera stacks up against gopro quite well.  Mine is used in conjunction with a gopro i already have for flights (i'm a pilot), and it does a fantastic job overall, sound and picture quality are comparable.  And for the price - there are no complaints from me.  Given that, i will note the areas where it is rough around the edges: 1) the battery is a not as robust as my gopro.  2) the camera will overheat in the sun in it's little waterproof enclosure - i get around this by leaving the case back popped open and use a rubber band to keep camera in place in the enclosure.Again - for the price... i'd buy 3 more before i bought a gopro.  I'd just make sure i could power them for the longer flights more consistently, and make sure they are keeping cool.

Living in Minnesota, we like to get away from the cold and snow to warm places to keep our sanity.  Avid hikers, beach bums, and snorkelers, we wanted a small camera that we could take snorkeling to capture some of the wildlife and underwater scenes.  Since it's something we only use once or twice a year and something that we use to add to the repository of photos and videos that we may not look at very often, it seemed silly to spend upwards of $300-$400.  As we perused options, this seemed like it was too good to be true.  It's totally functional, absolutely waterproof (in the appropriate included case), and it gets the job done.  The still camera photos are not as high resolution as I would have liked, but we mostly use the for video in the water.  For that, it's ideal.

I needed a webcam during the period of time when most webcams were sold out because of the pandemic. I decided to purchase this camera as an alternative and I 100% made the right choice. If you have your own separate microphone already and need a webcam, don't even hesitate before purchasing this camera.I thought I would have to go through a long process to get it working as a webcam, but I couldn't have been more wrong. All I had to do was connect the USB cord from the camera to my PC and it immediately went into PC Camera mode. My computer set it up as a webcam and I was up and running within 1-2 minutes. You don't even need to have batteries or a memory card in the camera to use it as a webcam.

This camera is awesome.  I did not appreciate it while on vacation.  I could not tell when it was on or off.  The screen is small and I am too old to see it well.  So, I wasn't expecting much.  I just uploaded my pictures and videos.  Wow!  I didn't even know it had sound.  It did not leak either.  I have had a lot of underwater cameras over the years.  They were 3 times as expensive and did not have all the features of this one.  Take some time and learn how to work it.  It is somewhat confusing.  I think the remote died shortly after taking it in the water. OOPS.  Lots of different kinds of attachments, but no way to connect to a wrist strap.  I used an old glasses saver and had no problems . But I am going to look for some other way to secure it since I don't have a go-pro mask.

I bought to go and make videos while playing airsoft but I a mount. I did however test it in my front yard with my dog to see how it captured color, movement, sound, and picture. All test that I did were inside the protective waterproof casing.Color - Color was not perfect but it's not so bad that you wouldn't like it for the price you get it.

I bought this for an upcoming dive trip and wanted to give it a test run before using this under water. I am very impressed with how simple it is to use and the quality of the pictures and video. I tested the video in and out of the waterproof case. Video was great and sound was OK with the case on, but perfect without the case. It comes with a good assortment of mounts and tools to get the best shot possible. I did purchase an accessory kit that had a bit more options, but it wasn't necessary. I added a 64GB card and can take almost 10,000 photos and over 2 hours of video in 4K; over 6 hours in 1080P. I should have set the date and time before using, but I was excited to get started with the photography. I cannot wait to get this in the ocean!

It looks great! It would be useful to know what size/specifications of memory card to purchase to go with it when ordering the camera, because now I have to wait to try it out until my memory card arrives.I also wish it had some information in the package about what each of the mounting pieces are for. I’m giving this 4 stars since I’m not able to test it right away. I will update this review after I’m able to try it out.

This camera was purchased with the hopes that it would fit into the Tarot T-2D Gimbal which is made specifically for GoPro 3/4.  When it arrived, the Akaso camera fit into the base of the gimbal and the holder that goes around the lens fit quite nicely, albeit a little pressure is needed to get the holder into place.  However, the screws that connect the lens holder to the base of the gimbal were too short.  With a little drilling of the holes on the gimbal so that the head of the screws slide in a little deeper, I was able to get them to reach to the base.  So now I am able to use this Akaso camera on a gimbal that was made for GoPro Hero 3/4.  I am very satisfied with the first video I took here at home using the gimbal and dji phantom 1 drone.Hope this helps someone out there!  God Bless America!

I bought this low cost camera for a 27 day motorcycle trip from Texas to Alaska and back via the Pacific coast. I knew I would be compromising on something, vs the GoPro, but the compromise was only in the inability of the camera to keep the data and time.  What happened is that every time I turned the camera on, it would start at the Data and Time I last set. The instructions say you need to reset it when you remove the battery, but I never removed the battery and never let the battery go dead.  Once I figured this out, I stopped using the data and time "stamp" on the pictures, and made sure to set the Date correctly at the start of each day, so at least I had the right day of the trip.  Unfortunately, since it started at the Time I set, all of my pictures had a time of between 08:00 and 08:10 or 08:15 as I set the time at 08:00 when setting the correct Date.  The effect of this is that the pictures are not in order taken, they are intermixed as the time was always within the same short window starting at 8:00.  Makes it impossible to align the pictures with the location based on trip plan for the day.  I will say that the camera held up well in the waterproof case, even when it fell off the bike at about 30 mph and bounced down an exit ramp. No damage done.  I would not buy this one again due to the time issue, maybe the next model up by Akaso does a better job with that basic function
Ok. So I have a mixed review on the akaso camera I purchased.I'll start with the bad. However make sure you read the pros.

It’s a cheap camera so expectations have to be tailored to it. It’s not a GoPro. I use it as a “dash cam” for my motorcycle. I wanted to buy a cheap one just in case I forget about it on the motorcycle and it gets stolen while I’m gone.The camera is ok but comes with a good amount of accessories. Each battery lasts about 2 hours or so. Make sure you have the latest version of the app or it might not work that well. When it is somewhat cold, the video footage sometimes skips. The app is pretty user friendly as is the camera once you get the hang of it.

I bought this camera to take time lapse of a house build. Unfortunately, the advertising on this page misrepresented the camera's capabilities. However, this little thing took some very good photos, and videos throughout the trip. I did not expect it to do so well for the price that I paid. It does not compare to a Go-pro in performance, but then again it is a heck of a lot less expensive. Overall, I rate this thing well, but am disappointed in the advertising on this page misrepresenting its features.

Updated review:The company reached out several times to make this right. As you can see from my original review, I was pretty unsatisfied. But customer service offered me a replacement and that goes way above my expectations. Nice work!

Got to admit, I kind of love this thing. Been reading a lot of reviews online lately about the next to GoPro killer. And while I will never consider this a GoPro killer, for the price, it is an outstanding purchase.Took it to the lake kayaking the other day, experimented with the different video modes and stills, Etc. Image quality is on par with the competition. Video quality is also pretty darn good. And the fact that it supports GoPros accessories, well that's just icing on the cake.

The sound quality is HORRIBLE with the waterproof case! I plan to return this ASAP!!!! None of my videos are even worth watching because you can't hear ANYTHING!!! Highly, highly, highly disappointed and will be reaching out to the product owners of this device. I bought everything that I needed and I was incredibly excited to make videos, which I made ALLLLLL DAYYYY yesterday and are now essentially worthless. All of my content is ruined because none of it can be heard besides loud choppy noises from the camera moving. I do not recommend this camera at all and I plan to shop around very smartly for a new one, as this one with its incredible reviews was able to trick me very easily since everyone had said such great things. Sorry to spread bad news but this is the absolute truth. I am definitely 10000000% returning this camera. Thanks for reading.

This has been my worst Amazon purchase yet. The problem isn't really the camera but the software. The EZ iCam app that is supposed to control the camera won't. My cell phone is a Samsung Galaxy S8+. I have watched YouTube videos showing the app controlling the camera and the video from the camera displaying on the cell phone. This appears dependent on whether your cell phone is supported or not. In my case it is not. I can record with the camera and then remove the memory card and watch the videos on my laptop. But no live streaming.

Not touch screen so a little tricky to figure out which button does what and I got the hang of it :) dosent have the best quality image not gona lie.. but for the price it’s fine for what I’m using it for. Haven’t put it in water yet.. and there’s an app you can download to connect the screen to your phone that’s pretty cool that Download straight to my camera roll… Sometimes and just realized the battery life is horrible:( I just bought a memory card for it for over 600 hours but the battery maybe lasted three after a full charge.. comes with two batteries btw

I am using this to film drone footage. This product comes with every kind of attachment you can imagine.  My best video footage is in 1080p at 30fps. This camera works best in the day time when it’s not so cloudy. It doesn’t adjust for low lighting, but it can be adjusted in post editing. I am still trying to figure out the still images, but I didn’t really buy it for photos. The mic picks up sound, but it will not be loud. I have not tried it in the water and that’s not my reason for purchasing it, but YouTube reviews say the water proof case is in fact water proof.

This camera is unreliable! I could have a fully charged battery and it somehow surges then dies! after 30 mins. It also does seem to get hot and hotter then expected when moving files over file USB. Not sure why, but it does... What i am displeased with mostly is not knowing if I am still recording. So if this mounted to a helmet, you are diving, and had a good dive, and wanna see what you recorded and well its not there cause it locked up on you and/or battery is drained... yea the level of disappointment is of the scale. I've been playing around with this camera for a couple months and knowing I cannot return is a slight bummer thus after this review, i'm also contacting the company to see if they can do anything about it or upgrade me/it to a "better" model...  Moving on to other features, image stabilization is good, probably the best feature on this camera. Recorded quality isn't to bad pending lighting. Picture quality, is 50/50 water shots good, outdoor, when bright, good. Audio is very muffled, so keep that in mind if doing YouTube stuff. Haven't tried the remote feature due to its lack of reliability. The wifi features is the 2nd "nice" feature, when it connects properly, but you can delete via wi-fi so you can clear without plugging in.. but having a device to see what you may have recording or not kind of defeats the purpose. Example, if i am using a smartphone to view, might as well but a smart phone enclosures knowing its records/syncs...so to recap,1 locks up very frequently, having to eject battery

I bought this camera (along with an entire accessory kit) for my aspiring you-tuber 8 year old son. It syncs with your phone for digital upload by way of app, which is very simple an easy to do. It is very lightweight and sturdy (as it comes with a protective case.) They only problem that we have run into is picking up static white noise when in action. We bought a noise reduction lapel mic, but in order to connect it to the camera, you can't have the camera enclosed in the case (which means you can't attach any of the accessories; i.e. tripod, head band, chest strap.)

*UPDATE*I am updating my review.  They reached out to me and replaced the camera without any issue.  Iniust got it yesterday and will test it out today but their customer service is excellent and they stand behind their product.  Even though the price is low you are taking even less risk buying this camera because they will support you and help with issues!

This is literally one hell of an action camera. And for the price, it's an absolute no brainer. Truly impressed and a great buy. Very professionally and safely packaged. I've had problems recording smooth videos with previous purchases and this product has fixed my issue. The picture quality is of the highest level, colorful, sharp and realistic. Very easy to transition between the different modes and wowww what a great idea about the remote control. Super handy and much needed. The built-in WiFi is fairly quick and can seamlessly be connected with your smartphone. There are a lot of things included in the box which you wish you would've had sometime down the road, so this product has all of your bases covered. Highly recommend.

We bought these to use on a snorkeling excursion on our recent cruise, and the excursion was canceled so we didn't get to use them as intended (yet, I hope).  We did use them when swimming at the beach and they're easy to use and fun.However, there are WAY too many accessories with no documentation indicating how any of them are to be used.  And nothing that seemed to be useful for snorkeling, which seems like an obvious use of this product.  We bought the Sametop waterproof floating hand grip to use with this, which works great.  Left all of the other accessories at home, never missed them.  Would be great if there were purchase options about which accessories you want or don't want.

I've had three or four of these little action cam packages so far, for myself and also to give as gifts. This package by Akaso is by far the best of the lot so far - all the mounting pieces fit well, they're all packaged well, and you even get a battery charger and TWO batteries!  Well done, Akaso.  Camera fired up right out of the box, batteries charged in under an hour, and all modes test out just fine. Also, I like the opening mechanism of the plastic case, it snaps open easily and doesn't require a jeweler's screwdriver and three hands to open up.  Highly recommended!

This thing is shockingly good for the price! I am very impressed by its build quality, and once I got a decent class 10 memory card it even records quite well. I have it 5 stars on waterproofing for the case but to be fair I've only used it in my hot tub just to test out its capability. And all the accessories are just awesome additions.I was surprised by the remote control, I didn't even notice it was part of the package, a nice little surprise. But the one dig I have (minus one star) is that the app supposedly built for it doesn't work. Won't even connect to it. And I'm quite sure I'm doing it right since another after market app works just fine. This isn't really a big problem for me since I never intended to really use it that way. But buyer beware if that's a huge selling point for you.

After a lot of searching through action cameras, even gopros, I am very happy with this camera and all of its features and accessories. I bought this action cam to take videos of working k9s that I train, and it works great for that. The night I recieved it, I was playing around with it infront of some friends, and one was just so impressed that he ordered one for himself, just because! The camera and settings menus are easy to navigate and have a lot of options for resolution size, video vs time lapse, burst photo and more. Most all of the accessories are self explanatory and can be used in multiple ways, and I like the option between the waterproof case or the hard plastic skin. The iSmart DV app was very quick and easy to set up and has worked great for me so far. I love the option to be able to set the camera up somewhere, and be able to start recording from my app or bluetooth remote instead of walking over to camera, turning on, walking back into the scene and having to cut all that out in the editing process. One thing I have had to play around with (and it's not necessarily a dislike - I'll admit, Im new at this) is my background or room lighting so the video comes out very clear, but also may have to do with me playing around with my resolution size as well. An excellent alternative to a gopro, will fit gopro mounts, and at a very reasonable price.

I'm a student pilot and I got one of these to record my flying sessions. My flight instructor has a GoPro and it probably cost about three times as much as this one when he got it, but this is even better than his. I love how clear the images are and the sound quality is also really good. These images I'm posting are really just screen shots of one of my video sessions (the dates off by the way, it was much more recent than this but I forgot to reset the clock!) but it will give you a good idea on the clarity. The image stabilization is pretty good too. I need to invest in a better mount for it, but even still, it's so much better than you would expect for the price. The 4k is amazing! I really recommend it highly.

I don’t review a lot on Amazon, but this little camera is just too cool not to hype up. It was purchased on July 12, 2020 to take on our family beach trip. We wanted to attach to our snorkel masks to video/photograph underwater creatures. I almost purchased a Go Pro, but then saw this. Glad I bought this instead. Picture quality is equal to my sister’s Go Pro, but a fraction of the price. It was easy to transfer video to the app as well. Comes with numerous accessories so will he also using this to mount to my 4 year old’s bike when we ride on the golf cart path. So many possibilities for capturing action sports. Love this little camera and important to note that it works awesome under water with the waterproof case that comes with it. Buy this with complete confidence you are making a good decision!

To start off this is not a paid review and I got nothing for this review. Just my honest opinion after having used this while snorkeling in Turks and Caicos last month. I've not used a gopro so I can't really compare it to one but overall I thought the pictures and videos turned out really well. I mostly just used it for underwater pics and videos as I would just use my phone for anything else on the trip. I purchased a 64GB micro The case is definitely waterproof and never had any leaks during the almost 2 hours I had it in the water. Once you figure out what the different functions of the buttons are, it is fairly easy to switch between the different settings even while under the water. The battery life isn't great. I got about an hour or 1.5 hours out of the fully charged battery before I had to switch out the batteries. I purchased additional batteries and had them charged and with me after reading other reviews about the battery life. I was not using the 4K video setting but stayed at the 1080p setting. The size of the view screen does make it difficult to see what you are recording or capturing but that wasn't a big concern for me. I would have left 5 stars if they actually made a filters, especially a red filter, for underwater use. I had to purchase the Sandmarc filter and file down the inside of the filter housing to make it fit onto the AKASO. In the end, this was well worth the $80 I spent on it. The quality of the videos and pictures was really good and not worth paying the price difference for a Gopro. I've attached a few unedited pictures and a short video I took with the AKASO while snorkeling.

I have been playing with the camera for about a month and I really love it.  I have been using it as a dash cam in my car to just record trips around town and the videos are VERY CLEAR and Crisp.  I am still getting the hang of doing video editing, I just need more time to work on my skills.  I think is a GREAT entry level camera and I do recommend this product.**Additional Comment**

Got this yesterday. Opened up battery cover and popped battery in and took some videos today. When the battery died I opened the battery compartment and the clip for the door broke. Two uses is all it lasted, checking on Google it seems to be a known issue.....junk it seems

Recently got into more video editing and wanted to pick up a "cheap" 3rd cam for multicam shoots. Since it wouldn't be my primary shooter, I didn't want to drop $300+ on a GoPro just to potentially use a few times here and there. The EK7000 had some good reviews ordered, got it in 2 days, charged up the batteries and put it right to work (make sure you order a micro SD card, it's not included. I've read other reviews saying don't use one higher than 64GB). Super easy to figure out the shooting modes and quality settings, and it comes with a ridiculous amount of helpful mounts and accessories. I slapped the waterproof case on and immediately had it in the pool. Hard to believe the quality for ~$60 USD. Very happy so far and will prob pick up a second one because it's so small and easy to use. See attached video for actual "dry" and underwater footage.*Edit: the quality is MUCH better than whatever Amazon's servers did to this video once I uploaded.
This is my first sport camera and I purchased this over more expensive options just to see if I liked it.Pros:

Everything works great picture quality is great stabilization is great. However they don't have a handlebar mount for motorcycles. They have one for bicycles but that one will not fit around motorcycle handlebars. I really did not want to mount it on my helmet because of wind lift, after a while wind lift will really start to hurt your neck. The adhesives do not last long especially when it gets hot out  so be careful  because they do not hold . That is my only complaint about this camera otherwise it's fantastic for the money.

It is amazing to me that this product can be produced for such a low price and include so many accessories. Even if the most commonly desired accessory type for headwear is not included...It is also amazing to me that the device is incredibly and unnecessarily complicated because of the lack of a basic traditional menu layout. The user has to literally learn a new method of communication that requires pressing a series of buttons in a certain order to access basic menu functions such as ‘delete’ for a video clip. ‘Click this button once and then jump up and down on one foot and then press this button twice...’ Why? Not even close to being intuitive. Ridiculous.

I've given this thing a chance, and it's just a huge disappointment. The only reason this has positive reviews is because with some of the cameras, they offered free accessories to those who wrote positive reviews. But real talk? It's a lie. This camera takes TERRIBLE pictures and video even at the highest settings on a sunny day. I had cell phones 10 years ago that took better pictures. I am attaching a picture from yesterday. This was on a day with no clouds, and 90 degrees. THIS is the camera at it's best. The battery sucks, and barely lasts an hour. Even with both batteries, I couldn't record a 4-5 hour kayak trip. Just get a GoPro. Sure they cost more, but you do NOT want this camera.

I was pretty sceptical about this just because of the price, especially when others are $300+. I will say I bought a Hero 7 black right after this. Is there a difference in image quality between the two? Yes. If I need to buy a 3rd camera, what would it be? The Akaso. I was blown away by the image quality and the features of this one. Is it as good as the Hero? Close but no. I personally don't feel there is a 250 dollar difference though and this one is more than I will need. As far as durability, I haven't had either long enough to tell. I'm hoping for the best with both of them. I'm super happy with it and I see myself buy another one or two.

I had a comparable GoPro Hero before this camera, and they are very similar. If you want the GoPro but can’t afford it, this is definitely the way to go.There are some small things that were annoying about this camera, like the way to download the contents via WiFi, since I don’t trust this camera at all with my phone info using their app that requires a concerning amount of permissions, but you pay less money in exchange for less privacy. This can be overrun if you have a memory card conversion to pull the data straight from the memory card out of the camera.

I bought this to make flying videos and I'm pretty happy with it, to the point that I ordered another one, though I decided to go one step up to the "pro" version.  The video quality at 1080p is as good as my older generation GoPro Session camera, though the colors may be a bit too vibrant.  I mounted it in its waterproof case because I didn't trust the other mount, which just clips to the camera, in a 100mph wind, and it muffled just enough of the wind noise to let the engine sound come through, I kind of like the effect.Only a few negatives:  When using the remote and you're in front of the camera, there's no way to tell if it's actually recording.  The blinking LED should be visible from the front.  There's no lanyard attachment on the camera, though there is one on the waterproof case.  It loses  the time and settings if you  take the battery out to change it, though you might be able to do it while plugged into the usb, I haven't tried that.
After 2 months with my AKASO action camera and I must say its pretty 50/50 and you get what you pay for its a $50 camera!!!!!..Came with alot of accessories 😑🤷🏿‍♂️

Bought this camera to find out what's going on in the water when fishing. The image quality is surprisingly good below the murky water of the Puget sound. The camera spent ~1h at various depth, some times as deep as 70ft. Not a single drop of water got inside the enclosure. The footage proved very valuable; I get to see a fish following the bait for a long distance before finally taking it in. Can't wait to go on more fishing trips with this thing!

My child wanted this camera to make youtube videos.  I thought it would be a great way to get him started without a large investment.  Camera was packaged well, and includes everything you need to get started, except a microSD card.  I read this in another review, so I made sure to order one along with the camera.  So far, this seems like a solid little camera, and it came with some nice mounts and a waterproof/protective case.  I charged the battery, and was taking video in about 30 min.  Settings are simple enough, and I got a nice manual in pdf form from a download link in the package.My only minor complaint, and for my own future knowledge, is that sound is not really recordable while in the full waterproof case.  But, that is easily resolved by using only the smaller mounting shell, if my kids want to record full audio.

Even after reading all the positive reviews I was skeptical, but for the price I figured it was worth a gamble. I wasn't disappointed. This camera is very lightweight but seems very solidly built. All the accessories are solidly made and sturdy (but I haven't tested the water resistance yet). It comes with two batteries and a charger, which is a big win. I strapped the camera to my head to capture my run down the mountain coaster at Holiday Valley in New York. The camera had no problems operating in the cold (unlike some other inexpensive cameras I've used) and the video quality was very good.

UPDATED review:(SUPPORT to the Win) After seeing this review, the manufacturer emailed me back, and sent me 2 new batteries no charge, and both were timed by filming a clock, (lol) and both did about 2hrs of run time, of course i ran this once on each. Once summer comes i will pull out the helmet cam and go riding and push the camera to the limit. Advice, be sure to keep the camera outside of the waterpoof case if your riding in the heat, it gets hot with those batteries. Thanks Akaso for the follow up

The only thing I don't like about this is how it drains the battery. The battery only lasts about 1/2 an hour. I get a little more by attaching an external battery pack. The device indicates that it is charging but still quits after a while. Not good when taking a trip.The picture and sound are quite good. It has many features, such as single photos, stop action, etc. I can't think of any case where I'd be using the extra features.

DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY! I purchased this camera to save some money and gave it a chance because of some of the reviews. I went on a trip and this camera kept freezing up and would not record anything. Sometimes the pictures would save but it was a real struggle. The picture quality was fair. I had a very frustrating time when the camera kept freezing up and failed to record any memories. After turning the camera off and on again it would family show that it was recording but to my surprise, it was not recording anything. Do not recommend this camera. Picture quality would be ok if it captured the memories I am trying to record . It will end up failing you and you will miss important memories. Do not buy.

I wasn't successful in getting it to record. It would constantly freeze any time I would press the record button and the only way to get it going again was to pull the battery. I tried two different SD cards that were different brand( Samsung and Sandisk) and storage size. It still failed to work. I tried resetting it to factory settings and it would continue to freeze as soon as I'd push record. I had high expectations for this camera considering all of the good reviews. The manufacturer website doesn't offer much support.Update May 2019:

I bought the Akaso EK7000 about a week ago.  Received it along with a micro-SD card and a bag of mounting accessories a couple days later.  Very happy with my purchase.  My only complaint would be that the directions leave too much to the imagination.  However, after watching some 10-yr-old explain everything on a YouTube video, I think I've got a handle on things.  I bought this camera primarily for motorcycle and dashboard use, but I haven't tried that, yet.  I've taken photos and videos inside the house.  The remote control works fine.  The battery charger and batteries work.  I noticed that after leaving the camera on for an hour it got pretty hot.  Not sure if that will be a problem.  The case certainly seems waterproof, though I'm not likely to test it.  All the gadgets for mounting fit together nicely.  I was concerned that there's no sound when you playback a video.  However, when I moved the file to my tablet, the sound works and everything is OK.  Picture quality is fine.  I have yet to figure out the WiFi feature.  All things considered, I'm glad I bought the camera.

this product is great got me out of a few traffic jams that I battled in court came with a lot of different parts and the pictures is great.  The quality of the hard waterproof casing seems to be in excellent shape but haven't tried it yet and I hope that I don't have to either since stuff like this gets destroyed when wet.  It also came with a few accessories that I also needed.  The set up is a breeze and easy to understand.  I can't wait to try this on my vacation that I had to now reschedule cause of the virus outbreak.

I purchased this camera for my 11 year old son for Christmas. I thought he might like to attach it to his bike helmet when he rides around the neighborhood. He loves it!! He has so much fun recording his trips with his friends!! It's user friendly and he can do everything himself, from setting it up, hooking it to his bike or helmet, even downloading the video and pictures from his rides. He and his friends have also used it to make Youtube videos and projects for school This camera was the best (most useful) Christmas present he's ever gotten. The picture and video quality are great! We have a GoPro and this is very comparable, for less money! Highly recommend!

Amazing picture! See my hiking videos (2 min edited videos of various epic hikes) on earthy4life.com. Everything shot after 9/15th was shot with this camera. I could not be happier. I had a GoPro Hero 5+ Black or whichever edition was the more expensive version and I had endless problems for it. I paid like $500+ for that camera without any of the goodies. This one is so cheap and I'm getting better clarity and reliability. Plus, the battery life is better and the display on the back is key for getting the composition just right. Love this camera!!!

Absolutely terrific camera.  Image quality is great.  However, the best thing about this phone is the quality of the build.  I had the water proof case on it, but I drilled a hole on it to attach an external battery to it.  So, no longer water proof.  I strapped it to a near space balloon, it traveled to an altitude of 70,000 feet, landed in a lake, sat under water at a depth of 20 feet for over 30 minutes, and still worked after I recovered it and dryed it out.  I don't suggest submerging it under water, but the thing is a beast.  For the price, it's unbeatable.

I had my reservations buying this camera, given the price, but the quality, hardiness and overall tech of the camera sold me!  It comes with several mounts and other handy gadgets, including a remote on a wristband to snap pics or video of things you may not want to get too close to.  Thankfully, an online manual is available because the info included is minimal and not easy to understand.  There are handy videos posted on YouTube by other consumers to further educate.  The waterproof housing is tough and nicely insulated.  The quality for the price is a great alternative to the much pricier camera that rhymes with "Pro-Go".

I am new to the action cam thing, so wanted one that was easy on price but produced relatively good video quality. I purchased it to film my kid's soccer games mounting it on a tripod with and extender. The videos came out relatively well and was able to make out the players while filming from midfield.Also, this camera came with a bunch of accessories and replacement parts.

Forgot my GoPro when visiting a tropical area- so ordered AKASO EK7000 so I wouldn't spend $400 on a new GoPro.It has easy to use menus, good battery life, and absolutely is 100% functional and does what it says it does.

For beginners this might be a great camera, but for professional photographers on a budget.... not so much. The time and date, as well as the the file naming, resets every time i take the batter out. Makes it virtually impossible to put together timelapse footage because the files get completely out of order and you cant just have your computer do it because they have same names, times, and dates. INSANE!! Batteries don't last very long at all. You can only change exposure, and even then there is still some auto settings that i dont believe you can change, that again make it hard to get timelapse footage because each photo taken, the exposure seems to be changing. Even when i set it. Its been great in other ways, definitely water proof. All the accessories i purchased separately work well with the camera. A little disappointed in video quality. Overall though, not very impressed with this camera.

I purchased this camera for my recent trip to Thailand. I was simply looking for a good underwater digital camera to document the snorkeling portion of the trip to share with my kids when I got back. That is exactly what I got. I wasn't looking for a GoPro. I didn't care about the 4K. I'm not a professional photographer, and never hoped my photos would be anything more than memories. I am currently organizing the photos of my trip (also used iPhone and Canon SLR), and I am quite pleased with what I came home with. Both underwater and above water photos and videos are great! The attached photo was from snorkeling. The water wasn't super clear, but from what other, more experienced, snorkelers said, it wasn't too bad either.  Note: don't go snorkeling around a Supermoon. The unusual tide patterns tend to mess with the clarity of water and underwater wildlife. Therefore, the photos weren't amazing--but that's not the cameras fault. The photos look much like it did with my own eyes. Second note: when transitioning between underwater and above, be sure to wipe the lens. Otherwise the water droplets left on the lens will distort the photos.Before purchasing, I was worried about some of the other reviews saying the batteries didn't last and videos were cut short, etc. I only took 1-2 minute videos at a time. Again, I was only recording fish swimming, etc. True, the batteries did not last all day, but I was okay with how long they lasted--especially since the camera came with two. There was only one part of the trip where I used both batteries while I was out and about. I'm okay with battery length. I never had any issues with recording video, but then I was conscientious about my battery life too--I never let my battery die while recording.

I received the camera today just in time to test it out before sunset. I had purchased a similarly priced action cam a few months back and well, there's a reason I bought a new one. All that to say, I have some experience with budget action cams. This thing is killer. The packaging much more closely resembles that of the big name in the category, and is very attractive. The components inside appear well made, fit snugly together,  and withstand some pretty good clamping in the form of included thumbscrews (a huge upgrade in itself from my previous action cam set). The removable battery and double supply in the box solve the other issue I had of running short on juice long before the day is over. Picture and video quality are great, not just for the price, but even against other "pricy" cams I've compared to. The direct link to my phone is also wonderful for sharing fun stuff with my friends and family, without having to wait for the long drive home and my slow computer. Now, I'm no techie or in any way qualified to evaluate some other features like camera stabilization, or aspect ratio, or any of the "high tech" stuff. But I am qualified to say it met and exceeded every expectation I had, made an ecxellent additon to my skiing kit, and allowed me to share my action vids faster and more hassle free than ever before. 10/10 would recommend.
***Update 07/30/2018: I wouldn't recommend this camera anymore.I have used this camera enough to give a much better review on its operation.

This is a really good action cam. It comes with all the accessories you would need for an action camera. I bought this product to use as a camera to record my motorcycle trips, record driving backroads, and to wear on my person while working on the river. It’s small, compact and lightweight so if you wanted to a person could use this as a helmet cam and supplies come with the camera to mount it anywhere along with helmet mounts. I’ve haven’t honestly used it outdoors or underwater yet but the case the camera comes in is surely waterproof and wouldn’t have an issue in the elements nor underwater. The picture quality is awesome. It takes a wide range 4K ultra HD picture and video. It also comes with an extra battery and handy battery charger you could carry with you without the weight. I’m impressed with the battery life in the little package cause the small battery will last well over 40 mins of straight recording time and would last longer without recording a long video. Haven’t tired to take pictures but will be taking nice outdoor photos soon for Ultra HD pictures of nature. I’m impressed of this product so far and definitely will be testing it and so far I haven’t any issues. Pros is it comes with any mount you could imagine, the underwater case would withstand underwater and rainy weather action and the custom service (even thought I’ve never had to contact them) seem to be top notch and would be willing to help you out with any issues you would have but so far never had an issue yet. It’s an awesome little tough camera!

I am taking this camera on my first trip out of the U.S. to Cancun, Mexico and want to use it to go snorkeling and do other fun things without worrying about pulling out and damaging my phone. The size of the camera is not what I expected and I'm not sure of that's good or bad. For people looking for action photos, I'm sure the small size would be great for mounting on helmets or bikes or other fun and daring activities...me on the other hand, I'm worried about dropping this at the bottom of the Caribbean Sea. 😨Since I have yet to use it, all I can give are my first impressions.

I was expecting this to do okay and maybe even fall off (so I bought the warranty), but it does good (better than okay) video quality and is sticking on like a champ! I have it on the way back of my helmet with straps that came with it. I can't get the straps much tighter, but they really are just a backup incase the adhesive gives. While taking these photos, I looked at the adhesive and there are 0 gaps on it! This will survive the highway! But for the inexpensive cost of 2/3yr insurance that covers accidental damage, it is a no brainer. In 3 yrs i'm sure I'll break it or have it knocked of my head.Would/Have recommended to a friend.

The Akaso EK7000 action camera is probably one of the best "bang for your buck" camera on the market. It has the capacity to shoot at 4K at around 22 maybe 25 FPS. Which is not THAT bad. Personally 1080p at 60 FPS is just fine for me. Right now I have fiddled with the camera enough to say its pretty decent. It does have a wide camera lens which views at about 170 degrees which covers a good percentage of the area. At a cost of having a fish eyed style perspective. Perfect for action events. It does come with your standard accessories and even an extra battery. I would recommend getting yourself extra camera accessories because it comes with your standard stuff. No head strap, no car stand, or chest harness. So far I am pleased with this camera and so far I give it a 4 out of 5 stars. This is definitely not a Go Pro. Under 100 dollars I am not complaining.

Got this specifically for our river trip. I've had one other very nice water camera in the past and they seem to be equally amazing. However,  not much instruction was included.  Unboxing and unlocking the screwing mechanism to secure to standardization accessories was a total mystery... words of wisdom, find the little screwdriver key 🤷🏻‍♀️😂👌🏼 also, the remote included is a really cool plus!!

My first camera i received worked well for about 5 months than stopped working. But that being said. The company reached out to me. And handled the issue very well. Rebecca was very professional and helpful. Replaced the camera right away. She checked in afterwards to make sure the new camera worked. And so far so good. For the price you can't beat it. My husband does a lot of fishing with friends and is great with outdoors and underwater.  4 stars for just the inconvenience issues  but 5 stars for customer service.

So I got one of these as a practically disposable cam for some skiing as a backup for some hero3+ blacks that I had around, given how cheap they were I figure worst case I'd be out a few bucks and have a pile of attachment gear lying around.One I bought my first one it was off of yet another struggle to get the hero 3+'s wrist control working, I could have wifi app control, wrist or neither, depending on the phase of the moon, but with the akaso, the wrist control worked out of the box no problem, and that was also true with this second one that I just got.

We purchased this action camera to film videos for my YouTube Channel Bro Ru. Our first video was a fishing trip in Central WI which will be featured on Bro Ru. This camera is easy to use, takes awesome video and with the hands free wrist watch control you can start the video recording without any issues. This is such an great action camera we bought one for my brother to film his outdoor adventures to post to Bro Ru and shortly will buy one for my dad. Thank you Akaso. I would never have been able to continue to try and build my subscriber base with great videos had I not come across your product while doing research. The other cameras were way out of my price range and you can only do so much with your Dad's cell phone. Check out Bro Ru for videos using the Akaso EK7000!

I own a GoPro but purchased this camera to test it out for a trip to Bora Bora where I planned to do a lot of underwater activities. After going through a lot of my vacation photos, I noticed that there’s a timestamp (an inaccurate one) on all of my photos and videos with no way to remove it once the photo’s been taken. It boggles my mind that the camera’s factory setting is to have a time stamp—who would want one right smack dab on their beautiful travel photos and videos? Even worse, photos are blurry and low-res, practically unusable. Videos are slightly better (especially underwater), but still low-res, MUCH more grainy compared to videos and photos on my GoPro during a similar trip. The positive reviews about this camera really confuse me, but if you haven’t owned a GoPro yet or a higher-quality camera, I can see how this one might appear to be a good choice. But if you have the money and can splurge on a camera that produces better pics and videos, it’s worth it. Those are once-in-a-lifetime memories and you don’t want to remember them via grainy photos where you can barely make out the subjects. Terribly unhappy with this product.

I have never owed a small camera like this one or even a GoPro. However, this camera is great and especially for the price ! My husband and I went away to a cabin for our anniversary and we took this camera with us. It takes amazing pictures and videos! ONE IMPORTANT PIECE OF INFO - When trying to connect the camera Wi-Fi. The camera itself is the WiFi. You have to connect to the camera. I tried for hours to connect the camera to the internet. Then I figured out the camera has its own internet. Very good camera and I highly recommend it.

I have recently gotten into air-soft, and wanted an action camera to record my game play. After doing a lot of searching, I decided on this camera, and i have been very satisfied with it. The camera has a very easy to learn controls and shoots at a high quality. I was surprised at the amount of mounting accessories that came with it, as well as the two batteries. It is definitely worth the price, and has held up to my expectations. Attached is a video i took with the camera as a test.

I like everything about this camera, but the audio recording volume is a little low.  I have to turn it all the way up on playback on my computer and it's still pretty quiet.  But if audio from far away isn't a priority or if you have an off-camera recording device for audio, this is a great little camera with a nice collection of accessories.  Nice wide-angle video and easy to use interface.  Also, it does not come with a chest strap.UPDATE- Working with the customer service department on this camera is really fantastic.  They are super responsive and helpful and will bend over backwards to help their customers.

I bought this for a trip to Hawaii, as we had planned some snorkeling and beach trips. Didn't really get the chance to use the camera as much as I wanted, but the few images and videos I did get were pretty neat. Quality of photos and videos are nice. Camera was easy enough to figure out how to work. I haven't encountered any issues so far. Definitely like that there are 2 batteries for this camera, so I can swap out when needed. Will definitely have to keep playing with this camera in other settings, just for fun.

We did our checking and per the reviews this was the one. The pics on land were good and the snorkeling were fine. However, under water the pics were terrible. We bought this camera ( 2 of them) for Cozumel for our SCUBA certification. We were so disappointed in the lack of quality. We took over 300 pictures and none of them our worth saving. We will never get this opportunity back but we are looking for a better camera for the next time.
