Ok little camera.. does what it says it will do. I bought it for a motorcycle trip.  Rode 4hrs in the rain no problem. Worked great.  Battery only last 1hr-1 1/2. So it sucked because I couldn't plug in a constant power source because of the protective case. Editing features are not that great. Had to download an app to edit. The app that you download with the camera is useless as far as I cam tell.  But the app does have one plus as you can see your videos on your phone.If you want a basic knockoff go pro this works fine. But my buddy had a real high end gopro. No protective waterproof case needed. And better features.  If you have the money go for it. If not this little camera works fine.

Thought about going the cheaper route since I own every GoPro but it’s starting to get hard to keep up with them because they are coming out with new ones every few months it seems. This is not the best product but for the price I guess it’s good. The image stabilizer in this device is horrid, seems like the only thing it’s good for is pictures. It is not meant to be an action camera because of the image stabilization is lacking. Will not buy one of these again, but good for beginners and those who don’t have the $ for a GoPro

THIS IS THE MOST DETAILED AND HONEST REVIEW IN THE WHOLE SOLAR SYSTEM!!! TRUST EVERYTHING I SAY! I DID NOT GET A DEFECTED ONE! Okay, I bet everyone that is reading my review right now, came to this product because of the 4 star 5,000+ reviews this camera has. Well, those that gave the camera 5 stars have really low expectations and don't know what a good action camera is. This is as bootleg and cheap of an alternate GoPro as it gets. You know what, I'm gonna just jump right into the pros and cons:PROS:

Bought this camera for action shots in the water during vacation. Took it underwater (maybe 3ft) in the ocean and on a waterslide multiple times. Included waterproof case works perfect, never had any fogging or leakage issues. The video quality turned out fine, even in varying light levels.  The only thing lacking is the audio, which I know in a waterproof case is expecting a lot, but even out of the case the recorded audio is extremely quiet.  Overall, with all of the mounting hardware and accessories included, you cannot go wrong at this price point!

I had this camera for a couple of months and at first it worked great taking nice quality video with reasonably good sound too.  Then it started having a problem where it SEEMED to be recording video but it was not.  This caused me problems on two separate occasions where it showed that it was recording but it didn't.  It just went into the trash.Akaso customer service read my review and took care of me by issuing a refund!  I'm astounded.  In the meantime I purchased the EK7000 Pro version which I like very much and I feel is worth the extra money over the base model.

This camera far exceeded my expectations for the price that it comes at.  I would say for the price point this is the best sports action camera per dollar.  It comes with loads of accessories,  2 batteries,  and a remote control wristband where you can record/take pictures from.  The picture is stunning considering it is coming from a sub $100 camera. I definitely recommend this camera to anyone looking to get into an action camera without the big price.I don't have any cons for this device,  the only thing I can think of is an sdhc card is needed before anything can be recorded but that was expected already.  I only write that as I am sure some will buy it and not realize they need a card as well.  So figured I'd put that in the review so if someone is planning on buying it,  they know they need to get one.

Camera works fine.. Just using it in case someone hits me on my bike. However, the battery life is rather small.. Only around 15-30 minutes. Don't know exactly how long since I'm paying attention to the road instead of the camera. However, the I changed the settings to disable features and reduce quality of the image so hopefully it can last longer. Satisfied but if it doesn't last longer, I'll look into investing in larger capacity batteries that'll fitEdit:

For the price you can not best it. I call this little thing my GoPro wannabe.  With the water proof case on it does get to a point where it gets hot and fogs up.  I tried recording in 4k but the battery dies way too fast.  It gets the job done. I would recommend this camera for children or teens as a gift or for use on your pets.  I have told coworkers about how much I bought it for and where I got it, they are impressed and bought some as well. I am really curious if I would have bought the top end camera with this company on how much better it would be. I plan on buying more. One for our dog and cat, one for our 8 year old daughter and one for my husband and I.  Also I am extremely impressed with all of the accessories that came with it plus a 65gb SD card.  You can't beat it for the price.  There are some accessories that I have no clue how to mount to the camera so it would be nice to have instructions on how to install each of them.  Thanks for making this affordable product, it is worth the money which is why I have it 5 stars, it is nice to not be scammed out of hundreds of dollars only to have a device that would be out of date a few years later.

Awesome camera! We bought this for our honeymoon to Hawaii and were so happy with it! Used it snorkelling and at some waterfalls; waterproof case worked like a charm. The case arrived damaged and they replaced it which was nice! The pictures are real crisp and clear. Also took this to Moab and used some of the action attachments. We did some offroading in our jeep and the windshield attachment worked great! It never fell off and provided a really nice smooth video despite the bumpy road. Have owned it 6 months now still love it still working great!Couple notes:

Final Revision... After a month and a half, and 4 or 5 uses of my Akasotech Camera I am completely satisfied.  The replacement camera has preformed perfectly and is pretty easy to use.  If I could give 4.5 starts I would but because thats not an option I've given it 4 starts because the original camera ultimately didn't work.Revised review... After my initial review included below I was contacted by an Akaso representative and provided w a nee camera, Ive only had a few minutes behind it so far but everything seems to be working fine.  Because my initial camera worked well in the beginning before stopping I will continue to use and create a final review in the coming months.

Bought this camera for my son. He wanted to start making videos, and I didn't want to spend a fortune on a hobby that lasted a week. This little gem does everything he wants to do. It comes with enough accessories to handle most anything. I am no techie, so I was no expert on cameras, last videos i made was when everyone had VCR's, but just watching him use it, It's easier then I thought and I have even started making videos of fishing trips, trips to the beach, deer wandering through my yard, etc. One other thing I have used it for, is working on equipment I am not familiar with, taking a picture in the past isn't as good as a video when you can't remember where that part went. All things considered, this was a great deal and i am thinking about getting the next model up, who knows, I could be the next big YouTube star . Great camera for the money!

I am old enough to remember my uncle holding his expensive Camcorder on his shoulder.  It was huge, clunky, and needed to be plugged in.  When we were expecting our first child, we thought we hit it out of the park buying a GoPro Hero3. For $300-$400, you got a great camera.  The GoPro's battery didn't last long and it did not have an LCD screen in the back, so you had to guess at what you were recording. Anyway, 5 years later the GoPro has died.So I read the reviews and decided to buy the AKASO EK7000 4K WiFi Sports Action Camera Ultra HD Waterproof DV Camcorder. I almost didn't buy it because I could not wrap my head around how a camera can be so cheap ($52.99 with taxes) and provide so many different features and accessories. I have been playing with this camera for a few days now and it works great. It has a longer battery life, came with 2 batteries, has an LCD screen, comes with a waterproof case, and so much more.  It does not come with a Micro SD, but I took my old one out from my GroPro and I'm good to go.  Therefore, this may be my best purchase or value purchase of the year.

I bought it for my  9-yea my son. It came with lots of accessories which is a huge plus. The remote is handy. However the video keeps freezing when shooting at 4K mode. Video stabilization is not close to GoPro.  For 43$ I will keep it as picture model and 1080p video still work. One thing I really loathe is that the seller offers free  accessories in change for positive reviews. I have to admit that the free gifts are very attempting. I was wondering how many of 10+k reviews are actually honest reviews. This is nothing but bribery. Amazon should do something to stop this nonsense!

Received Wednesday and took some time to play with it. Instructions are basic; it's not hard to figure out. Threw it on my car for a pov test run, and I'm impressed. Picture is great. Lots of accessories included, so don't buy add ons until you get it. It's light, case feels good- haven't gone underwater yet, but will eventually with no fears. I like the wifi connection. It's pretty easy, and it allows you to immediately download to your phone and begin editing or posting- I'm on an iPhone, so not sure how it would be on another format, but I assume there'll be no issues. Long and short, if you want an action cam without the big dollar price tag, give this one a try. I've seen big brand footage, and I'd put this up against it without concern.

Value for the money, this can’t be beat. It doesn’t have exactly the same quality as a brand name camera 10x the cost, but I’ve used this camera while snorkeling (waterproof case works perfectly) and got really nice results. I also use it on my bike - the huge number of mounts included is impressive.Pros:

I bought this as a starter / beginners "action" camera and couldn't be happier.  For the price, the picture quality matches.  So far i have only used as a dash-cam (window mount: https://smile.amazon.com/gp/product/B00NJVC2QC/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o05_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1) to test it out till next summer when i can take the jeep out on the trail.  I CAN NOT wait!**Only complaint i have is that i cannot seem to get it to fit all the way into the other mount if i don't want it in the waterproof case (see pictures) (I've tried flipping it both ways, same end result)

I primarily use this camera when I ride. I have taken it in my city and rural area rides, and it has proven to be a quality camera that can sustain fast-moving images. Video Quality is great, and the external memory, it is very easy to swap memory cards. Also, I really like the remote control feature that I come with, which you can wear on your wrist or attach it elsewhere to quickly turn start/stop recording or take a picture. Comes with the accessories that you would need to mount this little camera on your bike.

This is a great little camera with very nice features. There are many pieces to be able to mount in various styles and positions to fit whatever need you may have.The video quality is crisp and clear and the pictures are equal.

This camera does what it does exceptionally well for the price.  I purchased this camera so that I could take some video's of my son and I skiing and it accomplished that task very well.  The battery life is around two hours of moderate use, but since they ship you two batteries, swapping the two gives decent coverage.  They provide all of mounts that you could need, of which I have only used the helmet mount, but it worked perfectly.  While the camera doesn't have some of the features of more expensive models (i.e. image stabilization, webcam support, etc...) it does exactly what I needed it to do, at a great price point.

I got this camera for my son.  For the price, I wasn't too worried about it being ruined as compared to more expensive cameras.  It came with everything he needed to get up and running.  The video quality is awesome and can be easily compared to that of your iPhone or better.  Sound quality is great even in the waterproof case.  We have used it both fresh and salt water without any issues with the provided case.  Battery run time seems reasonable, we haven't run it out during an adventure and there are two batteries provided.  10/10 would buy again.

The camera came in a well constructed protective box. The box was tough and well sealed. In fact it was a little hard to get into to extract the camera.After the initial extraction it was necessary to charge the batteries and purchase an SD card. No problem.

My wife bought this camera to use while swimming open water. For her, the camera performed as expected: the angle of view is very wide, and the images were in focus. Sound is somewhat muffled when the camera is sealed inside the waterproof case, though nearby conversation is still understandable. The directions that come with the camera are very brief, however there are MANY detailed tutorials online, which were useful in setting up & identifying all of the attachments that come with it. Attached video is at a local river. The camera was mounted to her safe swim buoy, about 5-6 inches above the waterline. (she also wants me to add: don't blame the camera for her lack of skill in using it!)

My daughter wanted a waterproof camera. She's only 11 so I wasn't spending $300 on a GoPro. I didn't even know these GoPro ripoffs existed. I figured for $60 how bad could it be, she's only 11, t'll be fine. It is way better than fine. It has more features than my 2 year old GoPro, the video quality seems to be just as good, if not better, and the build quality seems great. If that wasn't enough, the remote is actually a fantastic feature to not have to mess with the camera itself to start and stop video once you have it in the right position.I can't imagine you being disappointed with this camera at $300. At $60 it is just ridiculous.
I really wanted something I could bring to the indoor/outdoor waterpark and this did the trick! We got some great photos and video.Cons:

Mine lasted For about 3 hours of use.  The solder joints on the charging port broke...I figured I bought a POS,  I may as well deal with it.  Bench charged  the batteries.  The contact points on the unit broke off when I re-installed the battery gingerly... Totally uselessUpdate.  Akaso earned some more stars.  I was recently contacted by Akaso and was offered a free replacement camera.  This was impressive because I purchased it back in 2017.  Sure enough, the camera arrived and is charging and functioning correctly.  I have only shot a couple of test videos so far, but will be using it in the near future.  My thanks to Akaso for making such an effort, I'm looking forward to shooting some Onewheel footage and adding another star.

This is my third action-based camera. The first two were both Go Pros; lost one to the Ocean and one to a breakup. Overall the picture quality is on par if not better, the sound isn't quite as good with the waterproof case on, but with it off it isn't noticeable. (makes no difference if you use an external microphone). The App that connects the camera to the phone is surprisingly good, but not necessary. This is essentially a stripped-down go pro, great camera, lesser microphone cheaper battery lock-in system. For the price this is great! would buy again (hopefully wont loose this one)

I bought this for one main reason and that it to record how I slowly improve on my snow skiing adventuress (still beginner). When I received the package and opened it, I was first impressed with the array of different mounting accessories it came with and the camera is very compact also! The best way I preferred was to mount to the camera to my ski helmet, which was easy using the sticky back mount and a ty-wrap for back-up. I skied for almost two weeks (including crashing) with no helmet mounting issues. The camera itself is not water proof, so it mounts inside a waterproof clear plastic case that seals everything up. The audio will be muffled while inside the waterproof case, but used as a regular camera, audio is adequate. The camera uses an external memory SD card to record video and phone app to interact with the camera-which I both liked. The external SD card removes and plugs into laptop for faster downloads of all day action rather than using wireless download from app. Shorter video (10 min or less) download fairly quickly). It comes with a wrist mounted push-button for start/stop of recording, but mostly left the camera recording the whole time because I sometimes got exited on beginning of ski runs and forgot to record some runs (just edit videos on computer when got home later). It comes with (2) rechargeable batteries, which easily last a half day of skiing per battery. I just change batteries at the ski lodge when I take lunch break; it's also a fun time to review video from the phone.The main negative (1 star remove) was there appeared to be a small rattling recorded in the audio while skiing with the camera mounted on my helmet. I've troubleshooted this to be inside the camera (including the batt and SD card removed). No big deal, I edited my videos to remove the camera audio and overplayed with my favorite rock songs any way. This is a great entry level camera for action recording for the price-very hard to beat!

I wanted to get something similar to a gopro for my 9 year old that wasn't $300. I stumbled across the EK7000 and at first I couldn't believe the price but after watching several reviews on youtube I pulled the trigger.Wow what a great deal! The image quality is fantastic and the video's are smooth and crisp. I still can't believe it was under 50 bucks. We've taken it underwater several times and the image quality remains fantastic. This is a great camera for a young up and coming youtuber or anyway that doesn't want to spend $300 for an action camera!

This camera is a sound investment if you don’t wanna spend $500+ on a device that has almost the same quality. The package comes with all the accessories you’ll need to mount it anywhere. Voice recording is always loud and clear. A single battery can last about 2+ hours of continuous recording. Attached photos are the unit itself and some screenshots I took from a 1080p recording at a biker rally this morning. I haven’t tried 4K yet but I’m sure it would be significantly better, but  also requires more power of course. If you are on a budget but still want a solid travel camera, this is it!

I wanted something to record movies while kayaking and did not want to spend a lot of money on a GoPro.  First the good.  I started off by experimenting around with photos and movies and find the quality to be pretty good for such an inexpensive camera.  Mind you, I do not own and have never owned a GoPro so I can't make a comparison to that.  Things that I found frustrating is the battery compartment cover once removed to install the battery just does not want to fit flush nor does it appear to want to stay in place.  I fiddled with it for around 30 tries and it still does not seem to want to sit flush again.  Also, there is a lack of good instructions that come even with the downloaded user manual.  To that I say, thank goodness for YouTube as there were some excellent tutorials there on several things that were either not addressed in the users manual or the information was insufficient.  The camera seemed to "lock up" on me at one point and none of the buttons worked so I just removed the battery to re-set the camera.  There is a dizzying array of mounts and again, not really clear instructions on using them.  Right now I am trying to figure out ways to securely attach the camera to my kayak.  I also plan to experiment around with attaching to caps and my kayak paddle.  Time will tell once I get that figured out and actually try it on the water.

After playing with the EK7000 for a while, I can say that this is one of the better low-cost GoPro competitors. It’s one of the GoPro competitors that has taken off in popularity, and after playing with it for a while I can see why. It shoots 4K video (at 25fps), takes 12MP still photos, comes with a waterproof housing, and uses the same mounting system. It’s even packaged the same way a GoPro is packaged, with the distinctive clear perspex bubble on top. But it’s simpler to use. And it’s much cheaper.

I have to start off by saying I wish they would have included a user manual. The QR code to go to the manual is not overly helpful. The hard plastic stand for the camera didn't come with any instructions. It was pretty difficult to get off. I finally was able to though. I like that it comes already in the waterproof case and its great with all of the accessories. Its a bit annoying that they don't include a cube to plug in. The only other thing that I would have liked to see is a  bag to hold all the goodies. The option to wear a clicker for videos and photos is awesome. All in all I am very excited.

I purchased this camera for my husband to use while scuba diving.  The camera is very compact, came with a lot of accessories and 2 batteries.  I added a separate memory card as recommended.  While he has not used it for scuba diving yet, we have used it biking, kayaking and just walking around.  The pictures have been great.  The camera is easy to use.  The most complicated part is figuring out all the attachments.  Looking forward to many pictures and videos we would not have been able to capture with our phones.  Extremely happy with our purchase.
I'm not well versed in action cameras, but it seems hard to beat for the price. The customer service is also some of the best around, at least in my experience.---Old review for clarity below---

Got this Camera delivered today and i was super excited to use it right away, First opening the box i can see it was neatly packaged, Inside the box came with some various mounts which is always needed for recording depending  on what you do, I play Airsoft, ride mountain bikes and go hiking and road trips often and like to record my adventures, From what i have noticed the Picture/video Quality is stunning way better then i thought it would be, The wide angle lens makes big area captures a breeze as well as the options to change what video size you want, 4K/1080/720 and FPS limits aso comes with a wrist remote for easy push and go waterproof too, One cool thing i noticed was the box has a flat plastic mount built onto it which the cam was mounted on which will make a awesome stand for itOne thing i can say is navigating between menus for Video/Picture/View Recording/picture was a bit tricky as i did know how to exit the menu from it, instead i would just restart the camera, also my phone with the WIFI did not seem it wanted to connect to it on the app. Im sure it is a simple thing ill ask about to find out but does not effect me using this awesome camera

This is a great little action cam for the money, especially when you consider that it comes with several attachments included and TWO batteries!  I use it for recording bicycle rides and hiking trips.  The only downside is that the battery life is only about an hour and a half on a full charge, but I don't know how that compares to other action cams.  And the batteries are small, you can carry one in a small pocket and change it out for another 90 minutes or so of filming.  For the $50 I paid for this, a real bargain in my opinion.

For the $ its awesome.. iv always wanted name brand but refused to spend that kinda $... but i have a event coming up that i really needed a sports camera for so i started looking and found this... with all the positive reviews i took a chance and now im glad i did....Now i have never used a name brand camera so i dont know how this compares to that

For this price, this is a very very good deal. The picture quality aren’t the best but it’s very good for this camera. The video quality is great. The only thing I didn’t like that the camera time resets after every time you change the battery. Which makes the whole idea of putting time stamps completely useless. This happened when I tried to do time lapse but because of this issue It messed up all the file names and I had to just delete all the files. Other than that it’s fine. Got it out under the rain the same day i got it. I paid about $100 to get this camera, micro sd and more accessories which is waaaay better than paying $500 to get the same thing with gopro. So yeah.

Not at all what I expected.  The device is super small and difficult to handle,  especially under water. I hooked an elastic ponytail holder to it to keep from losing it at the bottom of the ocean.  The remote is futile. It's a lot wrong with this product besides it being a teeny tiny camera. I planned to return but time ran out.

I had been eyeing Gopros for a long time but certainly wasn't ready to drop all the $$ on it.  I came across this on Amazon and saw how many great reviews it had.  I was still somewhat hesitant as I purchased because it seemed too good to be true to have a camera that goes underwater and come with so many accessories.  I was certain the quality wouldn't be very good.  I was wrong and SO pleasantly surprised!  I have used this in the ocean, the pool, and for a lot of outdoor video taping.  For what you're getting for the price it is definitely worth it!  I uploaded a video that I'm sure will be lesser quality once on Amazon, but is very clear on my computer.  I'm so excited to take this on vacation!

I bought this to use on my road bike.  Thought it would be fun to get some pictures and videos during my rides.  At some point I would also like to purchase a dog harness as well.  The price and the reviews were good, and I did not want to spend GoPro money for an action camera.  I've only used it on one ride so far and the conditions were too windy - - up to 20mph - - to play around with it too much and be safe at the same time.  Having said that the video came out as I expected.  I used the remote wristband to operate it. I was able to download and use the app but I didn't find it useful for my needs.  The manual that comes with it is not very detailed. YouTube had plenty of helpful videos.  The bike mount that came with it did not fit and I did buy a GoPro bike mount instead.  I also purchased the additional insurance.  $5.75 for three years and I've never had any issues with Square Trade before and hopefully I won't ever need to use it.

This one works for fine for me till now, I honestly said I didn't do much recording so don't take my opinion too serious this time.  I only turns on this as a 1080P camera cause too many people claim the 4K quality is not good.  So I didn't ever test that out.But As for the normal 1080P use, this is a great one, with many amenities, 2 battery and a protection case.

I was shocked at how poor the video quality of this camera is. To describe it as a 4K camera brings, in my view at least, expectations of high video quality. I tried the camera in all of the various settings (4K, 2K, 1080P) and found the quality equally bad with them all. Even 1080P did not come close to quality I have on other similar priced cameras. What is the point of 4K if the video is blocky, fuzzy, does not handle various light situation well and shows no detail. Bottom line is this that this camera has a low quality CMOS sensor and will not produce quality video at any setting.On the positive side, the packaging is professional, the wide array of adaptors and cases are nice, the wifi work good for me (although it was a very short test), function of the camera is pretty easy if you follow the manual. But all that really doesn't matter with such poor quality. I will be returning.

This is a nice all around camera for the price. I purchased this for my 12 year old to use around the house and vacation.  He opened the box and had it all figured out before I even got home from work!  Easy to operate and control. It does not come with the SD card so you will need to have one on hand.  He has already bolted it to his go cart and bike for some footage.  I like that it is light and compact.  It comes with a bunch of accessories to use.  I like the case that it comes in.  Some things that I can overlook are the fact that the sound quality is not great with the case on. If you have in out of the case, it is way better.  Since we are planning on taking it on a fishing trip, we really won't need the sound as we will make a video out of our whole week.  Overall, it beats paying hundreds of dollars for a name brand.  This will be a good learner for us and if we really enjoy it, we may upgrade in the future.

Updating my review, I decided to give AKASO another shot. This camera works well and the wifi connects well. Battery is good and it exceeded the expectations, it comes with 2 batteries and a charger. The battery is as good or better than my gopro camera battery. The video quality is good as well and the camera comes with lots of mounts, such as bicycle mount which is the main purpose of this camera (I record my rides). I definitely recommend this camera.Attached pictures showing the camera setup with bicycle mount and box full of mounts and remote control.

I am a 55yo female that had been looking at purchasing a "action camera" for a while. Mostly to use while on vacation, may use as a bird feeder cam. Had this camera in my cart for some time and pulled the trigger when the price dropped to $43.00. The waterproof case seems quite sturdy - have not tried it yet.  Have not figured out all of the accessories, will most likely only use a few, but nice that they are included. The camera itself is quite small and light - the only thing that seems low quality is the battery door, feels like it might break at some point but so far so good. The video is pretty good - not true 4k, but I am no professional and it looks great for my purpose. Price point is amazing for what you get.  If it lasts me a couple of years - I would purchase again.

I don't have any issue with the camera by itself, but I have issues with the battery life.  Batteries last maybe an hour (sometimes more, sometimes less).  You don't know when the battery is going to die, so after about 45 minutes, you have to keep taking it off and checking.When you do replace the battery, you have to reset the date and time.  This requires lots of clicking.  It's enough work to change out the battery every hour, but the last thing I want to do is sit for a minute each hour and reset things.

This device comes with enough accessories to strap it to just about any body part you can think of - I however just wanted it as a cheap and effective webcam. It works! It costs less than half what a webcam costs right now after the price gouging, err correction. I liked it so much for that purpose I bought one for a friend so we could chat on video.Someay I might go outside and strap this thing to myself and fall down a mountain, or scuba to Atlantis  - for today,  I will shelter in place and admire how silly I look on my rather thrifty webcam.

This product is perfect for those who want the benefits of a GoPro but don’t exactly have GoPro money. The quality of the camera is very nice. The main reason I purchased this was for a documentary that I’m filming, to get some cool shots. It was worth it, I got to go to the beach and use it without worrying about it getting damaged and I even put it on my bike.The only downside of this product is that there are a lot of pieces that come with it and was confusing at first. However the app that you can get with it was helpful in explaining how to assemble the pieces and what they were used for.

For the price you definitely cant go wrong with this camera set up. Definitely worth buying to see if you like it before purchasing a much more expensive option. No issues as of yet, have had it for a little under a month and its very easy to set up and use. Haven't used it under water since its winter here, but definitely will be going to try it in the spring. The remote wrist option comes in very handy as well. All the accessories are great, I keep it in a small makeup bag and put it in my camera bag.

We bought this for my husband and son to take on a future Boy Scout canoe trip, so they can take pictures on the water and not risk a cell phone or my 35mm camera. Our son and one daughter tested it out and it takes surprisingly good pictures and videos with as small as it is. The field of view is amazing. We haven't tested the waterproof/water resistance, yet, but the case looks like it will work well. They did take pictures with it on, and they still looked pretty good.

I've been looking for a small, reliable and affordable action cameras for my racing bike and motorcycle. This kit comes with all accessories that I need to mount the camera on my racing bike or on my motorcycle. It's kind of killing two birds with one stone! Easily setup and operated with good instructions! There's also a 2nd battery and a charging cradle in the package and some more free courtesy accessories are on the way from the vendor. It's a great deal! I have not tried the water resistance feature yet but I believe it should work by my looking at the rigid construction of the waterproof case!

I purchased this action camera specifically for an island vacation, wanting something to be able to capture something words couldn’t. Ive never purchased an action camera before and don’t know too much about them. Ive read reviews and watched YouTube videos about this product to try and make somewhat of an educated purchase. You will find people who love it and those who are not impressed comparing it to a more popular brand. In the pictures I have posted, you can see that it works better than expected. The picture and video quality is great, at least for me anyway. I took it through some serious off road hiking trails (safe in the waterproof casing always) and against some serious ocean waves. It held up against everything and having the two batteries was more than sufficient. If you’re not looking to spend a lot of money and want good quality, this camera great. There was only one minor back-draw and that was that sometimes in the ocean the inside of the waterproof casing would fog up slightly. Water did not get in or to the camera but just some condensation in the  somehow. This camera was better than I expected and the best purchase I made preparing for our vacation.

I really love my Akaso EK 7000 Camera.  For me the camera performs true to it's amazing specifications.  Ease of use and simple operating controls make for a pleasurable filming experience.  For my money the performance far exceeds the affordable cost compared to other brands of action cameras.  With those higher dollar camcorders I think a person pays a lot for the name.  I wanted to mention the included sturdy and well designed waterproof enclosure as well. It also comes with many handy mounting accessories.  With the EK 7000 you pay a small price for great workmanship and a reliable high quality device.  I would recommend this camera to anyone.

Just got this delivered today and took it for a dirt bike trail ride. I'm coming off an old Contour gps which was easy to turn on and go, but has seen better days. After reviewing some new action cameras, I couldn't justify the cost GoPro wants when every time I crash on my dirt bike I risk loosing a ton of money. Saw the great reviews and the low cost of entry and said I have nothing to loose. Used it for 2 hours this morning on a trail ride from my house. Got it all connected to my phone using the app which was easy enough, hit record, and went off down the trail. Picture turned out awesome, especially when compared to my contour. Color is much better, sound of my exhaust is more muted with the open back case so it's not as overwhelming, and battery life was excellent. Had no trouble after hitting the dirt several times with the camera. After I edit the video I'll post it to youtube and anyone that sees my old videos compared to this will immediately notice the upgrade. For the price, it can't be beat, I'm stoked. I'll update after I take it mountain biking and snowboarding, especially snowboarding as I go later in the evening and will be able to see how the late evening light and video compare.

Image quality and video quality are both fantastic. Stable, plenty of mounting options and accessories in the setup so you can use it on just about anything. My one and only gripe is that the built in microphone is subpar at best and does not come with any capability of connecting an external mic (for uses like recording music cover videos). With that being said, if you are not doing any sort of music video shooting, or at least not a lot, THIS IS YOUR CAMERA. makes for a great dash cam as well, which is what I decided to use it as.

We purchased this camera to take on our trip to South Africa. It was a last minute idea, and it arrived just days before be departed. Even though we had a limited time to explore the cameras options and features, we were able, with little effort, to get the camera up and operational. We completed the accessory package by adding a much needed selfie-stick,  which  made taking still shots and videos a breeze. We have yet to take any underwater video, but have exposed the camera to damp applications(water falls), and it performed perfectly. The only reason I gave this a less than perfect rating was that the battery life (in video mode) was a little less than spectacular. The other issue is that this camera only has Wifi capability. It would have been great with Bluetooth for areas with limited Wifi access.  All in all for the price & features, this camera was a great purchase!

I love this camera. I purchased this camera on amazon as a replacement for another camera (different brand) that wouldn’t even turn on. This one happened to be a lightening deal so I decided to buy it. I’m so glad that I did. My husband loves it and has it mounted to his helmet when he rides his OneWheel. The videos are really good. It recently came in handy after someone nearly hit him and we were able to give footage to the police. I’d definitely purchase this one again if I ever needed to.

I got the camera for the feature of taking photos with the wrist band. I set up the camera to take photos of my proposal to my girlfriend. Worked like a charm. I was got the selfie stick to go with is and pretended to take scenic photos with the sunset and used the wristband to take photos every step of the way. Worked great, captured every moment. Have not tested the waterproof ability yet, but the casing does appear secure. The battery life is pretty long. I haven't used the camera for extended periods of time yet, but I've only needed to charge the battery once. The app feature has given me trouble and somehow connecting the camera to wifi has still been an issue for me. However, it hasn't stopped me from taking photos and videos and uploading them onto the computer. Definitely recommend the camera for a more affordable option of sports action cameras. Plan to take it on all future vacations.

Impressive little camera for the price, loaded with video and still photo features in a compact size.  More impressive was the included accessories, including waterproof case, 6 mounts, 2 batteries plus charger, battery operated remote (battery included) numerous straps, handlebar mount and more.Initial test video provided clear, color accurate views with minor vibration (which could have been the result of my using a non-recommended mount set-up (helps to read the manual).  I'm impressed and would recommend purchasing for a first time buyer looking for a GoPro compatible camera.

so it apparently won't take an sd card bigger than 32gb. how do i know this? not from anything that it said on the product page or in the user manual. i learn it from a video on youtube explaining all the stuff about this camera that no one bothered to write anywhere. the terrible manual and support for this camera explains why it's so cheap. i'm not very happy since my SD card is too large and i cannot use this camera until i get a smaller one.
UPDATE**Akaso gave me the opportunity to try another camera and this time it was fantastic! I was able to dive to 80 feet no problem with the housing or film quality. Overall very pleased.

OK, so this is the first sports camera we've ever purchased. I didn't want to spend hundreds for a name brand GoPro when there are tons of equally better options out there. For the price, this is really great! It feels pretty durable and it comes with a ton of accessories. So far in playing with it, I know I'm going to love it. We've played with other people's GoPro's and I really don't see a difference at all between this. I would save your hard earned $$ and not buy a name brand and go with this! Amazon has a great return policy if you were to not like it, so what do you have to lose? I am very pleased with my purchase! I'm so excited to use it on our upcoming vacation!I also purchased the extra batteries and charger. For the price, it's definitely worth it to have a total of 4 batteries.

It's not going to cook you supper or walk your dog, but you could clip this little bugger onto your dog and get some pretty great footage! The still camera footage is so/so, but my mom wants something little she can strap to her walker and get some action shots of her walks around the block and of Lake Michigan without breaking the bank. At less than $50, you can't ask for much more. This thing has a zillion attachments and if Mom ever decided she needs to try parasailing, it comes with a waterproof case. Slick!

I bought this camera to use as a dashcam for my motorcycle. An answered question stated that it can. The problem is that you have to start it for every trip rather than having it start automatically when power is restored from the motorcycle. So yes, it can be used as a dashcam, but it is very inconvenient. The quality of the video is good, but lacking auto power on, it's worthless to me.

Got this camera for my cancun vacation that I went on during the christmas break last winter and I am thoroughly impressed. For the price of the camera, i wasn't expecting great shots like the gopro but the video quality and picture quality is way better than expected ! there's a bunch of different gear that comes with it that's nice and the water seal component is very sturdy.the only thing i didn't like about the camera is that the date is incorrect (something i can probably fix but couldn't get to as of yet) and for some reason, when i was using the camera on the trip in the water case that it comes with, some how mid- way (never touching the battery component), the battery had came out and i had no idea until i realized physically by opening on the compartment and seeing the battery had some how fallen out. missed some great footage opportunity but overall, the rest of the trip it was fine. missing one battery now so i'm most likely going to have to buy another pack because one battery is not enough for a trip (it'll last me maybe 2 -3 hour max).

While the picture is great, it appears that you have to set the date and time every time you change the battery. I haven't found anything in the manual that will save the date and time permanently which is unacceptable. Well I just found it #11. It says "if you replace the battery, date and time will reset". WT???????

While the camera itself performed fine, although a little unstable, my rating is because of the mounting hardware.  I mounted it on my motorcycle and rode about 3 times - and it broke.  The mounting hardware just snapped.  No camera now....couldn't recover it after going 70 mph and lots of traffic.  :(Updated: Initially reached out to my warranty via Assurion who refused to help. I contacted the seller and was originally told there was nothing they could do. However, a few days later someone from the company reached out and we were able to come to an agreement and they refunded the amount of the camera.  I did buy another model and mounted it on my motorcycle. So far it's performed well.

Great action camera for the price! Is this as good as a GoPro? Of course not. However, you are paying 25% of the price and getting a camera that provides about 90% the video quality of a GoPro. I'd say this is a good trade off.The video quality of the EK7000 is very good. The contrast is a bit high, which may cause details in the shadows to be a but muddled, but this is not really noticeable in an "action video". The field of view is very good, but it does create a fish-eye look, which is common to all action camera. However, most video editing apps can fix this in post-production. This camera is billed as a 4K resolution, but I preferred to use it in 1080p mode for the 60FPS, which I found to produce a much better video due to the smoothness compared to 25fps (at 4K).

Depending on the use case(Like to shield the owner from liability, dash cam, body cam, ect) You need to have an accurate date and time.The issue here is, You can't. They include two batteries, But you cannot remove the battery from the camera without resetting the clock. This is a huge design flaw. Imagine if your phone died and you had to keep resetting the time/date?

I've never dealt with an "action camera" so I was unaware of what I was getting into.  I bought this camera thinking it would do 4K or at least 1080 that it states, I was wrong.  The picture quality is worse than my older Samsung S4 and don't get me started on the video footage.  It was "muddy" and grainy and it does NOT come with EIS (Electronic Image Stabilization).  I bought this mainly to record RC footage and it was just disgusting and at times nauseous with the playback. Also the built in mic barely picks up any audio.  I did enjoy however plethora of accessories that are supplied. After doing some extensive research I'm finally narrowing in on two cameras that fulfill my needs without breaking the bank.  Currently I am testing out the Akaso V50X ($100) and the Yi 4k Action Camera ($115).  Once again the Akaso comes with a slew of accessories, where as the Yi 4K only comes with the camera and charging cable. I'd say after reading some of the reviews for this camera on here it's fine for a child, but if you want something better I will let you know by next week.

I bought this for my son's birthday gift. As he is a little boy, the things I focused on are easy to control, not very expensive and water resistance. When I got this and tested those lists, all of them were very satisfying. First it is very easy to control. Though it does not support touch screen, the button is much more convenient for little boy. He could use this right after I teach him. And as you can see, price is very attractive for buyers who want to test action cam first. And it needs a case for water resistance but putting the case on cam is so easy and it works well.Though this is not as great as other expensive action cams. But for the person who wants to use this as a gift for a little one or try to start an action cam, I would like to recommend this.

First off, I am a huge fan of gadgets and gizmos and I wanted an action camera to film my outdoor adventures with my friends and family. I bought this specifically for a Polar Bear plunge that a group of us were participating in. I had only tested the camera out minimally prior to the big event. I had begun filming around 9 am and stopped around 2 pm and I still had close to 90% of the battery remaining. When I got home I immediately uploaded the footage to my computer which only took a few minutes. I was very impressed by the picture & sound quality. My brother was also filming the event on his Go Pro (not 4k) and he even said he should have saved some money and gone with the Akaso. I did purchase the accessory kit and it came with everything I would ever need for the action camera. The day of the plunge I used the selfie stick, the floating stick, the headband, and the chest strap. The chest strap was the most comfortable, however, I felt like the best footage came from the selfie stick and headband. I used the floating stick for when we actually jumped in...let go of the camera to test it...it stayed right on the surface through the waves so I was assured that I could take this anywhere. The wide angle lens, the picture quality, the sound quality, the ease of use and most especially the price make this Akaso EK7000 camera's review the easiest 5 stars I have ever awarded. Thank you!!!!

I cannot give an accurate review because I have not seen any videos or pictures from this. It was a gift and I was told the batteries drain quickly. I am not sure how quick is quickly. I did overhear more people give the advice of saying if you lowered the resolution the batteries last longer (or something like that). As I said I cannot give an accurate review until we learn a little more about it. That is why I went 3's across the board. If I have more info, I'll update this. I hope it goes up to a 5 :)

The EK7000 is my second Akaso action cam, I also own the Akaso Brave 4 that I use on my motorcycle. I bought EK7000 to use on my fishing/sport boat and I'm very pleased with it. The video and picture quality exceeds what I expected at this price point. The camera comes with a waterproof case, two batteries and a wrist band with buttons to start and stop the video and to take photos. The battery life is decent. The built-in Wi-Fi works good, I installed (iSmart DV) app and connected from my phone and tablet. I plan to purchase another one to capture different angles on my boat when fishing or doing water sports. I love this camera and recommends it to anyone looking for a decent action cam at a reasonable price.

Fantastic camera for the price. Shoots great video, nice clear image. When in the waterproof case, do not expect to get ANY sound. If you're editing your videos afterward, do a voice overlay instead.When shooting underwater, either start recording before placing the camera underwater or press the button manually, do not use the remote as it won't connect when the camera is underwater.

So I just got this yesterday, haven't even turned it on yet(batteries are charging). But I am so far blown away. I was anticipating some cheap packaging and materials. The packaging looks as good as a go pro. It comes with so many useful accessories and TWO batteries!! I wasn't expecting the remote, as i didn't have one with the last cheaper action cam i had but damn if it isn't going to be useful. I can't wait to try it out. And once I do and check out the picture quality, i will probably end up buying a second one.I'll be back to update on the picture/video quality once I get some time under my belt. So far, I'm sold.

I bought this with a special application in mind, to monitor the recoil of a handgun, during  rapid fire. The idea was to test grips, that would reduce that to as near zero as I could. I had tried other video methods that were not great. This has worked out fairly well, although I did have to buy a separate headband mount that I thought was included.Aside from that and the inability to zoom ( at least I have not figured it out yet) in on the finished video are minor issues. Overall, I am please with the camera.

Got it for $55 from the akaso ebay store and glad i returned my gopro silver 4 for this. i use it mainly for riding my motorcycle and it holds up well at 80mph! came with a whole bunch of accessories and wish I opened the box sooner because I bought a gopro helmet mount when I really could've just used one of the mounting pads it came with. well, now I know gopro mounts are compatible with akaso is true. really happy with my purchase and it was 6xs cheaper than the gopro. i use the remote as a keychain and works well! oh I also use with a 64gb class 10 card, gives me no problems. microphone does suck but hey, its main purpose is a camera. battery life does suck, I feel like I got about an hour out of it, but they did give me 2 batteries.the camera also records in increments on 10 minutes and it starts over, if that bothers you. also it says it has wifi, but I really wouldn't consider it wifi, it's more like bluetooth where you connect it to your phone with an app and can view the files.

My boyfriend and I are going on a cruise and he has been wanting to get a propro to document our adventures. I researched GoPros and kept looking to try to find a deal on them. In my search on Amazon, I came across this AKASO EK7000 camera. The information and reviews for the AKASO indicated this camera was every bit as good at the GoPros, except $300 CHEAPER, so I went ahead and ordered it! The other 5 star reviews were right, this camera is great! My boyfriend loves the camera! He loves taking videos while I love photos. For 12 mp the pictures are very good. The video quality is great, as you would expect with 4k resolution. The accessories are an added bonus - we can't wait to use the camer and waterproof case while we are jet skiing around the Bahamas! I will add to the review if needed in the future, but so far we wouldn't change anything about it.
UPDATED REVIEW JULY 2020So Akaso sent me a newer version that holds its memory for 30 minutes.

Bought this for use as a motorcycle helmet camera. First important thing: the stick mount they give to attach to arbitrary surfaces fell off my helmet on the first ride. Don't trust it. On the other hand, the device fell onto blacktop at 40mph and came out just fine, so it seems fairly sturdy.The picture quality says 4k, and there may be 4000 pixels, but it sure isn't the crisp image you think of when you here 4k. Very grainy. Same thing if you just take a picture.

Holy cow! This thing is unbeatable value-wise, I can't believe how nice this camera is for the price, and I would still be amazed if it only came with the camera and a battery, let alone a boatload of mounting accessories as well. The wrist mounted remote is hands-down (lol literally) my favorite feature of this thing, taking pictures and starting/stopping video couldn't get easier. No more having to use a mobile phone to trigger it, or fighting with buttons at the most inopportune times. This is going to be AWESOME for my freestyle drone, I am really excited to use this thing for real. Plus it has an LCD display screen on the back, so you can frame your shots super easy, this is the first action camera I've had with this feature and I'm surprised it has it since most other cameras with them are $$$.Buy this thing. You won't regret it.

The pictures are nothing to be excited about. They are about the same as a low-end cellphone camera. The videos are actually pretty good. I'd definitely recommend this as a cheaper action camera. One problem could be a lack of firmware updates.

I mostly got this to put it on dogs and get funny video clips for their owners (I own a dog training & walking company).The video quality is good and the owners are loving the videos.  Sure the sound in the waterproof case isn’t the best, but I don’t really care much about the sound quality, as I often overlay that.  For the price, I’d say it can’t be beat.

The purchase price is really great! The quality is very strong especially when you consider the cost. Accessories are just as reasonable. I have use it for both camera and videos of my grandkids and local events. I am really glad I found this Action Camera/Video on Amazon.  I liked it so much I purchased the upgrade for my son's family. They are equally excited to use it. The small size and multiple attachment options make using it really easy.  I am sure I am just learning all the uses for my AKASO SPORT ACTION CAMERA.

The first time we tried to use this was at my son's high school District Baseball Championship game and, even though it was only 77 degrees, within the first 20 minutes of taping, it kept shutting down because the battery was overheating. We gave it a break (missing a lot of key parts of the game) and then tried to use the back up battery and, after 15-20 minutes, it shut down again because it was overheating again. I am so upset that we missed so much of the game, especially because the boys ended up winning the District Championship game and we have less than 1/4 of it recorded. So disappointed. Unfortunately, we had purchased it in November and just hadn't tried it yet, so it doesn't give us the option to return it even though that was the first time we used it.Update 5/15/2018 - After seeing my issues, customer service quickly contacted me and is correcting the situation, so I updated my rating to reflect confidence in the company caring about the experience of their customers and making sure issues are corrected.

I purchased the unit for a trip to the great Barrier Reef.  I used it to make videos snorkeling.  This unit does not have image stabilization and the image correction is not the best.  The videos were unstable due to me floating on top of the water.  Every wave movement was seen in the videos.  After researching, I found that a lot of the action videos are made with an external gimbal.  See attached video that makes my point.The case did not leak water and was completely dry.  I did not have any problem with condensation inside.

I knew before buying this it would not be any where near the quality of a GoPro but for the price it was worth a chance. You get what you pay for and that is that. Does not have good quality video while mounted on a bike in motion, the camera moves around in the case, the auto focus sucks and everything is a blur. Takes a half way good photo and the video is some what good if the unit is not moved around. I got this just to see if it works and to put on my sons bicycle and if it breaks, oh well what's $60, better than destroying a GoPro. If you are looking for an entry level action camera to strap on a kids bike or something of sort then go for this unit, might serve your needs more than mine for I have several GoPro's and know what high quality is.

Hope you're shooting outdoors in direct sunlight. Otherwise, you're out a hundred bucks. This is a neat little camera that works well otherwise. Its fatal flaw, however, is that you cannot disable its auto-exposure, which is ridiculously over-sensitive. I purchased it to use for indoor shooting, but after a few tests, I was getting motion-sick from the brightness of the video constantly going up and down and up and down. It's not even an issue of available light - I have video lights and other cameras that work fine - but on that off-chance that something moving in your shot happens to reflect one of those lights toward the camera, the exposure will dip so far the video will practically be black for a few seconds. If the auto-exposure could be disabled, a momentary flash like that would not ruin otherwise decent video. But it reacts to every little change, every little motion in the shot and is constantly bouncing the exposure up and down, and the resulting video is useless.This is not only unacceptable because it would have been four lines of firmware code to include it, but because these cameras are made for unattended shooting. They're made to mount on something where you aren't constantly monitoring what it's shooting (the wifi functionality is garbage, btw, so I can't even do that). So, especially if you're the videographer and the subject, you can't keep track of whether you've done something to make the auto-exposure go crazy, and you have to just start it and pray you don't, and then re-shoot if you do. Which is pointless, because you'll set it off again with so much as a sneeze.

This is an inexpensive sort of go pro. The instructions aren't great, but the product works fine. You need to buy a phone size micro memory card and be sure to take both batteries if you do recording as they don't seem to last long. I have only used this on a stand to record my pickleball games.This does not have any zoom so you have to do that on your computer or TV. It does have quite a few "attachment" pieces to fit different applications. I took it out of the case as I have no need for it being in a case.

So much cheaper than other competitor products and perfect for what I wanted it for.  Came with 2 batteries and a few accessories.  I bought an accessory pack to match.  First product came broken and exchange was a cinch.  Warranty company even came through on their end.  I had to buy my own memory card so don't forget about that.  It gets good video and the case has been waterproof so far.  If I break it, I'd buy another because the price isn't a huge loss compared to other brands.

So far so good.  I am using this for my motorcycles.  I have three that I use from daily commuting to bike nights to road trips.  I bought a mounting accessory kit to go with the camera.  One thing you need to know is that you have to buy a memory card with the camera.  It does not come with one.The basic kit you get with camera includes a charger base and TWO batteries.  Plus multiple charging options. It contains enough of a broad set of mounting options to use it straight out of the box.  Over all it’s a pretty good product.  We will see how time and use shake out.

Right out of the box everything feels nice, light and sturdy. The user manual is a PDF with a QR code on paper. Excited, I first took a short clip inside my home. It came out a little grainy, that was early evening indoors blinds mostly down, still a good video tho. Later that week I went for a hike with dogs. My recording ability is poor but despite that the camera quality was awesome. First use of the waterproof case produced fog inside the case, this was without going in the water on a worm day and some humidity. Further tests are needed. I do not own a bike and was not quite ready for where to put this camera as it was an early present so on the hike I attached the camera to a doll and put it in the pocket of an apron I wear. Wi-Fi's connection was easy enough to figure out and it is also quite a nice feature, especially due to the mount i used and the way it was attached. The screen was visibly blocked by the mount and my body so the connection to my phone made it much easier to check on the view. Looking forward to more points of views to record from.

I had high hopes for this camera, based on the number of positive ratings it has received. I'm wondering if I received a defective camera, as I am experiencing the same issues a user with a 1 star rating had experienced; overheating, password not working, short battery life, clunky app.I was willing to overlook all of that if the video quality had been great, but it's unfortunately not. Even on 4K, then video is choppy and seems to be more like time lapse photography than smooth video. And the sound is very low. It's neat that it can be controlled from the app, but that's likely possible with other cameras. I also had a hard time navigating through the camera controls. Really not intuitive

Literally garbage.Its just a paper weight now .The video quality is very choppy and definitely not 4K.The app used to view your recordings is very buggy and doesn’t stay open for more then a few minutes before crashing.I thought I could save a couple 100$ by not buying a go pro but now I’m almost 60$ in the hole with trying to find a decent Action camera.Do yourself a favor DO NOT BUY THIS!! YOU ARE THROWING MONEY AWAY.Ordered this In August so I’m way past the return window and now I’m stuck with a piece of plastic that doesn’t work.

What a surprise when I received  my  AKASO Ultra HD 4 K Edition actually I bought two and its was based on the reviews  on Amazon, YouTube and the AKASO website, this  little camera is solid and it didn't break the bank.  There is so much  packed into the box, the attachment for the camera seem to be sturdy and easy to use.  I have bought other action camera and I had to purchase the attachment separately adding additional cost.  So overall I'm very satisfied with my purchase.Thank you

I have had several days to try this out and I wanted to put it to the test before I wrote a review. I mountain bike and wanted a nice action camera to get my trail footage. The first day, I tested it with the clip mount on my hydro pack chest strap. It was extremely shaky and filmed mainly my legs pedaling. So, the next day, I used it on my helmet. It was soooo much better. Wonderful footage. Very steady and not blurry. I will say, if you have it connected to your phone and the WiFi on, the battery will drain fast.  If the WiFi is off, I can get 3 to 4 hours of battery life out of each battery. This is perfect for a nice price saving camera. It works great!

We bought this with our daughter's interest in making youtube videos, and it didn't disappoint. I went to the website and went through the manual in about 10 minutes after that we were off to the races. Connecting Wi-Fi to your smartphone was a breeze and there are solo many accessories that it may take us the rest of the year to use. Ultra small form factor, waterproof case and remote for taking videos or pics. Fantastic value and 12 month warranty, would definitely purchase another!

This is a rebrand of an already generic camera. If this is the camera for you - Find the cheapest one that looks like this one,  and it will be the exact camera for a fraction of the price. The 1080p is decent. Still frames are miserable. Not an actual 4k camera. The only reason they have so many good reviews is because they used to offer a free gift if you left a 5 star review.

Comes with 2 batteries and lots of mounting options. Has a wrist controller to take video or still photos - button on camera too. Charger will charge both batteries at the same time or one at a time. Can also charge a battery while mounted in the phone. Micro SD card is not included. Takes up to 32GB Micro SD. You can download their app and control the cam with your smartphone. Cam has resolution and exposure controls. It also has date-time stamp, loop recording, time lapse and 3-photo burst photo options.

If you are like me and cannot afford to purchase a GoPo but want something you can video with, then look no further. This is my second, only because my other one was stolen out of my car. I replaced it right away and haven't looked back. The quality of the video is incredibly sharp and I use the attachments to secure it to my Paramotor. It down loads easily and I am not computer savvy. I would buy this again and again, for the price and quality, you can't beat it!

Legit review from an every day guy. This camera/video is great for the price. I was trying this out before buying a Go Pro. I've tested it out on my bike handlebars and head while kayaking and hunting, and it works great with good quality pictures and videos. All my family and friends say the pictures and videos look good. I use a program on the videos to add music so I don't know about the microphone. The app works better than I thought it would. The wifi means you can use the app to control the camera and view and upload your recordings and pics. Very easy to use.If you are looking for HD 4K pictures that you plan to show in an art galleria than send the money on a Go Pro.

I have been looking at the GoPro for some time, I just couldnt justify the price.  Found this and decided for the price its worth a shot.  Very happy with the camera so far.  Havent tried it underwater yet but the few test shots I did are very good quality for a small camera.  Would recommend for anyone looking for a great little camera that compares to the GoPro.

The waterproof case is total crap underwater. I took it scuba diving and it started taking in water as little as 15 feet underwater for a few minutes. By the time I got down to 60 feet, it took on enough water to short out the camera. I managed to get a few short video clips and upon review, the lighting underwater was horrible (without a red filter). Everything was brightly washed out and green looking, but it could have just been from losing red as you go deeper (which is why you add a red filter when diving - and I didn't). This camera housing was definitely not made for scuba diving. Fortunately, once I removed the battery and memory card and rinsed the camera itself with fresh water (Yes, you can do this without the waterproof casing), and let it dry out, it actually worked again. Gotta give them some credit for that.Outside of being underwater for a long time, I think this is a decent camera, especially for the money. I've got some great footage mountain biking and kayaking. I won't be taking this diving again though.

Purchased this camera for business in the hopes to find a cost-effective solution to creating training videos and fun media for advertising and was not disappointed. With little video experience besides a smart phone this camera was so easy to use, simply point and shoot. The phone app makes it easy to view videos or pictures without having to stop and plug the SD card into a computer. The product came with so many accessories I still don’t know what they all do. Overall good product for the price point.

I am a beginner, it is working great, so I am quite happy with it.  It technical does have a 4k mode, but I am happiest with the 1080 mode, and it does this well and SIMPLY.  You don't have to be a rocket scientist to figure this thing out and actually use it.  The price was awesome - pretty good for all the stuff you get.  I just wish there were some instructions for how to use all these mounts as I am sure I am not doing some of it right!Anyway I have made photos and videos while on my paddle board and the remote control on your arm was awesome for that.  I could quickly shoot a video or a still when something interesting popped up with the touch of a button.

Mounting screw was impossible to undo, tech support was useless. Hoping replacement camera will work. Did get replacement camera, first time used waterproof case flooded, ruining the camera. Total waste of money.

Update:After I left my original review, they reached out to offer a replacement camera. Unfortunately, the issues I described were design flaws, not manufacturing defects. But after discussing the issues with them, I believe that these problems will be addressed in the next version of the camera. And based on their responsiveness, I would absolutely be willing to do business with them again.

I am a fledgling maker and beginning content creator on an extreme budget. After careful consideration, I decided to give this little camera a try. Package arrived in the afternoon and I had it up and running without fail in less time than it takes to write this review.  After an hour's worth of tinkering, test shooting and checking out the manual (available from the manufacture's website), I had already shot most of what I needed to finish a project that was long overdue. After 24 hours of shooting and playing with the app for remote control via an Android device I think I really need to get another one for multi shot capabilities. And maybe a drone, or a R/C submersible....the fact is it is just the right price to start all those little projects you thought you might never try to do... To be honest...is it as good as a comparable GoPro?? I have no idea, I can't afford one of those...but I did get this one and so far it does everything I need it to do. I did have connect-ability issues with the Android app, and I'm sure it is probably a problem fine tuning my phone, but for most all I do, I don't need it.All told you can't beat functionality for the price....well done Akaso!

We have had the camera for about 2 weeks and so far so good. We were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the video. The only negative I have for the camera is the mic volume. Either ours is broken or the mic quality is really bad. Conversation is almost inaudible.  I don't know if this is normal or if there is a setting we need to tweak but this is the biggest gripe we have with the camera. If anyone else knows how to fix this please let me know! Definitely would have given this an extra star if the mic volume would have been better.

Bought this camera for our vacation in Mexico as we planned to do a lot of snorkeling. The camera worked as expected for the first day, got some good footage no issues. On our 2nd day of snorkeling the camera stopped working half way through our adventure, once back on shore I took it out of the housing to find that the housing had been leaking and the camera had gotten wet! Upon further inspection I discovered a small defect in the camera housing that was allowing water to leak in! Thanks to this cheaply made product I lost a lot of great footage and was unable to continue capturing memories of our trip. Clearly should have invested in a better camera. And of course my return window closed while we were on vacation so now I cant even get my money back. Terribly disappointing. Another annoying thing about this camera is that it scrambles the pictures all out of order on the memory card. Overall not a good product

the recordings seem to be clear, but apparently the only way to access your files is to buy a card reader. memory card, reader, cables, and basically everything you actually need is sold separately. the app doesn’t work at all. the loading bar gets to the end when saving a file, then a quick error message flashes and that’s it. no file, no way to troubleshoot, nothing. you can’t plug it in and access your files either.edit, seller offered a refund or to swap the camera so customer service appears to be acceptable

After wanting a go pro for years, I finally did research and decided to purchase this camera. I travel and hike a ton and always regret not having better quality videos and photos and I look forward to using this camera for that. This was super easy to set up, which was important for me as I am not camera knowledgable and the quality is great. I love the accessories that came with it (a clip to clip to me!) and the remote controller. I'm so excited to finally capture the photos I have wanted to for years.

This camera is awesome. I bought it for my husband because he wanted a GoPro camera and it turns out that the Akaso EK7000 is just as good, with a better battery life, comes with tons of accessories, and is way less in price. We are extremely happy with this purchase and I recommend this action camera to anyone who likes good stabilization. In the car, even crossing over railroad tracks seems smooth on video. We are still learning about it's features more as we go. We have yet to really try it in wet environments so I can't say anything yet about water resistance but the accessories included for it seem to be top notch quality for water resistance.

Love this "GoProless" camera. Great price and great video. I always refer to it as my "GoProless" action cam but all kidding aside it is great for the money. Lots of extras come with it but no case. So make sure you purchase a carrying case for your AKASO action camera. I did buy more batteries because they do run out but with extra batteries you are covered. I also got a windshield mount and a usb cigeret lighter charger to plug in for linger use in the car.

The EK7000 is a very good camera, and is comparable to GoPro directly (I have used my son's GoPro).  The picture is just as good, colors are true, and it works great with normal room lighting.Also, when transferring to my computer for video editing, using my editing software I can zoom in digitally without loss, or pixelating.  I also bought one of these for my daughter, and she really loves using it.  Batteries charge quickly and last about an hour of continuous use.

I was looking for a disposable waterproof camera when I came across the AKASO EK7000. I had always wanted a GoPro for all of my adventures, but it was too expensive. This totally fit the bill. I took it whitewater rafting two days after getting it. I got some great video. Still pictures are OK, but the video is really clear. You don't get a lot of volume out of it, but that is not what I am looking for. There are a ton of accessories that come with it. Battery life is pretty short, but it does come with two batteries (bring the extra on any adventure). I am very pleased with this camera and would recommend it.

We got this for our kids to use at a water park this summer.  They all have YouTube channels and wanted to record content in the water.  The GoPro was on the pricey side so we went with this and we're very happy we did.The video quality isn't as good as a GoPro, but we're not sitting professional level video.  The water proofing worked perfectly.  The app worked great as a remote as did the included remote.

What an amazing deal for sure.  Got this because my family is going on a vacation and needing something inexpensive and great quality.  This fit the bill extremely well. I have owned GoPros in the past and have had issues with refresh rates. so abandoned them. I have a sony action cam, and it works good, but this camera (EK7000) really stands out. The features alone are phenomenal. WiFi works great, the recording quality in 4k, 2k, 1080p are just brilliant.  Akaso customer service is exceptional as well. Within 24 hours they answered my email and provided guidance.  It is not a GoPro of course not and I am not sure how the GoPro5 is but for this money this camera is hands down the best out there. I am looking to purchase 2 more and still cost less than one GoPro.

Wanted to use this to record fish and other sea life while on a boat or pier.  Had to connect meter sticks and tie on the camera to be able to keep the camera stable enough and point the camera in the right directions underwater.  Much easier and worked very well as a handheld camera while riding on a boat and taking above water video while fishing.+fairly clear photos and videos underwater (especially for the price)

I have had this camera for around 6 months. I used it for several different types of videos - underwater, biking and general family videos. One thing to clarify - This is an action camera. Always produces superior quality videos for action videos where you are not really concerned about close up's. Because of the 170 degree wide angle lens, it is not ideal for close up videos.The wi-fi feature to connect to the camera to view or download videos works great too.

I don't have any experience with action cameras so I don't know if it's fair to compare it to pixel phone pic quality but this is what I'm going to do anyway. Well, with 12 MP I though the quality of both pictures and videos would be better. I purchased it to mount it on my helmet but in a meantime I tested it on a dashboard of my car. The video was not what I was expecting and the sound was extremely low - my car is not one of the most quiet cars in the world so I was actually worried that any kind of conversation in the background would be overtook by the car's noise but there was almost no sound whatsoever. It's either great deals or pricey top shelf products what I usually go for and this camera looked like a good deal. I dunno... I will keep it, give it a chance with my helmet and we will see how it goes.

Recently purchased the product. I have had used many go pro sports cam but none of them give ultra high picture and video quality.
