I like how they upgraded their product from casing to lens to video cam. However, the downside is its lens fogs up easily after being under the sun for certain period of time. It's very frustrating. I never had that issue with other sports pro cam I used. Other than said fog issue I hope AKASO EK7000 cam will last longer than my other video sports cam .

Not close to GoPro quality. Not a bad item to buy for disposable use, but its dishonest to say 4k when it doesnt record 4k.Update: After leaving my review I was contacted by the Seller and offered to ship the Pro model at no additional cost.  I accepted and received the new one a few days later.  I appreciate the gesture and it appears they have good customer service.  So, I've updated this to 4 stars.  I would still like to see them change the description to say 1080p, or whatever the actual specs are, instead of 4k.  Even if the device upscales it to 4k, it's not really recording in 4k quality.  The device does record in higher quality than an older Fujifilm waterproof camera I owned which cost more than this when I bought it.

Decided  to try a action cam,but I did not want to spend a lot of money on one. After many reviews and videos I bought the Akaso EK7000. When the camera arrived I had serious doubts about this tiny camera producing any type of usable images or video,But I took the camera out and grabbed some quick shot and to my surprise when i downloaded them they were amazingly good as you can see in the photo above.The videos are of really good  quality also. The only Problem I find with this camera is I would like to see a cover for the USB and SD card slot to keep out dust and dirt,also a microphone port .For the price I think It's the best deal going.

I recently got this camera for a family trip to Colorado.  I was pleasantly surprised with both the picture and video quality.  The video can be a bit jumpy if you don't have a sturdy mount for it and the battery life is less than desirable, but if it is mounted solidly and plugged in via USB to a power source it can record up to 6 1/2 hours on a 64 GB micro SD card.  On batteries alone it will only record for about 1 hour before needing a swap.  Videos are also limited to 30 minutes, but it will automatically start a new video after it reaches that 30 minute mark.Video transfer is a snap if you use the app and the WiFi interface, but I opted to plug it into my laptop with the provided USB cable.  It worked without issue.  It comes with a variety of mounts and the waterproof case you have to pay extra for with other brands, which is a nice feature!  Overall I am very happy with my purchase, especially with a price 1/4 of the entry level Go Pro.

#1. The image was stuck at the screen after you connected the smart phone with wifi's function.(The camera was too hot). #2.The battery can not run with 30mins for each, it only supports to 15mins or less.(It can not be a 1050mAh Battery).Or maybe I was wrong, but it is a not good quality in my mind.  #3.It is not easy to connect to the phone with the app that names Akaso DV or iSmart DV, and when I used my phone to check the video,it always get the image at stuck at the screen, freezes and lag, even I can not turn off the camera after getting connection with cam.

This is a great little camera for a price that can’t be beat. I ordered this to replace a camera I bought for my son for Christmas. The other one (different brand) was poor quality, but this one exceeded my expectations. I would put the video quality close to my GoPro 5.  The sound quality is also good but it doesn’t playback with much volume on the camera ( recordings have good quality sound when transferred to phone or computer). I haven’t taken it in the water yet . It comes with quite a few mounts so it was usable the day we got it. Also had two batteries and a desktop charger.

Awesome quality and worth every penny.  My wife and I took this on a trip to Thailand.  The quality video was amazing.  Having the ability to upload video to your phone via wifi was a life saver!  Big heads up, when the waterproof case is on, dont expect much audio from your videos.  I dropped it a few times and it's pretty sturdy.  Definitely a good investment if you're worried about losing an expensive gopro.  Recommend you purchase a selfie stick to go with this.

Item arrived with damaged waterproof case; however, the seller, AKASO-Store quickly got a replacement to us immediately. Their customer service is top notch; I couldn't ask for better communication; even during the Holidays.So far, son loves this unit. It came with several accessories.

I use this on my V-Twin motorcycle. After trying a few positions, I mounted it on the center of the handlebars, with a RAM mount in vertical position, to get shake-free video's under most conditions (road condition/speed etc).Could a GoPro do better? Maybe... Probably...

Looking at online reviews it seemed like the Akaso EK7000 was a great buy,  1/4 the price of a go pro and lots of extras.  Upon receiving them I proceeded to format new storage cards and start recording to see how long they could record for.  First one did not even save anything, the other 3 were inconsistent with recording times.  all were unable to make it past 1 hour of saved recording time.  They were failing before the battery ran out.  there was a good amount of heat produced on 60fps at 720p (the lowest setting).  Never even tried 4k.I needed a camera that would record consistently,  I don't need 4k, nor do I need image stabilization.  This did not meet the most basic needs.  Do not buy, I have had better luck with other cheap brands.

So far the camera has performed very well.  Picture quality is superb and it is easy to use.  The wrist remote is fantastic especially if you have the camera remote mounted as you do not need to access it to start and stop recording.I will pick up a suction cup mount separately as it does not come with one.  It does included many different mounts and one of the adhesive mounts could be utilized but I want something that can be relocated easily.  Also, I would have liked to see some editing options within the app for video trimming and the option to remove audio.  Again that is resolved by using a video editing app but I would have preferred it all in one place.

We are newbies to this type of camera . Purchased after mild research and we are not disappointed . The content came as promised . We have used the camera and have had no issues !  Beautiful videos that capture our children living their best life . Took it in water , no issues !  It’s the perfect little camera to fit our needs and for that we are thankful. Allowed our cousin to tinker with it - he is a photographer - and he was very impressed —> purchased one himself . Great price and great product . Look forward to capturing many family memories on this device, both on land and sea . Thank you Akaso

Do not expect good image quality from this. If you are looking for an extremely cheap action camera that you can do crazy things with and not worry about losing too much money then this is right for you. I dropped it in a pot of boiling water I put it in the dryer and I have plenty more plans on ways to try and destroy it while I'm getting some interesting footage. Your footage will look like crap though. But hey chuck it in a fire and see what happens it's only fifty bucks

I really wanted to like this camera given the overall good reviews, but the housing leaked and my camera was completely soaked when I took it SCUBA diving. The sellers claim that this camera is waterproof to 100 ft., but within the first twenty feet of my first dive with it the housing was full of water. I returned my first camera, thinking it was faulty housing. But it happened again with the second one, too, so it's clearly not just a random manufacturing issue. This camera would probably be fine for splashes, but it is surely not waterproof and should not be used at any depth. If you are a SCUBA diver, beware as I didn't even get a single dive out of either camera that I tried. A complete waste of money and time.

First off this is not going to be the same quality as a GoPro, not even close the footage is a little grainy and slightly off-color but still good quality. Second, I loved this thing! I take it where I wouldn't take my expensive GoPro and it performs perfectly. The best part is the remote connects automatically without having to sync like a GoPro so you can just pull it out and hit record.Finally, a warning on the battery they do not like even a tiny bit of salt water. On the plus side with all the free accessories, most of which you would have to buy separately for a GoPro, there's a card for free replacement batteries and accessories.

I strictly bought this for a cruise I was taking for my birthday because I knew I would be snorkeling and wanted to be able to take pictures underwater. For the price that I paid, it did exactly what I needed it to do!  I didn't want to spend the money on a Go Pro for one trip and then not really have much of a reason to use it after that. The quality of the images were decent and the waterproof case did a great job of keeping all the water out. Only issue was that it was a little confusing figuring out the settings and what buttons did what, the instruction sheet did not explain much and I found myself running in circles trying to make my way through the menus. Overall, good product for what it's worth.

Bought this primarily to use as a front "dash cam" on my bicycle to have evidence in case I get in a crash and it's working out pretty good for that purpose so far.  Video quality is great, and it came with a large assortment of attachments and mounts (more than I expected)!  I do have 3 minor quibbles with the unit.  First, it will only accept 32GB cards and I had planned on re-using a 64GB card from another device, so have to buy another card (currently using a 16GB I had on hand).  Second, I've only used it once for a ride that was right at an hour, and it shut itself off about 5 min before I got home for some reason.  Will have to see what it does on the next ride.  Finally, it breaks the video into 10 min files which are about 1.5GB each at the default quality setting; would be nice if that was a setting and I could do 3 or 5 min blocks (more video files of lower size).  Overall, great camera at this price point and I'm pretty happy with it!

I can’t review because it was stuck in the box. No instructions and the knob for accessories was so tight I could not even remove it from the packaging. This product is like putting together ikea furniture with zero instructions. Don’t waste your time

This worked fine for a year or so. It started not focusing right. Sometimes it would be clear, other times it wouldn't. Now it's at the point to where I stopped trying to use it because everything is fuzzy and I'm well beyond the year warranty. I ended up getting a hero5 to get a higher framerate for 1080p recording for clearer slow motion. This was a good camera for starting out and if it was still working properly, I probably would have not gotten the hero5. However, the slow mo at 60fps the EK7000 does is not nearly as smooth as the slow mo when recording at 120fps the hero5 does.Still, for the cost, it was a good camera until the focus issue. The video quality was really good.

I was initially a little concerned given the cheap price, but this camcorder really delivered.The images and videos come out crystal clear. It is completely waterproof, and I got some great videos coming in and out of the water on a kayaking/swimming trip with my little guy at Ginnie Springs in Florida.

Really like the camera. I bought it primarily to take underwater photos and videos and am NOT disappointed in the quality.  What I am disappointed in is that the camera freezes and stops recording video. After a few minutes you are able to power it off and on again. If you remove the battery it will reset not only the power but also the date and time. I find the batteries last about 90 minutes.I had contacted customer service regarding the "freezing" issue and they were extremely supportive and made suggestions and received responses to my questions within a day.

This camera is pretty awesome! This thing is legit I had some issues with it when I first started but once I figured it out its been great! Like for 70 bucks you can buy a small accessory lit for go pro. With this its like the camera all the accessories a charger 2 batts! Insane. I was hoping to get a decent cheap camera but this thing will have me coming back for more! Already sold another to a friend! Thinking about upgrading to the nicer camera. 4k is not that good but you probably shouldn't buy a 70 dollar camera and expect 4k quality. It just has the ability. But at 1080 its pretty amazing for the price. I use it in extreme out door environments mountains, fires, will definitely have on the mountain come snowboard season. Buy buy buy

Received the camera yesterday.  Turned it on once this morning and the screen came on, looked normal.  Turned it off.  About 20 mins later turned it back on to take a couple of photos and...white screen.  Nothing.  Removed battery, SD, waited...replaced both, turned it on...white screen.  I was unable to take one photo before it died.  Needless to say, returning it within an hour of when I unboxed it.  Feels cheap, obviously is cheap.  I suspect all these reviews were paid for.
Outstanding customer service!The first device Device locked up after 4 minutes of video requiring & got very hot.

It's easy, wether it's a back up or a starting primary action camera we all could use a good performer for a cheap price. This is the one. Not the best in real low light level situations but that not important to me. Rides my handlebars on city commutes. Also used for random landscapes shots and time-lapses. All the accessories I needed right away came with it. You still reading this? Go buy it already. seriously, these seconds you are wasting still reading this review you could have already ordered it and started watching a tips & tricks video on youtube to get ready for your new Akaso EK7000. Look you are still here and still reading, it's not like I'm going to change my recommendation at the very end. Go buy the thing. go...

ITS THE OLD STORY. IF ITS TO GOOD TO BE TRUE!  ITS PROBABLY NOT TRUE.  ABSOLUTELY NO BATTERY LIFE OF ANY VALUE.  PICTURES ARE NO WHERE NEAR MY GOPRO OR EVEN MY ION AIR PRO WIFI. THE ONLY THINGS OF VALUE WITH THIS CAMERA IS THE ACCESSORIES.. THEY ARE INTERCHANGEABLE THE  GOPRO . I AM SURPRISED THE MANUFACTURER DIDN’T CONTACT ME TO SEE IF I WAS SATISFIED. THEY OBVIOUSLY KNOW THE ANSWER ALREADY

We purchased this camera after researching the go pros and thought the reviews were excellent and thought as a good action camera starter for our son.  Got it right on time, packeting it up and he was stoked.  I will say, there are a lot of accessories and no manual at all.  No clew how to put it together or what all the accessories are for so I went to utube and found a bunch of great videos, but a little disappointed no manual.  oh well. photos taken so far are excellent and video as well.  No head mount either, which I will hopefully get.  Also, no card included so buy one that is from a good company and make sure its for action cameras as the card that goes into this camera is tiny.  Called a micro memory card.  All in all so far so good, today.  I highly recommend this product for the price point.

The camera was easy to set up and use. The pictures were typical underwater pictures - blue and no color. When I used the red filter, the pictures were much better. The red filter did not fit snug on the lens so I lost the first one when I went into the water. I made sure to hang onto the lens on the next dive and for the future, will glue it to the lens. My next step is to buy a light/flash.  Overall, the camera is worth the money especially with a few more inexpensive additions (red lens filter and light) which is needed for any underwater camera.(the last 3 pictures are without the red filter)

I reviewed a lot of action cams and this was one that was tested against the go pro. I picked it because of that. I just got it and have used it quite a few times and watched the results on my 4K Ultra tv. The video was amazing!!! I mainly use it for fishing and other outdoor activities and have been really impressed!! Those that rate it bad really don't know how to use it. The only thing I have to say bad about it is that you get a lot of accessories that you'll never use. I threw most of it away. But overall I love it!! Buying another for sure!!

Quality of video is nice 5 stars however the app and the downloading of the videos is giving me difficulty, it will read "unsupported file type"  ..making it not able to save into the device... I've removed the sd card and put it into a smart tv and it will also read incorrect format or something of the sort, but when i did the same thing with a go pro it displayed on the tv.... Great bang for your buck as far as quality, but the software/formatting is what is making it difficult.

I was really impressed with the video quality out of this little camera. I did have some problems with the cam locking up while i was using the cam or switching from view to record. Overall it worked fine once i learned how to work around the locking up problem.Update: 03/23/2020; Customer service reached out to me and sent me a new in the box replacement cam.  The cam works great and I appreciate Rebecca Luster taking the time provide excellent customer service.

Just purchased this camera a few weeks ago to run on my FPV RC cargo plane.  Was initially worried I would need the digital stabilization but as you can see, there's no need.  Very simple to operate and takes FANTASTIC video and pictures.  Remember, this is an action camera.  So don't expect a lot of still picture options (ie zoom, and flash).  I've had dozens of crashes with this on my airplane with no damage whatsoever.  I've also dropped it half a dozen times without the case.  The WIFI is awesome (just short ranged) and the remote watch works great.  I haven't run this through live FPV yet so I'm not sure how the latency is.  Best 60.00 Ive spent in a long time!

I MUST SAY I AM DEEPLY SATISFIED WITH THE CAMERA I GOT THIS MODEL FIRST AND AFTER SOME TECHNICAL ISSUES I CONTACTED THE COMPANY AND I HAVE TO SAY THE CUSTOMER SERVICES, WAS OUT THIS WORLD  THEY EVEN UPGRADE ME TO AN ELITE MODEL AND THE RESULTS ARE EVEN BETTER THAN I EVER IMAGINED DEFINITELY RECOMMEND ANY OF THE ACTION CAMERAS HERE  THEY COME READY TO USE AND PACKED  WITH A LOT OF ACCESSORIES , 5 STARS FOR THE CAMERA AND 10 STARS TO THE CUSTOMER SERVICE REPRESENTATIVES
I order this cam as GoPro was too costly for me.I am not the type of person who takes a lot of pictures.

Works right out of the box. Easy to set up, great image quality. So much cheaper than GoPro's. Highly recommended.I have one of these and another similar cheap camera. All those stupid plastic hinges/holders etc, meant for fastening the cam in different positions to whatever - forget those stupid things, they are designed by morons, mostly in terms of the way they are supposed to able to have a cam directed in any position you want.....errr no, you cant. To me they are useless. I use those long white rubberbands, much easier, attaches cams to anything, anywhere, and rubberbands never cover the lense itself.

We just ordered our AKASO EK7000 4K for a Carribean Cruise that we just returned from and it was awesome!  This camera took amazing underwater pics of fish and reef life and kids and the picture was amazing and the camera is very simple to use for pictures and video.  Our last underwater camera died after one use but this one we used every day of our cruise in the ocean and jumping off of waterfalls and it survived without issue even when I lost out of my hand during one of the waterfall jumps and it was laying at the bottom about 15 feet down and all the pictures turned out great.  Videos and Pictures were of great quality and I was even surprised how good the sound was for being in a waterproof case.  Great Buy!!!

I use this camera every time I ride my motorcycle as it is attached to my helmet. That ends up being about 4 times a week. The fov is perfect for my helmet. Shows almost everything I can see. It is great for peace of mind in case I need to use it for insurance and it is great for sending clips to friends.I have also used this camera while snowboarding, kayaking, and swimming. The case has proven to be waterproof and durable every time.

Honestly, I dont know what I have been doing without this action camera. I know a lot of people thinking about purchasing this will reserved due to the price (which is very affordable) and also the comparability with a GoPro. Yes, there is a slight marginal difference in image quality and stability, and yes, it does lack a a feature or two but honestly the differences are so minute, and unless you're trying to record for ESPN or the Olympics, they are not noticiable. I use for mountain bike trails mostly and I love the video quality I get . What this camera I think does even better than the GoPro is underwater imaging. Did some Jetski and scuba and I could not believe how clear and stable the video was.All in all, the features are amazing, using the app is easy, being able to come home and bring up the content on a smartphone or tablet through wifi in seconds is majorly convenient. The accessories included are great quality as well and non have malfunctioned on me as of yet.

First and foremost, the camera records 1080p at 60fps very well. The mount it comes with is stable, and the hardware is decent for the price.Unfortunately, I was only able to use the camera twice before I was greeted with a black screen and no use of the buttons. A new battery, SD card, or computer connection would not solve the problem. And after contacting AKASO, I have received no response or attempt to assist.

Hi! I bought this just to try for I don’t want to buy go pro for the price is too steep. I read a lot of good reviews and I told myself to give it a try for I can return it if I won’t like it.I am surprised for the video quality is so nice when I tried it. The last time I used it is when my daughter had a parade graduation due to pandemic. The video quality is so clear. I do have the app so I can upload it to my phone (iPhone) and share it right away. With all the accessories included, that’s a killer. I highly recommend this item.
Edit: In the battery compartment. I noticed it when I took out battery to charge it. It seems to be an adhesive or foam that’s in the camera housing.Initially I thought it was the battery leaking.

This camera is exactly what I was expecting. It’s a great price for the quality. The user interface can be a bit frustrating and confusing to figure out. I also had some issues with my camera glitching and freezing up while I was trying to get videos during a snorkeling experience. It didn’t get wet at all and the water proof case did great. Other than that it works wonderfully! Would recommend to others looking for a cheap alternative.

it is plastic, and feels cheap. and comes with NO INSTRUCTIONs, you have to DOWN LOAD THEM and print them yourself! They were suppose to REFUND my money for 2 things, but gave me a refund for the LOWEST ITEM I BOUGHT! NOT HAPPY AT ALL! I WAS suppose to get a FULL REFUND! $69.99 NOT $19.00 and change!

Not bad for $40 but the picture and video quality are not even in the same ballpark as a GoPro or even my iPhoneX.  The time stamp on the photos needs to go too.  Could be I just need to update a setting for that.  If I had to do it over again I’d rather have no photos/videos than the crappy ones this camera produces.  Surprised it is so highly rated.  I suppose it’s a good value for the price.  Lots of nice tools in the box as well

So far it is a very good system.  My biggest problem was getting it all unwrapped without damaging something. Some tabs on the 'screen' protection film covering the waterproof case would have helped (for example).I was concerned about what the video quality would be like after reading some of the reviews.  I found the video quality to be good in the tests I performed -- maybe the critical reviewers received a damaged or defective unit.  It is also possible that they were trying to push the video stream received by their phone to a smart TV or a Chromecast device.  It appeared that the video streamed directly from the device via WiFi was inferior to the same video downloaded and played on the target device -- that would generally be expected.

Getting the camera angled just right may require some time. my first ride on my motorcycle with the chest harness the camera was aimed a little too far downward . Come with lots of options for mounting. 720p quality still has a great picture. I kept it lower quality in hopes to save space on the SD drive and also to save battery life. Battery life is a big one having extra batteries probably wouldn't hurt depending on what you are doing with it and how long you will be away from power. Over all well worth the price in comparison to the go pro

I've only had it for about a month, but all seems to be great.  You'll need a micro sd card to have enough memory for video.  I bought this to use as a dash cam in my 2018 Tacoma.  Fits perfectly in the go pro mount already installed.  The remote is great and I attached it to my dash under the air/heat knobs with 3m mounting velcro.  Very clear picture and playback.  Battery life seems to be average.  It'll run for about 3 hours time use and more if you lower resolution.

I love this camera! I got it so that I can record my kiddo doing awesome things at the beach or pool. The outdoor quality of the video is super clear. I am so excited about taking it into the water and out on the trails. Also, you can't beat the price. It is GoPro quality footage for like a quarter of the GoPro price. The wrist remote is really nice for vlogging, action shots, and photos (which it takes photos too). WiFi app is pretty sweet too. I haven't played with that to much yet, but I think it will be useful. It also comes with several attachments/mounts, but there are several bundle options on amazon that will work with the AKASO EK7000. I bought a $20 bundle to go with this sweet camera, and I feel like I hit the Jackpot. Even my brother is going to buy one of these for himself.Don't forget to purchase a Micro SDHD 32GB memory card too.

For the price, this is a good camera to start recording your experiences. I already had a few 900mah batteries from a previous action cam so I am now WAY load with power!The waterproof case is the same as my other actions so it’s nice that everything is somewhat standardized

Great price. Came nicely packaged. Has a nice protective waterproof case included but no memory card. Purchase a memory card when you buy the camera if you want to start using it right away. Actually, I started to give this camera 5/5 but realized there is no remote in the box. It’s been sitting since last xmas because I never ordered a memory card. I’m just getting around to ordering a card and unboxing the camera and everything is there except for the remote.

The camera is very similar to a Go Pro Camera but very much cheaper. Batteries last for 70-90 minutes depending on the mode you set the camera. I would recommend this camera to anyone who is looking for sports/action 4K recording and cannot afford an expensive camera. It comes with remote control which is very helpful in certain occasions. I was not sure if this camera would work well due the price but I am so happy with it. I would buy it again.

I'll get the bad out of the way right off of the bat, and the only issue is that there are not a lot of instructions.  There is a website you can go to, but it's also not as helpful; but there are a lot of YouTube videos of people explaining how to use it.  However; on the plus side, this camera is awesome.  It comes in a nice little package with all of the included accessories as shown, but like I said there are not instructions on how to use them.  After a YouTube Video or two I was able to figure out what each one was for and how they connect, and am very pleased.  The only reason I have not ranked the water resistance as a five is because I have not tried that yet, a little hesitant to be honest.  I have been wanting an action camera for years and used a buddies GoPro, personally I love the way this operates in comparison, and the price is sooo much better!

This is by no means comparable to a GoPro. This is an extremely affordable option and an easy entry into the action camera market, but you should really save your money for a better camera. While you can technically film in 4k, the image is still very poor. There is no video stabilization built-in which may not seem like a big deal at first, but after you view your first video, you will see how shaky the video really is. No amount of post-processing can fix that.Overall: This is a good camera for $50.00, but you will want to spend more money to get a nicer camera

Purchased this camera for a trip. But have only used it for daily use with family. Overall i like the camera. The size is perfect. And it fits into my wife’s purse. Which is VERY convenient!! The app option is very cool also. Some of the pictures can go to your phone and some can wait until home. Leaving more space on your phone for when you aren’t using the camera. We are still playing around with it. But i would say so far ? It is worth it. Especially for The price & dual convenience!

I was skeptical about how good this camera would be. It comes with tons of accessories so you can set it up for just about any setting. I do wish they included a simple tripod or stand type accessory though but there are so many options with those it's best they leave that to the user. The app was easy to find but found it to be a little 'buggy', freezes when trying to delete a file. All in all, all the features and accessories for an action camera, great value.

I bought this sports action camera for my 12 year old son.  He is into motor cross riding now and wanted something to record himself riding.  We have had this camera for several months and he has took some really awesome videos with it.  The camera has great quality considering the price.  Several extra accessory's do come with the camera not much extra will be needed unless you just want something really special.  Does come with a battery charger ( I wasn't sure it did or not but it does).  I highly recommend this camera for anyone who wants to begin taking videos its a great beginner camera and also a great camera if you wont something at a decent price but want good quality.

Good for the money.  I bought to record myself out fishing.  The picture quality is good,  however don't expect to be using 4k.  The 4k quality is very choppy since it has a low screens per second.  The wrist strap is also a great addition.  The kit comes with two batteries,  however I don't feel like the batteries last long at all.  If you keep the camera on <not even recording> I expect maybe 70 minutes of battery life.  Fishing for a full day I bring a portable battery charger to charge to be able to keep camera working.  Other than that,  I feel it's very easy to download and upload videos to editing apps and youtube...I'd contemplate going with a go pro because I hear they have voice activation and I know their batteries last much longer.  Also their screens per second is much higher for cleaner images.  But if money is the main factor,  this camera gets the job done.

I just purchased the AKASO Action Camera EK7000 4K Wifi Sports Action Camera. It is my first action camera purchase.The unit came nicely packaged, and in addition to the camera itself, it came with a large assortment of accessories (see pic) including a waterproof case, a remote control that can be worn on your wrist, and various components for attaching the camera to a helmet, bike handlebars, a tripod, etc.

I got this for my son to play around with - he is 8 and dreams of being a 'youtuber'.  I thought that he could spend time learning about the camera and have fun playing around with it.  For $50, can't really go wrong.I REALLY wish that the user manual (had to download) would have been more in depth.  I have no idea what most of the attachment pieces do, which were not covered in the manual at all.  Camera seems great, but the manual stinks.

This camera is awful. The had mine a year and all it does now is turn off every 5 minutes. Usually I can get 10 minutes of video off a fully charged battery befor it shuts off completely and no matter what I do it just stays off. It was great in the beginning but after minimal use it's already dead.  Piece of junk.

Surprising good build quality on camera body out of the box....time will tell ....accessories are very good.  Video at 4K60fps is pretty good as are photos, but in-motion footage will be shakey.  I would recommend helmet mounts instead of your bike frame to improve the stability of the video.  It's also lightweight.  Remote works great and does not require pairing...a feature that GoPro could learn from.  Generous accessory bundle.  My riding buddies are buying these to augment their other cameras.

I was amazed at all of the accessories that came with this camera.  It is indeed waterproof, coming in a clear acrylic case that protects the camera.  The only thing it doesn't come with is the MicroSD card, but that's easily purchased.  It has several different mounting accessories and sticky pads, and a car charging cord.  That's great because I plan to use it in my car to record the horrendous traffic conditions we have here.

I really like this camera. For the price the quality of picture, video, and sound is great! I first bought this in October so I could test it out for my trip to Hawaii in Jan, which I am on right now. The battery that it comes with does not hold a charge long. I purchased a selfie stick that is also a charging stick so I could plug the camera directly into it and have it hold a charge through the day. It worked GREAT until the port in the camera where you plug into the charging cable collapsed into the camera. (See the top port in the picture where you cannot plug anything in anymore because the metal port fell in) There is no way for me to charge the camera now. I have to charge multiple batteries and switch them out through the day to use the camera. I was hoping to use the camera long term but I know switching batteries out through the day will get old quick. It’s definitely a design flaw as I have used this camera less than 10 times to date.UPDATE: The seller sent me a new camera because of the old one breaking. I will be using this one and updating this review if I have the same occurrence with the new camera, but so far so good!

My husband enjoys project cars and drag racing and pretty much the only thing on our TV ever is YouTube builds of drag cars, test and tunes, etc.  I wondered if he might like to make his own, so I got this for him as opposed to a GoPro since I wasn't sure if he would actually use it.  I was very wrong in my assumption that this product might sit on the shelf. He uses it CONSTANTLY and the endless hours of video I can watch in lieu of spending time with him are of great image and sound quality. Due to the lack of times he needs to renter the house from his shop I surmise that the battery life is excellent.  Highly recommend for those looking for an affordable and durable GoPro equivalent or those who wish to spend less time with their spouse.

I’ve only had this for a couple of hours..but this cámara has exceeed my expectations...for the price..it was a good investment especially for a first time user of a camera like this.I will have to say I had a bit of a hard time opening where the memory card slot. It took a bit to just to open it and to close it I also gave me a bit of a struggle.

Worst worst worst camera its the most frustrating situation trying to pair it with my cell phone, due that mo manual book coming with it,  I expected to used last weekend but was hard and complicated to pair, so I decide to put it away and enjoy the weekend with out camera, and then I started calling the tech support to help me to install it on Monday, Wednesday and Thursday and today Friday was the most frustrating situation the technician in charge was talking weird I think was drunk or sleeping, hard to understand what he saying, he make me go back to my house in order to connect it with my wifi, and make unload 3 different app to connect ot but nothing works, so I finally give up and return this pz of s

I was nervous at first but other reviews helped encourage me. I received my package today and opened it up to find out they shipped me the wrong color.... I ordered black but received a light blueish color. I don't really care and don't feel like going through the exchange process but I was more nervous than ever.  I opened the package and found a seemingly well built unit. Very comparable to the name brand cameras I've had before. I keep destroying and or losing the high priced name brand cams and wanted a lower cost alternative and was willing to take a reduction in quality both build and video wise. I'm here to tell you first hand. BUILD QUALITY AND VIDEO QUALITY ARE ON PAR WITH GOPRO! I was especially suprises at the low light performance as that's usually the worst. If I had any complaints to nit pick, being an acrobatic drone pilot, the lense doesn't deal well with sudden high light. Think flips and the sun passes across. It washes out for a spilt second then recovers.

I love this little camera now that I have figured out how to use some of the attachments that came with it. I wish they would have come with directions but I enjoy a good puzzle. Now that I that figured out I am using this camera all the time! This is a wonderful deal for the price and I would recommend to everyone who wants to start out with action cameras! I take it with me everywhere!

This is a fairly good value, given the price.  The photographs are not great.  It does not pull in a lot of light and the images are blurry.  The video is better, for my usage at least.  I purchased this camera mainly to take video for a trip with snorkeling.  I did not want to spend a lot on a go-pro.  I thought it had fairly good reviews and that if it breaks after a few uses, it was worth a try.  It was the price of a few waterproof disposable cameras.  The video had good color and was bright.  It looked like a high definition image.  The video did not have a very wide-range view though.  That is, the field of view was focused on a small area.  This may have been partially due to the shallow water depth.  I do not know how a go-pro would have looked, so it is difficult to compare.  The case fit perfectly on the snorkel gear and the camera stayed dry.  It was easy to use for someone with a limited amount of tech skills.  The remote is not waterproof.  I used a 32GB Sandisk Ultra micro SD card (not included).  Overall, it was a good value at around $45 and served its purpose.  Do not expect it to perform like a go-pro though.I watched some product reviews on youtube that do a nice job reviewing and appear to be honest assessments.

Not having any experience with this type camera, I did a little homework and ordered this one.  My purpose was to chronicle my fishing and boating activities in SW Florida.  On the day after Christmas, my son and I did a two boat trip up the Ferguson River out of Everglades City and I tried it out.  I loaded EZ iCam on my phone and had a camera mount that I'd made that stood right behind my seat in my canoe.  I alternated between the remote that came with the camera and my phone to operate the camera.  When using the phone app, you can see the image you're recording live on your phone.  I wasn't sure what I was getting but once downloading when I got back home, I was amazed at the quality.  I only took movies, but quickly discovered that you can pause in a movie and use the Microsoft snipping tool and capture an image to print or post.  I love this product and will post additional reviews as I get more familiar with it's features.

What a great video camera.  I use on my fishing YouTube channel I have called destination fish zone.  I have been very happy with the video quality.  A little hard to see the red light bleeping to know if you are recording in bright sunlight but that is probably the same with any camera in similar conditions.  I bought a second one recently.  Also I love the mobile phone WiFi viewing of the video and recording using my cell phone.  Very cool.

I purchased this camera for my parents to use when they went on their vacations last year. It was very simple to use (my parents are 70 and do not understand technology very well) and photos they took came out very clear. The wide angle lens helped them capture some pretty good photos underwater while they were snorkeling. My brother has also used this camera when he went sailing and took great photos with it. It was helpful to have the additional accessories as they helped keep the camera firmly attached to the wrist. Even now, I use it for taking photos of my family when we are at the pool or lake. The waterproof case works great! Overall, very pleased with this purchase!

I purchased this camera, along with the cold weather batteries for a snowmobiling trip to the UP Michigan earlier this year, and could not be happier with the results!I used mostly video, but the quality is perfect. And I really put it through the ringer too. I mostly ride off trail and a few of the morning we were out it was well below zero. The camera got whacked by branches, constantly snowed on, and run at 50+ mph in a -15 degree wind chill... not a single malfunction.

I really like this camera. It does what I want it to do. Two things I wish I would have known from the beginning though:1. If the battery dies during a recording, you lose the ENTIRE recording. That's frustrating. I record my tennis matches and my last battery only lasted about 55 minutes.

Ordered due to great reviews and price for a snorkeling trip. Water resistance was flawless, picture quality and image stabilization worked great as well. Every possible mount you can imagine is included, as well as an extra camera battery. The instructions that you can download are very thorough. Really like the remote feature, it would be great if that were actually waterproof too so you could use while skin-diving. Highly recommend this unit.

Overall I really like this camera, especially for the price I paid for it! Has much better video and picture quality then what i thought. I haven't tried it myself yet but I've seen a few videos of people tying these cameras to fishing poles to dunk them in the water to get some footage of the wild fish and whatever else in there (damage, water free thanks to the clear case it came with) and that's exactly what I plan on doing! Only thing I don't like about taking pictures with this camera is the motion blur is a bit too much for me. The audio for videos as well sounds decent, but honestly could be better. Thankfully you can attach other microphones to it of your choice. Picks up my voice good when i'm holding it in front of me or even holding it by my side while recording. This also came with generous amount of  accessories as well as 2 rechargeable  batteries, which is really nice for when a battery runs out because then i have a back up! Definitely plan on investing for more of this companies camera equipment in the future. I'm a happy customer. Thanks for the product!
This product worked exactly as described. It came with all the necessary equipment and the camera resolution was very impressive. You can't beat this price!Update 06/2018:

This is a feature packed little camera for the price! Takes excellent footage, and comes with a TON of accessories. It comes with 2 batteries and a separate charger although the battery can be charged in camera via the micro usb as well. There are numerous mounts and couplers to mount it up in any circumstance: dash cam, handle bar mount, helmet mount, waterproof case, a vented back plate for the case, and spring loaded clip. It also comes with a remote camera and video control. The instructions are minimal, but I was able to quickly figure it out. The documentation says it can use up to a 32gb micro sd card, but I’m rocking a 64gb with no issues. For the quality and price point you just can’t go wrong with this product!

The price and quality are great. The battery life non-existent. I have it mounted on my motorcycle helmet but a single small bump can shut the camera off. So I can’t depend on it to capture anything for recreational or insurance use. If you’re just casually filming or taking pictures this camera is perfect but not so much for any active adventures.

Would have generally given a 3 star ratings, but then taking the price into comparison, with similar HD action cameras in the market, needed to give a 4 star rating. Was a bit concerned before ordering the product though the reviews were good. But after using it for the first time, considered it a good value for the money.Though 170 degrees is the mentioned angle, close up shots looked more like a fish eye at the edges. Long shots did not seem to have the effect or at least was not notable.

I ended up returning this because it was just not reliable. It is a great camera for those on a budget, which is why I purchased it. But the battery life was unpredictable and sometimes it wouldn’t turn on. I spent more time trouble shooting it than actually using it.

Got this camera to chronicle my waterfowl\upland bird hunting.  Awesome little camera with a wireless remote that straps to your wrist.  It hooks up to your phone as well with Wi-Fi but find that it kills the battery life much much faster than using the wrist remote.  I'm not sure that it has a microphone because the few videos I've made had none.  Not a deal breaker for me though.  Great little camera for a stellar price.  Would recommend this to anyone wanting a good action camera without paying the high price of a GO-PRO.

I was about to shell out hundreds of dollars for a more expensive brand of Action camera. That would have been such a waste. Its so wonderful that this camera comes with so many different accessories. I will say that the amount of accessories was a little overwhelming and I don't think enough instruction was given on how to use all of them, but a quick YouTube search helped with that. I will definitely be buying more as gifts.

Bought this camera rather than a gopro for the same reason you're reading these reviews... super cheap! I was impressed to get a bunch of free accessories in the box along with an extra battery.Overall, what do you really want out of an action camera? It has intuitive controls, clear video, and writes everything to a microSD card. I haven't tried the software but I hate uploading videos through wifi anyway regardless of the product.

I love to ride my ATV, and bought this product for that reason. was exited to try it out. and It worked perfectly. The mount stayed stable to my helmet & ATV and I had no problems. I tried using 4k, just to try, but 25 frames is just not enough. It is very spotty and you can barley enjoy the video. Other than that AND it's complete inability to pickup the SLIGHTEST bit of audio other than the slight rumble of the ATV. Even with the case off, the mic pickup is not great. One thing I must mention is the wide angle lens. It was great, as I could get the whole area in one video. I used it at a pool, made awesome underwater shots, as it is completely waterproof.  I have not tried all of the mounts, but I have tried a few. The adhesive mount stuck instantly onto my helmet and stuck well, but then I bumped the mount and it unstuck, but that was on me. Overall, if you want a dependable, and very capable camera, go with this one, as it is the quality of it is that of a $300 GoPro brand, (I did quite some research) with the price of a cheap one.

I’m pretty good with technology, so getting this camera should not have been a problem. The directions are thoroughly in adequate. I was able to connect this to my iPad through Wi-Fi one time, the connection was lost, and could never we connect again. The fully charged battery lasted only about 15 minutes. I followed the directions exactly to use time lapse video mode, but no time lapse video  was recorded. Devices like this should be easy to use, and in 2018  I have no tolerance for devices that make you work.

When shopping around for cameras, I was primarily looking for something I could bring kayaking. Therefore, there were a few features that were essential to me:1. The camera had to either be waterproof, come with a waterproof case, or have a cheap waterproof case available;

This little camera works great for the price.  We initially were looking at GoPro like everyone does.  We came across this product and after comparing features we decided to give this one a try before we purchased the much more expensive GoPro.  We use the camera in less than extreme conditions and we have to say that for us, this is a great option. We have purchased a few aftermarket mounts from GoPro for it.  These mounts are of obviously higher quality than the ones we received with our camera, but for the price, the ones we got were completely functional.  For us, this camera is perfect.  Thanks Akaso!

I'm old and tech stuff often frustrates me. Not this time. Comes with a link to a pdf user manual that walks you thru step by step. I'm thrilled with the results. Used it as a dash cam, made an instructional video and if spring ever comes to New England it will go on my bike handlebars.  Everything works as advertised including the app I put on my iPhone.  You don't need to buy the extra attachments package - it comes with enough stuff to keep you busy.  Very pleased with this purchase.  You'll probably want a multi card reader though - it makes it easy to pop out the sd card stick in in your computer to save your vids. I learned they are too big to attach to emails but if you use a free google drop box you can send them to everyone.

My daughter wanted a camera to video herself on the skateboard and after messing with a cheaply made one with low video quality I decided to upgrade her and got her this one. The video quality is very good and the camera itself is easy to use. The only reason I didn’t give it a 5 star rating is because it came with now instructions on how to set up all the mounting  accessories so it’s like a puzzle without the final picture. It’s pretty frustrating so she hasn’t  been able to use it on her helmet as she hoped. She holds it and that’s good enough for now. I’ll probably have to go on YouTube to see if someone can explain all these extra parts to me.

Everything works great right out of the box.  Exactly as described.  Great quality video.  My favorite part is that I can connect it to my phone and record video on it via the phone, while the camera is in another part of the house or just away from me.  It also came with so much stuff, including two batteries and a whole bunch of mounts, all different for different setups.  I was surprised by how much you get with this camera.  I definitely recommend!!

I used this camera on one trip for a few days and it worked great. The quality was amazing and we had so much fun with it. However, a week later on our next trip we pulled it out and couldn't get it to work. When we press the power button it turns on and shows the "AKASO EK7000" screen. With no SD card in it says "No Card" but we can see the screen as if ready to video/photograph. When we put the SD Card in the screen goes black and we can't see anything anymore. It's a SanDisk SD card shown to go with the camera. Can't figure out what the error is and very frustrating to only seem to be able to get that one use out of it.

I've been disappointed with this camera.  I bought this to replace an Eken 4K Ultra HD Camera which died after a few years of use..  The Eken camera appears to be the same camera (same form factor, batteries, and accessories), but did not have the same issues which are as follows:1. Regardless of the video resolution, the camera will not record consistently.  It creates multiple files of varying lengths, with gaps in the video of a few seconds.  This makes the camera almost useless.

Camera works very well except and BIG except: it does not expose the shot properly when used in 20+ feet in depth of water. I used this camera on 5 separate scuba diving trips and the housing never flooded. Deepest I took it down was 70 ft. The problem is that it has trouble capturing details in mixed lighting conditions. It blows out midtones and highlights to compensate for shadows and leaves ugly footage. The only time it worked it fine is when I aimed the camera lens at areas that were not exposed to bright light (mixed lighting conditions) and the colors and exposure were the same throughout. You may also want to keep in mind that the colors rendered by the camera are not true. This isn't the camera's fault but the need for a red color filter to compensate for the loss of color as you descend.When used for mountain biking though, this camera produces AMAZING footage. Can't complain about that. Smooth 1080P video and vibrant colors. Do note that colors are saturated so you may want to tone it down in post. Beside that, this is a great product for the price. The user would need to know how to use it according to conditions though.

Camera is very easy to use even grandma can give it go. Its a very unique camera. Quality is alright, it will also adjust to nighttime. You will still need some sort of light though. The only thing i would change is the battery life. It tends to die quickly.I would just suggest getting the upgraded version of the camera. It really a simple small camera. Really easy to replay videos. Customer service was also very kind and made me feel like a customer again. Answer all the questions i asked.

Bought this camera for vloging after tons of browsing. I saw over 14,000 positive reviews and decided to try it. All I can say is WOW. The amount of accessories, the build quality, the wifi,the expandable memory, extra battery and charger. The video is fantastic in an affordable action camera.. I have other action cams costing much more that are not as complete as this little beauty. It even has a remote and waterproof case...I will definitely recommend this as a great device and look forward to buying other AKASO products as well.

We are taking a trip down with a group to Pigeon Forge for a week long Baseball Tournament.  Thought it would be fun for the kids to have a "GoPro" for the ziplining, roller coasters, etc.  Found this camera bundle, and all of the parents are still amazed at the overall package of what is received and the very low cost.  Took forever to sort through all the accessories for mounts, but in a good way !  They really prepare you for a great experience out of the box.  A charger and two batteries is a nice touch.  So is the remote.Nothing but happiness with this purchase.  It does not come with a SD Card (Which is good, since you will want to get one of type an size of your preference), so order one from Amazon at the same time.  Much cheaper here.

Easy to set up, works with pretty much any universal camera accessory. Photo & video quality is awesome! No issues so far with any of the typical bumps & abuse using it on our outdoor adventures. Battery life has been fine (I do turn it off when not actively in use just to help prolong the need for changing the battery). Connects to my laptop without any extra software. Looking forward to using it more once the Coronavirus travel restrictions are lifted!

I am a photo hog and very active. I hike, kayak, etc. as often as possible. I was using my phone in a waterproof case but found it was taking away from actually enjoying the views. I love how this has a wrist remote, great feature. I also bought an accessory kit so I can wear the camera on my chest.  Although I have never had any other type of action camera I will recommend this to anyone. Great features, great price, wonderful camera!!!

I bought this camera for live streaming.... which it doesn't do, so now its going to be used to record other videos. I have also noticed that people are asking about the maximum size for an SD card i bought a 128 gig sd card and it works just nicely!

Very happy with it so far. Received it on the same day ordered. Packaging was great. Many extra parts. Came with two batteries. Couldn't mount it on my Goldwing so my wife was holding it while riding on the back. We got caught up in the rain, she started recording. Came home and downloaded it on my laptop. Video quality was pretty darn good. Audio could be better but I put music in the background anyways. Overall, I am very happy with it so far. Hope to make more videos soon. I would definitely buy another one in the near future.

Let me start by saying this camera is awesome! Not only does it feel and look great but it has an amazing camera. The video quality is crisp and bright. Even in a poorly lit room the video quality is still there and pretty nice. I also love that the camera has built in filters and white balance to help with lighting situations. lighting is key lol.  It is very easy to use and comes with tons of accessories! i love the water proof case that comes with it. It snaps and just hugs the camera all snuggly like. I honestly dont think i will have a problem with it leaking. It comes with tons of mounts and an awesome wireless remote that looks and feels like a nice watch.I can keep going on about how much I love this this camera but ill cut it short by saying this camera is worth the buy.  they did not skimp out on quality with this one. For the price you can not beat it. The video quality is awesome too! This camera was everything I expected it to be! If you are considering buying one. I highly recommend this model :)

I bought this as a gift for my son, we haven't had a chance to use it just yet. The only issue I've had was inserting the SD memory card. Something seemed to be wrong with the slot. It wouldn't stay inserted all the way in, it seemed it was engaged like it already had a card in the slot. After some time I did manage to get it in correctly. We did do a practice video and took a picture, it has nice quality. We cant wait until the weather warms more to try it out.

Great camera for under $100! The camera is very light, almost delicate, but the waterproof case fits perfect. The only downside with the case is it muffles the sound when recording. That may be the case with all waterproof cameras though. The attachments are abundant, but I do wish the bumper case enclosed the entire camera. Charges great, great video and sound, and fairly easy to use. The instructions are broken English and the App they advertise is non existent, but I've found a couple apps (iOS) that work well. I didn't realize this was Wifi, not Bluetooth, so the pairing is like pairing to a router. No problems there. All in all, I bought this for my daughter to play around with outside and on vacations...perfect starter camera vs a GOPRO.

Had this for awhile now and finally used it at an Arena Driving Trial last weekend. I used the chest mount instead of the helmet mount, just because. Adjusting the angle was easy and if you hit the right button (the gray one) on the remote the camera takes lovely video! I found the clarity and sound to be excellent. I shot my Hazards course, which was about 16 minutes long over differing terrain, and the camera didn’t get hot like I read in other reviews. I got great video of my horse’s butt and the beautiful Prescott National Forest. And having it was great backup for those times you might get called of course when you’re not! For the price you can’t beat this camera. As other reviews have stated, direction suck, YouTube them 😁
I'm going to try not to make this a jumbled mess, photos on a class 10 SD card provided for feedback.Pros:

I got this for my Barber class to record my practical portion of the classes for grades. I only got it yesterday and so far it is doing what I want. The only thing is the instructions and how we have to get on the computer and they really are not good instructions and it comical that they just show the picture of the accessories you need and the addition to the equal of what it's suppose to look like without any details. It seems easy, but it's not for me so they shouldn't think everyone is capable of looking at a picture and putting it together and they are not good pictures anyway which is funny since I'm buying a camera that takes pictures. Once I figured it out, so much time wasted, I rigged it on my microphone stand using the accessories for bike handles and secured it with the velcro strap. For the price and what I want to use it for seems to do the trick. I'm having difficulty downloading the videos from the app ISmart DV, don't know what's up with that.

Camera has great quality video. Have used many times since purchase, and have not had any negative issues with the camera.Added bonus of all the attachments, extra battery, charger for 2 batteries at a time, rear screen (did not have on old camera), remote control makes this a tremendous bargain!!!!

Have been wanting a decent sports cam for a long time. After a lot of research, I came upon this. Got good reviews here and on Youtube, so went for it. Glad I did. Excellent camera for the price. I just wish these kinds of cameras came with a port for an external mic.  Looking forward to Vlogging with this little gem. I'm including a still of a sunset I shot with this camera, without any kind of filters. Came out fantastic! Couldn't be happier!

Bought it because of the good reviews. Right off the bat, when I turned it on and wanted to start recording, it started lagging and not recording properly. Tried this 2 more times and did the same thing. I would rather spend on something more durable and that will guarantee better results. Also, I have read reviews of video settings not being as good as mentioned and that was a second reason for returning it.

Based on reviews, I decided to give this a try.  Just got  back from a ski trip and took almost 100GB of video.  The quality is very good, and I used primarily 1080p and 2.7k video modes.  The only issue (as others have mentioned) is that the video stops after 5 minutes, but it will continue, just in another video file.  So I did not lose any video.  Not a huge deal as can easily put them together with editing software anyway.  The still picture quality was also very good.  The battery lasted maybe two hours, but having a second one on hand was great (which comes with it).  I found the camera easy to use, and easy to change out battery.Will be taking it for underwater filming in a few months, and based on usage so far am very pleased with quality, especially given the price versus GoPro!

Admittedly, this is my first venture into action cameras. However, I can't believe the value when compared to the highend products out there. The picture is great. Comes with lots of accessories right out of the box. EASY to Use!The Live Preview app is simple once you get the hang of it (see below).

First impressions stick with me, and upon opening the box, I was greatly on the fence.In one hand, this thing is light. And in the case, it just looks so nice. I gathered everything from inside the box and was impressed by how much hardware is included. I sorted everything, and noticed that there are two batteries with no charger, and I'm missing the advertised watch.

I purchased the AKASO EK7000 4K WiFi Sports Action Camera for a couple specific uses.  I have a lot of animals on my property and enjoy capturing photos of them.  This little camera can be placed close to where the birds bathe and the deer congregate.  I can use the remote control to turn the camera on and off.  The waterproof case allows me to leave it out in the rain.  Additionally, it is useful for events like weddings where it can be mounted unobtrusively and turned on remotely to gather the scene,  Picture quality is amazing for the size.  It is a nice compliment to other cameras for zoom and close up shots.  At a wedding in Denmark, I used it to record a "traditional" plunge in the harbor.  I also used it to record reception speeches and activities with great success.  Given the quality and versatility, I am upgrading my review from 4 to 5 stars.

the quality is great! Pictures and videos are clear and lighting turns out great. Waterproof case works perfectly. Functions are easy to figure out- I know nothing about cameras and was able to figure it all out within a few minutes. The WiFi feature is great. You just download an app and you can instantly view all media on your phone and save it or share to social media!Would buy again in a heartbeat!

We are at this point trying to avoid buying things from China but for the money its not a bad little camera. We use it on our airplane as a wing camera, used it a couple of times. The picture in high definition is excellent. It stops recording after 45 minutes on this setting and in 720k 24 frames it lasts about an hour, even with a charge on the battery. The battery has to be removed from the camera to be charged. No audio input.

The Akaso EK7000 is a great starter action cam. The price for the functionality is a steal! My only issue is that the stabilization is not very good and you are not able to playback the videos directly on the camera. I have only had the camera for about a week but am so far very pleased with my purchase. Since I have not had much previous experience with action cameras, I am very happy with the cost for me to get the feel for the action camera and how to best use it. I did a lot of research prior to my purchase and this particular camera had really great reviews coming in above other well known action cam brands due to the price as well as quality of the Akaso EK7000.

In my initial review I reported that I was happy with the camera but the remote was faulty.Well I guess customer support listens and reacts. Shortly after my review I was contacted by customer support and they offered to send me a new remote. Of course I was happy to hear from them and accepted their offer. Not only did they send me two remotes but also included an extra battery and misc. accessories for my troubles.

I like this camera so far so good. I havent tried it in water yet but i will soon. I got this to start vlogging and didnt have as much to spend on an expensive camera but this works just fine especially for just starting. Lots and lots of accessories come with this camera as well as 2 batteries which is great to be able to switch out when needed. The wrist remote is also a cool addition. Still figuring out the rest of the parts but overall this is a great buy. I can do an updated review when i have it for a while. Also came very well packaged and fast.

This is the first action camera I ever purchased.  I've seen advertisement of GoPro all over the place but did want to spend a fortune to purchase the toy.  I looked up Amazon and found Akaso EK 7000, which was priced at $59 and got really great reviews.  So I decided to buy it for my upcoming snowboarding trip.  After unpacking the box, I was immediately impressed how well built this tiny little action camera was.  .  I also purchased a pack of Luxebell Accessories Kit which also works great with the camera.  So I took the camera to the ski slopes and it was not disappointing.  It was extremely easy to use.  With the wristband remote control that I wore on my wrist, I could start/stop filming, taking pictures at ease.  I used the waterproof casing that comes with the package and mount it on my helmet and selfies stick.  I'm extremely happy about this camera and would recommend it to anyone who is looking to purchase a really affordable action camera.

Bought this for my wife's birthday. So far, we love the video quality of the camera and all the different accessories you can use. She's already used it on her bike rides - it fits well on the handlebars, and you can easily take a video while riding. While we still have some things to figure out with it, such as pictures, sound quality, etc., it is overall a great product for capturing our activities.

This is the second action camera I purchased. The first was a slightly cheaper (~$50), different brand, and it was awful. When I received the Akaso (~$70) I was very surprised at how much better it was than the cheaper alternative.------

I used this camera when my husband and I went to Akumal, Mexico in February 2020. We did a lot of snorkeling.  I had never used an underwater camera, so wasn't sure what to expect. I purchased it based on price and reviews. I didn't want to spend a lot of money just in case it didn't work out- didn't want to waste too much money.  It worked better that I had expected. I took thousands of pictures, because I wasn't sure if they would turn out. Well, I know have A LOT of pictures of sea turtles, sting rays, fish, coral, and shells. It was easy to use once I goofed around with it for awhile before going snorkeling. I also purchased a Crosstour Floating Hand Grip Waterproof Handle. It worked great. It gave me an extra "hand" because the camera is small. I was afraid that I might drop it in the ocean.  I also bought Nordic Flash Waterproof Camera Float straps to go on the camera- just for an extra piece of mind. I didn't want to loose the camera. All in all, I would definitely recommend this camera. It was very waterproof and didn't worry at all.

This was my first action camera. I have been tempted to buy one for a while and try my hand at motovlogging, but I didn't want to spend too much money. The high end cameras I'm sure are great, but I couldn't see buying one of those for my first camera. Just too much money.I finally decided on this camera and I'm glad I did. The picture quality is fantastic. I've been shocked at how good it is. It also came with quite a few accessories. The quality of everything seems good to me. I have no complaints at all. I no longer want to buy a more expensive camera. When this one finally dies, I'll just buy another one. It's a great camera.

This camera works just as well as one you would pay $300+ for. Comes with a ton of accessories as well. The videos come out very clear and the pictures are not pixilated or anything. Read the directions carefully before taking it under water. I would definitely recommend this action camera to a friend!! If you want to use the camera right upon receiving it, make sure you have a memory card as it doesnt come with one

I just love this little action camera! It is extremely clear with 4K resolution and perfectly water proof to give me confidence to take anywhere. I also like the fact that it comes with tons of mounting adapters and connectors for every situation. It's great that it is so small that I can take it along with me in my DSLR bag. The other brands are much more expensive but for a budget camera this little guy packs a wallop!

The AKASO camera delivers on what it promises. It has pretty decent image quality and the connectivity to the mobile app works well. Ultimately, this product is great for the price. There are only two critiques I could give when it comes to the overall package. First of all, the sound quality was terrible. When speech did come through, it was incredibly muffled at best. Now, that doesn't matter a whole lot if you're snowboarding or waterskiing (since there would be lots of wind rushing by anyways), but if you're walking through the forest or sitting around a campfire and want to capture the audio it may be worth looking at other options. Second, the set of mounts given in this package are largely useless. There are maybe 2 or 3 that could be realistically used, so I'd recommend getting a separate body mount or gimbal if you want something reliable. These critiques being given, this camera is great quality for the price.

The packaging was nice. It came with a lot of Accessories for mounting on many platforms. The camera itself is pretty easy to use. Go to YouTube for a video instruction set up. The password for the WiFi is 1234567890. Had to watch the video to find out. No real instruction come with the camera. So the video was very helpful.Now for the quality. Videos come out really nice with many options in the menu for images per second. Battery life could be better. If you buy a motorcycle mount make sure it comes with a tether line, so you have extra security if the 3m sticky tape doesn’t hold up. That’s just a personal suggestion. They are also available on Amazon. It comes with a waterproof case to keep the rain out and as well be used underwater. Have not tested the underwater capabilities yet, but when I do you all will be the first to know.

For the price, can’t believe how great this camera is. I’m assuming the video I uploaded will be compressed, but the true quality is amazing. Loooing at purchasing a second in the near future for multiple angles.

I needed an 4K action camera, and I was on budget : )............ Now I use one camera for everything and that is my AKASO 4K/EK7000. This unit is incredible. I shoot it from the hip, from behind, upside down, under spray of waterfall and pointing at a racing hare - every shot looks great! I'm still working on mastering the camera pictures/video, but from what I've seen this camera is a great buy especially in this price range. It's a great camera for travel due to its convenience.

Cant beat the camera for its price. The above water pictures came out really good despite being in the water proof case. The waterproof case did its job really well to. Went snorkeling and it worked perfect. As well as took it Scuba diving at 40 ft. The case held up, and the pictures still came out good. I didn’t grab a red filter so the pictures are green as expected. But at shallower depths the pictures still came out crisp and clear. I’m not a professional photographer, but anyone wanting to capture the moment without paying $400, its a perfect buy. Battery life lasted the day, but I powered off when unneeded. Yet to use all the attachments.Don’t mind the date in the pictures. Somehow changing the batteries or something reset them. All from this year, 2020.

I wanted to get a GoPro for ski or water activities, but when I checked the price-tag for the original GoPro it was too high. Then I started searching and came across this one. It does everything GoPro does and it comes with a ton of attachments, so you don't even need to buy an extra accessories kit. I literally cannot think of anything you can't attach it to. I use it with 64GB card, which works with no problems. It has very wide view and image stabilization is amazing considering with this price. Definitely recommend for others who are searching for cheaper GoPro alternatives.
Insanely good pictureI cannot however figure out how to take shots over 10 minutes at a time.

First of all, if you like the price buy it! It works just fine for all different shots. It comes with some great accessories and a waterproof case as well as many great mounts for all different types of action shots.  We are using it for an independent film that needs to have some great action shots. We tried other action cameras (non-GoPro) and they don't compare to the quality of this camera.  The only downside was the difficulty of connecting to WiFi.  We used the app suggested in the manual and it is spotty at best.  Overall, great camera and great price. If you're on the fence about it, I suggest to buy it. It works well!

I just received my camera about a week ago and it's awesome! I'm still figuring out some of the settings, but all in all I can't complain.  You can pair it to your phone and see what it sees in real time. I used it several times to record what I do at work . It't pretty easy to download the files to your phone or computer too. I love it and would recommend it to anyone looking for an affordable action camera!

It works for my needs.  Customer support is a little slow, as I had to wait 24 hrs. to receive a response to each e-mail sent.  However, the support was great (thanks Margaret).  Initial camera had a recessed button that was working properly on the side of the device.  An exchange was setup promptly, well as promptly as 24 hrs. for each response can be.  Purchased this to record my daily commutes on bicycle.  Plenty of mounts and extremely decent video capture.  I have it on loop recording so I get a 10 minute snap of my, approximately, 17 minute rides.  The reason I keep it on loop recording is so that it overwrites the data on the card that I don't need because the majority of my rides are incident free.  I can recommend to folks who are in my situation.  Can't speak for any other uses however.

This is an amazing camera! I am able to do just about anything with it! It works with lots of mounts and attachments. It can take amazing panoramic videos and photos! The only changes I suggest are a better microphone (for taking videos without waterproof case on), and a VIDEO time-lapse mode. It comes with the basic mounts (bike and helmet). It can connect to the the iSmart DV app and AKASO DV app. It can be used as a webcam too! You can charge the battery while it’s in the camera. Compatible with Micro-HDMI. Comes with two batteries and a charger.

I was impressed at first, especially for the price! But if you plan on using the camera with the waterproof case I had many issues with the camera over heating (is my guess) and shutting off or the screen freezing...both would lose any footage that was supposed to be recorded. Note that this was not after extended use, it did this at 2-3 minutes into the videos almost every time. Then would not work for 30+ minutes after that while it cooled down. If you plan on using it without the case it might work better, I honestly got too frustrated with it to even keep messing with it. This could just be a problem with the one I received for all I know. But it comes with lots of accessories, which I was excited about! Maybe once my frustration goes away I will mess with it again and have better results, but not going to get my hopes up.

Camera came with no issues that I could see.I know other reviews have/had said things about the time lapse not working, but it DOES work. It has options to take a picture every 2,3,4, etc. seconds and I've tested it and it does work. It's possible it did not work previously.

nice clear pictures, even under water. with so many different attachment to use, this was on my baseball hat brim.I love the fact that it has a remote wrist band so that you can take pictures or video's with out taking the camera off your hat to change format.

I bought this camera as an entry-level for my son that uses RC's definitely very happy with the quality and all the extra features that came with it I think it is the best value for your dollar as an entry-level camera before you get a GoPro.. I don't think that you're going to find any better quality camera it's definitely high quality amazing waterproof case very happy with that my son's very happy we transferred from RC's to riding quads and everything in between
