This little camera does the job of a much more expensive counterpart, all for the fraction of the price. I love all the ways in which I get to use this camera they I can't with my phone. I have it mounted on my motorcycle helmet and it helps keep me honest while driving, but his others accountable on the road as well. I also have submerged it in my reef tank and it's been fun seeing the cities and fish up close in their environment.

IMO, you can't beat this camera in this price range, or even with more expensive cameras! I bought this action camera so I could "take" my ladyfriend on rides on my motorcycle even though she's 6000 miles away. After seeing the way it mounted to the handlebars, I was rather dubious as to whether it would work very good. I was pleasantly surprised! The resulting video was clear, sharp, and did not have the fuzziness from the vibration of the bike that I had expected. The remote control that is worn on the wrist is a very important feature for me considering how I plan to use the camera. I don't have to fumble with the camera to turn it on and off while riding.  I am in the process of figuring out how to permanently attach the mounts to my helmet. I don't fully trust the sticky pads provided with the camera. I would suggest this particular camera for those with a limited budget. The attached video, which was shot through the windshield of my bike,  is a small example of the picture you can expect. Much better than I had anticipated!

I've had this camera for about a week and so far I think it's a fair value. I took off one star because the instructions were vague and had several typos, indicating a lack of editorial oversight. The camera comes with loads of mounting options, which is excellent, but there are absolutely no instructions on how to use them. It's mostly intuitive so I did figure it out after fiddling for a bit, but I was very surprised at the complete lack of instruction.Once I figured out how to get it working, the camera itself works just fine. Video and picture quality are as expected. I've found the wrist control to be mostly useless so far due to the fact that the camera powers off too quickly when not in use, but I can probably fix that in the settings. Overall, I think the product is a fair value at this price point, but don't expect to be up and running within five minutes of opening the box.

I bought this camera for my upcoming honeymoon where we plan to snorkel. Since we will be taking photos underwater, I specifically wanted the dive mode feature. In the Q&A section, a customer asked if this camera had dive mode and Akaso answered saying that it does. This version does NOT have dive mode. After looking into buying filters that I could make fit the housing (there are currently no red filters on the market made specifically for these cameras) I decided it would be cheaper and easier to return this and purchase the Akaso EK7000 Pro.So far I am much happier with the Pro version. I feel like the lighting is better than with the regular EK7000. There are also more settings available.

If you aren't an everyday surfer or extreme sport fanatic but still want a GoPro style camera, this is perfect. Only came out of the casing once but its been great so far. Mainly using it for capturing media for an everyday vlog, nothing too extreme but it gets banged up a bit.  Came with almost everything I needed sans the tripod but that's no biggie. Has two batteries and a remote plus tons of clips and fixtures. Nice camera, happy I got it.If you're going to vlog, get a tripod and a mic since it doesn't include them. The mic is decent for action but won't catch those nuances like a yeti. Both of these aren't minuses but to be expected.

I am a musician and a YouTuber, I need it a cam that I can attach to my guitar and get some good videos. So far the Akaso EK7000 has giving me good quality video. Since I only need the image I don't use the audio from the Akaso device. I like the control, I can activate the camera to record when I need it. It comes with two batteries, but since I leave it on for one hour, I drain it fast. I do play live so I really need a good battery. I plan to buy another Akaso so I can have more multi angle shoots.

If you are considering this camera don't spend another second thinking about it and Buy it Now! I wasn't sure if this little action sports camera would be any good or not but I can tell you that I am Very Impressed. The camera is easy to use right out of the box and has wifi capabilities to connect to your cell phone to view or upload your pictures or videos. No regrets on this camera! The price is fantastic and it came with a ton of mounting accessories. Works exactly like I had anticipated! I Highly recommend this sports action camera for anyone who is thinking about buying it. Go ahead and do it.
Good product for a knock off, but I think you get what you pay for.Screen had bubble in it like they didn't adhere the glass correctly(if it actually is glass)  Looks like

Initially purchased this camera to record basketball games as last year was my first year coaching high school basketball and always found watching footage when I was younger as a useful tool for growth/improvement. I was honestly blown away with the quality of this camera. A buddy of ours has a Go-Pro camera and we compared footage and honestly we were both blown away at how comparable the image/color quality was. With the season being over and my new found love for this camera I even use it for recording family videos. Super happy with my purchase and have recommended this camera to several friends/family. Love that the camera also came with 2 batteries that has been super helpful!

Bought this for my girlfriend for our trip to Jamaica. I didn't want to purchase something expensive if she lost or damaged the camera so I went with this. After reading reviews I have to admit I was very impressed with the camera. I actually used it the whole time to document our trip and then create a video of it after. Such a great camera an the watch is great to to start or stop the camera. If you are hesitant about go pro prices like I was do yourself a favor and get this camera it will not disappoint. I read a lot of reviews on this and that's what made me purchase this camera so I hope this gives you a good explanation.

I really wanted an inexpensive action camera, and this fit my needs. It has everything but the memory card you need to get started. I bought a 64 GB Sandisk Ultra Micro SDXC UHS-I card even though the instructions that came with the camera said max of 32 GB for some reason. Everything has worked flawlessly, and the included remote is a great idea when you mount the camera on a helmet and can't get to the buttons. I recorded a few rock climbs in Red Rocks and the videos turned out great, although the color washed out a few times but I'm not sure why. I'm still messing with setting and mounting options to get the best footage.

I purchased two of these cameras. Each came with two batteries, a double battery charger, and several mounts, although I also purchased a bag of mounts. I bought these for bicycling and for the car. The picture quality is excellent. Unknown about the sound quality as the waterproof case blocks a lot of sound. The battery life is the problem for me. The description says they should last 1.5 hours, which is the absolute minimum time I need, but all four batteries lasted less than 1 hour each, so I returned the cameras. If you only need short video time or are not taking many photos, this is an excellent camera, but if you want additional time, look elsewhere.

I bought this almost a year ago, and I still consider it one of my best spent purchases ever. If you are looking for a cheap yet overall good action camera, this is the one for you. This was the third action camera I had bought within the $100 price range and for the price, it was definitely the one that stood out. I was able to compare it side by side with a Hero3, and it stood right up to its $300 dollar predecessor.I am an avid adventurer and one that does go easy on the use of my cameras. I bought this last year with the intent of a cheaper camera that I could put in harm's way. That is what I did. Growing up in the jungles of South America and being able to use this in the jungle setting, I tied it to a tree for monkeys to play with, filmed a piranha underwater with it, and stuck under a Land Rover to get the perfect shot. It has been deep in caves and mounted on sailboats. It literally has gone through about every test an action camera can have, and it has not failed. It is still going strong.

I've been using this camera as both a body cam and a makeshift webcam ever since April, and I've gotta say that I'm extremely happy with it. In daylight, the image quality leaves little to be desired, and even in the semi-dark of an office or bedroom it's still perfectly serviceable. The battery life is long enough for really any extended activity, and it comes with a spare right out of the box, as well as a selection of clips and adapters to mount the camera on all manner of surfaces and harnesses (which aren't included, but hey, it's 50 bucks).Good stuff. Highly recommended.

Great value, great price! I took the camera to the beach this weekend for a test and it did great!! Great presentation on the product when the package arrived. It comes with a lot of useful attachments for the camera/case.  The video quality is very good. There's good  sound on the videos, when you put it in the water resistant case, it is a bit muffled, but you can still hear some. I am very happy with the purchase!  I look forward to using this camera on our adventures and hikes!

I originally had an issue with the camera having poor sound quality in the case. The camera has sat for the last six months not being used.A customer service representative from Akaso, Jack emailed me offering a refund, and help with the camera. Come to find out I did not look through the box... There is a camera frame that allows you to use the camera without the waterproof case. I am happy to say the camera and sound quality are exceptional. I am also very satisfied with the level of customer service I received from Akaso.

Would not recommend this camera!! Bought this for my son for Christmas, since we were going to Disney right after. The house we rented had a pool, so my son recorded several videos of him running around and swimming. The video skips on every recording. It’ll be smooth, then start skipping, then back to smooth, skip, etc. Very disappointed in this!! He loves outdoor activities and wanted this camera so much, to record his activities and progress. Can’t believe some of you gave this 5 stars. Must work for the company or getting paid.

This little camera is perfect for what I wanted it for, casual use filming simple things. It doesn't have a lot of bells and whistles but what it offers is simple and to the point.The build quality is adequate, set up and use is simple, nicely packaged and comes with several accessories, picture and video quality are very good. For such an inexpensive action cam, the EK700  does a great job. I'm very happy with my purchase.

I originally bought this camera with the intention of starting a youtube channel. However, I decided against the YouTube channel idea and will use this for family home videos for when we go on trips and cavations (in the farout future, because of coronavirus). It is the perfect travel size and won't take up much room to put in a bag. It is also incredibly light so it won't add anymore weight to a bag that you're carrying. It definitely stables my videos very well, as I have shaky hands sometimes haha. The video quality is pretty good, as I expected for the price. I didn't realy test the water resistance because I had no reason to put it underwater, but the case seems like it would be pretty durable underwater. :)

Unlike most people that use this for recording their travel and adventures, I use this on places that are hard to see and difficult to reach areas. When I need to inspect under my car, install cables behind TVs and computers, I use my AKASO EK7000 that is attached to the mono-pod (selfie stick) to see the live video on my phone. The app work great over WIFI. At one point I used the camera as a surveillance to watch my front door to see if my Amazon packages has arrived while I am my room and looking at the live video feed at my phone.

I bought this product for my 12 year old daughter who likes to take pictures. She wanted a camera to use at the pool and small enough to take on vacations to theme parks. I like her to have her own device that would not be a major loss if we lost it - instead of using her cell phone. It was great for candid shots in the pool with her cousins. It was a little difficult to put the memory card in the first time and you must have a memory card ( the camera does not work without one.)Note- it is not waterproof outside of the waterproof case. Also it had way too many accessories and the one thing it really needs is a strap that works with or without the waterproof case. There are straps included but those work with the remote for setting up pictures.

I put this action camera on my wedding registry ahead of a destination wedding to a snorkeling hotspot. After combing through reviews of the best, reasonably priced cameras available, all signs pointed to AKASO. The camera arrived quickly, and the build quality is very impressive for the cost. I was thrilled about all the additional pieces that came with the camera, but I was disappointed to see that there wasn't a package insert with instructions on how to use all the accessories. I love how light the camera is and that it comes with an additional battery. It's a great buy.

I'm confused how this camera has so many good reviews because it's terrible.  The product outputs a 4K resolution but when you view the video, it is very poor quality.  This is likely because the sensor capturing the video is not really 4k resolution and the software in the camera is adding additional pixels to make a 4k image.  The result is essentially a fuzzy video with lots of random noise added.  Additionally, the compression type is JPEG which is weird in it of itself since most cameras use h.264 compression.

I can't even say that it's good for the price. I may be okay as a dash cam, but that's about it. The screen quality is worse the the gameboy advanced from back then. The picture quality is bad. The video quality is worse. I plan to return it and just spending more money and getting a go pro instead. Don't waist your money. I'm assuming they have good ratings because of the offer they put in the package that says, they would send you free stuff if you leave a review. But honestly I don't like it.

Definitely lives up to that of an action camera. This is your go to for YouTube videos, bikers, skateboarders, and so on. I would only recommend getting an microphone for better sound quality. But it's still worth it all around.UPDATE: 07/26/2020 You cannot buy an external microphone for this camera. Built in microphone is fair so I would not recommend for sports where sound is a key factor.

I bought this for my husband for Christmas to go on his motorcycle.  He was excited to get it and was particularly impressed by the mounting hardware, which provided a lot of different options by combining different parts.  The camera quality seems very good as far as we can tell at this point.  And the iOS app is really simple, as was connecting the camera with his phone.Since it is for the motorcycle, the final quality judgement will have to wait until it gets warm and dry enough for him to get out on the bike to see how the image quality is on the road so I can only give it four stars until we try it on the road, but we are pleased with everything we see so far including the price.

Came well packaged and was able to get free same day which is always nice. I tested out the camera in my fish-tank worked great with no leaks! The remote is a really nifty addition. I bought for my trip to Puerto Rico so I will leave a better review once I really put it into action. Happy with my purchase and planning to recommend.  Also for those who are paranoid shoppes like myself where you see one bad review and almost want to just not even bother. Take the chance with this one I shopped around a lot and looked up many videos on youtube before deciding to get it. Make sure to pick up a MicroSD I purchased a 32gb Sandisk.

I was in the market for an action camera and after a lot of research, I decided on this one. I couldn't be happier with the purchase, the camera takes crystal clear 4k pictures and the video quality is very good too. I like that I can control the camera in so many ways. It can be used as a normal camera or can be controlled through an app or the remote that was included. The customer service has been fantastic as well. I had an issue with the camera after a couple of years and the support team at Akaso responded promptly to my support ticket and resolved the issue in just a few short emails. I highly recommend this camera and will definitely continue to use Akaso products in the future.
Update - The seller sent me a new camera and it's great!Either I had a bad unit originally or they updated the design but it seems fine now.

My hero camera finally broke so I looked for its replacement.  Read the reviews for this camera and thought I'd give it a try.  Very pleased with my choice.  Camera works just fine, pictures are great, and it came with many attachments.  I use it as a dash camera in the car.  It fit the mount I was using for the Hero camera perfectly.  I feel I already got my money's worth, now time will tell how long the product works.

The camera seemed fine but I can't attest to how well it works due to the fact that the VERY FIRST TIME I used it, it flew off of my helmet! I cleaned my helmet thoroughly and applied the correct helmet mount and allowed to set for 3 days. I mounted the camera and went for a ride. About 10 minutes into the ride, the camera mount peeled off of my helmet and my camera was lost! DO NOT TRUST THEIR ADHESIVE! I can only imagine if this were a $400.00 GoPro! I am sick as it is. I went back and spent 2 hours walking the side of the road looking for it to no avail. All I found was 2 deer carcasses and a bunch of litter. So, there went my new camera AND the 64gb card I bought for it. I am not happy with Akaso! I feel they owe me another camera and memory card. Luckily no one was behind me to have it hit their windshield!

We have been looking for a good underwater camera BUT didn't not want to spend crazy money on GoPros. We looked back and forth on the reviews and watched videos and were still skeptical BUT could not beat the price point of $59 for this underwater camera. We got it in and couldn't wait to go use it. The clear case is durable(not as tight as the gopro's but still tight). Very lightweight, like how compact the batteries and great for storing. Went to the pool to take pictures and videos. Even though the pool was very murky it took GREAT PICTURES and VIDEOS. Seriously good videos. So glad we bought this camera and would buy it again. Not only is it affordable but it actually takes great media!!!We have used a GoPro Hero and what we like compare to this one is the battery life is alot better than the go pro.

I’ve never owned a GoPro so I don’t know what I’m missing for features.  However for $60 this is a great little camera.  The menus are a little quirky but the quality is decent.  I purchased it to make small short videos of my shop projects and to use as a dash cam on our upcoming cross country trip.Even the batteries perform pretty good. However, if using the highest 4K features they run out quick. I’m using 1080p for my shop projects because post processing is faster.

My child requested a Go Pro camera but the price was a little out of my budget for a birthday gift. I found this after researching online and it is exactly what he wanted. He can’t wait to bring it on our next vacation. In the meantime he has been learning how to use it and enjoys taking videos on top of his remote control car while he drives it around! We’ve only had it for a month but it seems to be holding up so far.

This camera is great. It is simple to set up and easy to use. Instructions where easy to understand ( although I could never find an explanation of  what the mini usb port is for.) I found out from trying to get used to it that there is no audio when recording with the waterproof cover on. The audio is exceptional for such a small camera when out of the case. The accessories that cam with it will come in handy I'm sure as I expand my usage.  My only real flaws I see are it doesn't come with an audio port for an external mic, and I had a little trouble getting the micro sd card in and out. The software is a bit sketchy to get used to , but once i figured out the wi-fi it all worked out fine.Buy a card reader if you want to download to pc.

My 12 year old son wanted a camera to mostly take videos and make videos for YouTube. He did extensive research and found this one. I researched it as well and it seemed like it was a pretty promising camera, but you never really know until you get it and test it out. As soon as we got it, we were both impressed by the 170 degree camera and how easy it was to use. He's used it taking video going down slides and rides at the water park and it has done fantastic in the water. He likes that the batteries are rechargeable and it came with two so you're never without. It's also compatible with his tablet and computer. The picture quality is good and it's so small that it's very easy to carry it around with you. I think we're both pretty impressed by all that it can do, especially since it's so affordable. It's so great that his 8 year brother got one, as well and has loved it just as much. Great camera!

I use this camera mostly to hang on a fence and record my son’s baseball games. It did everything advertised even though this isn’t the ideal camera for this job. I was able to start, stop and review videos from my iPhone or my android tablet depending on which one I had connected. The battery life wasn’t that great but I was asking a lot out of it, it came with two batteries and a double charger that worked well but I usually used a battery pack and rolled right along. It took a couple shots from balls hitting the back stop and was dropped several time and is still working. Hopefully this fall my son will is it for more of what it was designed for.Main thing is it will record whatever you want it is a wide angle lens so I recommend recording things close to you and you can buy about 4 of these to each GoPro you can buy

My husband and I purchased this camera for our son for Christmas and it is still going strong. We didn't want to spend a ton of money being that he is only 10 and this was his first action camera. This thing has been through it all, he took it to Disney with him, attached it to his bike and chest. Basically he uses this any opportunity he gets. Its very easy to upload videos and the picture quality is good. I would definitely recommend this as a first time action camera!

I really liked this budget friendly camera, Ive only had for couple days an been using non stop on my harley. At first it was kinda hard getting on my handle bars , but they did supply you with enough accessories to make it happen, just need a little patience.The 4k resolution was actually pretty decent the only down side it it wast not at 60fps.

This EK7000  is a super product at a fraction of the price of GoPro.  We also got the accessory kit (underwater case) and selfie stick.  He has fun creating underwater movies of our koi fish in our pond, skiing movies and attaching this to his R/C trucks to get a birds eye view of the jumps he takes.I would recommend and would buy again.  super quality and functionality for a very reasonable price.

The device only lasted about 20 mins and overheated so it would shut down. Once I purchased the item I tested it in my house at night in cool weather with no case on and it still overheated...every time I tested it. It was extremely hot to the touch and would require a cool down of about 30 mins before it would stay on.If they can fix the overheating issue this device would be pretty awesome. I was good with the video quality, all the settings, and attachments it comes with.

Thanks to my Lovely Wife and her knowing I wanted a Go pro Cam, and her being the woman she is, amazed me Christmas morning with the AKASO Ek7000, which alone blew my mind, and to pop my vessels more IT HAS BUILT IN WIFI!!!! MY MIND is bouncing. FULL OF LITTLE KID EXCITEMENT, so just imagine your happiest moment as a kid and how overly excited it made you. Yea, that was me. But the Man I am showed excitement, but not as clear as my mind which is jumping. But i went out after purchasing a SD CARD, which had slightly saddened me, because i was ready for LIGHTS, CAMERA, ACTION. But couldn’t cause I needed a card, which i had to wait until the next day, No stores open on Christmas WHY!!!!! EVEN WALMART.. SHOCKING!! But after getting a sd card, I was amazed at the stability, and clearness of the camera. Even In motion.. OMG i am AMAZED!!! I APPLAUD HER 100000x for this Excellent Gift.... BUT THIS CAMERA!!!! I wish you can hear me yell!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This is my second time buying one of these, because I lost my first. Regardless, this is the best camera you can buy for the money you pay. It comeswith plenty of accessories, 2 batteries, charger, adhesives, wipes, straps etc. and the camera performs really well. I use this camera as a recorder for my motorcycle rides and it does not dissapoint.Update: A week after initial purchase, one of the side buttons went limp and I can no longer push the up button and get a response from the camera.

This is the first of two reviews.  I took this camera out on the boat to film fishing for the day.  I have not edited or even viewed the footage, but I can tell you the battery life on the accompanying batteries is very poor compared to a GoPro.  Each battery lasts MAYBE an hour....and those are brand new batteries.  8 hours of filming?  Expect to switch out batteries 8 times.  This is not convenient AT All.

I bought this camera for our Punta Cana trip. I was a little skeptical about the quality of it because of the price. “You got what you pay” - I always say it to my Uber passengers and I think that about the people who wrote a tone of negative feedbacks about the cheapest resort expecting a “Bahamas presidential suite and service”.It says that works great in 30 meters deep water. That’s the only thing that I don’t agree because I couldn’t check it because I don’t dive. I tried 5 feet in the sea but the quality was terrible and that because the water. But I can tell you that it’s really water proof and making unbelievable nice videos and pictures in the pool and outside. I video out parachute fly, it’s great. Even being in the waterproof case it recorded the voice. Even in the pool. So you can use it outside, around the pool , on the beach , in the park , it make very quality videos and photos. For the price that you pay it’s perfect.

I bought this specifically to use on my motorcycle rides. Camera records great, but there are some issues. First if you use the waterproof case for the camera you can't have it plugged in to charge. Second, if you remove the battery from the camera it loses time/date and you have to reset it each time; so that is a low point. Third, the sound recording is not good at all when you have the camera in its waterproof case, too much crackling heard on recordings.

Where do I start? This camera is excellent for the price. You have two recording modes..720P(60FPS) & 1080P(30FPS)... the 4K options are not available on this exact model, however the 720p and the 1080p are excellent and very clear.. the stabilization is fair, I really can't judge it completely because I brought it and used it on a jet ski with a friend's waterproof chest mount. It comes with two batteries would hold a very good charge for continuous recording. If you want a HD action camera this is the one to get save yourself a lot of money. Don't waste your money on the competitors $200 to $400 models, trust me you will be happy with the quality of this one, and I also forgot to mention it comes with a wrist mounted wireless remote control that you can start and stop the recording by pushing a button, the wireless wrist control is not waterproof, this camera has all the features or at least most of the features of the big boys.

I always like to wait reviewing item like this until I have used it for a while. I didn't drop this or anything but it's not working right , it freezes up in normal temperature inside. Also , when water proof case is put on , you can not hear anything on video. I found this out very early on. It's too late to return it or get a refund , so I have to eat the cost on this.

After spending years buying expensive GoPro cameras and them failing over and over I decided to go with this camera. Figured, why not? And to my surprise, this is my go-to cam when doing anything. Hell, I use it more than my phone or point and shoot Nikon when I want to capture great video. I plan on buying another one soon so I can attach it to my drone because my drone cam sucks and it's so lightweight that a bee could carry it.

Wanted to get a camera for posting on YouTube. For $60 this camera works. No bells and whistles but works. The interface is a bit clunky and the camera buttons take a little getting used to but it works fine. If you’re needing a sports action camera spend $15 more for the pro version. Sound isn’t great but like everything on this camera it’s OK. Using iMovie on an iPad I’m able to edit video just fine. Best $60 camera out there.

have not even put the battery in and Iam off to a bad experience. The app is rated a 2.5 stars(RED FLAG). Went thru 3 cameras because the apps sucked or did not even work!! They should have in BOLD red letters NO SD card!!! come on guys. 5 days later I am ordering it. All the little adapters and tools are confusing( some) . Thank god for youtube. Looks like iam missing a adapter for the helmet already. Waiting for sd card and check it all out when I fire it up on the head cam. thats why I got it

I bought this camera last fall and only used two times. During the first time use everything was ok. This summer I tried to use it and found the remote was dead. Replacing battery did not help.After I adjust the date and time now the screen is black after a flash of the model string. The top red light is on but the action button shows no response. I tried removing the battery and putting it back but it did not help. ...

I got this to record videos for youtube.  So far it works great.  The accessory pack is good, but the case is not the best.  The clamp that holds the back in place came apart the first time I opened it.  Still functions, but not the best.  The sound is typical for an action camera, very muffled.  Picture quality is okay, but the 4K does not seem native.  The menu is not user friendly.  The battery hatch is hard to open, and when it does open it is not attached.  Other than that, it will work for me.

If you are hesitant to purchase this low priced sports cam don't be, it is a great value.  The cam is small, super lightweight and works great.  The wide angle lens truly is wide angle and takes very high quality photos and videos.  The system is very easy to use and intuitive.  Didn't have to even read the manual to get started.The cam comes with 2 batteries, compact fast charger, waterproof housing, remote, and an accessory bundle that includes all types of mounts including handlebar mounts.  Out of the box, the batteries only took 30 minutes to charge and they lasted for 5-6 hours a piece.  I use a 64 GB microSD card, a bargain at $15, and it will record 6 hours of video at 1080p resolution.  The waterproof housing has buttons that are easy to use with gloves on.  The remote is even water resistant and has big easy to use buttons to take either photos or videos.

I am happy with the camera as it is a nice small camera with a lot accesories included. For the price is great quality so you can have your action camera for a good price with 2 batteries. I don't like that is not touch screen and there are not good instructions but YouTube has all the information to use it. Also the batteries last better that the expensive brand. The quality of video is ok.

For the price, this camera is stunning. The included accessories are extremely nice to have. Video and picture quality are amazing. I've been putting this in my bird feeder for short amounts of time and have had some great results so far.I do wish this camera was able to shoot in 4k at 60fp, and I wish the lens was changeable with a focus feature. Though, for the price of this camera, it's exceeded my expectations wildly.

So, the reason I bought this camera was that it boasted the ability as being a webcam. It does work as a webcam, but the cord is really short (around 23''), and the physical connection is terrible (cuts out frequently). Another issue is that the screen looks not that great, but you can make out what your looking at. Accessing the media involves pressing the 'up' button and then the front power button (which I found out by pressing stuff). I believe the resolution can only be changed using the app 'Akaso DV' I think. The general usability is not great.If you want a fairly inexpensive camera featuring some useful mounts, this device will suit your needs. Since this has no reliability as a webcam, I will be returning it. Some captures I took writing this are included (pardon the mess). Overall 3/5.

I bought this camera to mount on my bicycle "just in case" I have an incident involving a motorist or a dog. Using a combination of the various mounting options included with the camera, I was able to attach it to the handlebar stem where is it convenient to operate. It works great for that purpose.I also plan to use it with the waterproof case when we go snorkeling in the Caribbean later this year.

This camera is a great go pro alternative, its cheaper, smaller, and easier to mount. The camera has WiFi connection so someone on a phone can see whats going on the camera and you can also control it with the phone. Its waterproof case allows you to go underwater and protect it from damage as well. I think its a very neat device and its worth the money. You get a ton of mounting options too that allows you to mount to bikes, tripods, and even a stand just to hold it up. I think this is a great choice as far as action cameras go. I would highly recommend this product to any adventurers out there.

I wanted an Action Camera for Christmas and was super excited when I was gifted the Akaso Action Camera EK7000. I have to admit, when I opened the box and seen the contents, I was a little intimidated at first .... so I put the camera aside seeing that I might need a couple of hours to figure it out, LOL. I've decided to learn my new toy today. I started reading the owner manual, but decided it'd probably be faster to see tutorials left on YouTube by other users, which it was! After watching a few videos on YouTube, I definitely had a better understanding of how to format the SD Card, and how to use the multiple accessories included with the camera. It's fairly easily to operate with only 4 buttons on the camera. It's definitely a great value and I recommend this to anyone whose into recording simple action videos (like myself). I'm not a professional videographer, but enjoy the professional results!
Pros:- Price: Great price for a camera like this.

This camera is amazing! My son was asking for another brand camera, but when we compared the features, accessory kit and overall package, this one was clearly the better choice. We could not be happier with the choice. The look on his face when he opened this amazing kit was exactly what we hoped for. The camera works really well out of the box and he has already gotten some great video of our kittens and the other kids using their new stuff. The number of mounts, brackets and accessories is outstanding. Thanks so much for a great product. The only problem we have with this is that now everyone else wants one too, including my brother who is very techie!

Shipping was a bit delayed. Over all, a good camera. It overheated on my first go around floating a river, and it kept shuttingoff. Water proofing works well, but the housing steams up and made the video foggy. Some different mounts would be great, but I made due. Over all, heck yes! I'll keep using it! Picture quality outside water proof case was amazing!I found out the camera wasn't shutting off. The screen goes black but continues to record. I'm assuming to save batteries

It works well in daylight, does not work in the dark. The waterproof case did get some water Inside, and kept fogging up the lens. I wish it could zoom in for closer pictures but overall not to bad with pictures. Took it snorkeling and in the water. Not a perfect clear picture in the water at times, for distant objects.I will use it again.
Amazing value for the price, mounts seem to hold well enough, comes with lots of accessories and the picture and video quality is good enough for methanks!!!

I purchased this a while back as a low-cost camera to use for my next diving trip. I confess that I do not have a GoPro to compare this to but I have used this camera on two consecutive dives and I must say that I truly love this camera. I found that it was easy to read when I was underwater (the only small bit of confusion was that the screen goes out after a few seconds making me think the camera stopped recording, which was not the case) and I was able to start and stop the recording easily during the dive. The images at 1080p are very nice. Note: although the instructions said it only used up to 32GB memory cards I tossed in a 64GB and it said that I have 7 1/2 hours of recording time on 1080p (note that the battery lasted about an hour recording at that resolution). So, the 64GB memory did work although I have not done the math to see if it gave me the full 64GB.I have pleasantly surprised at the quality of this camera that is a fraction of the cost. One drawback I found was that the menu is a little bit clunky but with the book I was able to figure it out. I can't wait for my next trip to try out this great camera.

I was super stoked I bought this because of the price and the 4.4/5 stars, and I was going to use this as a trail cam for my jeep. I took it for a test drive and right away I noticed issues. When I loaded it up on my computer, the audio and video was super choppy. So I recorded like a 20 second clip in my room and found that for some reason the 30 fps works better than the 60 fps. After the third test I tried, I went to turn on the camera and the screen stayed black. I took the SD card out and the screen worked fine, however when I try to insert the SD card it shuts itself off, and keeps staying black when I turn it on with the SD card in the camera. I will return and get a new one and I'll update the review when it comes

I bought this camera with low expectations due to price, the reviews are all great so I figured it can't be that bad. Upon getting the camera with all of the accessories that come with it I was amazed at how similar it was to buy a GoPro which I have previously purchased and spent way more than needed. The video quality is great and ease of use is great. my only complaint is that the housing and buttons seem to be made too cheaply and the top LED cover on the case popped off after one use while flying(i use the camera to record my flights in an airplane that I fly).

I do wish this product came with better instructions since the attachment were a little confusing at first but I love having a small water proof GoPro I can take pictures of my dog with. I also love that is comes with two rechargeable batteries. easy two use and the best for on the go. P.s. you'll have to change the date. Mine came saying 2018 but I really took this picture 2020.

This is my first action camera. It came with every little accessory you could imagine and glad it came with 2 batteries. I bought the samsung 32gb card as recommended. I bought this for a trip I'm taking in October to take pics and underwater videos. Playing with it it seems like it'll do the job. The app seems alright and using the camera is fairly easy. For the price you cant beat it so I gave this a 5 star review.

1/27/2017-Bought this camera to take with us on our honeymoon to Isla Mujeres coming up in February, so I have not had the opportunity to fully explore its functions. But from the unpacking and amount of accessories you get with it, I love it and am excited to try it out. The main reason for the purchase is I wanted a camera to be able to take under water to snap some pics while snorkeling. I did do a test check on the waterproof case at home and it worked perfectly. The one thing I would like to see made available as an accessory for the camera is some filters, specifically a red filter for using underwater. I will update the post after using on honeymoon.

I liked how this was easy to setup, and came with a pretty decent selection of straps and holders for the bike and helmet. you need to buy a micro SD card. It says you have to use FAT32 as the file system, which implies you can only have a max micro SD card size of 32 GB, but the promotions, and other adds for this say that you can use a 64 GB which would make more sense for large videos.Sound did not work very well.

I would have given it five stars but I struggled with the remote during my one and only parasail and it did not record. A notification on the remote that it is on would be helpful. Also the mounting bracket broke off but I had purchased extras so that saved me.I updated my review to a full five stars as the company reached out after reading my review and addressed my issue of a broken item.

This is a really great action camera. I wanted something to take videos while I was skiing and it was perfect for the job. The videos were very stable and clear. The camera itself is easy to use and comes with a nice selection of mounts which are simple to attach. And the battery lasted me an entire day of skiing and recording which was awesome! If there was anything I’d change, it would the photo clarity. Sometimes my photos could have been a little bit clearer, especially indoors but for the most part I was really happy with the video quality and that’s what I wanted.

When you can get it to work the camera takes great videos and has good sound, but the problem is getting it to work.  I bought the camera for mountain biking so having a remote was key so I wouldn't have to mess with the camera. I wanted to be able to capture the more interesting parts and turn the camera off for the uphill parts. I was very excited by this camera since it came with great accessories and a remote. However, the camera has a tendency to freeze up and the only way to unfreeze it is to take the battery out. The little remote sometimes works sometimes doesn't. I have found the camera to be more of a frustration than a help.

I purchased this Action Camera as a backup to my GoPro Hero 5 Session. I didn't want to spend the money on another GoPro, so I decided on this camera. I have had it for several months now, and the quality and everything else the description says about it is truly worth buying. It did come with a remote 2 batteries, which is nice! And several other accessories, I did a lot of research on these lower end off brand cameras. Especially because their are so many different ones available now. So just take my word for it and get this one.

while price is the most attractive point of this product i was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the product. while a competitor costing 10x as much might be a little better i would hate to have to live on the difference and i don't care how much you spend they can all be destroyed if you try hard enough. that said i have found no durability faults and it is mounting compatible with other cameras. As far as accessories  this camera comes with many accessories included that you are going to want such as remote control

I did a lot of looking around.  This is, by far, the biggest bang for your buck that I could find.  The camera itself seems well made and does pretty much everything I could want.  The interface is basic and very easy to use.  The waterproof housing works well.  I got it for a trip to the coast.  I took it in the ocean and the pool.  It got tossed around in the surf with no problems.  The only thing that I would say is do get an anti-fogging solution.  It did get a touch of condensation in the housing when in the surf, but even those pictures turned out pretty well.  The remote control is a nice thing to have.  Getting the pictures off the camera was also pretty easy.  You can download an app and transfer the pictures to your phone via WiFi or manually with an SD card.  Add in all of the attachments that come with it, and you are getting a ton for the price.

This is a sweet little camera, and it comes with quite a few accessories, including a wrench for assembling them. I bought a case full of more accessories, many of which won't be used, but the carrying case itself is good to have for keeping all the items safe and handy. The reason I left off stars is because as soon as I received the camera and replaced the battery,  the tab on the door for the battery compartment snapped right off!  For a camera of this caliper, the quality should definitely be better! It's no fun to use a sports camera while having to worry with holding the battery inside! Extremely disappointed!

I just bought this product and was using it the first time and the camera isn't working at all! It has a black screen with the red light continuously on and nothing else!!!!! I am so disappointed because we were at a volleyball tournament my spouse couldn't attend and he was looking forward to watching later on.

I was looking for a camera that could fit into my woodshop and could be used to document project work. This camera has a great field of view, is small, light, and the waterproof case fits my needs. The added attachments, battery, and straps were a pleasant surprise and made it even better.Cons: only a small one - the instructions didn't give much detail on the wide assortment of attachments and connectors - Had to figure that out myself.

I was looking for a GoPro for our Hawaii trip so that I could take pictures and videos underwater, but beyond that I didn't have much use of an action cam. Paying more than $300 for a camera that I was not going to use on a regular basis seemed too much for me. Then, I came across with Akaso EK7000 with great reviews and ratings. It greatly exceeded my expectations, and I was highly impressed by the product. With a variety of mounts and cases, this camera gave us flexibility to use under water, walking on the streets, hiking and even as a dash cam for the scenic drives.Hoping that the pandemic subsides soon so we can use the camera again.

I didn't realize this camera didn't have an external mic.  However, the pictures are gorgeous and the cost makes it very accessible.  You can't capture audio when it is in a sealed box anyhow, and that is how I have been using it.  Because the cost is so low, I feel much more comfortable using it in more situations where the camera may take a hit.  It hasn't taken a hit yet, so I can't say anything to it's durability.  I have recorded about 40G of video through it.  The app is VERY helpful.  I liked the camera enough that I purchased another one with an external mic and speaker.  The one app runs both cameras.  Now an Akaso fan!

I am putting 5 Stars because people wont read bad reviews. Beware, this company's quality control is all most none existent. The camera delivered to me was not working properly. It would fail to turn on with fully charged batteries. The only way to coax the camera into turning on was to put batteries fresh of the charger and put it on right after installing it. And even then, I had mixed results. This camera's resolution isn't 4K or even close. Its 1080p at 22 mbps video upscaled to 4K resolution. That causes grainy footage and photos. Also, at 1080p the quality is still subpar. The main reason others are putting 5 star reviews is because in the camera's box, it ask for you to leave a 5-star review and you can get free camera stuff. For example, batteries and charger, more accessories, and more mounts. They ask for a screenshot and the order number.PLEASE BEWARE!

Out of the box, easy to set up.  Nice variety of accessories included. You will need to buy a microSD card. This camera has  WiFi. You can control/view with your phone. I am going to use mine as a backup camera to connect trailers to my vehicle and as a dash cam (continuous loop mode). Even if it does not last, I can buy 6 of these for the price of one GoPro.  This camera also uses the same quick disconnect mount that GoPro uses.

I'm using this product to record my wood work projects.  The super clear image of the camera is great to capture the detail of my projects.  I like how I'm able to use the remote to start and stop recording, which saves me time in editing.  Easy set up and came with a lot of accessories that will help me capture the angles that I need while I'm working.

I purchased this as a Christmas gift for my son to use while downhill skiing.  He tested it out in the house as well as on trips to the mailbox and the camera seemed to work fine.  However, on his first skiing trip the unit powered on and he started recording, but sometime during that process it shut off and the recording was lost.  The unit would not power back up.  On his second trip he was able to record about a 5 minute video before it shut off.  Very disappointed.  I realize it is winter, but no where did I see any information about operating temperatures.I plan on returning this camera for a replacement.  Hopefully there is an issue with this unit.  I will update this review if my 2nd attempt is any better.

Only just recently turned it on but seems what I expected. Only issue I had was trying to figure exactly how all the accessories worked but a quick search on youtube helped figure that out. App doesn't seem to work or connect to camera but plugged into my computer and was able to view and delete videos/pictures so I think I'll be ok. More to come with this but so far what I expected for what I paid.

ORIGINAL:  The camera clip that comes with this does not fit the camera therefor all of the other attachments (except the water proof case) are useless.  Plus the wifi connection does not seem to be working so we can not download the pictures & videos off of the card and onto a phone using wifi.UPDATED 11/19/2018

Great product for the value/price.  I have 3 go pros that I use but I was always forgetting to take them off my bike but then I came across this camera  and gave it a try.  I am glad I did, the image is great on it and the remote is the icing on the cake.  I have now ordered a couple of more and I don't have to worry about forgetting them on my bike.  I will also be keeping one in my vehicle as well.

Received the camera today and I have to say wow. The camera performed better than expected for the price. I use the phone app to control the camera while riding my bike and works great. For simple video and photos cant beat this camera for the price especially with the added accessories that it comes with, ready to use right out of the box. Batteries took minutes to fully charge for their first use.

This camera works really well. When I first saw the price I though "this can't be that good," so I looked at the reviews and they were pretty solid. Once I got it, I tuned it on and even though it didn't have an SD card, I could still see the screen and the footage looked really good. I tested the water proof case and several of the mounts and they all worked fine. I am satisfied with this camera and may buy again if I need another one.

I am very satisfied with the purchase of this camera. Intending to record some videos for potential posting on the web, I wanted one of these small cameras and did a little research. This camera had good reviews so I got one. Overall, I am happy with its ability. Although I'm no professional, the colors in the videos are very vibrant. The camera comes with a good selection of mounting accessories so I mounted it to a bicycle to take videos of my rides. They are very nice, and, using Kdenlive, I'm able to stabilize the videos for decent playback (bicycle videos are very shaky). Battery life is about 1 hour and recharges fine with the supplied charger. For a budget outdoor camera, I feel that this is a very good value and am happy with the purchase.

My first one drained the battery while it was unplugged. Charged it at night, in the morning it was dead. Tried this multiple times, same thing every time. I exchanged it for a new one. That one was broken in the box. The video quality is fairly low, unless you use it as a stationary camera. I ended up getting a gopro hero 6. It was significantly more money. But in this case, you get what you pay for. This $80 action camera is the quality of an $80 action camera. Which is fine if that is what you want. It didn't fit my needs unfortunately.

If you are thinking of buying this item because you want a GoPro for cheap then you will be  disappointed.  IF you are looking for a versatile camera that can take a beating then this is it.  The box comes with a variety of connections and mounts as well as a wrist mounted remote control.  The built in rear screen is great for ensuring that the camera is correctly positioned to catch the shot you want.  I cant wait to mount this on my road bike as an extra bit of insurance.  I will post some videos from the bike ride once they are edited.

Excellent Camera. It takes great pictures. Great under water pictures with ease. The one drawback is the lack of easy to understand the supplied instructions. I found them extremely difficult to understand, but with persistence you can begin to understand their process of using the camera. They are a more affordable alternative to similar cameras of this type.

Updated June 5, 2019 from 4 stars to 5 stars!!!AKASO representatives reached out to me regarding the battery life issue and shipped me new ones. BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! Now I have more batteries to record my activities.

This has been a lifesaver this baseball season! I’m able to record my sons entire game while keeping score for them. Love that I’m no longer missing hits and great defensive plays!! Also get to share great moments with his teammates and their family by capturing the whole game.Easy set up. This camera has great quality video. Provided a video for reference ( clip is taken with cell phone for the computer screen). My son loves that we are able to hook the camera up to the TV and can watch his games. Been a wonderful investment.

Bought 2 of these originally for youtube videos. Ended using them as webcams for twitch streaming. Good quality, pretty much same as gopro action cams, and work with most, if not all, gopro accessories.Only downfall is the usb port seems flimsy, as I've had problems keeping them connected to thr computer.

So I bought this camera as a way to take photos when I took my 2yr old kayaking.  I wanted something I didnt have to worry about if we tipped over (which we didnt).  Everyone was telling me to get a GoPro because they are completely reliable.  Well, I wasnt paying GoPro prices for a few uses.  Needless to say, it is the best thing I purchased for this trip.  Came with plenty of accessories and straps.  Even came with a back up door in case the one on the water proof case was damaged.  Only thing, it does not come with a description of usage for the accessories.  But  that will not be a deterrent for me to suggest it to my friends.

Before I deciding to make a purchase of EK7000, I was a little hesitant to about if 64gb microSDXC card would be compatible with this camera because I think 32gb would be too small for me since I'm planning to go to the South East Asia for a month. After reading majority of this product reviews on Amazon and other sites, only one person comment mentioned about 64gb compatibility out of hundred comments.  I took a chance and bought two microSD 64gb along with the EK7000 camera.  Both shipped in the same package.After unboxing the Amazon shipping box, I found the  camera dismounted from its black base casing. This was due to shipping & handling from Amazon but can also be blaming on the cheap plastic made itself.  Opened the camera and there were A LOT of accessories that came with it that other reviewers were right about. I don't think I will be needing all of them but nice options to have. An excellent decision made by Asako.

A camera that doesn't sacrifice function for affordability. With the AKASO EK7000 you can get a great 4k action camera at the fraction of the price compared to some of the other cameras. I was hesitant at first based at the cost but after getting and using my camera I couldn't be happier. Looking forward to using it during scuba diving during our up coming cruise and all our future family vacations. If you are looking for a 4k action camera that doesn't break the bank, the AKASO EK7000 is the camera for you!

Compared to the GoPro, this camera is legit. It has the same specs as a gopro 5 with 4K video and 12mp. Im satisfied with it especially for the price. The sound is even pretty good when it's not in the waterproof case. I wish it had better instructions as they basically say how to turn it on and record, not edit, or anything else. The WiFi app doesn't work at all so loading straight to your phone won't happpen.  It can only be done by transfering it manually, but that's fine for me because I plan on editing on my laptop for youtube. Instructons on the accessories would be very helpful as I'm not sure how to use many of them. Verdict: great adventure camera and the price gives it an edge over gopro in my opinion.

We are going skiing and biking quite often and like to use an action camera to capture the fun moments. I’ve decided to give a try to the akaso sport action camera and extremely happy with it.The camera comes with quite many accessories which are easy to mount and very useful for different type of footage ( we tried to mount it on a bike steering and now on the helmet)

The remote... I had it strapped to my palm, and felt like Peter Parker/Spiderman. Snapping picks or taking video with a tap of the finger, like web swinging for the pics and vids I wanted. The Down side was the battery life, they do give you two batteries, so that closed the gap for me from the three stars to four. The camera also seems to get a little/very warm when recording vids. Bottom line, great first time action cam for price. Will definitely be recommending this to my family and friends. My father in law is probably getting one for this upcoming father's day. Thanks for reading, written by husband, so husband approved....... pending CFO approval AKA the wife.

Battery life was good for about 50 minutes of recording for the first outing, 60 the 2nd, and 70 the third. The image quality was very clear in daylight but recording through sunset without changing the settings resulted in a very dark video by the end.The casings and mountings appear to be of very high quality. I've taken a few hits and dropped them a couple of times without damaging them. The waterproof casing makes the audio pickup very poor, such that you can only hear distinct words when they are shouted.

I’ve been in the market for an Action Cam for a while now, I do a lot of fishing and have been getting into photography/videography a lot lately. But I haven’t been able to bring myself to spend the money on the newest GoPro, so in my search for alternatives I came across this camera, and I was intrigued. I mean, surely this cam cant compare to the GoPro, as its only a fraction of the cost, right?? I read reviews, I researched the specs, and bc of the price, I decided to pull the trigger and take a chance. It arrived yesterday, and i was immediately impressed when I unboxed it. It had basically the same design and presentation as the GoPro, AND it came with a number of mounts, as well as a waterproof casing. A side by side picture comparison to the GoPro Hero 8 blew my mind, as you couldn’t tell which was which. I definitely recommend getting this camera, and trying it out. And I’m highly surprised it hasn’t put GoPro out of business.

For the price, this little camera is great! Mounted it to my seadoo and just blasted around the lake. I even tested it out with a few underwater videos and pictures. It's exactly what I needed. Sound quality is ok. But I wasn't really looking for that. You can still hear sounds with the waterproof case on. Also it floats! Comes with a bunch of different mounts. Overall I was stoked when I got this. Battery life is short lived. But they supply you with two batteries.

The image quality is good and it comes with a lot of cool accessories, but it doesn't have sound. I thought it was just the waterproof case causing the sound to be blocked or muffled, but even without a case on, there is very muffled sound. It is essentially no sound. I wouldn't expect top quality sound, but there is none. Not sure if that is a defect, I've emailed the addresses listed on the manufacturer's site for support, but haven't heard back.*Update: I heard back from their customer support who were very helpful and responsive. They sent a new camera and an RMA for the old one. The new one works better. The sound with the waterproof case on is still very muffled but I assume that is to be expected. The trade off for being waterproof. Out of the case, the sound is much clearer. Overall they have very good customer service.

I wanted to get an action camera for a trip but was hesitant to spend the money to get a go pro- this was the perfect solution! Couldn't ask for anything better especially for the price. Similar features to the go pro- can take pictures, videos, bursts, self timer, etc. Comes with a ton of accessories- even more than I know what to do with! But especially like the water proof case and multiple batteries.Only downfalls- when you turn it on, it automatically takes you to video, so you have to make sure you click the button to get on camera mode. Took some accidents videos. Also, picture quality is great for the price but would probably be crisper with go pro.

I bought this to capture rides on my motorcycle and action shots at sporting events. I could not be more pleased with the way this action cam performs. The images are excellent. Even clamped to my motorcycle, the video is clear and almost no vibration registers. It even picks up great sound quality. This camera performs well beyond the price I paid for it and I am considering getting one or two more to improve my videos in the future.

I got this for the purpose of a helmet camera because I ride a motorcycle. The image quality is not bad at 1080p/60fps. Any lower video quality it’s is not worth it (if you’re using it for “action camera” purposes). But for my purposes (dash-cam/helmet purposes) its ok. Not the best by any means but it serves it’s purpose. Have not tried the 4K because I doubt the little screen on the camera can display 4K and neither can my computer or phone screen so a review on the 4K would be naïve of me. The battery life is sub-par to say the least, in my opinion which at 1080p/60fps lasts a solid hour. But hey, for 60$ serves the purpose that I use it for so I can’t complain.

This GoPro knock off was unfortunately junk from the start. I took it on a backpacking trip abroad. On the first use, the unit overheated and turned off after about 15 minutes of on/off shooting. Some of the videos wound up being corrupt on the memory card. On the second use, the interface froze twice during recording, causing the loss of more video.Furthermore, each battery barely manages to get through 20 minutes of recording. So it's effectively useless.

Was looking for a little camera to use mainly for taking videos in my kitchen to blend with my iPhone videos for creating posts for my blog.  So far, it’s worked great.  My first comment is that when purchasing this, be sure to grab an adapter to more quickly download the videos/photos from the camera to your iPad/Laptop so you’re not sitting around for hours waiting for them to download via WIFI.  The other comment is that i wish i could turn off the 170* angle to get some tighter shots, but maybe that’s deeper in the online instruction manual that I’m still reading through.  Would like to be able to add that setting to get some tighter shots for what I’m working on in my kitchen.

Fun lil camera. I dont know what 3/4 of the attachments do or are for. The screen turns off after like 10 seconds of record time, a bit annoying. Dont like having to download the owners manual to my phone, I'd rather have a paper copy. I'm not sure if this has night vision or the camera somehow reflects light at night but it seems to do Something at night. That's all I got...

Bought this for a 9-year old to use.  Takes great wide angle pictures and good video.  Easy to connect to cell phone app to access memory card to download and/or delete things. Battery lasts several hours of constant recording and charges quickly. Also nice that it comes with 2 batteries.Waterproof case is nice and rugged to help protect camera (now if I could just get the kid to leave the camera in the case!!).

This has been a great camera on our vacations. Purchased a waterproof housing and it works great. The sound, with or without a housing, is terrible. I opted for 1080p 60fps over the 4k and I love it. The only thing I don't like, which could be fixed with a gimbal, is the shakiness of the camera. Every little bump is like an earthquake.

So far so good.  I typically use this camera for taking videos. I find the the audio works best without the case on.  This product came with various attachments, some of which I may never end up using.  One of the biggest struggles I faced was getting the camera off of the box, but with some trial and error I eventually figured it out.  All in all I would recommend this product. I love the size and quality.

I am so sad that my water proof case leaked!!!.. so towards the end of our day there is a haze from the moisture on our pictures.. it comes with 2 nice batteries and ample accessories which I was impressed.  The water damage did get behind the screen not sure if the picture quality was affected. I did use it multiple days since this was bought to capture or vacation which was spent mostly in water.

I bought this camera for my husband as a birthday gift and was not disappointed! He enjoys making videos about fishing and is able to take this anywhere without a worry.  Setup was simple and we could not be happier with the durability. Put the camera on our dog to see what kind of trouble he likes to get into... let's just say it's very waterproof! Picture quality is better than leading competitors, no joke. Have had friends purchase GoPros in the past, only to be disappointed by the frame size and grainy quality. Not with Akaso! Looking forward to seeing what new products they will release.

I’m impressed. I bought this to record off-road videos on my Jeep. The picture is actually as good as my GoPro. I feel very comfortable putting this in places where it may get damaged such as under vehicle shots for unique angles instead of risking a $300 GoPro. I can mount 6 of these cameras on my Jeep for that price and never miss an angle!

This does not handle bright sunlight well, everything white out , even tried changing settings. also the batteries not last beyond 30 minutes. Was hoping to use this as a dash cam too. it worked ok I guessI just got a replacement camera, brand new. I will test and update this review. They have sent me replacement camera and batteries. everything works fine now

Didn't realize the heading had a "2" at the beginning of it so I was pleasantly surprised with two of these cameras when I received the package. So far, the camera(s) works as described. I don't base jump, ride bicycles down mountains, surf enormous waves, etc. so I didn't need an expensive, high end camera. However, I think I'll be able to get some really good hunting videos with these things, especially with two of'em. I'm not a big tech guy, in fact this is my first action camera, so I can't compare it to another of it's kind, but if you're looking to buy such a camera and don't care about having the popular name brand (GoPro) then I would suggest this one. Hell, I bought 2 of them for $70 + $20 for a 3yr warranty.

This product does not come with the memory card, therefore, it does not work with out it.  You must buy it separately.  Once you find the correct card, it does not fit into the camera.  You must hold it in and it does not work with the waterproof case.  Also, I downloaded the app on my iPhone and found the correct camera on the app and tried to connect it to the Wifi.  After countless attempts, it never connected and I completely have given up on this product. This camera does not work and was a complete waste of time.

I honestly like this camera alot, mainly because, if you think that you can't get good quality products for fair money, then you should give this camera a try. I'm very scepticle about buying electronics online, but this came to me well packaged and with good presentation.When I unboxed it I was surprised at how premium everything felt even though you tube reviews said that the camera itself felt a little cheap plastiky, I certainly did not feel that way. It was sturdy and felt like it could take a beating, and the waterproof housing felt really robust. So I think I definitely made a good decision buying this camera.

I purchased the camera so I could create unique content for my social media, but I also wanted to be able to record myself riding so I can see what I need to work on and reflect on my ride. This camera has been perfect especially with the COVID-19 as I cannot have someone recording me. Plus this is a portion of the proce of a go pro! Sp happy I decided to get this!

First I went in not expecting a great camera.  I am not a wannabe photographer, but instead I wanted a good camera to take a few decent pictures while scuba diving. First thing I did was go to the web site and download the user manual PDF file. It has a lot of details not included in the package and was very beneficial. I had everything working within 20 minutes and even took a few picture to get a feeling on the quality. It is not my Samsung Galaxy, but nevertheless the pictures were of good quality. I even filled the bath tub with water to test the water proof case. I must say I am happy with my purchase.

My son has wanted one of these for a while and was so thrilled to finally get one.  We were impressed with the amount of positive reviews as well as the price being so affordable.  At 9 he is easily able to figure out how to work the camera on his own, which makes my life easier.  So far it is working great, good quality pictures and videos!
Edited:Customer service we're really helpful, they did replace my camera . Yet rating this camera three start because of the hassel we went through.

I bought this as a little helmet cam in case of any close calls and it does it job perfectly. camera quality is pretty good for $70, and so far it's done what I need. I would say the battery only has about 1hr of charge so take the  two that come included if you think you need more than 45min per day. other than that the camera works really good and for a helmet cam that is only concerned with capturing everyday footage its exactly what you need. only thing that might concern you is that the audio is really bad, but I don't think it matters for close encounters talking is barely audible, but hasn't been a concern of mine. The iphone camera app works okay if you need footage just run it from the app and screenshot or use your microusb.

Ill cut to the chase and say that yes I recommend this camera! I compared it to the Pro Cam and I couldn't be any happier that I saved so much money but the quality is great. The video resolution is crystal clear, the audio is on point and the photos come out a lot better then my new iPhone! Save the money you would spend on a pro cam and try this one out for yourself. You won't regret it!!!

I've been looking for a budget friendly action camera for quite some time and found yours on Amazon. After reading through some of the 14,000+ positive reviews I've decided to order one.Received the camera today ontime. Packaging was really nice also unboxing your product was very exciting. Camera and the various accessories that came with it was really a nice touch. I was expecting to pay a little more for the extras but your company really did come through with the extras. Nice job!
Dun waste money, the housing cracked after only the 2nd use. And poor video n pictures quality, and somehow the date doesn’t show the date/time that I set, it kept showing the wrong date.3/24/2019

Recording in 4K mode freezes the camera. Tech support sent me firmware update, but still didn't work. Got a replacement and it works well without freezing.This camera doesn't keep the date/time. Every time the battery is replaced, the date and time are reset to factory. Looks like there is no internal clock chip as this is an entry level camera. Very annoying as the file names are by date and time, and sorting by file names doesn't help.

Just received my new little Akaso EK7000.  I'm going on a trip and already have a 4k camera but needed one that was water proof so I purchased this one. It's a cool little camera. The video quality is not fantastic but for what I need it for it's perfect. I'm not spending $500 on a go pro when all I need is this.  Build quality is good and it comes with a bunch of attachments including a 2 station battery charger.  For the price I can't complain at all.  The battery lasts about 45 minutes on 2k 30 which is great.  4k quality was a little choppy but 2k 30 and 1080P 60 were fine for what I need.  I plan to use this all the time when going in the water!  I gave this a 4 star because of the price.  I have a few high end cameras but nothing I can get wet.  The video quality is not perfect but  for $60 you can't beat this thing.

I have used this action camera several times in the past few months since I purchased it and am very pleased.  The company and previous reviews gave an accurate description of this product.  I've used this camera to film my sailing and trail biking, and it has survived the wet and rough conditions.  The picture is of high quality.  I would highly recommend this action camera.

This is exactly what I was looking for. A camera for riding motorcycles. GoPro was way too much for me. I also got a 1 inch ball adapter so I can move it from bike to bike. This is small, light weight, and simple to function. I synced it to my phone to view VDO and it’s great. I run it on 720p with 64 GB card and that gives me over 8 hours of recording. 2 batteries are nice for longer day. Highly recommended especially for $50.

I am amending the review written below. Almost a year later I received a response from the seller. I was sent a replacement. I will be giving this to my son as a gift to replace the one he received last year. Once we see how this one works, I will again update this review. I appreciate the seller’s response.This worked fine for the first month. My son’s birthday was 1/25 and the window for return ended 2/24. Now it won’t work and the back is constantly popping off. Very disappointed and wish I had taken heed to the other reviews.

I realised that most of the reviews online on this camera are not honest. The supplier leaves you a written message in the box promising you lots of free accessories if you give them a positive rating and they ask you to email them confirming you gave a positive review! No wonder why this poor camera with bad recording quality has so many positive replies. I am so disappointed with the quality, the image is so grainy and sound quality is bad. It's a very basic and poor entry level camera. Dont get cheated

After opening the box and trying to figure it all out with no so hot directions and diagrams, I gave up and gave it to a friend's son who has more experience with the tech.  So many pieces and it was just not worth it for me.  I never even got it working so I can't judge the camera at all.  So, if you are into high tech camera stuff, it might be great, average user, not so much.

The camera was as expected and advertised.  Company stands behind their products and are good to deal with.  The camera takes wonderful, high quality videos with good sound.  Very satisfied customer.  Much less expensive than the Go Pro.  Camera will link up to your smartphone for control viewing, start/stop recording.  Underwater capability.  What more can you expect?  Terrific buy - thanks!

We got this for my 11yr old son to use attached to his dirt bike helmet. It came with everything we needed for easy installation. We definitely recommend! We will definitely purchase more products In The future. Picture quality is very good, it came with a case that saved us a lot with mud and water splatter. My son takes some falls and it still holds up!

I was looking for a wearable camera so I can video my fearful dog training so I can learn and hopefully help others. Some other cameras were very expensive, but I did need a very good quality camera for my needs. After searching the many cameras and looking through reviews, pricing, capabilities, I decided on this camera. There were so many accessories in the box, there will be endless possibilities to get good pictures and video. Right out of the box, I was able start recording and the picture was clear and definitely will be easy to use and easy for my other dog trainers to see. The instructions were easy to read and I had no problems going through the settings. I would definitely recommend this camera to novice and advanced users - great value for a very reasonable price

You can't beat what you're getting for your dollar. I was looking for something to use an a multi-purpose action camera. I wanted to be able to run time-lapses in rough weather. The camera comes with a handful of accessory mounts which make it out of the box able to snap onto a wide variety of items. The 4k@30fps video looks great, I personally prefer the 1080p@60fps for the majority of my usage, but I do see it has a higher frame rate 720p@120fps but I haven't been able to run that through its paces yet. Overall I'm very pleased with the quality of the camera and for such an amazing price when compared to their competitors. Well worth your money!

I've been wanting a camera so I can record family vacations and everyday family outings. I bought this Camera on a spur of the moment because I usually research before I buy. So far I'm impressed with video quality and the amount of accessories that came with it. This is my first action camera. The camera itself was easy to understand just after a few mins of messing with it.
