The internal image stabilizer seems to be doing a great job, especially at this price point.

overall this is a fantastic camera, it comes with so many parts to connect to just about anything.  The reason I only gave it a 4 star rating has nothing to do with the camera but the instructions or lack of.  Setting up the camera to pair with my phone  was a real pain. I was asked for a password which wasn't provided.  Once it was set up it was fine.  Additionally you must have a SD card to take any pictures or videos, the camera doesn't have any internal storage.

I got this for my boyfriend for his upcoming big ski trip with the boys. After a lot of research between this and the go pro I decided to go with this based on the awesome and through customer reviews. I was so pleasantly surprised by the packaging and all of the products that came inside the box with the camera. When my boyfriend opened his gift he was SO excited and ripped it open. Instructions were simple, the device was SUPER easy to use and he's already running around the apartment taking videos of anything and everything in amazement of the quality from such a tiny compact camera. Thank you for making me the "cool girlfriend" on the trip and i cant wait to see the top of the mountain through his eyes.

I use it while fishing from my kayak using a chest mount. I was completely surprised by the quality of the pictures/videos and the amount of territory it covered. Easy using the remote function. A little challenging following the user manual but I eventually got there. A re-write may be in order with more specifics.

We just received this last week.  After reading the good review , we bought this for our upcoming trip.  We have never had an action camera before.  We downloaded the manual and followed the instruction.  But, it never tells anything about those attachments.  While trying to put together the backpack attachment, one of the piece broke and we can't use it anymore.  It would have been helpful if it was labeled on each pieces(there are so many of them) since not everybody is knowledgeable about the action camera.

Very impressed with this action camera so far. The setup was super fast and I was taking pictures and videos within minutes. I bought this camera to film videos while riding my 4 wheeler and it has just been fantastic. The waterproof case keeps the camera dry even when going through the deepest holes

Used the camera going to Wisconsin and took some video of my grandchildren swimming in the pool.The camera stayed waterproof and has a clear video capture under water. Works good on not so lighted areas with no noise.Color wise is great but not too much in audio.Anyways the unit is good for family use in capturing videos/photos.Still good in price.And by the way you could connect the unit via Wifi,

First, the plastic base the camera is mounted to in the display box is flimsy and breaks.  My camera arrived having broken off of the mount and bouncing around in the clear plastic box on the top of the package.  That looks nice in a store, but is a problem for shipping.  The camera still functioned, which I would expect for an 'action' camera, but it seems a more secure way of shipping is called for.The real problem is a dirty sensor right out of the box, as can be seen on the attached picture.  This is on the sensor, not the lens, and there is no way to clean it.

I got this camera on sale and very glad I did. I did not know much about action cameras when I purchased this one. I figured with all accessories and price it was a good deal ($40 at the time). Well, I put this thing through it's paces on a biking trip in the mountains and the footage came out great! Was able to share with my family now once I was able to get a decent video editing program to compress the files to share and send to my family all around the country that were on the trip. Which was nice to relive going down the trail in the wide angle format, we put it on the big screen and instantly took us back.If you want a spare action camera or this is your first pull the trigger.

I bought this to use as a camera for pictures only while paddleboarding.  I knew it was fish eyed and made to be more for videos.  I takes ok pictures at best.  Side by side with a Samsung S8 or iPhone 7, the picture quality is rough.  It's waterproof and small, but turning it on and off resets it back to video mode.  It won't stay on the mode you leave it.  The battery is also terrible.  Even just using it as a camera, I get about an hour and a half.  I kinda knew what I was getting into, and I knew it wasn't a gopro, but I don't know if if but it again.

Took it to Cancun, worked like a charm. Would highly recommend, especially due to the cost compared to gopro. Easy to use, and picture quality is great. Took it scuba diving and held up without any issues.  All photos and video can be easily accessed through the app. Photos can be reviewed on the screen, but videos have to be viewed on the app or your computer.Worth the buy if you are wanting to take pictures/video under water.

Tested the case in shallow water, including repeatedly pressing all the buttons, and it did not leak a drop. Have not tested at any depth.The camera itself feels cheaply made, especially the door to the battery compartment.

I used this camera on my Christmas Cruise I took last year & it did worked well. The quality is decent. It may not be a pro go but I would say it’s very very close to it. It’s worth the price. I’m so grateful that I bought this cam because little did I know, both my Fiancé & I cell phones shut all the way down on us. We couldn’t even unlock our phones to get to our home screen so we couldn’t take pics. Our cousin took pics for us with her phone so this cam came in handy.

Update!  Seller was very accommodating, and made this 100% right with me.  I am going to be giving this product another try, and also would absolutely buy from seller again!  Original Review: I bought this for a week trip of snorkeling in Cozumel.  Although it took great videos and pictures, it only lasted for the 1st 2 days of the trip, so I had 5 days that I couldn't get any footage of.  I never used it out of the waterproof case. Never dove deeper than a few feet, and never dropped the unit.  It just simply stopped working!  The only time I could get it to work was when I pulled out the battery, and put battery back in, and it would power up for 2 seconds, and then shut down.  It is a shame, because I was really happy with how it worked, the 2 batteries that came with it, the watch band remote control was really cool, and I loved that it came with a TON of accessories.  I really wanted this to work out!

Being new to video recording there was a  bit of a learning curve to this device. Not so much in the point & shoot aspect of it, but with how to use it most effectively. Comes in box with a ton of attachments so it can be creatively attached to just about everything.My only issue is that it will occasionally time out when transfering files from the camera to my Samsung Galaxy 5e tablet. Could be the tablet, could be the software, could be the camera, could be the memory card. I dunno.

My niece is a YouTuber and wanted a waterproof camera to blog her family trip to the beach.  She's only 9 so I didn't want to spend a ton of money.  I must say we are totally impressed! Unbelievable video, and the waterproof case was incredible for underwater snorkeling shots.  My niece was so excited and happy with this little action camera with every attachment imaginable.

This is a decent little camera. The one major flaw is the lack of image stabilization. The static wide angle is a touch annoying but workable, but the lack of image stabilization makes the video dizzying unless set down on something. The good news is for $10 more there is basically the same camera with some improvements including EIS. I am ultimately going to return this one and order the one with EIS. Other than that, the number of additional accessories, the fact that it came with 2 batteries, and all the various clamps and attachments was awesome. Only thing it didn't come with was a memory card but I had an extra 64GB anyway so no biggie. Over all it's a cool little camera at a way better price than the go pros.

This camera is great! My 10 year old loves his so much we bought one for our 7 year old too. It takes amazing underwater pictures and videos. They can’t wait to get the accessory kit so they can record themselves on their bikes and on the trampoline. Definitely get you money’s worth with this product.

Bought for son , he likes it alot. It's actually a really good quality camera forbits size , and price.  I like that you are able to buy a ton of accessories for it !! I gave the water resistance score a 3 stars..because we have not tried in water yet.  Only dislike is i wish it came with a manual !! Kinda hard to figure stuff out on your own with it.

I must say that I really like this action camera.  I've only used it 2-3 times at this point, but it worked great and the picture and video quality are perfect. I took this snorkeling and diving with sharks 4 miles off the shore of Hawaii. Diving with sharks is kind of a once in a lifetime  event, so the video was important to me and it did not disappoint. Seriously, you can go and spend $200-$400 more on a big brand name, but this camera does the exact same thing, so why.  Also, the amount of accessories that this comes with are fantastic and would cost a bit more for a big brand name camera too.  I can't wait to take it on hikes and more adventures as well. Do not overthink this purchase...Go buy it now, you won't regret it.

I got this camera as a Christmas present and in the few days of using it I these things stand out. One pro is the camera tells you how much film time and photo space you have left. But there was one con, I noticed that the camera wouldn't record in 4K because the included micro SD card was only 4GB. A larger capacity SD card is required. Overall I definitely recommend this action camera for it's great price point

I am very surprised of the quality of the product. I did not expect the camera to be so good and capable of making videos with such incredible quality and resolution. So I was surprised that for such an affordable price the camera worked so well. I have made videos with my camera AKASO in the sea, in the pool, in the bicycle, like dashcam among others. I love the way that you can use your camera with the App and download pics and videos to  your phone. I am very happy with my new camera and I know that you will not be disappointed if you buy one. Overall a very good buy.

I love this camera and am amazed by the quality of it for the low price. I had my doubts but after setting it up and using it I am convinced that it was well worth the money paid. I surf alot and my board has a built-in camera mount and this camera fits perfectly. All the accessories that came with this camera just blew my mind and I don't need anything else to have great videos and pictures come home with me from the ocean. NICE JOB AKASO!

It is a great camera for the money. It records in 720P, 1080P, and 4K. It comes with two batteries. I used 64GB Samsung EVO Micro SD, and it records well. I haven’t tested its waterproof ability yet. It comes with a handlebar mount and a helmet mount, but not a head mount.

I purchased this for a snorkeling vacation, and to see if I like the concept of using it underwater.It is fantastic value for the price.  Looking at a large number of web reviews, one can see that the opposition might slightly outperform it slightly in some areas, but at several times the price.  So the price/value combination is unbeatable.  As a camera. it does everything it should and comes with a range of accessories, including a spare battery and battery charger. It provides a result that should be sufficient for nearly everyone who is not a professional photographer

The description states that a micro SD card is highly recommended and it is not included. This was purchased for a birthday and was THE GIFT the recipient has been asking for It!  The mocro SD card is required to record video!  Very disappointed!  Seller needs to change the description.  Micro SD card is required for it to work!

I liked the camera but the buttons are only okay; they can be confusing without graphics near or on them.  We bought for a cruise (underwater picture attached) and it fit the bill.  No concerns about water leakage.  Many attachments included but no wrist strap (or the possible Velcro piece isn't comfortable if it is meant to be a strap.) Upon powering up, the video option is default. I think that if the photo screen was first it might be a bit easier, or default to last used photo/video option.Transferring photos to desktop is fairly straightforward.

The Akaso camera is an amazing product at a great price! I got it only 2 days prior to a trip, so didn't have much time to get used to it. We put it on a chest harness and got awesome video and pics while zip-lining, then immediately  (uh-oh) went to hit the rapids on kayaks...we added the water-proof case and went to the head-mount and yup, you guessed it...we should have added floatation :( The camera is somewhere on the bottom of the Lower Mountain Fork River maybe near some large boulders and a low-hanging branch lol! I have placed an order for a replacement camera and you can bet we'll download pics between excursions...my girl-friend says there's a good possibility that she'll wear it from now on...

This camera takes the best video. I cannot believe how good the video and pictures turn out.The first one I bought malfunctioned and was refunded by Amazon without any problems.You can download the App. to connect with your cellphone and operate it remotely. It also has a wrist mouted remote to take video and pictures remotely. It is the most fun camera I have ever owned and the possibilities for it are endless.I bought the Luxbell accessories for this and they work very well.

We used this camera on a cruise last week. While we were using it in the water, the case came open and of course water got into the camera. We were able to salvage the SD card and the picture quality was amazing. I am returning it only because the action case that was suppose to protect the camera failed.UPDATE - Rebecca with customer service reached out and was extremely helpful and wanted to make sure I was satisfied with their product. As mentioned cameras pictures were fantastic so I was willing to give it another try - just extremely cautious if used in water. I’m happy to give them another chance. Great customer service given when not asked for!

Was really impressed with this camera. I got it for trips, golf course, and snowboarding. It’s done wonders for me so far. Thought the picture and color balance was better the GoPro. As far as scrolling through the camera I thought it was pretty straight toward and easy. I did get both the apps to work but the downfall is you have to have WiFi for those to work and where I’ll be using this 90% of the time I won’t have WiFi. Or at least I couldn’t get it to BT for when I didn’t have WiFi. Really awesome that all the accessories came with it. This camera for the price is absolutely worth every penny and I highly recommend it.

Tl;dr good buy for the price tag, waterproof case works well, and battery lasts about 1.5hr.Overall the camera is as listed. Good build quality for a low price tag. It comes with a ton of accessories as well. The plastic though feels a bit like a toy but it holds up well. The image quality is good in day light, but it’s a little saturated in dim or dark lighting. I put the camera in the waterproof case it comes with to test it and put it in a bucket of water for 10mins and there was not a drop of water inside the case at all and the camera was safe. The set up for the camera was easy as well, and the battery lasts for about 1.5hr ish so it’s nice if you go for a hike or bike ride or something for a bit.

This camera had everything I needed to attach to my bird feeding gizmo.  It was perfect for my needs.  The wifi worked well and I was able to connect to my phone readily.  The parts all interchange well with the action cam that I already have.  The shipment came fast.  It isn't the best in the world for IS but you wont find that at this reasonable pricepoint. I recommend for birding, fun with pets, time lapse, travel and those on a budget.

Great camera for $80 it performs what I use it for very well compared to a gopro. I use it for fishing on a chest mount and at 1/4 the price of a gopro this is a easy choice. Extra batteries are cheap and a 32gb sd card cost $10 provides about 3 hours of 1080p footage.Video quality is great just gets some lens flairs looking directly into the sun. I've gotten into recording my fishing trips for much less then a gopro and if it wasn't for the akaso I would be able to afford too so thank you Akaso.

Camera is great. The plastic is kind of thin but when inside of the waterproof case, it is very rigid and durable. It is super light which is nice for when I put it on my quadcopter. Very disappointing when the packaging was all messed up and all the accessories were just thrown in a sandwich bag. Its very sad that people would return an item like that and also that Amazon sent it to me like that but I didn't want to wait to get a new one and thankfully it works great. I do recommend this camera, the accessories are good quality, it comes with two batteries, it has a wide field of view, and it supports 64 gb micro SD card!

My son and I started using the AKASO EK7000 4K WiFi Sports Action Camera Ultra HD Waterproof DV Camcorder 12MP 170 Degree Wide Angle yesterday and he had an absolute blast with it. Picture quality was great!  Unfortunately, as we were charging it this morning, the charging port pushed directly into the camera and was shaking around inside! We were able to unscrew the front of the camera and remove the charging port. It looks like it was only attached with two small tack welds. I emailed the company (through Amazon), but Amazon responded that there is an issue with the email address the company provided.  I didn't expect this camera to last forever, but I did expect the charging port to last more than 24 hours!

I get so much use out of this camera! I’m big on video editing and making home videos for our kids and we love being out on the lake and wakeboarding and also riding dirt bikes and quads so we stray it to the boat and our helmets! this was an amazing deal. I’ve had so many people ask me where i got it!

From what I have seen so far, this is a very nice unit for the price of it. I don’t think that it feels as solid as a GoPro, based on my limited exposure. But obviously at one third the price, of a GoPro, how could it feel as solid? My initial video test seems good for my needs. Being that I don’t plan on BASE jumping or snowboarding with it, I am confident that it should hold up and do the job that I need.

This is a very budget-friendly camcorder that gets the job done. I've only taken it out a few times to try, so far its been very easy to use and the quality is great for the cost. The sound quality could use some work, it's not terrible, it's just not amazing. I wish there was an option to install an external microphone to use, but other than that I have no regrets with this purchase. Really handy for fishing if you use it in a chest mount, the angle of the lens captures the action and scenery very nicely.

I got this for my 12yo son as a starter camera. He enjoys being able to take it everywhere, including attaching it to his bike. The included features (waterproofing, various brackets, remote control, some smartdevice connectivity) are nice additions to the overall experience. The video quality is decent, the still photos not so much. It's easy to transfer data to another machine for processing via flash memory. I would say my biggest complaint is that the LCD view screen is pretty lackluster.  Off-angle viewing is pretty bad, and in bright sunlight, it is difficult to see much of anything. Overall, my son likes it, so I'm pleased.  This one was decent price for a starter action camera. I'd consider buying an upgraded model once this one dies.

A very pleasant surprise. The camera feels high quality and operates without any of the quirks inexpensive electronics often have. Easy software install and pairing. Lots of mounting hardware options included. Image quality is great. I love it.The only problem is one is not enough. What about a dash cam. or motorcycle handlebar cam, or a cam to monitor the baby birds in that nest over there? I just ordered 2 more cameras (one has the touch screen).  It will be interesting to see how the remote functions (or doesn't) with 3 cameras running.

This is my first action camera. It’s a good machine and does what I wanted it to do. There is a learning curve in that I’m still trying to figure out how everything works. Volume is weird in that I can hear the recorded audio if I play back on the device, but not if I play it on my phone. The iSmart DV app works better than the Asako DV app. Definitely download the user manual. I think a lot of my issues are from user error. The picture quality is great. There are several mounting options packaged with the camera. The time lapse function is for photos, not video, so you’ll need a separate program to install the photos as frames. Overall, I’m glad I decided to purchase this.

First of all- you always hear that "you get what you pay for" well that may be true but with this camera you get alot more.  Our daughters are on travel softball teams and we didn't want to spend a fortune on a name brand that will only be used 2-3 times a month so after reading a few reviews-we picked up one of these cameras.  While the software and interface my not be the greatest the pictures and videos that this camera take are awesome.  Very impressed with this little camera considering the price.  So far we have only used a few hours but I expect to get a few more hours this weekend as we have 5-6 games.  Will update as needed but def do not regret this purchase.

Overall, I am very pleased with the Akaso EK7000 4K WiFi Sports Action Camera.  This is my first camera of this type and I  am very impressed by its light weight and features.  I am really anxious to take it on some hikes and adventure courses.  The only part of the camera that I do not care for is the battery door.  I wish there was some way to connect it to the body of the camera.  I can see myself dropping it while changing the battery.

This product was exactly what I was looking for as an entry level, cost appropriate action camera.  I love the remote and iphone app feature.  Screen and menu are easy to use and you can work you way around electronics. I use this for camping, backpacking, kayak fishing and taking video of my kids. Probably not a 1 for 1 gopro replacement, but then again I am a casual user not needing to have all the benefits that come with spending what they costs. I bought the small amazon action camera case to carry a few accessories and batteries and it fits fine. you'll be hard pressed to use all the attachments that come with these kind of cameras. They all seem to interchange without issue.  Ask me any questions, I'd be glad to answer as best as I can.

I was searching for an economical camera that I could mount on my bike or helmet when I go mountain biking. This Akaso camera has by far exceeded  my expectations for the price of it. First it does not look cheap at all and comes with all and more accessories necessary. The image quality is excellent. The app and file transfer was also very easy.  It’s also pretty sturdy in its plastic case. I had a hard crash on my mountain bike and nothing happened to the case or the camera! I was pretty banged up however! If you’re looking for a camera to record all your actions, Asako is definitely it.

I had a second generation GoPro that i lost and needed to replace prior to a trip to Mexico. The GoPro prices were higher than I wanted to pay so I did a search and came across the AKASO EK7000. I was shocked by how reasonable the prices were but was skeptical that it seemed too low. I read all the reviews and watched YouTube videos and figured it was worth a shot. It came with a lot of extra pieces and two batteries!! I charged one up, popped it in, and tested it out. I was very happy with the picture and sound. I downloaded the app and was able to easily get the videos to my device.I’m very happy with my budget buy. I will probably give this one to my daughter and buy another one for myself.

I bought a GoPro 4 like 5 years ago, but that cost a whole lot more than this gadget.  In functionality, they are almost comparable, but the buttons usage on the Akaso are more intuitive. You can basically start testing it without reading the user’s guide which is a big plus.  Hey, 4K industry standard and wide-angle, what else do y want?  I have not tested the waterproof quality but I am it is fine because I used this design before. Surely, the versatility will be controlled through the software, can’t wait to try all of them, esp with fast action Sports!!!

This is a great budget alternative for a GoPro. I mainly used it for audio quality (DCI hornline) and it was pretty good (NO CASE) and the picture at 1080p 60 FPS was great!! The only downside is the app sucks, and you can't get your videos from the camera straight to the app, only through a micro-sd to your computer. Highly recommend if you need an action camera on a budget.

Update:Akaso support reached out to me and went above and beyond to make sure I was happy. They provided a replacement camera that functions as I expected and hoped. I have used it on a couple of ski trips now and it works very well. Given the time between my original purchase and now, the level of effort Akaso put into their service is really incredible.

I purchased this camera for my teenager to use. It was easy enough to understand that he was able to get everything working himself. The picture is very clear and the camera is a nice small size. We have not tried it underwater yet but I would recommend this camera for anyone looking to get a good value.

The camera is really good for the price that it is. I think it’s better for video rather than pictures, but the pictures are still pretty good. I found that even though the camera was in the waterproof case it would pick up sound sometimes. I really enjoy using the camera and I think it’s a great starter camera. It’s pretty user friendly once you get the hang of it but it was confusing at first with the minimal instructions. I had a really hard time opening the battery compartment and I was worried I’d break it but once I got it open it wasn’t as difficult.

This is the first camera I have ever bought.The video 1080 P 60 fps I can record for about 60 minutes, the description said 90 but mine records about 60 minutes. When checking my files, the video at around 4 gigs stopped recording and proceeded to record again in a somewhat different time. So it recorded for around 45 minutes, stopped recording and proceed to record again for around 15 minutes.

I can't believe they are selling this thing so cheap! Found the camera hear and researched reviews on Youtube. I am using it for a trip to Guatemala as I don't want to pull out my iphone or a large camera. If it gets stolen it isn't the end of the world due to the price. I bought a kit to

I like to give a product several months before reviewing. This was a gift for a 10 year old budding YouTube star.As an inexpensive alternative to a GoPr this hits the mark. It is easy to use and video quality is outstanding. Battery life is short but it came with two and charge time is quick. Get extra batteries if on an extended trip away from a charging source. Compatible with a myriad of attachments that come with or can be cheaply purchased for this camera. Quality of camera and accessories is good. A suggestion if not used underwater change cased back for the non-waterproof accessory otherwise sound is muted.

This is an outstanding camera for the money. I bought this for my 10 year old son and he has had so much fun making videos. He first tested in a swimming pool and the camera worked like a charm with no water issues. We could even hear the sound going down the water slide and hitting the water. The other amazing thing about this camera is how many accessories it comes with. There just can’t be a better value out there for the money..... If you buy this camera it won’t disappoint!

Downgrading from 5* to 2*. This camera has been used extensively for about 10 months and, during that period, worked great. Other than that, things were great: good price, great battery life, easy to use. The remote was a nice addition. There are only two downsides: one minor and one major. The latch for the battery cover is really stiff. The camera stopped working after about 10 months -- completely dead -- no lights, no screen, not recognized as a USB device when plugged into a computer, etc.

Was awesome when my new camera arrived.  First thing was "mmm I don't know, would be a good product?" The package was so serious good and beautiful. I open it up and everything was promised was in there.  Instructions scan works good but set up the camera functions it is not to easy indeed, however up installation and set up was easier.There is a little delay betwen the app and the camera but not a big deal.

So let me start this by saying, this is not a bad camera at all for the money. That said, the aforementioned says it all. I learned at a very early age that you get what you pay for, and this stands absolutely true. This is an 85 camera once you factor in the cost of batteries/mounts etc. It's nothing more than that.So with that out of the way, let's talk specifics. This camera is built to compete with GoPro, of that there is no question; And for the cost, on paper anyways, it seems like a formidable competitor. That aside though, the picture and video quality just isn't that good. It's not bad, but it's not $400 GoPro good. Now, when you take the specs of various GoPros, this camera is nearest comparable to the Hero 3+ Black Edition of which I have 5. I admittedly bought this camera as I wanted a cheap Dash Cam I wouldn't fret about leaving in my daily driver, as opposed to one of my more expensive GoPros. Thus far, the camera performs that task well enough, but I'll talk about the cons briefly.

We bought this for my 7 year old who has gotten into riding bikes, and started to attempt tricks. We bought this for him so he could attach to his bike or helmet and be able to watch his riding back. For a gift under $50, it is a fantastic buy for what we needed it for. We did not want to spend the money on a genuine Go Pro for a 7 year old who would most likely break it within the first 6 months of use.

I got this camera to take along for my kayak fishing adventures. Picture is great, but audio is extremely poor. You essentially have to yell if you expect it to pick up audio while in it’s case. I have an iPhone with the Akaso mobile app. The app is well designed, however when synced with the cam, it constantly freezes, so virtually useless for me. The red light that blinks while filming goes off eventually, so you are never certain if you are actually filming or not. If all you are after is video, this is a decent buy. If you want audio and more app functionality on your phone, I would keep looking.

We bought this camera for our seven year old that was demanding a go-pro for Christmas. For the money, this little camera has been great! It has tons of connections, and the picture quality is pretty darn good!If you don't have the budget for something like a go-pro, this should be on your list.

I bought this camera for my husband at Christmas. We are taking a honeymoon in March and I thought the underwater case would be perfect since we plan on snorkeling. The camera itself is sturdy but lightweight. We did a little bit of recording with it just to test it out and the picture quality is excellent. It also has great sound quality so there is no need for an extra microphone. All of the sound will be picked up by the camera. The camera package included a few accessory items but more are available for purchase. My husband especially liked that it is compatible with GoPro accessories.In addition to video, this camera also takes pictures and has a mode for timed pictures. It also has a shutter mode where you can take multiple at one time.

I searched for hours to find an inexpensive  to the (other) water proof action cameras. I was kind of skeptical about this camera after reading certain reviews but after trying it out a couple of times I am extremely satisfied with it.The underwater clearity is awesome. We have donr some underwater fish feeding videos and some off road videos with the unit strapped to the front of a side by side ATV . I was impressed with the stability and crisp video this camera captures.

I have a go pro and got this b/c it's much cheaper. It's definitely comparable. My only thing is that the clip to the battery doesn't clip in correctly, it is always crooked so it's hard to pry out when I need to replace the battery. I'm concerned it will break off at some point and if it does the battery will definitely not stay put.
Save your money for an actual go pro.1. The camera starts getting hot after 10 minutes of use.

Great bang for the buck! Came with lots of extras and was impressed with the extra battery and charging cord. Only wish it came with a memory card.Update: we’ve had this for a month now. It floats by itself as long as it’s in the waterproof case! The picture quality is not amazing, but I got this for my 6 year old to have fun with. I cannot get it tohook up to my iPhone, but a friend was able to get it hooked up to his. Battery life is fairly sufficient, but it’s definitely nice to keep the extra one on hand and charged.

I bought this camera before a trip I took this past month that included snorkeling, hiking etc that a camera like this is perfect for. It shot some amazing footage for us, and it works exactly as expected. Having an app connect to the camera was really nice, it was such an easy way to review footage / copy files off the camera. The quality was good, but the sound was ok (but what do you expect when it is encased in a plastic waterproof case?)The only real downside was the plastic waterproof case. The first one showed up with a cracked case (which was easy enough to return/refund). The second case did fine except the hinge for the backdoor is already rusty! We have only had the thing for less than a month and it already has rust. Keep in mind that the camera still works fine, and the case still is waterproof. It is just a little disappointing to see rust this early in owning the product.

So I bought this little camera for hunting and some off roading, and so far the picture quality is alright. Not what I expected but better then some. Only problem is the base on the unit is broke so I can't attach it to anything. The base was broken in the mail before i got it in the box. Kind of surprised because the box seems pretty well secured. I'm hoping the company will fix this for me but we'll see

I bought this camera for my husband to take on his annual elk hunt. He hunts at 9,000 to 10,000 feet during November. It is usually cold and snowing and i wanted to see why he loved being up there. When he got home,  all of his recordings were 15 to 20 seconds long and I asked him why. He said the battery life was only that long and when it dies the camera stopped.  He also said, when here at 790 feet it lasts about an hour and a half. Too bad he can't use it where we intended him to use it. He is now looking to purchase a Sony 4K Camcorder for $400 that others have that does do the job.

I take a lot of nature photography while hiking, kayaking and bicycling and I wanted a waterproof camera that I could use to take pictures of manatees on the Chassahowitzka River and dolphins at the beach. I did a lot of research on the action cams available and read a lot of reviews before choosing the AKASO EK7000.What sold me was the extra battery and the positive reviews, what made me happy on receiving the camera was all of the accessories that came with the product that have to be purchased separately with other cameras.

I got this as a beginner version of a GoPro.  It's worked ok as a dashcam on adventures, but everything else I've tried using it for (time lapses, overhead videos of the art projects I work on, etc) have been a problem.  The batteries die fast, and the numbering/sequencing on for the time lapse photo files resets or resequences every time I have to swap the battery.  I've also noticed that files become corrupt, although it could be more of a memory card issue than the camera's fault.  At any rate, I think this camera is better for outdoor use rather than indoor use.

I love this little camera! I bought this for my trip to Thailand, not wanting to spend a ton of money on a GoPro in case it got lost or stolen. The waterproof case worked really well at first, but the lens part came loose and let in water after a few uses in the ocean at a very shallow depth. The camera continued to work despite being exposed to sea water. I took mostly videos with it, which turned out great! I had trouble downloading the photos and videos onto my phone through the accompanying app.

A lot came with the Cam. Including two batteries, which do not work. Effectively making the camera useless. Camera works fine plugged in to a power source tho.Edit:  they sent me a new camera a few weeks later.  So far every thing seems to work. It was a gift for my husband so I’m not 100% sure.  He hasn’t said anything negative tho.

I bought this for my teenage nephew so he could use it with his friends skateboarding and doing other activities. It was a lot more affordable than a GoPro, so we didn't have to worry as much about it getting damaged or lost. He still uses it months later and the video comes out great.

We love this action camera. We purchased this for recording our three year old around the house and on camping trips. We went for this camera as it is a cheaper option then most action cameras and figured having a three year old holding/operating it, this would be a wiser choice. The water proof case is a true water proof case and we also use it as a protective case from falls when the kid has the camera running around. The battery holds up well when recording and the quality of the picture is great. The camera all around is user friendly and well worth the purchase. I have recommended this product to family and so I'd recommend it to you too.

5 stars!  Absolutely amazing.  I was first taken back by its small size, but within minutes, I had the camera up andrunning.  The picture quality is great and the app download and installation was seamless.  I can hardly wait to go

Enjoyed camera for about one month! Good quality of the picture. It supports 4k 25 fps, but I prefer to user 1080 60 fps because of much more recording time. Sound quality is not bad, but anyway it's always better to use the separate microphone for wind filtering.I liked a lot mini HDMI port - I connect the camera directly to the TV.

There is a difference between taking pictures on a timer and a Time Lapse movie. I bought this camera with the idea of creating Time Lapse movies for my projects. This camera takes pictures on a timer. It is possible to have it take multiple pictures on a continuous timer which does not constitute a Time Lapse. So I ended up using my Iphone to create my Time Lapse movies after all.

I had just recently bought this camera for when i ride my horses. I go through the woods and through mountains, as well as jump! I wanted to get a decent camera, nothing much, but WOW!! Am I impressed! This camera has THE best camera quality that I have ever seen. Everything is 4k quality, it is incredibly easy to use, and VERY light weight. it attaches to my helmet so easily- takes about 20 seconds! I have gone on many trail rides with it, and it is now my best friend. super durable, and I love it! I have had  to send back multiple cameras before. This one however, is my favorite one. Better than a gopro! Comes with almost everything you need! it never slides or bounces on my helmet- just stays in place. Am I in love with it? YESS!

An excellent camera that has some terrific features (like being waterproof!) and a REALLY great price!For all the accessories you get in the box and the clarity of the video, this camera "could" easily be worth way more than the MSRP of $140, and really, even at that price, it's still a steal.  Getting it for under $100?  Get it now!
It’s a pretty good camera. My only knock is the battery doesn’t last ling at all. 15-20 minutes tops. They give you 2, but the battery life sucks.

I've owned several action cameras and this one by far exceeded my expectations. It also comes with many cool accessories, two batteries and a remote control. Very easy to use and the picture quality is on par with other action cameras 3-4 times more expensive. I highly recommend this camera to anyone who wants to take superb 4K videos and photos. The only thing I found lacking was the instructions, although there is a link provided to download a user manual.

Excellent. I am very satisfied. The delivery was extremely fast, it took under a day. In addition, the camera comes with a large amount of accessories. There are mounts that can be used for several situations. Within minutes, I was able to use wifi/bluetooth to connect the camera to my phone and view/download the pictures to it. I also managed to connect it to my son's phone with ease. The camera is sturdy and comes with two batteries. The photo quality is as good as it gets for an action camera of its price. I used it for fishing today and will use it for snorkeling soon. So far, so good. In addition, it is super simple to operate: it only has four buttons.I recommend it to anyone.

I just got this item this week and am starting to use it learning as I go. I have managed to figure out the basic stuff intuitively without reading the manual yet. I look forward to learning about the more advanced features.The package came with a bunch of attachments but I was not able to use these to attach the item inside my car so I suggest buying extra attachments.
Pros:Compact and light weight

My son wanted a GoPro but at his age......the price is so high so we found this alternative camera on Amazon and looked thru reviews and it also came with a great assortment of accessories. We have had it for a few months and finally used  it in pool. It has exceeded our expectations and has been so much fun. Can't wait to use it the rest of summer to get some great action videos and pictures.

Bought this for my bike riding adventures with my friends on nature trails.  It's easy to set up (WiFi and remote capabilities, for remote picture and video).  Love that it has a wrist strap on the remote, so you don't have to fumble looking for buttons that are physically ON the camera to start your video/take your picture.  I love that it comes with two batteries, because with a spare I don't have to worry about my camera dying in the middle of a ride.The video quality is impressively good.

It was getting hot every time I turned on.Update: I received the replacement of this product. I have another action cam and the sound of the video wasn’t good but this one is great. Clear sound when I’m recording video clip. It seems like it’s not too hot like previous one so far. I will see how it goes but do far it’s working great. Thanks for replacement.

Pretty cool camera that has good video. It also comes with a lot of Quick connects. We purchased extra hammer bases so we could use in both kids ski helmets.I do wish it would have come with some safety sticks as well but they are cheap to buy.

This camera is awesome for the price. I did a lot of research on camera's before buying one and this one kept beating the pricey competition by a long shot. Great starter cam for sure.  Super easy to use.  Only negative so far is it didn’t come with a lens cover. However, it did come with a ton of other accessories. Can’t wait to take it Scuba Diving!

I use this camera while I play airsoft and it works great.Sound quality is good and so is the video and it has a ton of options like Wi-Fi connectivity and 4K recording. I would buy this before a Gropro and you can't beat the price.

Usef this camera to record zip line adventure at Marble Mountain Zip Line in Canada. Used clip on mount to attach to my helmet and got unexpected great movie shots. I used the remote control attached to my wrist to turn the movies on and off. I am very satisfied with this product and would recommend to my friends.

I bought this camera for my honeymoon to Hawaii. By using the special casing that comes with it, we were able to take great pictures of fishes and turtles underwater while we were snorkeling. The interface can be a bit confusing due to the limited number of buttons, but you get used to it after playing around with it for a bit. Considering the price though, I think it was a really good buy. It also gave me peace of mind while out on boats, as I didn't have to risk dropping my phone in the ocean while taking pictures of wildlife.

The product is great to use comes with everything you need to get filming minus the Micro SD Card which didn't bother me since most the time the ones companies put in don't have the memory capacity I use so I always use my own anyway.PROS

It's quite a solid camera for the price and has held up to a decent amount of wear and clumsiness from me. My only real qualm with it is it tends to overheat pretty quickly and I don't know if it's a good idea to continue using as I think it might damage the camera. This is unfortunate because it interferes with taking really long videos. Good for the price though.

If you are looking for an alternative to the GoPro cameras, this is your answer. I wanted several cameras to capture video of my band and of me playing drums from different angles. The cost of the big name camera made it cost prohibitive to get what I wanted. The image quality from the camera is really good. I can't wait to get even more footage and start putting together videos for our social media.So far I'm happy with my decision to go with these.

I bought this as a gift opposed to the gopro. My fiance has found the set up  to be nice and simple. We are looking forward to taking it on our 2 week panama canal cruise. I haven't used a gopro, but I did extensive research and was not disappointed in this product. A great product for the price!

Very disappointed. I purchased this camera to record my childrens sports games, but while testing it out on only an hour long practice last night, the camera got blazing hot, lost the recording and died. It may work for a few minutes, but dont trust it for any length of time. You get what you pay for. I'll be saving for the real thing.Edit: Customer service bumps this rating to a 4. I contacted the company to let them know about the issue and they sent me a replacement within a couple days. Satisfied.

I liked the overall design and fair amount of options out of the box. I didn't like having to purchase a video card, as it doesn't come with one, but realize this is a way to keep the costs low. It did take a bit to figure out how to maneuver through menu items, and the bluetooth/wireless side was a bit slow. That said, once I figured out how to shoot a video, which is very easy with the remote they give you, and then export to my desktop, it's easy to share videos and pictures with friends by text or social media. I would recommend this as a fair alternative to an expensive GOPro.

The order comes with many accessories...more than what I know what to do with some.  The quality of the video recorded is very good and clear as well as volume.  I use it to mount on my bicycle helmet and record the journey.  Would have been great if it comes with a case or bag to keep all the accessories in otherwise they could be easily misplaced.  Overall, good product.

I have to say this is a very nice video camera that I ever bought and for the  price I paid you get alot, you get extra accessories a wrist remote and two batteries along with the package for not alot of money it's very affordable especially if you're wanting to start your own YouTube channel

I was leery about purchasing because it was so cheap, but this thing is awesome!! It helped me capture my encounter with wild spinner dolphins!! The video quality is so good. Image stabilization could be better, or maybe I could not be so excited that I was shaky. 🤣 súper simple to use, have loved it so far!!

Pretty good so far. This camera was really easy to set up with wifi versus some of the GoPro's I have. I have had a problem with the camera just shutting off, but I am not sure it is not user error. If you are looking for a cheap and good camera that could potentially get lost or damaged I would recommend this.

I recently bought this to use to record my grilling/BBQ videos. I’ve been testing out the camera and learning its features. Just takes a little bit of working with the camera to become familiar with all the features. So far, so good! I definitely recommend. The box full accessories takes me back to a time where you went to the toy bin at school, pulled out everything there and you figured out what went with what to make your vision come to life. LOL!

My son really wanted a sports camera like this for his birthday. We read tons of reviews on a lot of different cameras. Many cameras we saw were well over $100. We just didn’t want to make that sort of investment. I am so glad we chose the AKASO EK7000. It is perfect for our needs. It also came with a lot of fun accessories. My son is absolutely thrilled with his gift!!

Only one reason I am giving this camera 1 star.  It loses time and date and has to be reset every time you change the battery.  This is about the lamest thing I've seen on any product ever.  So there is no such thing as quickly changing the battery and continuing a sequence of pictures or videos that can be sorted by the time stamp without resetting the Date and Time.  Not sure if everyone has this problem or there is a defect with the camera I have.  Too late to return it, didn't discover this until after I'd had the camera for a while.

Overall a great camera for the price.  Easy enough menu, good pictures and video.  No built in stabilization but great for the price point.  Glad I got this instead of paying 7 times as much.  Meets my needs !  The accessories included are very generous also.  Using this on my ebike.

Straight out of the box the camera worked great. Until I put it into the waterproof case. It loses wi fi as soon as it goes under the surface of the water and the camera freezes, only way to turn it off is yanking out battery. So frustrating as the only reason I got this camera is for the underwater recording and photos. Would not recommend this camera to anyone needing it for under water.Update: Seller sent a third camera and it works. Great customer service!

I purchased this camera for my daughter and got the accessories pack with it. Very inexpensive and produced pictures with much greater clarity than would be expected of a 'budget' camera.its definitely a Go-Pro alternative but so much cheaper.

I just received my EK7000 and it has performed flawlessly out of the box. This is my first ever action camera and I researched a while before deciding on the right one to purchase. I read plenty of negative reviews about Akaso offering free items in return for positive reviews. My EK7000 came with no such offer. It did come with a dual charging dock which was a bonus. Also, take the time to move beyond Amazon to do your homework. This camera was well reviewed and rated on multiple other sites and that is what led to my purchase of this particular item. My camera is still new to me and I'm learning about all the features but so far I am happy with the purchase. I'm sure other, more expensive models do have more impressive features but this is a great, budget-friendly action camera that does exactly what it is supposed to. I can't speak to the longevity of the EK7000 yet but I'm looking forward to many great adventures with it by my side.

during this pandemic and the outcry of the Black Lives Matter movement, biking in NYC has been at an all time high. it more than i've ever seen in the decade and a half since i moved here. so in order to document my daily travels to and from work, protests, and reckless drivers/pedestrians and anything else under the sun, i bought this action camera and i hope to get some dope shots with it. i do like that there are bundles for body mounts, car mounts and even a water buoy mount all on their website. will add on to this review once i break it in this weekend. psyched to try it out. CheatDeathNYC and Black Lives Matter!
I was surprised and impressed by this purchase.Far exceeds what I was expecting as far as quality.

Wanted to take pictures underwater while on vacation but didn't want to spend a lot of money to do it.  The Akaso EK7000 did the job quite well. Spent a lot of time snorkeling to about 25 ft/ 8m and hit 60ft a few times with no leakage.  Did a scuba trip and spent about 40 minutes between 90 ft and 100 ft and briefly hit a max depth of  127 ft/ 37m and found a few drops of water in the case after the dive with no damage to case or camera. Got the photos so that my non-swimming wife could see what's down there. Can't speak to image quality as compared to something else but it was at least adequate for my purposes. Very happy with this purchase.

These cameras are incredible for the money... I am very impressed with the quality of video they produce. Only downfalls I see are that they dont give you a separate charger (you have to charge the battery in the camera) and second that they dont really give you a good mounting solution for a vehicle...like a suction cup mount. You will probably want to buy a charger and mount right away...The other must have is an external microphone.. I used a Rode VideoMicro microphone.

I purchased this camera several months ago primarily for a vacation that I just returned from. When the camera arrived, I tested all of the basic functions and it worked fine.When arriving at my vacation destination and attempting to use the camera in video mode. I discovered the camera would not record video for longer than 10 or 20 seconds. The camera starts recording, freezes somewhere around the 10 to 20 second mark so that no buttons can be pressed and I have no choice but to restart the camera and lose my video.

Bought it. Came to the house very quickly. Easy to use, easy to set up. Brought it out this weekend, so far for somebody who wanted to use this to just document day to day activities it is a pretty good alternative to go pro. I have yet to test the waterproof capabilities but looking at the design of the case i am pretty sure it will hold up.Picture quality meets my needs as a day to day pedestrian user. The remote is a nice touch to switch between recording a video and taking pictures

The camera worked well in the water and the video quality is good for the price of the camera.  I have a gopro as well and it did just as well as it.  For the price, no problem.  It was used in Thailand on a vacation trip and I have used it a few other times.  Never has let me down.

EDIT: had a run in with customer service, and was satisfied with their treatment of me. Warrants the extra star.You have to keep in mind the price you're paying for this product so treat it accordingly.

So if you’re looking for an good quality action camera at a fraction of the price of the “GoPro” camera, this is the one. It comes with a bunch of accessories to mount the camera. It also comes with (2) batteries. This is all I need. I bought the 64GB memory card for mine. You will need the instruction manual to set up. I got a little hung up on trying to get to settings but it’s easy now

Have read a lot of great reviews, unfortunately, we could never get the camera to actually record any video. Newly formatted Sandisk Ultra Plus 64gb card, but nothing would save. Also FYI, you need an application to transfer any files to a pc and then you must use wi-fi to transfer the files. Also FYI, there is a card in the box promising atttachments, sd card, etc if you leave a review and that you should not mention this.

We purchased this as an affordable alternative to a GoPro. We based our purchase off of the existing reviews and hoped that the quality was as good as people stated. We tested the camera with some action shots, action video and underwater video (at the beach). The quality was great! We were very impressed with the stabilization throughout the video. The underwater shots are very clear and the protective case worked with no issues. We have not taken the camera more than 2 feet deep though, so I can only attest for shallow submersion. Though the camera came with a lot of attachments, we probably won't use most of them since we got this camera for our honeymoon (snorkeling and such). But for someone who participates in action sports, you will likely have most everything you need to get started. I recommend this camera to anyone looking for a less expensive alternative to the GoPro.

I was looking for a camera I could use to get some video of my son at the plate in his baseball games. I also wanted some video of him on the mound. The GoPro cameras were simply too much for what I was going to be using it for. I found the EK7000 on Amazon and decided to give it a try for $68. Other than the battery not lasting terribly long it is a great little camera for the price. I have had it for a little over a month and it is working out exactly as I had hoped. Connecting to a 10,000 mAh battery during games solves the battery issue. Controlling the camera from my phone or tablet allows me to mount the camera where I can get the best video while not having to be right next to it. Would buy again.

This camera is pretty good quality for being $50. It's in desperate need for even a little video stabilization, attached to an atv the video bounces very bad even on a smooth road. Same for attaching to a Traxxas Slash rc truck. Using it on anything that doesn't shake is ok. Make sure you get the appropriate sd card for recording in 4k. The wifi connection works good, and the app works fine.  Overall it is definitely worth the money if you don't want a real gopro.

Did so many swimming with this little thing and it's worth it, i've took videos and pictures in salt & freshwater and the picture n video quality is good, Use a 32GB or higher SD card better be Samsung so it will work better!

There are a lot ofGood reviews on this product and I imagine that’s because they bribe people for reviews with accessories.  You have to buy a “brand name” card separately, but when the camera didn’t work, and I called the company, they said we had to buy a “Samsung” card.  So, we jumped through that hoop, formatted the disk, and the camera still locked up, shut off, had artifacts in the playback, and finally just flat out recorded nothing to disk.  Life got busy and we missed the window to return it, but basically, it’s crap.

I love to record all of my adventures. I never had usage for a camera as I used my smartphone for everything but being that we went to Macchu Picchu, Peru for our honeymoon, I wanted to have quality backup camera coverage. Little did I know what I have been missing all these years. When one thinks of filming action sports or adventures, the word Go-Pro immediately comes to mind but after doing hours of exhaustive research, reviewing all the specs, cost and accessories, the Akaso EK7000 was the camera for me. Not only did it not disappoint, it comes with mounts and straps for just about everything so I was able to use my wristband remote to control when to record, take a picture and when to stop. I highly recommend this camera to anyone, even just for the mounts alone for the cost. Not to mention it comes with two batteries that record for around 30-40 minutes each before dying. Even when those die, it comes with a charger so if you have a portable charger, you can potentially record for hours on end. I cannot wait to compile my Macchu Picchu footage and make a video out of it.

This product met all my expectations so far. It comes with a lot of accessories, two batteries, straps, remote control and etc. I was able to take pictures and videos right away. I also download the app and was able to connect to the camera through wifi. This product definitely is worth the price. The only thing I found inconvenient is it does not come with a manual. I have to google online to figure out how to connect to wifi. And that is why I gave four stars.

This camera comes with fantastic packaging, very similar to my GoPro, and with a ton of attachment accessories. So far I have used it for underwater video, at less than 20 ft, and on a rifle barrel. It performs as well, or better than my GoPro in both environments.Some had expressed concern about low light shooting, but I had no issues with that underwater, or shooting at dusk. The response time to record is a little delayed using the remote, but I got the timing of that sorted pretty quick.

Purchased this action camera for my daughter for her birthday and wish I had videos and photos from it to show but I don’tThis camera works great as well as the remote!! Download the app and load the photos and videos to your phone or computer. Works really well underwater awesome picture with great sound. I enjoy my GoPro but next time when I need to replace mine I will be ordering this action camera!!

I figured this was cheap enough that if it was junk, I didn't lose too much. I figured the quality would be meh, but didn't realize how bad it would be. The colors and saturation were way off and the pictures were grainy and undefined. I ended up getting a $5 drybag for my cellphone and have been using that instead. I'd still really love to find an adequate budget sport camera, but this wasn't it.

I bought this camera hoping that it was close to a go pros quality, how ever when I first opened the camera and turned it on, since I only had a 2GB micro sd card, I could only record about 11 minutes of 1080p at 60 fps, which it did rather well for under 100$. I was very pleased to see the it actually does shoot in 4K if you have a 64gb micro sd card in it. The quality of the camera is pretty good, and the image it produces is great for under 100$. I think it is a pretty good little camera, but if you are looking to use for more than just for fun, I wouldn't recommend it.

The video quality is great, the sound not so much but for the price that''s not a deal breaker. Personally i don't like that it doesn't have a zoom, but again, for the price not a big deal.  I like the fact that i could plug it into my computer and use it for live streaming and it didn't drain the battery on the camera, I did have to do research to find out that in order to use it for live streaming, i had to remove the memory card. but all in all i don't regret my purchase, it's definitely worth it.

Unfortunately I haven't been able to use this camera but twice. The battery says charged but when I unplug from the power source it shuts off. The buttons are confusing. Manual was no help. I was really excited to get and use this camera for my horse back riding but guess I will look for something else.

I got this camera for my boyfriend for Christmas and he loved it! It works very well and for a reasonable price. This camera is perfect for any adventure and we plan to continue using it. The picture quality is very clear even when underwater as the camera advertises. I was a little nervous because I thought you had to buy a very expensive camera to get good pictures, but this one is more than sufficient. Although we don't plan to use it underwater as much, the times we did there was no problems. The camera still continues to work well. It was smaller than I expected but I think the stand that it came with really helps to take level and clear pictures. I encourage people to buy this camera. Well worth it!
I was amazed at the quality of the video this camera provided.This camera worked great, each battery lasted for about 2 hours of snorkeling with constant video being recorded.

This is amazing and I don't see how it is $85. I previously used this camera on a ski trip and got some very good footage in 1080p 60fps (Video Attached Below). I had zero problems with the actual camera but if you are mounting on your helmet just buy a GoPro mount as this camera works with all GoPro accessories.BATTERY LIFE

I own a go pro and I bought this because of the ratings but when I took it out on my first trip after months of having yet  It will only record for maybe 10 or 20 seconds then it automatically shuts down I went through the owners manual I've tried everything but it will not continue to record  Hoping the manufacture will reach out to me and help me and I'll be more than happy to give a better review if I had one that worked properly  to test and review

Obviously the elephant in the room is the big GP cameras... but this product is quality. You're not paying for a name - but you're getting name-brand quality, image, and durability. Highly impressed. You could go through 3 of these (but you wouldn't) before even hitting the price of the big name brand.

This is a great little action camera. It is super tiny and portable. I’ve used a Go Pro and this case is verge similar to it. It worked great, no water. You can’t beat the price! It’s not quite as good as the Go Pro, but it’s pretty close and it’s a fraction of the price. And I’m a professional videographer so I’m picky. Honestly you can’t beat the price for this good, tiny camera. It also came with a bunch of accessories and ties. I only wish it had directions explaining how to use some of them and the only one I wanted, which it didn’t come with, is a handle bar to hold the camera when underwater.  I’d recommend this for sure, so worth the price.

This camera does a nice job of serving as a budget GoPro.  It takes decent photos and video, I like that it comes with two batteries, and it's a value price.  My only wish is that I was hoping it would take a larger storage card, but that's a small sacrifice.  Overall, it does what I expected it to do.  I'm not blown away by it, but I knew what I was getting.

At first, I thought this was too good to be true. Turns out, it wasn't! This camera can take videos and take pictures! The video settings are the following: 720p at 120 frames, 720p at 60 frames, 1080p at 60 frames, 1080p at 30 frames, 2.7k at 30 frames, and 4k at 25 frames. I would use 1080p at 60 frames per second. The camera is also a wide-angle camera! The best things that came with this camera for free are the following:  Waterproof case, clips, and attachments.Pros:

I purchased this camera because I was headed to Punta Cana and wanted a good camera which can also record video which is waterproof as well. After looking throughout Amazon, I decided upon this one and am pleasantly surprised by its features and accessories as well. The camera housing is watertight and the buttons are still usable when under water which is great. It also comes with the remote which is a nice addition so that I can combine it with the accessory pack and not even have to be touching the camera to take a photo or video. It allows me to connect to my phone over WiFi as well which is a great feature. I really like the camera and am now looking forward to using it on other trips as well!

Bought this for a test that was supposed to practically destroy the camera. Wanted a quality picture but didn't want to lose a go-pro.Well, the little thing lived, and the video was pretty decent for the money. I wouldn't call it better than higher priced models, but I wouldn't have had it any other way.
After the screen on my first camera fizzled out after a few uses, the seller was kind enough to send a replacement. So far, it is working perfectly, and I appreciate the customer service!

Used the camera 4 times, never under water.. inside my home... testing video recording. The camera turns on, after pressing video record once or any of the up or down menu buttons the video screen just displays streaking lines across it. I cannot turn it off.. have to pull the battery. I've contacted the vendor. Waiting for a response.

What a great purchase! I wanted an inexpensive,  capable,  and durable camera for all of the fun outdoors things we do year round in CO. This was a great value which came with accessories.  There batteries seem sufficient and it's WAY cheaper than the leading name brand.

This camera is amazing (equal to any GoPro) and for a much better price.  I was worried at first that it wasn't connecting to my IPhone.  I talked to technical support and they directed me to the right app and how to connect, now it works perfect.  Lots of extra mounts included with the camera including a remote control and it has a screen on the back or the camera integrated in...All of which are extra on a GoPro.  If your looking for an action camera this is the one to get

My son wanted a GoPro, but couldn't afford the bill. I read the reviews and they were all so good, so we bought this one. And it has been just what he needed. It came with a ton of accessories for him to use it in different ways and  attach it to his bike and use easily. The instructions are easy to follow - there are one a few buttons, but tons of ways to use it. Our family has only scratched the surface of putting this to use and we are pleased! I mentioned our purchase to a friend and he said he has the same one and loves it too. Can't wait to document our adventures!!

I got this as a gift for my 12yo son. He loves it! He uses it on his helmet/bike as well as while shooting his air soft. I’m sure through the years he will use it to film all of his dare devil stunts. It’s small & lightweight. Only bummer was that I didn’t notice I needed to buy an SD card. A reminder when buying would be great but ultimately my bad not realizing. Great buy!

Bought this before going on a road trip to Florida. I bought a 64 GB sunkis memory card for it and it never got full. It brought two batteries and I never even changed the first battery in the two weeks I was in Florida. The picture and video quality are amazing. The water proof case definitely work, I was under water for most of my vacation and took really clear videos and pictures. Definitely worth it.

Just received this in the mail today. It took me a while to figure out how to get the camera out of the box. I ended up using an electric screwdriver to get the camera out. There are a bunch of accessories that I haven't figured out how to use yet. Most of the accessories are mounts I believe. I tried out the wifi function and that worked without problem. The camera got a little hot when I was in the wifi function but I don't think that would be a problem. Can't wait to take it snorkeling in Hawaii this May!

Last day of the snowboard season for me, I had the best run of my life only to find out that the battery came loose and shut the camera off. Did the same run THREE more times and every single time the battery came loose and none of my footage was saved. If you're doing anything bumpy, the battery WILL come loose and nothing you do will be captured/saved up to the point that it shuts off. There's literally nothing holding the battery in place, you just push it up into the camera and pray that it decides to stay in the chamber. Unacceptable.

Camera is no go pro but it does take decent quality videos.Do not buy this camera if you need to record audio. It does an extremely poor job at that. But the price is fair, the video quality is decent and it does come with a lot of accessories and various mounts.

I literally can't believe how amazing this Action Camera is.  I bought this for my 8 year old son for Christmas because he wanted a Go Pro....I wasnt about to spend hundreds of dollars for something he will almost certainly break.  Let me tell you how jealous I am that he has one and I don't.  That will definitely be changing soon.  This thing is so inexpensive I could by one for the whole family.  The video quality is unreal!  The ease of use right out of the box is ridonculous!  There's an app for your phone that connects to the camera via wifi and you can literally watch my son's POV nerf battles live on our flat screen TV...how cool is that.  It is so easy to use, 100% waterproof,  excellent video...Go Pro who?

I really wanted to love this. The pictures are amazing. I have the new Mac book and I got the correct sd card. It worked amazing the first two days then it wouldn’t hold movies correctly. I didn’t change anything on the format and also it wouldn’t hold the correct date etc. every time I changed the battery it would reset. Very disappointing might be operator error but I have never see a camera go back to factory setting when you change the battery. Ugh

Great quality especially for the price did use this camera to dive in multiple places on our trip for snorkeling and scuba diving. the quality could be a little better but it is great like I said for the price. I really liked the feature where you can sync your phone to the camera and upload the photos right to your phone to post right away. But it took a while to find the photos in my phone due to them not popping up right away in my gallery. It was a real joy to have this camera along. The quality of the stuff so far I have used, it has been great. Except for the wristlet to use, it has started to fray a bit. The camera durability is also great while I was heading out to the reef to dive I slipped and fell and the camera took a hit but still work perfectly and is still waterproof, has little scuff but it just gives it more character. The fall did not affect the camera. Overall great piece of equipment for a vacation or for amateur water stuff.

First off, the SD card is not included. They consider it an accessory yet the camera does not function without it. Second, the USB cord was not in the package but should have been. I also bought the mounting pack. It did not include the suction cup mount which in my opinion is the most desireable mount. I haven't tried the camera yet but even if it functions as expected, I will not be recommending this unit. Buyer beware.
Have this mounted on front of my bike to track rides.  Very good video.Only issues are:

Good video and pictures. Cant beat the quality for the price or even double the price. Highly recommend if you want an action camera you can use and not worry about it costing too much to have fun with. I use on a drone and am not a great pilot so I cant see spending $300 on a camera that doesnt get much better video that this one does. I dont worry about a $300 camera if I crash with the drone so i can enjoy the action much more. Anyone can enjoy this camera.Get one, have fun!

I absolutely love the Akaso. I recently took a trip and unfortunately wasn't able to take good pictures because I didn't have a water proof camera,  I was in search of one.  I researched between the go pro and the akaso and to be honest found excellent reviews on the akaso.  Once I received my camera even though the manual was not to use friendly,  YouTube had excellent videos from many reviewers on "how to" including how to use all the extras. I'm very pleased and ready for my next trip.

I bought this to take for a vacation. It worked well underwater when scuba diving and snorkeling but when the camera turns , the pixels break and gives a bad image. I think its better to pay a bit more and buy a better quality product like GoPro. If you are looking for a entry-level action camera, probably it will work but don't expect good quality images
Didnt try the water proof case but everything else works good. A few small things that could improve it.1.....No screw hole on the cam to mount it to anything without using the H2o case.

I cant believe Amazon allows this product be listed as No. 1 best seller, implying that this product is as advertised.  It does not meet any of the specifications listed.  Horrible resolution in both video and pictures.  Does not work.  Save your money.

Way better than I expected got it for my son 6th  birthday and he already knows how to use it better than me. At first it kept freezing because i forgot to format the card. After I formatted the card it works great and has never  froze He likes taking it in the pool and also shooting videos around the house.

I was in the market for a waterproof camera for a vacation. There's a lot more expensive options out there but I stumbled upon this one, the reviews seem great and it was cheap compared to other cameras. Decided to try it out and I couldn't be more pleased. This camera is really easy to use and takes great quality videos, especially underwater. Above water is just the same, very easy to switch between photos and videos but mostly used this camera for taking videos. It has a long battery life, can use it for awhile before you need to charge the battery again. Would recommend 100%

I have used this camera many times and trips. It has pretty clear video and I like that I am able to view photographs and videos with my smart phone. Waterproof case works well. Found a competitor window mount and it worked well with the assortment of attachments this camera has.Cons: Most recent road trip, the camera got hot and the battery got hot as well and had some swelling. Still working though.

Bought for taking videos surfing and bodyboarding. Waterproof housing leaked immediately despite looking at all instructions on how to close housing door etc etc. Looking at prior reviews I realized I was taking a gamble as there are a significant complaints about leaking case. Took the gamble b/c the price was fair. Unfortunately it  didn't work out. Decided to go with Gopro Hero5 Session with added waterproof case to ease our concerns. More expensive but worth piece of mind. Personal opinion - Akaso has a design law in the waterproof case they need to address. Thank God for Amazon's refund policy with these sellers.

We had purchased this for our 7 year old daughter and wanted something she could take pictures with underwater and pictures that were good enough for printing or backgrounds on computer(which many cheap cameras lack). This camera is great and being able to connect via wifi to the camera directly to share the photos to our iPhones made it even better no more looking for adapters to hook to the computer. Came with 2 batteries which was a plus as well. Overall impressed with the quality of even the under water pictures. Kids have a blast with it. Highly recommended for the price.

I picked up the camera as a second video unit to use for the the family out riding. I didn't want to spend a lot as I plan to let the kids take it places and use it regularly. This camera far exceeded my expectations and works great. Its simple to use, easy to upload and the quality of the footage is great. I have been using it on the lower resolutions as the quality of the footage is so good it didn't make sense to use its full capacity. Can't recommend this camera high enough, great buy.
